Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Fallback”
Reviews.Author: Mitz50
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Hotwire and received an excellent room rate. Unfortunately, the hotel was not a four-star in our book. We should have realized that there might be a problem with the room when we saw a set of complimentary earplugs on the sink. Maybe it was just this room, but the wall was paper thin on the left side of the room and we heard continual noise from our neighbors. Also, the street noise on Saturday at night was annoying even though we were on the fourteenth floor. Other than that, the location of the hotel is excellent for exploring downtown S.F. The room was clean, the service was good, the view was beautiful, and an inexpensive continental breakfast was available in the lobby. Parking was expensive so we parked one block away for half of the price.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular view, good location, average rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: maverickberlin
Reviews.Content: If you stay on the top floors, club level, you're treated to sweeping views of the bay. The rooms seem to have been refurbished a few years ago, which is OK, even though they are a bit heavy on the beige. The reason for that is probably so it blends in better with the stuff from the orginal design, i.e. bathroom fittings. But why no safety deposit box, no minibar, no slippers? In that category, I would expect those. I would have advised them to do something about the hallways, they're simply uninviting, utilitarian. But the club lounge is awful: you get the same great view, but it is simply too small and has no style. The small catering area is absolutely crowded, even on weekdays, and the stuff struggles to keep replenishing the dishes. And the food on offer is more the kind I would expect from a motel. It's clear that the hotel management treats the lounge as a cost factor only, not something that would enhance the quality of the stay of their patrons or a differentiating asset, which is sad. And be advised: don't take room 3109: it's right next door to the kitchen of the aforementioned lounge, with the door always open. So unless you don't mind getting up at 5 am, pick a different room. The final touch: the second day the water was lukewarm, and when we called, the answer was "Oh, OK, no hot water at your room ALSO. I will call engineering and get back to you." They never did, but later on there was hot water. But it sounded like ot was a known problem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: Renee W
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco tagging along with my sister while she was at a conference. We checked in late and were given a room on the 32nd floor. Every member of the staff we met were extremely friendly and very welcoming. Once we got to our room, the view was absolutely amazing. I thought it was just the downtown area we could see, but image my surprise the next morning when we could actually see all the way to the bay. It was so relaxing and beautiful to watch the fog roll into the bay in the afternoon. It is close to all of the public transportation San Francisco offers which makes it easy to get around. I would definitely recommend the Parc 55. From staff to location I could not have asked for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: sarahtham
Reviews.Content: This is a convenient hotel right in the heart of downtown san francisco with 3 minute walk to the BART. Lovely spacious and rooms. Business centre on 4th floor is great for online check-ins of flights. The "to-go" breakfast was good: pastries, bagels, fruits, teas, coffees, parfaits. Rooms were tastefully decorated. Noise from outside can be intrusive although ear-plugs provided in rooms. Beautiful view of city on 9th floor ( my room). No free Internet;(

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Lilogirl22
Reviews.Content: Conveniently close to the bart/muni stations and quick walk to the mall! Staff was really helpful and really nice! Thank you Ericka! After a plane and bart ride all you want to do is get to your hotel and she was very pleasant when helping us check in. Other reviews mention the noise. Yes you are in downtown so you can't avoid it! I stayed on the 26th floor and still heard sirens but you get that in any city in downtown. Room was clean, prompt room service, and great hotel views. You get what you pay for and I really enjoyed my time there. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but clean.”
Reviews.Author: meghancmm84
Reviews.Content: Overall it was clean. The closet is huge and the Cityhouse restaurant downstairs was delicious. The bathroom wasn't really much to look at and the room smelled of rotting onions or body odor, which we assumed was the carpeting. We upgraded to a Junior Suite which was basically a waste of money. The only difference is that they added a couch, table and seat - none of which were comfotable. The beds are more firm that most hotels, so if you prefer soft ones, this might not be the place for you. The outside noise can be bothersome (especially when the trash truck and ambulences drive by - and we were on the 14th floor..), but that is to be expected in the middle of a city. Be prepared for absurdly priced valet parking, since they do not offer self-parking. Internet is expensive and a daily charge, but the front desk waived the fee for us, which was very generous. It is only a block away from the cable car line and all the shopping in Union Square, so it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: outcastalien
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the St. patrick's day weekend. The rooms are pretty decent BUT definitely not worth the price. ( St. Patrick's day might have had something to do with it). The staff at the front desk was not friendly at all. We only dealt with 1 guy and he seemed couldnt be bothered to smile let alone offer any kind of apology for rooms being late. The concierge was less than helpful. Single worded answers to almost all my questions...... The bell desk ppl were very nice and friendly so full marks for these guys. Location is fantastic though. So all in all, not bad but not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “You'll need earplugs but it's worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Leslie255
Reviews.Content: Loved the service, the food, the decor and the location. I even enjoyed the view but the outside noise was problematic. I will stay there again for sure but I'll take a sound machine.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: This place is expensive and is not impressive. Movies are super expensive, the Internet costs daily, Parking your car is super expensive too! We tried to buy internet last night and the server was down. Boo. Â The staff was great about cleaning the room, but the room was bla in design and the bed was uncomfortable... Not great. The room comes with three pillows for a king size two person room. Huh? Does that even make sense? I won't stay here again. We travel once every two months and frequent many hotels. This hotel should lose a star. I should have stayed at the Hilton around the corner. However, San Francisco is the bomb!!! We love it!!!Â

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: We had never been to San Francisco before but following a bit of research booked at Parc 55 based mainly on location. When we arrived after a long flight we received a warm welcome and the lovely lady on reception made some general chat about our journey and the purpose of our visit. She then very kindly upgraded us to club level (not something we at all expected) and we were overwhelmed by the beautiful room that we were allocated at club level. This also included an amazing buffet breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and very spacious. We ate one night at the restaurant and the food was delicious. The waiting staff were very good. The location is really good for local shops and restaurants but also bus, BART and cable cars from Powell Street along to Fisherman's Wharf. Also close to the ticket office to buy Muni passes for public transport which are good value for money. We would not hesitate to stay at Parc 55 when we return to San Francisco in hopefully the not so distant future and thank them greatly for a brilliant stay. We went on to a number of other cities and hotels, but our time at Parc 55 and in San Francisco was definitely a highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Rainy in San Fran, but Warm @ Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Azuredirection
Reviews.Content: I've traveled throughout my entire life. My parents worked for the diplomatic core, then I worked for the diplomatic core before my career in education and counseling; so hotels have been a mainstay in my life. I consider myself a novice connoisseur of hotels - self appointed of course. A counseling convention brought me to Parc 55. Upon my arrival, I was greeted with sleek, modern lines, vibrant wall art, and a welcoming 'hello' by every hotel employee who crossed my path. The lobby area was airy and open, very suiting for the San Fran area. The front desk quickly check me in and I made my way up to my room. I'm a Wyndham rewards participant, and had requested a room on a high floor; so I was very pleased with my 23rd floor assignment, offering an expansive view of the city and the beautiful bay. The room was clean, open and accommodating. The bathroom (a pet peeve area for me) was spacious, clean and spa-like. I didn't hesitate to put my things on the counter, nor did I ponder before stepping into the shower. Whew- thank God for small blessings! Within an hour of my check-in, a complimentary tray of fruit, and my preferred beverages of sprite and bottled water were delivered to my room. Now that's how you welcome a guest! My stay extended over three nights and four days. My room was always clean, and fresh. The nightly turn over service was like clock work - and always done with a smile and small talk. The room service, was delivered with the same level of warmth; although I felt the menu options were a bit lacking for the San Francisco area, but they were able to accommodate my requests. The room offered a soft hum from the city, but it was welcomed as it served as reminder of being a new place. Not once did I see any signs of untidiness in the hotel, nor was anyone every rude or impolite. I think my visit to the hotel markets sums up the quality offered by Parc 55 Wyndham, San Francisco: Having flown for 8 hours, with a connector, and a 2 hour delay due to rotting fish - I was tired and my ears had not yet acclimated to being on the ground again. Every word that I said echoed loudly in my skull as if my it was empty, cavernous. Every attempt to dislodge the trapped air was met with shooting pain. I needed the warm end of a q-tip and of course I didn't pack any. I made my way down stairs to the hotel market. I was greeted by an aging man with a youthful smile. He welcomed me and asked if he could help me find anything. I explained my dilemma, and we began dialoguing. Before I knew it, we had shared our professional journeys, our travels, and our passion for inquiry and people - he was so gregarious and joyful; respectable traits to someone who was intrinsically introverted. His exuberant small talk made you feel hopeful about the world... a big statement for such a small act I know. While paying for my travel sized pack of q-tips I noticed that we hadn't even exchanged names. I looked to his name tag. "Nice to meet you Warren. It was a pleasure speaking with you", I said with a grateful smile. "The pleasure was all mine Ms. Graham. You have a nice day and enjoy your conference." The warmth infused into the simple task of helping a customer find q-tips is not at all uncommon at Parc 55, and I think that's what make this hotel exceptional. I love quotes, and I recently came across this one, â€œTruly great friends are hard to find, difficult to leave, and impossible to forget.â€� I visited the store one more time before leaving, with no intention of crossing Warrens path again, but I would be remiss in saying I wasn't hoping to get a little bit of his sunny disposition before heading back to the east coast. He wasn't working that day, but the experience provided by Warren and the entire Parc 55 staff is "hard to find, difficult to leave, and impossible to forget". Thank you for making my stay in San Francisco a wonderful one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: Easy trip from SFO via Bart! Jump on the train for 8 bucks, and you are in the heart of the city. Super location. Take a walk up Powell to get your exercise! Lots of good pubs close by.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: timest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! Like other reviewers have mentioned the location is great. All the public transportation options are a block away and are very easy to use. The club level is very nice for a light breakfast or hearty appitizers Sunday-Thursday. Everything is clean and well taken care of. We had no problems of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: epe49
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when I visit San Francisco. Just off Market St near Union Square, this large modern hotel has all the amenities of more expensive hotels and is ideally located near the bart, street cars and the theatre district. Rates vary considerably, but are quite reasonable if there is no convention in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent great location”
Reviews.Author: Dotty178
Reviews.Content: Me and my brother stayed in this hotel due to the Hotel Fusion being a dump but this hotel was great, big rooms, big gym would def go back and the location for the shops was ideal

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: A block away from the BART System and Cable Car "station". Hotel was clean and comfy. Concierge was clueless. Asked what they recommended during a rainy day in SF and the guy told us to go to the movie in the mall across the street. That's the best you can do???? Also, another rep sent us to an Italian restaurant down the street only to find it closed. Best to have a gameplan before asking the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel- Ambivalent Staff”
Reviews.Author: jfeld0ax
Reviews.Content: The facilities and the decor are fine but if you have a problem or an issue..staff range from helpful to infuriating and ambivalent. I had a mix-up with my complimentary breakfast, a priceline error, and the staff were completely unhelpful and condescending. I've stayed in hotels with lower ratings before that made up for the lack of amenities with their rock staff. This is not one of them!

Reviews.Title: “Returning customer pleased again”
Reviews.Author: Roccobaby
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Clean, convenient location, and overall a great hotel. Hotel was accommodating allowing me to check in a little early. I don't expect to check in early, but it is always nice when it happens. "ChiefStansberry"

Reviews.Title: “Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: Halle B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and centrally located to the BART (rail system) and dozens of delicious restaurants in the area. Our group walked to Chinatown and enjoyed a delicious and spicy meal that we're still talking about today. The rooms were clean and comfortable but seemed a bit on the pricey side. The only downside to this hotel is that you have to valet your car - there are no other options to park on the street (2 hour max) or in a garage. Valet was $48 a day but the valet man reminded us several times that we had in and our privileges. That sounds great until you remember that you have to tip them $5 everytime they retrieve your car. Overall the hotel itself was very nice and the concierge was extremely helpful in suggesting several different restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “We coming back!”
Reviews.Author: gw3ndolen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Wyndham for four nights in August 2011. We booked a club room with a wonderful view over the city and the bay. Loved the complimentary breakfast and the hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The location is great. We're definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, beautiful views, great location for shopping and theater.”
Reviews.Author: Loriyas
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a unique corner location offering easy access for those driving into the city. Unfortunately, parking is expensive - which impacts the value of this location. Shopping all around. One block from Union Square. The hotel restaurants are good! Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: agstanley
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks brand new and has wonderful spa toiletries in the guestroom bathrooms. The views are UNBELIEVABLE!!! We stayed on the top floor and had access to the Club Lounge. It costs a bit extra but is worth every cent. We got free continental breakfast every morning and the heavy appetizers in the evening served as our dinner for two nights after returning exhausted for sightseeing all day. For a family of four, this is a huge savings. They serve desserts and cocktails as well and it was never crowded since access is for only a few of the hotel guests. The hotel location was perfect and every single employee there was so nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Rinnie S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here,very nice accommodation. The staff were friendly and we were able to check in early without charge. Has a great restaurant and the service was great there also. Good location with the trolley and cable car just across the street as well as Westfield shopping Centre. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and upscale at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: petersam
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've stayed there since Wyndham took over. It has the modern feel of a Westin at a lower price. The rooms are in great condition. The fitness center is large with a variety of cardio machines and a smaller number of strength machines. Fruit and towels, but only a slow water fountain to drink from. Registration is on the second floor, but the main entrance is on the first. It becomes quite deserted at night down there and did not feel as safe in that part of San Francisco as I would like, especially considering Wyndham's reputation for caring about such things. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: AInstin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, friendly staff. Pitty there's no pool, sauna or hot tub, but other than that, just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheetahtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge, but its in an excellent location, and the staff service is amazing. The rooms were also very well kept, and the corner rooms are massive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: Kimmmmmm
Reviews.Content: Rooms were decent, but wifi was extremely expensive. Close to Westfield and the trams

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Remgirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband had a Sun-Mon company-paid conference, so we decided to take a long weekend and book our own hotel for Thurs-Sat. Having visited San Francisco several times, we are familiar with the city, and thus decided to save a little by bidding via Priceline. We got the Parc 55 for $160. per night. Not a huge savings, but considering conference/convention season is in full swing, we were happy with the price. Upon arrival the doorman and bellhop greeted us and offered their service. The woman assisting us checking in was also friendly and polite. The only (slightly) odd thing about checking in is that you enter the lobby, then go up one floor. We soon realized having a separate lobby from the check-in & concierge made sense because this hotel frequently hosts conferences, meetings, tour groups, and is used by many different airlines as crash pads. This kept the check-in area free from the large groups clogging up the space. The airlines even had their own self-check in kiosk. We knew that booking via Priceline often means getting the least desirable rooms. That's why when we use that service, we only bid on the highest star-level available. With those hotels, the least desirable room is still usually better than an average room at a lower-star hotel. At the Parc 55, we were given one of those rooms, #814 (standard non-smoking King). Our room looked into the "courtyard" aka looking out at the back of the other buildings. I consider that a "plus" because those rooms are usually quieter than street side, (if I want a view, I don't use third-party booking agent). Pretty much everything about the room could be described as standard and comfortable for the star level. We found the bed to be a bit firm, but otherwise it was your average hotel pillow-top. The only thing that made the room sub-par was that the maid's access hallway ran right behind the wall our bed was against. So, from the time we checked in (around 6:30) to the time we left for dinner (8pm) we heard the trolley carts rolling like thunder through that hallway several times. When we got back from dinner, around 10pm, we heard nothing until around 9am the next morning, well after we were already up. This was no big deal for *us*. We live in an urban setting, so we're used to some noise. Plus, our sleep habits were not interrupted, and we didn't spend much time in the room by day. That said, I can easily imagine this room could be a nightmare to others with differing habits. The hotels seems aware of this, and a pair of earplugs are provided :) The bathroom: Average sized, Bath & Bodyworks products are nice, hot water comes on quickly and seems a bit hotter than normal (yay!) and the shower is fantastic. The only downside is poor lighting over the shower. I like a well-lit shower for shaving. Overall: Yes, I would book again via Priceline, and if the price was right, direct with the hotel. I felt we got our money's worth and had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Union Square”
Reviews.Author: rpwiki
Reviews.Content: This is always my first choice when I need to stay downtown. It's close to everything, room prices are reasonable for San Francisco and the hotel has been recently updated so it's comfortable and well appointed. If you can, try and get a room on the upper floors to avoid street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if a bit soul-less”
Reviews.Author: keltzar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for two nights over Christmas in 2011. San Francisco was really nice to be in during the season, and we stayed at the Parc 55 because that's where my wife used to stay for business in the 1990s (it has since changed management/owners). All in, I would say that the experience was pleasant. The hotel is conveniently located, at the bottom of a hill sort of ... with easy reach of Union Square and Chinatown. It was also a reasonable distance to the wharf area. The room itself was reasonably well appointed, though things are showing some age. ] The experience was comfortable, though not exceptional... a bit "soul less", if I might say. In some ways, i guess it felt like I spent several nights there practically invisible to the staff. We minded our own business, and they minded theirs. All in, I would say it was a pleasant experience though for it's price, I wonder if there are alternatives in SF which may be newer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScholarGentleman
Reviews.Content: Right by the BART station--transportation hub. Lots of food steps away, from fast food to very upscale. At the terminus of the cable cars that can take you up to Fisherman's Warf/Tourist Mecca. Was here for a conference, and it was just about perfect for that. Great beds, nice shower. FAST elevators. Friendly and helpful staff across the board. Would be nice if it had a fridge (I didn't ask for one--I'm sure they would have provided.) And the room was quite clean and new, but--well, I'm fussy and the furnishings needed to be more carefully cleaned. It can get a bit noisy on the street on the weekends, though I didn't need the provided earplugs. Overall, I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Check the Hotel Web Site First”
Reviews.Author: petrus1966
Reviews.Content: First of all, make sure that you check the hotel's own website for special rates and packages before scouring other hotel discount websites. I could have saved a lot of time by doing so, as I found when I discovered a lower rate than the one I had obtained on Priceline. I did get a refund from Priceline to match the hotel's lower rate, but there were still certain limitations to having booked on Priceline versus directly through the hotel (e.g., I couldn't use my Wyndham Rewards card for points and free internet). The hotel itself was good- lovely, spacious lobby and friendly, helpful staff. Concierge was great. The lobby bartender was particularly helpful and pleasant but the prices were kind of hard to swallow. I agree with other reviewers- the location is quite central, especially for conventioneers, although you have to be careful how far you wander because you can be in rough area very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: JC_chgo
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I stayed here. I was here for a conference 2 years ago, I went to the same conference this year. My room was a king, the bed, sofa and desk were nicer than I had two years ago, and it was fairly spacious. The bathroom was also upgraded, it seems the hotel may have done some improvements. Conference was at Moscone Center, it's close enough to walk- maybe 4 to 5 blocks. The Parc55 is right on top of Union Square; if you want to shop, it's literally 1 to 2 blocks from major boutiques and Macy's/Neiman Marcus/Nordstrom's. There's a Bart and Muni station 1 block away, the cable car turnaround is 1/2 block, and the trolley stop is 1 block. Wireless Internet is $15/day or $49/week, kind of steep even for a hotel. Join their loyalty program and I believe they give you free WiFi at all their locations (Wyndham). I would say this is an upper-midrange hotel, with amenities and prices to match. They know their competition, and you get what you pay for. I've stayed at nicer, but it was more expensive. San Francisco is not a city for cheap hotels, at least not ones you'd want to stay at. I would stay here again. P.S.- they have a 'Grab and Go' breakfast bar, you can get muffins/bagels/yogurt and coffee. 2 pastries and a coffee for $5- that's a steal in this town.

Reviews.Title: “Great local to Moscone”
Reviews.Author: TheChampagneGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and it was a great location and easy access walk to Moscone and restaurants and shops. #1 tip-I took the water with me from the room for my day at the show and I am glad I did. While it was priced at $4.50 it was the large size Dasani water and at Moscone it was $3.50 for the 10 oz bottle. If you don't have time to shop for waters this was a good answer. #2 tip- Mark at the City House restaurant was excellent every morning for our breakfast and I highly recommend the home-made corn beef hash and poached eggs with mustard seed sauce.

Reviews.Title: “Great night in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Leah F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc 55 for one night and really enjoyed this hotel!! It is super clean, comfortable, has a GREAT location next to everything (shopping, BART, trolley car, ect.) and the staff is wonderful!!! We will definetly come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for fun and busines!”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo C
Reviews.Content: I had to go to SFO to do a training for 3 days so I took my family with me. So we looked for a hotel that satisfies all of our needs at the same time. We looked for other options at much higher price, until we found this one. Indeed this hotel met all of our expectations: close to everything with access to almost every public transportation, shopping, restaurants, Offices, etc. The people at the hotel were very kind and gave us lots of tips to maximize our joy while in San Francisco. It was very helpful! If I'm San Francisco again, I would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in SF for the value seeking guest”
Reviews.Author: SodaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Jan 31st/Feb 1st on business. Reason for selecting this hotel was purely best price for the location without compromising on quality. This hotel was a pleasant surprise! Lobby was very modern and clean, front desk check-in was easy, pleasant, staff member very helpful. Stayed in room 1872 which is a corner room and it was excellent. Windows on two sides, terrific view of City Hall and the city. The bed was comfortable, room was clean, and included large flat screen tv. Only the bathroom was a bit lacking, (rather old looking, simple, no lighted makeup mirror, could use some hooks on the wall for hanging towels, some mold in the grout in the shower/tub combo (pet peeve), but it was large size so not clausterphobic) Hotel is within easy walking distance of restuarants, shopping at Union Square and bart, which was good, as we did not rent a car from SFO airport. Ate breakfast at the restuarant adjacent to the lobby. Standard/higher price for breakfast, but service was quick, friendly, food good). Will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Geof G
Reviews.Content: When I found the safe in my room wasn't working, John from engineering came up and was the nicest, most responsive engineer I've ever met at a hotel. The manager of the day called up and made sure that I was satisfied with their service. The hotel is nice and convenient, and, in a town filled with nice hotels, these people go way out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Right across from Downtown!!”
Reviews.Author: NanNanSF
Reviews.Content: Having worked in the hotels like Palace Hotel, Monaco and The Ritz in San Francisco, my standards for hotels are a bit high. At $250 a night, my boyfriend and I booked Parc 55 because it was close by to the venue we were going to be celebrating New Years Eve. The staff were nice, but sadly they could not give us a king size bed. We had to have double beds which was really annoying, however, I'm not going to blame the establishment because it was new years eve. Parking is a whooping $50 a night. If you're smart, you will park in a parking lot a few blocks away to save $$. The room was nice and tidy and the bathrooms were to standard. It has been one of the nicer hotels I have stayed in San Francisco and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for the Perfect Night”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc 55 and had dinner over at their in hotel restaurant. The service from beginning to end was just excellent. The location was in the prime area of San Francisco. I stayed at the 32nd floor of the Wyndham hotel in one of their sky line suites, and can I say the view was just stunning. We had breathless views that were great, and can I say, this was well worth the price that I got the room for. The restaurant, which was Cityhouse, was a great restaurant, on their website, you can go onto OpenTable and do a reservation, which is what I did for Valentine's Day, myself and my girlfriend spent the evening there which was serene, the place is child friendly too just in case you would ever want to take your kids over there. The stay was wonderful, someone from housekeeping came into the room and closed all the drapes and left us some chocolates, which were made local in San Francisco, on our pillow. We chose to open up the drapes because the view was just great. I can't wait to come here for another stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location and Comfort Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: LovesSunshine56
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day trip to SF with a girlfriend and our two teenage daughters. After too much research of where to stay in the city, we selected the Parc 55. Won't research other options in the future, this place was perfect in every single way!! We opted for the Club Level feature which is hands down the way to go. The breakfast offered was very substantial (2 fresh cut fruits, yogurt, granola, cereal, hard boiled eggs, toast, pastries, juices, coffee & tea). A quiet lovely environment with outstanding views. Also enjoyed other Club amenities - appetizers and wine, and later desserts and wine. Most definitely worth the extra money, especially considering the prices in SF. The staff in the Club room (especially Sergio!!) were gracious, friendly and extremely accommodating ~ loved them all. Our room was on 29th floor with stunning views both morning and evening. City noise didn't bother us, as no matter where one stays in the heart of SF, city noise is a way of life. Ample space for 4 of us in the room, very comfortable beds. Nice products in bathroom. Staff at front desk always polite, friendly, and genuine. Congierge Staff was extremely helpful and quite delightful personalities. On way to Alcatraz Tour one morning, Congierge made sure we knew our transportation options, food & beverage rules of Alcatraz, then reached in her purse and gave the 4 of us See's Candies suckers to wish us a fun day. While discussing evening and dinner options one evening with another Congierge, an impatient man behind me interrupted us and was extremely rude to her about wanting "his time". She handled it like a pro and never made me feel like I was taking too much time to discuss options with her. She was a star; only sorry now I can't recall her name ~ she deserves kudos for sure!! I had read earlier about this hotel being a block from The Tenderloin district ~ clearly nothing to worry about, so don't let that concern you. We took BART from SF airport to hotel, exited at Powell St station and were a 1/2 block, if that, from hotel. Convenience plus!! You do not need a car in the city whatsoever if you are there for sightseeing. Between F Line Muni Bus to Embarcadero and Piers, or Cable Cars, you will have all the transportation options just outside the door when staying at Parc 55. This property is worth the 5 Stars I gave it for Location, Service and Comforts in the big city of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, noisy, but great location”
Reviews.Author: jlobel70
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a single night on business, and felt the hotel was tired. The room was adequate, despite a very strange doorway entry configuration. During the night- if you are a light sleeper- you will find the noise level from outside activity to be quite high. As for a central location- the hotel is excellent. However, there remain multiple choices within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Realy good. good location. Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: CarlJohanLsson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 100m ( 2 blocks) from the center of Downtown. And is close to everything. Its located right next to a subwaystation and have the cablecars around the block. Very easy to access from the highways. Just exit from baybridge and the hotel is just in front of you. We stayed in the Club area at the top floors. Little more expensive but a great view. Also breakfast is included then selecting this club option. Only drawbacks is that they charge 50$ for Internet for a week and that parking is very expensive, 48$ per 24h. The staff are very service minded and realy nice and helpfull. The room have a very good standard and the morning view is exelent.

Reviews.Title: “Heart Of The City!”
Reviews.Author: mymothersbuttons
Reviews.Content: The Parc is the perfect location for shopping and the views of the city are incredible. Service was top notch. Only complaint would be that the beds were not as comfortable as they should be for an upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff was very welcoming, each and every time we entered the hotel or public areas making us feel very relaxed and comfortable. Staying on the Club level afforded an easy breakfast and great lounge to relax in the evening before bed. I was here for leisure travel and it was a great central location to stay with spectacular views of the city and bay. Steps away is Union Square, BART, and cable car line. I thought the stay was a great value for its location and quality of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SportsFan59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost perfectly comfortable and very conveniently located. Really friendly staff (thank you Sarah at the front desk!). 1/2 a block walk to the Powell Street BART and the cable car, and if you walk across the street you're in the fabulous San Francisco Centre mall. My 22nd floor room had a gorgeous view of San Francisco Bay. I was puzzled that the hotels provided earplugs, until I went to bed....a weird trick of acoustics meant that in my 22nd floor room, sounds from the street sounded like they were right outside my window..I mean, I could clearly hear conversation and laughter from the sidewalk. The earplugs helped, though, and the room was great otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynH12346
Reviews.Content: Loved the property and the location and the friendly help! Special thanks to Andre at the front desk!! Kevin the dorr man greeted us so heartily that it felt like we were family. It was beautiful and clean and spacious and the price was great for al we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: rexcab
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square, Muni/BART Train Stations. Well maintained facility and room. I usually stay on the higher floors so the street noise does not affect my sleep too much. I also ate dinner at the CityHouse restaurant at the hotel and enjoyed my meal. This is my first choice for hotels when I have to go SF.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay at this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at the Parc 55 Wyndham Hotel 12 to 15 times a year and each time when we arrive to when we leave the staff treats us like were at home. the staff is wonderful, caring, helpful and very professional. Oh, you should see the views of San Francisco down town area. It's beautiful! This Hotel is close to Union Square the heart of San Francisco for shopping, restaurants, bars, cable cars and entertainment. Stay at this Hotel and you will have a great time. This is also important, the rooms and the hotel are very clean. Rooms are good to great in size. Wonderful ! Wonderful ! Wonderful ! Time at this hotel. My wife and I cant wait to get back. William Skelton Santa Rosa, CA.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, location can't be beat, nickle and dime you on services”
Reviews.Author: andrea1077
Reviews.Content: my husband and i met in san fran after a work trip for a long weekend. the hotel was amazing, perfect location and definitely up to par on the star rating and amenities. we got a great rate through a special sale that i was alerted to b/c i had been searching the san fran area for hotels during a specific time frame. upon arrival it was refreshing to see that the desk clerk could see and was responding to my special requests for a higher floor. he sited that he read i was in town for a late v day celebration and he upgraded us to the exec floor level which included great city views and breakfast in a club level suite. my one and only complaint is that they seem to nickle and dime you on services. we paid 48 for overnight valet per day. it wasn't until we were leaving that we noticed the hotel across the street offered the same service to non hotel guests for 28. they also charge 15 a day for internet which i think should be included in a hotel of this level. the movies in the room were also 16 a piece and to watch dvr shows were 5 a piece, we didn't use this service but i thought the cost seemed high. others complained of street noise, this is why i asked for a higher floor and it was not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Convention Business.”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean accommodations. Within an easy walk of the Moscone Convention Center for my business trip. Also nice location to explore San Francisco with its proximity to the shopping district as well as transportation with the hotel near the Powell Street Trolley stop and BART.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - Just a few pointers”
Reviews.Author: mwm308
Reviews.Content: This property is excellent and in the best spot possible. The hotel is basically at the intersection of Market and 4th-5th street. It is right outside of the entry location for the cable car. The hotel has an awkward entrance. When you enter the hotel you are on the ground floor where only a bell hop station is located. You have to go upstairs to the second floor to registration. If you have luggage, it's easier to go around the corner and use the elevators to get upstairs verses using the escalators. The only complaint is that the hotel doesn't have a door man to offer assistance when you arrive. I stayed in a Club Room King which puts you on the upper floors and gives you access to a club lounge. The views from the upper rooms are worth the extra money. I stayed in a corner room on the 31st floor that gives you a front and side window. If you can book room 3107 you won't be disappointed. The onsite work out room is well equipped with a lot of machines and free weights. There is a Starbucks on site as well as a roomy restaurant and a side bar. The food was good and the Martinis were excellent. When you rent a club room, you get a continental breakfast every day in the private lounge on the 31st floor. Sunday through Thursday the club room offers a full highline bar, hor'devours and desert from 6pm until 10:00pm. This is worth it. As for the hotel room, it is updated with marble and wonderful beds and coverings. The bathrooms are well appointed and a nice size. I would like to see more pressure from the shower. I was really impressed that as busy as the hotel was, the elevators were always available and quick even while staying on the top floor. A few pointers. Attached to the hotel right outside the door is a coffee and donut shop when the lines at Starbucks are to long. Internet is pricey at $14.05 per day, but you can purchase a weeks pass for $49.00. Bottom line is that this hotel was worth the money. It's great for a holiday location and doing business at the Moscone Convention Center. You are within walking distance to everything in the Union Square. Everything else is accessible through the Cable Cars and trains.

Reviews.Title: “Weekender with the mrs and 2 baby girls”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysonther0ad
Reviews.Content: Great location to town square, clean fresh and remodeled. Late night front desk staff were fantastic! I stayed at property 5 years ago for work and was less than impressed. Great remodel changes - I/we will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanepaddy
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, great location, nice fitness area, like the decor. We were on the 29th floor and didn't have any problems with the noise like some other guests have mentioned. They also gave out cake pops to the ladies on valentines day.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Billscottvb
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is steps from Bart,cable cars and the best shopping. Good value can be found online With club level rooms which include great view, free Internet and the executive club lounge with an outstanding breakfast, appetizers, and deserts. Best of all Mario in the lounge makes for interesting local information. He made my day. Thank you Mario!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: My assistant booked a last minute business trip to San Francisco for me here and I was a little concerned. No need to worry though - Hotel was excellent! Stylish, comfortable, well located, nice bar/restaurant and a GREAT value! Room was a good size and very clean and comfortable.One negative - the valet parking situation on weekday mornings is utterly chaotic. It took about 30 minutes to get our car even though we had called down beforehand. Just plan in enough time - all in all a very nice choice in S.F.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable, clean and had a great contemporary feel. It is in a great location in union square and across the street from Bart. The food in their restaurant was excellent as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ethan Friedman
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Parc 55 during a recent weekend trip to SF. I found much to like about the hotel: large, clean room; great location right by Union Square; less than 1 block from the Powell Street BART station, which will get you to or from SFO in about 1/2 hour (plus whatever time you have to wait for a train). The front desk staff were extremely friendly and gracious, especially the nice person who gave us free in-room wifi access (which would normally cost a ridiculous $15 per day). A few of the fittings in the bathroom were a little loose or aged, but nothing that had any real impact. My only major gripe concerns the hotel's practice of putting 2 bottles of water in the room and then automatically adding the charge ($9 for two 1-liter bottles!) to the bill. Luckily, I hadn't drunk the water, and I noticed the charge on the final bill, so I had the charge removed (immediately and without any argument, to their credit). Still, I just think that's a scummy practice, and I hope no one else gets suckered by it. But it certainly didn't ruin my visit, and I would be delighted to stay at the Parc 55 again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent SF Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rcommins
Reviews.Content: We live in the Bay Area, but every so often enjoy spending the weekend up in San Francisco. When we do, we always stay at the Parc 55. The hotel is very nice and has a modern edge to it that we like a lot. The staff is very professional and kind. When you book your room, try to get a high floor - the views are tremendous - especially facing east. The hotel is close to many of our favorite restaurants and shopping spots. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place good location”
Reviews.Author: AsfordbyVillagefolk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying for one night in the Parc 55. If we ever go back to San Francisco we would certainly look into staying there again. Having read a previous review I asked ahead if we could get a high room with a bay view. We didnt quite get the bay view but it was a high room with a great view nevertheless. The room was excellent, everything we needed, the room amenities were good, large screen TV compfy beds. The reception staff were polite and helpfull. All in all a nice place to stay when in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly415
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels while in San Francisco and decided to give the Parc 55 a try after a friends recommendation... and I'm glad I did! The location was central, check-in was quick and friendly, and I actually found my room quite quiet, being so close to Market and Powell Streets! The property and room was extremely clean, and I was fortunate to be in corner room which has a spacious bathroom. I will definitely consider the Parc 55 on my next visit to San Francisco. Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: EduTravler
Reviews.Content: Just a few steps from the Trolley Start and Visitor's Center with plenty of restaurants and stores within walking distance. Without asking, we were upgraded to a room with a view. From this spot, you won't need a car to tour San Francisco. Active and informative concierge service. We booked through the website and received a great rate for San Francisco standards.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Speckypilot
Reviews.Content: It is located next to Powell BART Station which connects directly to San Francisco Airport. It is also right next to the Cable Car station where one can experience a SF Cable Car ride to the Fishermen's Wharf. Within walking distance, Apple Store, Macy's and Westfield Departmental Stores, Bloomingdales, Saks Fifth Avenue, Union Square and The Cheesecake Factory! Nice bed, spacious room, shower with good pressure and temperature control. Front desk could be a little more friendly and efficient. Long queues can often be found at check in/out counters even if you just want to borrow an umbrella. Sirens from the streets could sometimes be heard probably due to its proximity to a Fire Department or Police Station, or is it just common throughout SF city? Homeless people could be found roaming around near Carl's Jr. Hamburgers fastfood joint right across the street from the hotel main entrance. Best not to go there at odd hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic night in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: linda_ski
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at the Parc 55 and loved it. Elegant, safe, cozy, and great location. We celebrated Valentines Day a bit early and rekindled our relationship. The room we were given on the 23rd floor had windows on two walls which gave us a spectacular city view! The room was quiet even though there was a busy city down on the ground floor. Everything was perfect until we went to get our car. At checkout time everyone is waiting for the valets. We had to wait 1/2 hour in the chilly breezeway till our car arrived. Next time, and there will be a next time, we will call down to have our car brought around!!! Heed the warning, but don't hesitate to check this cool place out!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 we found all facilities to enjoy San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Jessica E
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks ago, I went to San Francisco with my chillaren and staying at Parc 55 was my first smart move. The location is perfect to enjoy all city. The cable car stop is only a few steps and Market street is perfectly connected to visit all zones. Muni, metro, bart,all in same avenue. We could enjoy all locations, piers, golden gate, museums easily and return safely for shopping and dinner in the Union Square zone where the hotel is located. Later to a nice, warm and clean room with a helpful staff to recharge bateries for next day. I would highly recommend it and of course we want to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 never fails to impress!!!”
Reviews.Author: btrain87
Reviews.Content: If your like me... I'm always looking for the best bang for your buck... and Parc 55 has that... Great location, spacious rooms, Wonderful hotel staff!!! It's amazing that a hotel can offer so much at a great price!!! Thank you Parc 55... You never fail to impress!!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “San Fran Perfection!!”
Reviews.Author: mindisue13
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay here every time we are in San Francisco. The location of the hotel alone sold me. Upon arrival you travel to the second floor for check in. There has never been a wait to check in, and we have stayed here three times. Rooms on the upper floors give great views of the city surrounding. The room is well situated with a couch in the large window, attractive decor, and comfortable bed. You can hear city noise, but it is in the middle of a busy area. Walk around the corner of the hotel and you are in Union Square. It is the best place for shopping. It has everything from Tiffanys to small boutique stores. It is also within a 15 minute walk to China town.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: AnnieC_11
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel based on the reviews of other Tripadvisor reviewers and wasn't disappointed. It's a perfect base for exploring SF as you are so centrally located it's easy to get around. All forms of transport are easily accessible and within a short stroll from the Hotel. You can get to Fisherman's Wharf easily from Union Square. Most of the major shops are on your doorstep, so you don't have far to deposit your shopping bags. I even had to buy another suitcase and I was still overweight at check-in!! I had a room on the 18th floor which had fantastic views. The bed was nice and comfortable and had lovely fresh white linen. The bathroom was quite large, spotlessly clean with lots of lovely white towels. The reception lady on checking in was very courteous and friendly. As others have mentioned - you can hear street noise below, but that's city life for you. The Hotel have very helpfully provided ear plugs which worked like a treat for light sleepers like myself. I did not try the Restaurant as there were so many other options in Union Square and I was only there for 3 nights. The Airport Shuttle bus, stops outside the hotel several times a day and you do not have to pre-book it. I left on Superbowl Sunday and was slightly concerned that the city would come to a standstill and the shuttle bus would be delayed. This did not happen and I made the airport in plenty of time. I found the Hotel lived up to the positive reviews on TA and I would definitely return. Another thing I would highly recommend, is purchasing a travel "passport". This pass allows you unlimited travel on the cable cars, trolley cars, buses and BART. The scenic trolley cars (the ones with outside seating) are $6 per trip one way. So getting the passport is extremely good value for money, in my opinion. However, if you have no plans to leave Union Square - don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Great SF Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Loriwhitlow
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is very centrally located! Rooms are a decent size with views from many! Loved this easy hotel with great sheets!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gerribarb
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Wyndham Parc 55. The hotel and lobby were very attractive. The room was clean and bright and we had a wonderful view of the city. Our favorite thing about the hotel, however, was the food in the restaurant. Everything we had was first class and delicious. And, being in Union Square, it was very convenient to the best shopping and local transportation. We highly recommend this hotel when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but really pricey parking!”
Reviews.Author: crayolagal
Reviews.Content: We loved our room during our 3-night stay in Parc 55. The hotel had a great lobby and service, our room was beautiful too. Ultimately, this hotel has wonderful location, being right smack in the middle of union square. If you're into shopping, the shops are minutes away! :) it was a great place to stay after a long flight from Singapore and being jet lagged, it was just nice being able to explore a little..then walk back to our room to rest a bit. The not-so-great parts..well gotta agree with everyone else on the forum. The parking of $55/day was horrendous and if you're unfamiliar with the area (and the left hand drive for us), the safest option was really to go for the crazy rate. And yes, bring your own water too.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: jdubs1175
Reviews.Content: I have to say right off the bat that my wonderful experience was largely in part due to Andre at the front desk. I checked-in with him and he was delightful to talk to. He knew I was staying at the Parc 55 all week for business and put me up in a corner king room (#2073). I was told that this room was very nice and had an amazing view and it did. The room was spacious and the view was amazing. After a long day, being able to relax and take in this view of the city was awesome. Thank you Andre! The room was nice and clean. The bed was comfy. I would have appreciated a little more storage space for my clothing items since I was staying all week but I made due. Room service was ordered one night and the food was mediocre at best but the service staff was a delight to interact with. I called for a wake up call and was in the shower and was not able to get to the phone...staff was knocking at my door to make sure I was up and that nothing had happened to me. How great is that? Overall I was very pleased with my stay here. The location is great and as I said, the service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mmoc65
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly hotel in a good location but the rooms aren't that nice and the beds are hard. The bathroom was rather stark. The view was terrific but for a boutique hotel it wasn't that boutiquey.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Valerie P
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leary of the location but it turned out to be perfect. We were close to everything. The staff was very courteous and helpful and our room was great. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: clserranoc
Reviews.Content: My first stay in SF was absolutely excellent thanks to Parc 55. The hotel's very clean, lovely lobby, the rooms are amazing. We had room 2418 and the view to the city was incredible. Definitely breathtaking. The receptionist was very welcoming, and the staff overall was very nice. Rooms and bathroom are spacious, and the location was wonderful. It was right on Union square, close to everything. The price was very good compared to other hotels that were much more expensive, and once being in SF, we walked in front of them and none looked like Parc 55. I will definitely come here on my next visit to SF. Really, really good. The valet is a little expensive, but we parked at the Sutter Stockton garage, which was cheaper, and you get to walk the wonderful streets of San Francisco for about 8 minutes before you get to the garage. It's really close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for any shopoholic!”
Reviews.Author: KlaudiaC
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in San Fran as we headed out to Napa the following day. We chose the Parc as we wanted to be central with easy BART access. we stayed near the ferry building last time so this time we wanted to explore union square and sourroundings a bit more. Location is fantastic, we even strolled easily back to the ferry building for dinner (20 min) as it was a beau I'll evening . For less mobile or tired there were so many other options via tram, Bart taxi etc which took only a few minutes. The room we had was amazing, big bathtub, floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city, huge king with great pillows and duvet . The lovely Roxanne at the front desk upon finding ou it was our honeymoon gave us a lovely free upgrade which made the stay even more memorable . The only surprise was that inspite being on one of the top floors , we still could slightly hear the city below . Usually we prefer or try to stay in more boutique hotels not in the big boys as we don't like feeling like just a number . But this hotel sure made us feel special .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Night”
Reviews.Author: T D
Reviews.Content: Only staying one night in SF so we thought we would give Parc 55 another go (last time was excellent, but we like to change up hotels for fun). I called and made reservations direct with them. It was an extremely great rate, but was for two double beds when we would have liked a queen or king. Got to the hotel and CHRISTINA at the front desk checked us in. I asked if they had the possibility of changing our room to a queen or king. She did it for no charge and on top of that got us a corner room which was perfect with full wall length windows all around. The location is great because it is slightly off all the busy streets but is central to Union Square, Market St., Trolley Cars and BART. Had drinks at the bar which is very nice and went out that evening. Hotel is clean, modern and great service. Only downside would be that parking there is very expensive, but you could always park in a public garage not far away. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Roger L
Reviews.Content: The manager Brett was exta ordinary in his service and personality. The upgrade to the hotel since the last time I was there was a real pleasure. Great turn down service and I loved the location near Nordies and Market street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Hardly A 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Furnman61
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in union square, however room decor was only fair, business center was out of order and beware of parking fee over 50.00 with tax. Ill pick the Hyatt next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service...”
Reviews.Author: Gattogattogod
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, besides a few minor mistype due to other guest on my floor, but where the hotel really stood out was with its great customer. I directly worked with Jeen, and Ericka abd due to them I will be staying at the 55 everytime I'm in town

Reviews.Title: “Oh Aunty Em...”
Reviews.Author: FranklySpeaking53
Reviews.Content: My son went away to school in San Francisco. For the last 5 years, my husband and I have stayed at the Parc 55. It's a great location. The best shopping, restaurants and walking distance to my son's apartment. When we get there, we always feel so comfortable. The surrounding area is safe, busy yet quiet. There is also a great restaurant on the premises on the second floor. And great food - everywhere - right outside the door of the hotel. Bring some good walking shoes and you're ready to go.... The views are to die for; and the service is just a phone call away. The staff is so friendly and although I like to recognize any employee that goes out of their way, the best thing about this hotel, is they are all so accomodating. I used to travel on business to SF and have relatives there for years, but when I found this hotel, I stopped looking for any others. Between the staff, the location and the hotel itself, I didn't need to look any further...

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Location, Service & Value”
Reviews.Author: jtm1607
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at the Parc 55 twice, and this hotel is tough to beat in San Francisco as a total package. I used to live in the city so I'm picky about my San Francisco experiences. The Union Square Neighborhood, where the hotel is located, has the best shopping in the city and is central to numerous attractions. The Parc 55 is convenient to all public transportation being steps from the Powell Street Station, which services both the BART trains (including the airport line) and MUNI trains which are both great and economical means for getting around the city and Bay Area. For example, you can get from SFO to the Powell Station for under $10, as opposed to a taxi which would likely be $50-70. There's even a cable car stop steps away. Furthermore, what you get for your hotel dollar at the Parc 55 is outstanding. The interior (lobby, bar, rooms) have all been completely renovated within the last 3-5 years and are contemporary and attractive. The only slight shortfall are the bathrooms, which are modest (but fine). Views of the city and bay from the upper floors of the hotel can be stunning. And the staff at this hotel works hard to make our stay an enjoyable one. All this comes at price that is EXTREMELY affordable for a world-class city. The Parc 55 doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Mandas76
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were excellent as a four star hotel should be,but what really impressed us was the outstanding customer service we received when we first arrived thanks to Andre. Andre, greeted us and was warm, friendly, knowledgeable about the area and helped us get a spacious room on the top floor with views of the entire city. Thanks, Andre

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nahed1
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel walking distance to all the fun places to visit...

Reviews.Title: “Bleach, cheap wine, bad service and harassing maids.”
Reviews.Author: colorblind123
Reviews.Content: We will not be back. We reserved a room with a king bed. On check in we were told "you get a room with two doubles". No I am sorry. No nothing. Basically just rude. This was just the start of a miserable one night stay. After check in we spotted what looked like a cool open floor plan and comfortable bar / lounge. We decIded to stop in for a night cap. We both ordered a glass of wine. Granted "by the glass" wine is not going to be opus one, but I think box wine from Costco would have been much better than the skunk p.... We were served. Anyway on top of that both our glasses smelled strongly of bleach. We signed the check , left the wine, and went to bed. Some battles are not worth fighting. Anyway - in the morning we ordered room service. I ordered pan cakes. My wife ordered oatmeal with fresh berries. The berries were mushy and to boot moldy. And the coffee tastes like it was made a week prior. Anyway - as if that was not enough, the rooms were not fresh and smelled of body odor. And finally at 822 am maid began pounding on our door. I answered to a barrage of questions 1) when you leaving? 2) what time can we come in. 3) what time will room be empty blah blah blah. Anyway that is it. There are many better options in sf: taj campton, ritz, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Jess L
Reviews.Content: It's right by the metro station, making everything extremely convenient. We were there for a few days for a visit and this hotel was the perfect location to do all the tourist-y things. The end/start of the famed Powell cable car line is RIGHT by the hotel too. Comfortable, friendly, fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alvin C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for a wedding anniversary and birthday with my wife. Great location off Market Street, and an easy jump-off point to any part of San Francisco. Rooms are well-maintained and clean. Staff is very friendly, courteous and willing to help as they can with any ask. For an overnight stay, I typically look here first and find competitive rates. I'll likely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Parc 55 was exceptional. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left and all points in between, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Ericka at the front desk greeted us warmly and did all that she could to make us feel special. The hotel's location is perfect, walking distance to many resturants, Union Square, Chinatown, galleries, etc. The starting point for the primary cable car lines are only a block away. The accommodations met our expectations but the friendly staff exceeded our expectations over and over again. Sergio and Yolanda at the Club 55 Lounge were so kind and attentive. We had an opportunity to visit with them as we enjoyed a drink overlooking the city. They took a sincere interest in our personal life and made us feel more like friends than customers. Even as we were checking out, Roxanne was warm and pleasant. We went to San Francisco to celebrate our 30th wedding anneversary . We wanted something really special and we weren't dissappointed. We would stay there again and we strongly recommend the Parc 55 Mr. and Mrs. Martinez.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: bob w
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in San Francisco. Suite was great and views very good. The breakfast in the AM on the club level was better than most and helped us enjoy our time there. Location near Union Square was perfect. There was good energy in the bar and common areas. We walked to our event on the Embarcadero and found the central location in SF quite good. We found good restraunts in the area too. Staff friendly and helpful. Used valet parking; also very prompt. Definitely our overnight spot in the city from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: linsmcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at parc 55. It's in a really good location next to station as well as union square. We were starting our honeymoon trip and the hotel staff looked after us well. We had a room on a high floor which had a great view from massive windows. Really impressed with the concierge service overall. One staff member in particular was really knowledgeable and was able to 'read' his customers well. He gave us great advice to go out and explore / eat in the not so stumbled upon places in SF. Would definitely stay there again if visiting the city. Only thing that would make it better would be free wifi access in room. However there is a business centre with free use of computers.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: RDT_UCLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 over the weekend of January 27-29, treating myself to a weekend in the city to unwind after working night and day for the past 3 months, and how you are treated upon arrival sets the stage for how you perceive your entire stay. Andre at the front desk has the perfect mix of professionalism and friendliness that can't be taught. It's a gift you either have or you don't, and despite my telling him any room was fine, he went out of his way to find me a great room that allowed me to relax and enjoy a panoramic view that made me not want to leave the room! He did joke that I was not allowed to work, and being a man of my word, I didn't. I turned off my work email (something I hadn't planned on doing), focused on enjoying my stay, and it was just what the doctor ordered. Between getting ultra-relaxed and the ultra-comfortable bed, I got the best night's sleep I have had in months on Friday night. Seriously. I've stayed at many nice hotels in San Francisco over the years and have my favorites, but I think the Parc 55 will become my new "home" hotel in San Francisco. The location is unbeatable, the rooms are modern, well maintained and spotless, the bed was incredibly comfortable, the wireless Internet was speedy and reliable, and the staff is excellent. And despite being a 32 story hotel with over 1,000 rooms, it doesn't have that sterile, huge chain hotel feel. I don't know what more one could ask for. I enjoyed my stay so much that I decided to do it more often. I have already made a reservation for next month and - and looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mteast
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I met in San Francisco in Jan. and stayed at the Parc 55 on a holiday special rate. We expected small rooms with bad views at that rate, but we're pleasantly surprised to have wonderfully furnished upper level rooms with great views. The entire hotel is well cared for and clean, clean, clean. This is a great place to stay in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ty D
Reviews.Content: The front desk service is amazing. They are very helpful and accomodatiing. Ask for Roxanne, she made me feel at home right way! Thanks Parc 55. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve stay”
Reviews.Author: prchippie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Parc 55-Wyndham hotel in San Francisco this past New Years eve. It was full of people and very busy. The staff was very accomodating and helpful. The room was immaculate. The service was exceptional. A great place to ring in 2012. I will definitely stay there again. Thanks Mr. Brett Leonard for the professionalism of you and the entire staff. Ricky Gomez

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: The business stay I had at the Parc 55 was a great experience. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. The hotel accommodations were among the best I have ever seen! I will stay at this hotel again, especially when I visit for vacation. I would recommend this hotel to everyone looking to visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “perfect city hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MMK49
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham with high expefctations since the Wyndham hotels have become my gold standard hotel. I was not disappointed. Besides the beautiful enterance, the quick valet service (the price is on par with similar hotels in the area), and the perfect location in San Francisco, the real treat of this hotel is the customer service. The beds at renovated Wyndham hotels are by far the most comfortable of any hotel, and with the bath and body works products in the bathrooms, any stay has a 5 star feel. I have come to expect this from all my stays at Wyndham hotels. What made this trip extra special was the customer service by guest manager Brett Leonard. He went absolutely above and beyond to make our short trip our most memorable. Our entire party was upgraded to the most luxurious suite I have ever seen, and we were given complementary access to the club room for a delicious breakfast buffet. He was so friendly and made us feel welcome and relaxed after a 6 hour drive to reach his hotel. I do not imagine a more professional or personable staff member can be found at any hotel. Minor issues which were encountered during our stay (very loud partying teenagers in the room next door) were taken care of swiftly and courteously by security and after a little mix up with room service, we were able to enjoy one of the best nights sleep at a hotel. If you are ever in san francisco, this is the place to stay. You cannot find better service or a better location!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great location and a nice hotel, Good value.”
Reviews.Author: mountainportal
Reviews.Content: A modern high rise building. It is a great location in heart of Union Square and they run specials. It is a great value compared to nearby hotels. A lot of international airline crews stay here. Some web booking sites call this a 4 1/2 star or 4 star.I do not know where they are coming from, but I would call it a solid 3 1/2 star. The rooms are big and clean but this place is showing a bit of wear since it's last remodel. This is especially true in the bath and showers. Check in and check out is strangely slow so be prepared if you need to check out in person and are in a hurry, allow time. The staff are very nice and attentive. The $15 per day charge for internet in a business setting, this in the world of free wifi in most hotels is a bit strange and annoying, but maybe they will get over this. All, in all it is a good value in an area of much pricier properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: virtuous1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham in November for a conference. Everything from the reception desk to the cleaning staff was perfect. The beds are super comfortable. It was actually the best sleep I've had in awhile. I had a very nice corner room with panoramic views of downtown San Francisco. The staff was more than accomodating in helping me arrange a semi-private dinner at the restaurant on the property. I was very impressed with all of their efforts. The hotel is downtown - so it's very close and within walking distance to the Moscone Convention center and many other attractions and shopping areas. My one and only issue is that there is no free internet access (about $15 per day). For the cost of the hotel, one would think internet would be a complimentary amenity, especially since most of the guests are business travelers. Otherwise - no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Wyndham San Francisco - Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mapleleafr
Reviews.Content: Located by Union Square this is an ideal location for business or pleasure. I happen to be on business and my wife accompanied me (to shop .. of course) we walked to all venues daily including Moscone Center. The hotel is steps away from MUNI buses , cable cars on Powell St and awesome shopping up and down Market Street including Westfield San Francisco Center - A huge Mall indeed. You can get to Fisherman's Wharf or the Golden Gate bridge very easily. Invest in a MUNI Passport for a multi-day transit pass and enjoy the rides all over the San Francisco area - BART is not included on this pass. I also recommend a trip to Alcatraz for $26/each. Don't pay anymore than that in "service fees". Check pricing online and book early for your preferred day and departure time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beebs54
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location in Union Square. We were very impressed. Close to trolley line, San Francisco Center, Macy's etc. We got a really great deal on this hotel and the rooms are very clean and the staff was very helpful. I recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “They do a good job”
Reviews.Author: GMKR
Reviews.Content: Great location. Not so far south on Market as to be gross. Not so close to the Financial District as to be just business. Not so close to Union Square as to be touristy. A mix of tourist, business, and convention; and domestic and international visitors. Nice decor. The rooms were in pretty good shape. Friendly staff. Have stayed here a few times over the years and it's a preferred hotel in the city for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: turbodog08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a babymoon! Perfect location to walk to the trolleys and car rental companies are right around the corner as well. Room was large and very clean, and hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the SF area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: 10062011c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located by Union Square (walking distance), is clean/safe, with friendly staff, and offers a nice bar with a decent view. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fernando G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay in San Francisco about 30 days a year on business and pleasure. My wife loves the location of the Parc55 over many other more high end hotels that require a walk up hill after shopping. We enjoy the friendly staff that always greet us by name from Sara and Christina at the front desk to Arman at valet service to Sergio at the club level lounge. The price is always very good and at times you can find extremely good deals on room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas shopping in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cindy1753
Reviews.Content: Every December my daughter and I go to San Francisco for our annual Christmas shopping trip and stay at Parc 55. It's a very easy walk from BART to the hotel. We always have a wonderful experience and love to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “New Years In SF”
Reviews.Author: Lynette G
Reviews.Content: Our trip to SF for New Years was very very nice. We had planned a concert and chose this hotel because of the location to the concert. However, this hotel turned out to be located near everything you would need as well as just a few blocks from the concert venue. All transportation types were within easy and quick walking distance. Nice location for evening walks. We felt very safe. The hotel is beautiful and we enjoyed our stay there very very much. The staff were kind and helpful. Rooms were awesome and hotel was beautiful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Diego1
