Reviews.Content: This was a great experience all around. I would certainly recommend this place to colleagues and family. If your in SF and want nice views and great service this is the place to go. Keep up the good work Parc55! Thanks again for a good stay. Dirgo

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Excellent location Good value”
Reviews.Author: bobnmarians
Reviews.Content: Take the shared shuttle from the airport. Eat breakfast at Mo'z 1 1/2 blocks away. Try the New Delhi restaurant if you like Indian food. Cable cars and public transportation close by.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Visit on a Rainy Weekend”
Reviews.Author: DallasGuest
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to SF and had no idea where to stay or what to do. Checked out several hotels in the Union Square area and selected Parc 55 for the wonderful service Ana V. gave us when we arrived to inquire about rooms. The entire staff from Doorman to Concierge was friendly and professional. Ana assisted us in the hotel features and what was close by as well as answered all our questions about the city. She won us over. Thank you Ana, my partner and I truly enjoyed our first visit to the city and will return to Parc 55. The hotel and room was everything you said it would be. Thank you !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy”
Reviews.Author: Travel9821
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to hear EVERYTHING from downstairs even if you are in their "club level". The concierge and front desk are average and I had to ask a different hotels concierge for help!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but way expensive!”
Reviews.Author: bjr11
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night on January 12th for business. It was clean, nice enough, gym was good and room service was fine. A bit noisy outside my room down on the street all night long. But was it worth the nearly $500 bill for the one night? Probably not. I realize it's San Francisco and was a busy time, but still - Wow! I had to stay there for business reasons, glad it wasn't out of my own pocket!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mszozobra
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size, clean and the hotel is in a great location to do all the downtown things, shopping, cable cars, the works. Our room was on the 25th floor, so we have a very quiet night. The bed was VERY comfy. The parking is pricey, but that goes with the territory. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul A A
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff, especially Brett at check-in, were extremely helpful, friendly and thoughtful. It is centrally located and easy walking distance to the Moscone Center, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: happy2bJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a two night stay at this hotel. The entrance lobby is not great. You come off the street into a "grey" cold lobby area. The rooms were a reasonable size, however, I would not give the hotel 5 stars for cleanliness. The carpet in our room was grubby, the room was quite noisy with traffic noise. So all in all, I would say not a 5 star hotel. The location was great for sightseeing, and shopping. Union square looke fantastic with all the Christmas decorations up.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and service in S.F. - Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Jammer1
Reviews.Content: I and my significant other have now stayed twice in the last year at the Parc 55. Can't say enough how great both the accommodations and the service were on both of our visits. These were both holiday trips, including one right before Christmas when things were crazed in San Francisco, but the hotel was both an oasis of calm and an outstanding customer service experience. Rooms are very clean, modern and quiet. (Make sure you close the window vents before you crash - even up high you can get a pretty good earful of City noise if you don't do that!) Great beds, great bathrooms, my only beef is that they charge for Internet access (like most of the major hotel chains except for Residence Inn and Courtyard - in my opinion this is a goofy thing to do in the age of the Internet - like charging for cable TV access.) Lots of great places to eat near the hotel, it is literally half a block or less from the Muni and BART Station at Powell, there's a decent pastry and coffee shop just outside the hotel on the same block as Parc 55 heading towards BART, and you're only blocks from Union Square and all the shopping any human could stand. Also very close the Theatre District. Let me say it one more time - outstanding customer service. Everyone from the front desk staff to the hotel operators to the cleaning staff - everyone was great, friendly and nothing but helpful. I recommend Cafe Mason (on Mason) for excellent dining for all three meals - really a superb place to eat only 2 blocks from the hotel. Santorini just a block away walking North is great Greek food as well. There's a Starbuck's just before Santorini's, heading North. There are other excellent hotels in S.F. - of course. But this is one of the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KyleDenverCo
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference at the Intercontinental Hotel and decided to forego the "conference" rate and stay at the Parc 55 - great decision! Great room, great price only imperfect experience was no hot water one morning -which can happen but they did not handle the situation well initially but came through in the end.

Reviews.Title: “6 Wonderful night”
Reviews.Author: maisoncote
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco as every year for the Fancy food Show I usually stay at the Powell hotel in the same part of town but last year I fund a visitor in my room a big black cockroach and was just very discusted I decide to upgrade to the Wyndham and was I very satisfied a beautiful room with a great view, great service, I really enjoy my stay and will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review 2012”
Reviews.Author: HYNsalsera
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, clean and near the bus,cable car, & bart. Close to Westfield Centre and Union Square If we return back to SF we would definetly stay there again. We did have a small problem with having NO hot water in the morning but thankx to the manager cathy (mahalo) , she was very nice and was on top of fixing it!!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend lives in the Mission District, but we often choose to stay at Parc55 because we love being in the heart of the city and enjoy a romantic hotel stay wherever we are. This hotel has been very good to us. It truly feels like a home away from home while giving us a lot of perks. We love the rooms on the upper floors. The sweeping views are always breathtaking, no matter what direction you are facing. You might see the bay to the south, you might be staring at some of the most beautiful architecture, but it won't matter because you'll find yourself peering down at this magical city with awe. I like the layout of the hotel, the color scheme and the zen vibe. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. On several occasions, we chose to extend our stay (because we actually DO love staying here) and they bent over backwards to make it happen even during a "sold out" weekend. The reception level is beautiful and inviting with high ceilings, wood flooring and gorgeous orchids. Don't pass up the citrus infused water near the bar/restaurant entrance. If you want to grab a cocktail before venturing out, the bar has some great 2 for 1 deals on wine and specialty drinks. We have not tried the concierge/upgraded package yet, but plan to do so soon. When we were checking out last weekend, we noticed a different key card on our agent's desk. She explained that the tippy top floor rooms have special amenities that include breakfast and cocktails in a spectacular viewing space. I can't wait to book that package on my next trip. The only negative I can point out would be the beds. Although comfortable and elegantly dressed in fine white sheets with large Euro pillows, the mattresses aren't top of the line. You can tell that they are springy and not plush. It isn't a deal breaker though. Being near the Powell St. BART station has its pros and cons. It is lovely to go direct from SFO and be about 20 steps from your hotel, especially when toting a lot of luggage. The slight downside is dealing with people hanging around the BART entrance, both the panhandlers and the crowds of tourists buying tickets for trolley rides. It can get quite chaotic and loud, but once inside the Parc55, you don't hear the street noise below. You'll be hard pressed to avoid any unwanted street activity at most SF hotels anyway. Walk across the street to Nordstrom, their cafe is yummy with gorgeous views back toward the Parc55. Take a jaunt down Market street to the amazing Ferry building, especially on the weekend when the Farmers Market is bustling with energy from both locals and tourists. Our favorite secret find is jumping on the Sausalito or Larkspur ferry for only $5 (with a Clipper card) and boating across the water to have a reverse view of this amazing city! I have stayed at a wide range of SF hotels- from budget to luxury, but I will only choose the Parc55 from now on. It has everything I want for a wonderful San Francisco experience. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuenosAiresRoxana
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very comfortable and clean, very nice beds for a relaxing sleep. Location was excellent, everything we needed we had near. We arrived very early in the morning after more than 20 hours of flight+airport time and the hotel staff managed to give us one of the two reserved rooms so we could "unload", get some rest and shower. Other hotels might have charged for an early check in but Parc 55 did not. Thanks Cristina!!! Also we had ordered a big amount of things, which could have been easily lost given that this is a big hotel (+1000 rooms), but all our packages were perfectly delivered, thanks Mr Sanchez!! Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great views”
Reviews.Author: jackal3
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here about 3 times now. The rates are always excellent, and you can't beat being able to hop on the Bart at the airport and get off across the street from your hotel (and then hop back on the Muni and go wherever you like anytime). The shopping at Westfield Centre and Union Square is right there, and there are tons of great lunch options around. We got upgraded to a view suite this time, which was fantastic! Panoramic views all around. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Lt85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and booked a king bed club room - this includes access to the club lounge for breakfast, hors d'oeuvres and dessert and a room on the 27th floor and above. Upon check in we were given a room on the 25th floor, went back to reception and were advised there were no king beds in the club rooms but were told all the hotel rooms were exactly the same except club ones are on a higher floor. This was slightly annoying as on the website we booked on we selected a king room opposed to double and paid slightly more so thought it was guaranteed. In the end we settled for 2 doubles on the club floor. If you're a couple I wouldn't recommend this though as they are smaller than UK doubles. I personally would say the rooms are slightly nicer having seen both and you get amenities such as dressing gowns, complimentary water etc which you don't in the standard rooms. Breakfast in the club lounge is nice, however they only provide tiny saucer size plates which are even too small for a slice of toast which is a bit impractical. Breakfast is served every day however hors d'oeuvres and dessert are every evening EXCEPT Friday and Saturdays so we only got to experience them one evening. Also if you have a connecting door like we did be aware the sound proofing is pretty terrible, on our last night we could hear a couple talking loudly mid evening and then were woken at 2am by them having a rather heated discussion! Could even hear them flush the toilet. However I think if it was a normal room without the door it wouldn't have been an issue but if you are a light sleeper make sure your room isn't a connecting one. I've stayed in many hotels with connecting doors and never experienced that level of noise from the adjoining room. Other than the issues we experienced the rooms are clean and offer fantastic views, would consider staying here again but probably just in a standard room as I don't think it's worth the extra money for the club one. The location is brilliant, right outside Powell Street station, you can get the BART train directly here to/from the airport. Be sure to book Alcatraz tickets ahead of time too as they can sell out quite far in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is a solid 4 star in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Jeff-in-Laguna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Parc 55 several times, most recently for a quick weekend trip to the city. We are from Orange County, CA, and visit SF 5-6 times/yr. We have stayed at most of the nice hotesl in Union Sq, including the Westin St Francis, Hyatt, Parc 55, and some nearby gems like the Mark Hopkins (Nob Hill) and Palace Hotel (Off Market). The Parc 55 can definitely hang with them First, the location is a short walk to the center of Union Square. It's very close to Market street shopping, along with all the Union Sq shopping/restaurants. It's also a nice walk down market to the Ferry Bldg on a Saturday for the farmer's market. All in all, good location. The hotel is clean, well appointed rooms, and good service. We didn't eat at the hotel, but did have cocktails and appetizers in the lobby bar. Just ok on the appetizers. Not a great selection of beers on tap as well. Concierge was very good. If you don't visit the city often, this is important. You must be able to get good tips on eating places, and also areas to avoid. For example, the Tenderloin area is a short 2 blocks from the hotel. As we know the city well, we know how to avoid this area. But my wife and I often wonder how new tourists to the city fare if they mistakenly walk through this area by accident, especially in the evenings. It is a dangerous area, and one you definitely want to know about and avoid. A good concierge will do this for you, as well as guide you to great restaurants, make reservations (some of the fine hotels have connections that can get you a table that you might no be able to secure on your own), and popular attractions. We will definitely consider the Parc 55 on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is a good choice for your SF stay”
Reviews.Author: Mangare_e_Bere
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndam a handful of times in the past two months and have had a good experience. The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square and the Theatre District. The rooms are well-appointed, reasonably sized and relatively quiet. The only complaints that I can make is that the parking rates are ridiculous (as in all of SF) and that the front desk seems understaffed at times. This is not a dis on the people behind the desk, they are by and large very nice and very professional - it is just that I have had to wait to check in and check out for too long. All things considered this is a minor complaint. The hotel is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it because of Brett!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel201
Reviews.Content: It was a great location. The lobby was goregous but best of all staff was amazing. One in particular, Brett. He was so upbeat, friendly and professional. He gave us great recommendations for restaurants and places to sight see. Brett was so personable. Thank you Brett! When we are back in San Francisco again, we will be back at your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeW1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 hotel for a trade show and could not have been more pleased. The location was excellent- one block from the start of the cable car line, 3 blocks to Union Square, and a short walk to the Moscone Center. DO NOT be alarmed by other reviews regarding "street people" and " a bad neighborhood." Anywhere you go in the city, you will come across homeless people asking for money. The room itself was quite nice- vary spacious and well appointed. I asked for a refrigerator and was brought one in short order. The bathroom shower was especially nice with consistent hot water and nice pressure. We had a beautiful view of the city from our room. No complaints at all about this hotel and we will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 Wyndham is a beautiful hotel right in the heart of San Francisco. My husband and I stayed for three nights in the amazing top floor suite. Brett Leonard was wonderful and we are already excited to go back. The hotel lobby really sets the tone for the entire hotel. It is elegant and contemporary. The staff is very friendly and you are very close to everything. The bart and other public transportation is a block away and while you can walk most places, the convenience is great to have as well...especially after long nights :). Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, a hip feel and quality service make this a great deal.”
Reviews.Author: geeman1017
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel largely based on tripadvisor reviews - it scores well. And it did not disappoint. High scores for location, easy valet and parking, excellent and friendly front desk and concierge team and a great vibe which was unexpected for a pretty large property. Check in had a boutique feel. Lower scores for a concierge who didn't know some of the cool places around town that tripadvisor as well as some basic google searches would come up with - but very friendly. Still i think a great concierge is one of the most valuable assets to the front desk especially in a foody town like SFO. Extras are expensive. Almost $5 for a bottle of water in your room, $14 for wifi and it is per device so $28 for your laptop and phone for 24 hours. Thay's just wrong! But let's go back to location. San Francisco is a great city - and with the hills and streets some places are just naturally better starting points than others. This hotel is exactly where you would want to be. BART outside, you are right at the key point for shopping and Union Square and the trolleys are at your doorstep. As a home base and you want really (absolutely) nice sheets but happy with something fairly basic but truly well run and rather hip, this is a great place. Advice to get a higher room because of street noise was absolutely accurate. It's a buzzing part of town - so go higher. You'll love the view too.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Planetary
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Parc 55. It is much-improved after the renovation. The lobby, restaurant and other public areas are stylish. The room was large and comfortable, with a great view to the north and west, including the Transamerica tower. The location is excellent, one block from the Powell BART / Muni station, two blocks from Union Square, surrounded by restaurants and shopping. Given the recent concern over bed-bugs in several US cities, we checked the bed carefully and found nothing. Wireless internet was available but cost $14/day, so if you have a 3G USB stick it will save you some money. Our only complaints are 4 minor annoyances that may have been the result of incomplete detailing after the renovation: 1) the TV cable box didn't work and required 4 technician visits to troubleshoot (ask for Allen to go straight to the best); 2) the bathroom door didn't close properly; 3) the alarm clock had no battery backup and had to be reset at least daily; and 4) one of the bedside lamps was not plugged in, and the nearest receptacle was inaccessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spenney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Parc55 twice, first time pre Wyndham owners. Second time better than first after revamp. Concierge and bar staff very helpul. Rooms great views and massive. Couldn't get in Christmas 2011 through a budget site but found out later probably could have booked direct, sorry I didn't as stayed in Nikko and didn't like. We actually visited the bar at the 55 for a snack and drink as our bar was not open in the day ?? Would recommend this hotel and then use as a benchmark to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tammy t
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the hotel over the Christmas holiday and had 2 interconnecting rooms. The location of the hotel was just great, very central. We paid a little more to stay at the club level and had access to the club lounge. The breakfast selection was alright, they have starbucks coffee and a wide selection of tea, it would be perfect if there was some hot food. One of the butlers at the lounge, Mario was really helpful and friendly, he definitely made our stay at the hotel a lot more pleasant. The rooms are comfortable but do not expect 5 star furnishings, the rooms can do with a little refurbishment. Overall it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you use american miles”
Reviews.Author: Gtown59
Reviews.Content: Paid in full for a night using americans miles. The hotel charged me $160(50% over the rate on their website) without giving my a bill on checkout saying my reservation was fine. Now its even more of a hassle to get it cleared up. Horrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: ExoticDave
Reviews.Content: I moved here from the noisy Sir Francis Drake hotel for my last 2 nights in San Fran. This property was farther from Union Square so wasn't so loud. I also didn't have a corner room. That helped. Being sleep deprived from being on the 6th floor at the SFD, I requested a high floor at the Parc and ended up on the 23rd. The BIG disappointment about this property is the lack of sauna. The information provided said that there was one on property. But when I wen't to sit and sweat, is was no where to be found. After calling the front desk from the house phone in the fitness center, they informed me that it had been removed when the fitness center was expended. Bummer. Instead, I went back to my room and opened my book. Aside from that, the room offered a nice view of the city, plenty of lounging furniture and space, a great bed, perfect climate control, and hot water that is one degree from steam...watch it! I would stay here again. Especially because I enjoyed a wonderful night (2) of uninterrupted sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, low on amenities”
Reviews.Author: ajitbhanot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a steal for the price, we were here with friends and family and our only criteria was a safe hotel near Union Square (we were recommended union square over the wharf area by friends). The first thing that I noticed was the expensive parking and a lack of any waiting area (they have one which can accommodate 2/ 3 cars at a time), which meant that my friend who had come to drop us off could not even wait for us to reach the lobby to ensure that we had our rooms. The lobby is on the 2nd floor and there is no elevator near the main entrance which means the luggage goes with the bell hop (nothing wrong with that just a matter of preference). We had 2 rooms and they were on the same floor. The rooms have no refrigerator of microwave, we rented one at a charge since we needed one in the night for the little one. Having no refrigerator meant that the milk that we bought was bad by the next day :(. Internet is expensive though they do have about 8 machines free of charge in the lobby and the business center. The rooms themselves were clean and nice, the bathroom though not so well lit but was clean and large. The room service is AWESOME. They were very helpful and were quick and prompt and courteous. This is the only reason I would ever go back to the hotel. If you are looking for family fun, this is not the place, this is a cold business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My staycation in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: sls1047
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 2 nights at the Parc 55. Great location! 1 block away from the amazing Westfield Mall. The parking attendant was right there as soon as I pulled up and got a bellman to take my bags. Checkin was fast and done with smiles. The lobby smelled so good! I was on the 29th floor with a wonderful view if the City. The beds are very firm! I must say I don't care to much for the room service menu, but I ate out most if the time anyway. All in all very nice, clean and quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 good and bad”
Reviews.Author: nystyleformReno
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Booked through Expedia and halved the rate/night that was advertised. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Ordered room service our first night and it was deliverd prompt and hot. Rooms are very clean and quiet...and our room was right off the elevators and we stayed there for 3 nights! BART and cable car connection right outside. Mall across the street. Con's: Hotel located on the 'line' of good neighborhood vs. bad! Literally. Cop cars park at the hotel corner to keep gang/street people from causing a rucus. So, in one way, very safe since cops hanging there 24/7! Matress quality was ridiculously poor for a 4 star hotel. We complained and the desk said they would switch out matress' for us. Instead they sent the housekeeping staff in with an inexpensive egg carton foam to put on top of the bed. Now the sheets didn't fit, so the corners kept sliding off during the night! Our room had 2 double beds, so my husband and split up and we each took a bed, to try and get some comfort to be able to sleep! (Not the best sleeping accomodation while on a vacation :( Other wise, the bed linens were nice, and a variety of pillow softness from downy soft to firm and plenty of them. TV in the room would only receive a few analog stations. National stations were being broadcast on HD, and the signal was 'broken' everytime we turned it on. Internet available in your room, but for an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: elobrux
Reviews.Content: when you spend more than 500$ for a hotel, you expect at minimum a good service, which was here the worst we could have: issue by checking, the desk agent was impolite, angry and didn't smiled at all, not only with us but she had the same behavior with other clients from the hotel (we were complaining during the waiting time, which is by the way unacceptable for a hotel in this standing (more than 30 min to have his "keys") ! we highly recommend to take the breakfast outside the hotel, which will be much cheaper what was positive: the location, the bed and the view but it's a minimum for this price !

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A_simple_man
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything bad in particular to say about this hotel, but the overall experience was not very good, as I had expected. We had some issues with the bell boy checking in, but that is the sort of things that happen. The bad was not very comfortable but it was fair. Our neighbours down the hall made a lot of noise, but that's not the hotel to blame. Two things annoyed me about the hotel itself - we had spent new year's eve there, and while we were asked to sign a paper syaing we will not have a party in our room (which sounds reasonable), the hotel itself held a party that lasted until 2 am. We couldn't sleep due to the noise. The second thing was their breakfast. One of the worst breakfasts I've seen. Poor variety. Small plates. There were very few places to sit, so some people eat while standing. Every chair was occupied so strangers had to share tables. Not the sort of thing you'd expect from such hotel. Also, no free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “good location, pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: pattiorama
Reviews.Content: Nice room with modern, clean decor. Bed was comfortable and room was quiet (for San Francisco.) Lots of shopping within easy walking distance. Parking was valet and very expensive. Lots of restaurants nearby so we did not eat in the hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel a while back the rate was awesome- $120 a night. this is definitely the nicest hotel I've stayed in, obviously within my price range. I believe it was recently renovated- maybe the rate was low to attract new visitors. The hotel was in a great central location, walking distance from a lot of cool San Fran stuff, and super close to buses, trolleys, etc. Super clean, awesome location in Union Square and a good view! Would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware when you Parc here!”
Reviews.Author: calman255
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the resonable rate I received at this Hotel...beautiful room with a great view and in a superb location. The only thing I can complain about is the parking charge. There is a sign at the valet desk stating a maximum charge for per day parking. When we checked out the man at the desk charged extra for what he called an oversized vehicle...close about 50% extra! I drive a Chevy Tahoe and the parking charge was close to $75 per night. Be aware that whatever great rate you get on the room they will do their best to get it back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: We4palls
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when we come to San Francisco. You can walk to many spots from the hotel. There is a great Thai restaurant in the hotel that we always go to. Its always filled with locals and the prices are great.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jnew02
Reviews.Content: Let's start at the beginning. Valet parking was such a cluster and so disorganized. It was hard to get help and we watched them put the tag for our truck in someone else's BMW (could've been a good thing) but they realized the mistake. Then we got inside and realized we had made the reservation for the wrong day. The front desk was very helpful in accommodating us. We got to our room and discovered we got the handicap room. The bathroom door wouldn't close all the way or lock. There was hair on the bathroom ceiling and in the shower. The walls were paper thing and even from 13 floors up we could hear everything on the street. We shouldve known when we found earplugs offered with the soap and shampoo. I've also never had a more difficult time getting a tv to work. There wasn't enough light and one of the lamps was burnt out. The coffee rocked and the paper towels in the lobby bathroom were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice!”
Reviews.Author: clutchbomb
Reviews.Content: I was walked by the Clift Hotel and moved to this property due to an oversell situation, which was very inconvenient. However, I received a lower room rate at Parc 55 (first night was comp'ed for being walked) and was very happy here. The staff and room service were perfect, and the room was impeccably clean. The lobby is a bit sterile, but overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gret Location average to poor servie”
Reviews.Author: tassie4061
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 stayed for 3 nights in two club rooms. Booked the day before direct with the hotel and requested adjoining rooms or two rooms close together (no guarantees given and that was fine, I prefer adjoining rooms as were travelling with 3 teenaged daughters). Upon check in we were told rooms were not adjoining but relatively close together as the hotel did not have adjoining rooms. So we checked in nice rooms, however the room my daughters were in had an adjoining door? I rang down was told no adjoining room that night however there would be adjoining rooms available from the next day and we should talk with guest services and they could make the change for us. Long story short, we were moved 3 times (we move ourselves each time) as each time they allocated two adjoining rooms when we arrived at the rooms there was no adjoining door!! 1/12 hours of our holiday we can;t get back!! Finally I said we had to go as we had a tour booked and could they sort out the rooms and when we got back later in the day I would collect the keys. Guess what...... arrive back after a massive day of sightseeing, allocated new swipe cards and arrive at rooms which are not adjoining. To be honest we could have stayed in non adjoining rooms, but now it was a matter of principle, don't tell me I can have an adjoining rooms, make me move my suitcases 3 times and still end up with two separate rooms!! Arghhhhh super annoying!! An adjoining room is what we ended up with Other that the room debacle, the rooms were large, clean and hotel is well located. The staff (other than reception staff who don;t know the hotel room configuration were great) I was annoyed that I had to pay to WiFi but if you are happy to googled downstairs there are 2 desktop computers for guest use. Also I found that it there were several free WiFi ports my girls used from the room so that was fine. KInd of made paying for PARC 55 WiFi stupid. Would I stay here again, probably not, but I would stay in the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling G
Reviews.Content: This is my home away from home. Staff are so kind and professional. Exceptional value. Affordable luxury. Wonderful views, comfortable rooms/beds/pillows/general surroundings. I am always impressed. Location is great. Walk to everything - cable car right around corner, BART across the street, Starbucks one block up, mall and Union Square right there. Always clean. Again, the staff are exceptional. They are so happy to serve you, truly.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Ying M
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews unless i have very strong positive/negative opinions. I booked this hotel based on the number of good reviews i read online. I was SO disappointed with the whole experience. It's very NOISY (neighboring rooms, floors above you and the street noise outside!) The breakfast area was so small - people had to stand up to eat & the staff couldn't care less about helping you with anything! The only decent thing about this hotel is its location but it's not worth the stress of staying here just for that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Good price”
Reviews.Author: Ropires
Reviews.Content: We went there for NYE 2012. Great location, value and service. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient to everything”
Reviews.Author: donmhighland_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 25th Dec to 28th and the stay was comfortable. Very good beds, clean room and big bathroom. Good view from 20th floor. Everything is so close from here which is why we loved the hotel. BART, cable car, union square is all on walking distance. burger king opposite the hotel served us as our daily breakfast and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussies_11
Reviews.Content: Exceeded our expectations. Great location and fairly quiet. On minor hiccup was that we had to wait for room to become available for check-in wasnt ready until after 5.00pm. Room was a good size for SF or NYC standards. We didnt pay the extra for a Room with a view - others said the views were great. Staff were friendly. Good value for money and we would recommend it. Location makes this a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: commanderbyrne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Parc55 in May of this year. We stayed in a club level bedroom, so had us of the club room for breakfast in the mornings. Room was spotless and staff were friendly. Bar in the hotel had a nice mix of people and a good selection of drinks. Only gripe I would have is having to pay for wifi, which in a modern hotel is ridicules. Seems to be becoming the norm in 4+ star hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Club room not worth the additional cost and book directly”
Reviews.Author: Froggystyle
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the hotel's website we selected a 'club' room thinking that we'd get something just a little bit nicer which we thought was worth it given that we'd be staying for almost 2 weeks. We booked in via a third party booking site and prepaid the whole stay via credit card so we were kind of stuck with what we got. It seemed quite apparent that the hotel knew that and we were stuck in a room which looked directly at another hotel. We asked whether we could get a room with a view of the bay and were told that we'd be given one in a few days which despite following several times, never eventuated. The room itself was quite small and not that special (surprisingly, in comparison to a very sexy 44th floor Manhatten hotel room that we got a few weeks later on). The hotel itself is very well situated if you want to go exploring SF, though you do have to run the homeless person gauntlet every time you leave, though this is pretty much the norm everywhere). In short, the hotel was ok, a bit overpriced and I'd recommend booking directly with the hotel so you can leave if unsatisfied. If you intend on it being a romantic getaway, request a bay view room and ensure you get it because the view from the other side isn't that crash hot. Don't bother forking out extra for the Club Room either the facilities of the executive level are ok, but not worth writing home about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but has issues”
Reviews.Author: mmehtas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights recently. The hotel is well located, in the center of everything. The staff were friendly, the room was immaculate, and housekeeping was prompt. Overall we had a good stay. The minor issue is with the street noise - emergency vehicles with sirens on in the middle of the night that can be clearly heard even on the 12th floor. The price one pays for being in the middle of the action! The major issue we had was with the elevators. There is one bank of six elevators that services all 6 floors. For some reason, they take forever to come. On our second morning (weekday), we waited 15 minutes for an elevator. One showed up every 5 minutes or so, but they were already full. Finally, we ended up walking the 12 floors down to to the street level. The elevators were slightly more frequent for the remaining of our stay. The front desk told us that "engineering" was working on a "problem". Not sure we bought this given that all six elevators were in operation. Seems more like not enough elevators to handle the traffic, or very poorly programmed algorithms controlling the elevators. The business's center was open 24 hours, and although the description we had read of the hotel spoke to free wifi in the business center, there was none. There were 6-7 computers each with an attached printer. We tried to use one to print our boarding cards, but found 3 of the computers not operational, and not a single printer working. Wifi in the rooms is available for a steep price ($14.99 per week?). Other than the issues above, we enjoyed the hotel. It was comfortable, the staff responsive and courteous, and the location was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Puts the A in Accessibility”
Reviews.Author: OJ07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is v. central, across from all the hot shopping spots if you're into that. It's also easy to catch cabel cars and public transit to other parts of the city which is incredibly handy. I felt we accomplished a lot in a short time just because we didn't have to walk far or wait for public transport for long. It was always available. Hotel is v.clean.staff v. friendly THE ONLY CON to this place is the windows are not sound proof. The place is so central that you'll hear fire, ambulance sirens thru the night and sometimes fights on the street. I wouldn't normally get fussed about this but we were travelling with a young tot, and she woke up thru the night, which meant we we were up so We moved from the 11th floor to 22nd floor. Staff made no hesitations about moving us. They seemed to be well aware of the noise situation plus I did read previous reviews on the noise and forgot to ask for the interior room when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service ,great place, coming back Forsure”
Reviews.Author: Tavi10
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, front desk job done by Ana Vasquez was superb! Made me a believer that the client is always first here at parc55

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great customer service, and amazing deals”
Reviews.Author: mb1wny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times and have been impressed by how much they offer for the price. They staff are nice, the rooms are immaculate, and they offer great prices for the location. I look forward to continuing to stay with them on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: TC89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend about 2 weeks ago and we left with smiles! Check-in was a breeze and we were actually upgraded to the King view room, more about that in a minute. The hotel is centrally located and towers over the city. Valet is pricey at about $45 a day/night but there are smaller parking garages within a couple block radius for about $30/day/night. Both the upstairs and downstairs lobby screamed of luxury and class, walking in we knew that we made the right choice. As I said before we originally booked the normal King room and I politely asked if there was a room higher up aka the King View rooms and if it was possible to receive an upgrade. The woman was kind enough to upgrade us with a smile and it made our day and night! Overall, the view you get from the king view rooms are amazing, panoramic views of the city that will leave you speechless. We will definitely be coming back and we are already thinking about this upcoming weekend!

Reviews.Title: “ask for lower levels”
Reviews.Author: Riclau
Reviews.Content: every nice and clean room, nice and close to the cable cart and car which was very easy to get around the city. the noise from the street was pretty bad at some times but that wasnt a huge problem, thou we did come down from the 20th floor to go and explore in the afternoon and the hotel was being evacuated and fire brigade where there from a fire alarm we had no idea of this alarm or did not hear anything and when i spoke to reception about it, he didnt mention that there was a problem with it, and would bring it up again with staff. i felt he was very casual with this problem, even thou it turned out not to be a emergency, if it was we could of been it alot of danger. And also look out for the exy wifi charges, they say free internet but it means two slow computers in the wall way, which half the time werent working.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: dalycalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great location. Awesome views in corner room. Mostly windows to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, don't regret it”
Reviews.Author: Hector A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son for 4 nights. We visited San Francisco to go to the Monday Night Football Game (49ers and Steelers). The location is great; walking distance from Union Square, many stores and places to eat. Public transportation and taxis always available. Room was clean, comfortable and service was excellent. Concierge (Rosanna?) was very helpful with recommendations and reservations for local tours. Other reviews mentioned street noise and homeless people in the vecinity, but none of these were ever issues for us. I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always pleasant”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here 3x within this year. Pro: Centrally located, decent staff, nice rooms, clean hotel and quiet. Con: VALET: For some reasons, this hotel charges $48 if you look at other hotels nearby, some charges as low as $35. There is also a car garage less than a block away where you can park 24 hrs for $28 if that makes a difference just no in/out privilege. INTERNET: they charge per day or weekly. Sucks if your there for business.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: foodietrotter
Reviews.Content: I was at the Parc 55 for 9 nights, 5 of which were work related and the last 4 an extension into a vacation with my partner. The hotel was nice. Clean, good service, room size was just okay and space was a little limited. However, all amenities (suitcase stools, hangers, 24-hr gym (big bonus), hair dryer, in-room iron and ironing board) were available, I was expecting bigger rooms. I was especially expecting a nicer bathroom. The water pressure was not the best and the carpeting was a little old. However, they did give us a nice room with great views off the 23rd floor, and as I said the service was exceptional and prompt. We were offered free internet which was a good bonus, free in room coffee and even though the space was not as big as expected, it was enough for two of us. The location is super convenient, right at the exit of Powell BART station which makes commuting to the airport very easy with big bags. In addition taking the cable car down to the waterfront was also easy, as was getting to Union Square and the major shopping areas. Note: for the price, the bathroom products lacked lustre, but I hardly ever use hotel products so no biggie for me. I would recommend the hotel for buisiness purposes. However, for the same price, I heard other colleagues were staying at much nicer hotels. If I were to go back to SF, would I stay here, probably because of how convenient and good the service was- but there would be temptation to try something new if the price was the same as Parc 55, for instance, Sir Francis Drake Hotel, or Westin St. Francis.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale experience”
Reviews.Author: angela h
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean and friendly hotel. We could hear the cable car bells and see the bay...it was great! They give you ear plugs because the street noise is there, but it's not bad. I highly recommend this hotel in the middle of Union Square in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for First time Visitor to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: chargap
Reviews.Content: It was so easy-took the "BART" from the Airport, got off at Hallidie Plaza on lower level of station at Powell and Market St (Also the Visitor Info. Bureau) take the elevator up or escalator to street level and it is right there-Union Square and Cable car are just around the corner. Rooms were large, great view-join the Wyndham club before hand and your WI-FI is free. Rates were reasonable--it was a great place for our first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay-great location, rooms and staff are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: HarrisBH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights through Priceline. We were upgraded to a corner suite. WOW. Everything about this hotel is great. Would stay here every time. Parking is expensive but BART is close to the hotel and other parking is also close.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel right in the center of everything.”
Reviews.Author: JRZIP
Reviews.Content: Just left this hotel and have nothing but the highest praise for the hotel staff. I was there working on a photo shoot and one of our colleagues became sick. The staff was so gracious and accommodating from the front desk allowing us to buy a half day extension on our check out time to room service putting a rush on all the orders. Housekeeping was also excellent and the hotel even provided a house car at a great rate on our return to the airport. I cannot say enough about this venue and all of the staff and management I met during our stay. Beds were awesome and the water in the shower/bath was really hot. The dinners I had at their restaurant were fabulous although not inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: popey16
Reviews.Content: We booked this as an expensive treat at the end of our trip to the USA but it didn't compare to the so called budget hotels we had stayed in up until this point. Having splashed out for a club room we were told on arrival that the rooms had been overbooked and there wasn't one available. We had to settle for a lower priced room and agree to be moved the next day. We were given a $50 dinner voucher for this inconvenience. The next day we were moved but the club room wasn't that impressive and felt like an extra room tucked out of the way and we had to exchange our keys yet again when ours didn't work for the club lounge. We shared an outer door with the room next door which meant it was noisy when they were leaving an entering. The only thing that redeemed this hassle was the unfailing politeness of the hotel staff. Whilst the views were impressive the club lounge was not that exciting so I wouldn't advise paying extra. The gym was impressive, so this is a great hotel for a workout. The location is good and convenient for most San Francisco attractions. We ate in the restaurant once and found the food good but expensive and chose to eat out on subsequent nights. We also couldn't afford the wifi which we felt overpriced especially after having free wifi everywhere else we had stayed. Overall we felt we had overpaid for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, parking can be difficult sometimes”
Reviews.Author: LTAN72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last week. The hotel is a decent business hotel. Check-in process was quick & we were even able to score a room 2 hours early. The rooms themselves are pretty standard - clean, but nothing exciting. The walls are a bit thin, but that's probably true of most hotels. The real draw is the location- you're right in the heart of Union Square. I guess the only (minor) complaint is the parking at certain times of day. The hotel is on the corner of a fairly busy street, so it wasn't uncommon to find a line of cars trying to valet and, as a result, block the street traffic. Similarly, it made it difficult for cars leaving the hotel to exit the hotel driveway. Still the valet staff worked very hard & as fast as they could. They were always very polite. If you want to be right in the middle of things & don't mind the hustle & bustle, this is a great place to stay. If you want a calmer experience, there are hotels 1-2 blocks away that are still close enough to the action without being too busy.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, Dark and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel as we decided at the last minute to extend our stay for a night. We pricelined the hotel for $100, and I feel that we overpaid for what we got. In direct contrast, we stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco for the previous two nights and what a difference. Let's just say that in shopping terms, the Intercontinental is like Saks Fifth Avenue, and the Parc 55 is like Macy's (the non-designer Alfani and INC floor). It wasn't good. I almost cried when I saw how gross the Parc 55 was in comparison to the Intercontinental. We were given a room on the 8th floor and looked out at the roof of another building. The room was very dark and had a grungy quality. For instance, the light switches were caked in dirt; the door looked yellowed (and had an old-fashioned chain security lock rather than the newer bars); and the blanket on the bed was like a yucky terrycloth towel. The decor made me want to just stay standing; I was afraid to touch anything. The couch in the room and the bed were both very hard and uncomfortable. The linens were not of high quality; the closet door was grungy and outdated. Everything about the room screamed for a makeover. It was not a pleasant place to spend your time. The clientele also left a lot to be desired. I was happy to leave the place behind after a night, and I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Dana B
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel! My first experience at the Parc 55 and I must say it is a wonderful hotel. I unexpectedly had a business trip go over, and overnighted at the Parc 55. It was certainly a great choice! A very posh, upscale hotel - in a great location. The accommodations are quite lovely but the staff are very polished, professional, and exceptional in the customer service arena. Brett at the front desk was awesome (especially after a grueling day). He was friendly, efficient, gave me pointers on the area, the business center, etc etc etc. I did order room service, the food was excellent and Hamilton, my server, was just a delight! Exceptional service!!! Thank you all for making my stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Blondietex
Reviews.Content: Club level with view was most excellent. Close to shops, dining options and mass transit. Chinese dim sum close by is good. Skip the sushi place Han Zen. It was awful. Beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: juljas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in a Club Level room. Worth the extra dollars for the continental breakfast and appetizers alone (nothing amazing, but very nicely done). Try and get a corner room - the extra space is so worth it (we had our daugher on a rollaway), and had more than enough room. Much bigger that the standard club level. Yes, was still noisy, even on floor 27, with sirens, however didn't bother us. We expect noise in a city centre. Concierge not overly helpful - I would have to say that the staff on this desk were the least willing to assist in any hotel across the US that we stayed at (in fact the staff in the club lounge assisted us more than the concierge!). Location was fantastic and very close to Union Square. We had no issues at night with panhandlers. Great hotel, would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get fooled by the lobby”
Reviews.Author: juju-anne
Reviews.Content: Upon stepping into the lobby I thought that the rooms were going to be very nice and modern (as this was what the lobby looked like), but was wrong as soon as I stepped into the room. The room itself had nothing wrong, but was quite outdated. I was also placed in a disability room, so I'm not sure if that had anything to do with the decor, and the bathroom had a shower over bath tub. Again this could be due to the room being accommodating to disabled persons. The thing that bugged me the most was that maids started to clean rooms at around 8:30am- I had to tell them to come back later a few times. I would stay there again as the location was quite good, but I think if you paid a little bit more you could get a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: victorleeSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Convenience, comfort and value, these are the three things guests consider when making a hotel selection. Just back from a week end at the Parc 55 and this hotel has it all. Make it easy on yourself, fly into San Franciso (SFO) and hop on the Bart Train ,fast clean, comfortable and 20 minutes and $8.20 later you get off on the Powell Street station ,right at Parc 55's front door . You're now just about 4 blocks from Union Square . Newly renovated the Parc 55 is beautiful. Why is it priced so affordable ? 1,000 guest rooms and very little meeting space (big design mistake) so it can't be a higher priced convention hotel. It's an airline hotel ,40% of their business is air crews. It's become my new San Francisco hotel and one stay there and it will become yours too. If you're not happy here, you won't be happy anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: Glow_wormnz
Reviews.Content: I admit I was feeling a bit apprehensive as the other hotels we've booked over the internet for San Francisco have been complete dives. My room was really nice and only cost me $NZ150 per night. I enjoyed using the free internet available near reception and in the Business Centre. The location is good; close to the tram and Union Square for great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay but pricey”
Reviews.Author: euexplorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this lovely hotel over thanksgiving. Without even asking for it I was put in this huge room with 2 windows and an incredible view of the bay. Lovely clean comformtable rooms and a great nights sleep. I can't really say if they staff are good because I did not have to go near them at any stage which I think is always an excellent sign. They have express checkout also which meant no queuing when leaving. The location is perfect - just a couple of blocks from Union Square. On the negative side lovely and all as it was it was certainly on the pricey side especially the valet service. It was 48 dollars a night which I think is ridiculous. I was waiting for ages to get the car back after checking out aswell. However if you are not driving and you get a good deal I'd jump at a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: hushieprints
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access to union square and BART. But take note that Tenderloin is also nearby. We read reviews that the neighborhood was quite noisy so we requested for a high floor corner room but our room was not ready upon check in. Reception was helpful and gave us the highest floor available (8th floor i think). We can still hear some noises from the nearby pubs from our room but it was bearable and we had no problem sleeping. Room was pretty big. Hotel also provided Bath and Body Works toiletries. Expensive internet and parking. We also skipped breakfast at the hotel and opt to try the different breakfast joint recommended by Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 20+ Minutes Stuck In The Bathroom (On my birthday!)”
Reviews.Author: georgeb1307
Reviews.Content: My female companion took me here on December 2 after a night out on the town for my birthday. The night was going well--but then somehow I found myself trapped in the bathroom. At first I thought she was playing a prank on me and was holding the door from the opposite end, but it wasn't the case. For some reason the locking mechanism of the door was malfunctioning and the door wouldn't open despite various creative attempts. My female companion eventually called the help desk and they sent someone by the name of Anthony to come assess the situation. He tried opening the door himself but to no avail. He assured me things would be handled and to not worry. The "engineer" or someone or another was called eventually. To make a long story short, the "engineer" got me out by using a jaws of life like contraption to push the door open. To be honest I was frustrated and the experience was kind of a buzz kill that night. That being said, I seriously thought we would get some kind of comp... but no. Needless to say, I'm not sure if I'll ever go back to this hotel establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bimats
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Parc 55. Our first stay was good, but this time it seemed a step above! The lobby really impresses, very modern. The room was clean with a fantastic view of San Francisco! We were on the 28th floor and it was a spectacular sunrise! The service was great, just what we remembered from our first stay. I must admit our second stay was mostly based on price and location (both ideal), but they have locked us in for future stays! Our only complaint was the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is!”
Reviews.Author: gr8eats88
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 will do for me all I needed was a bed and earplugs. Stay here in November during thanksgiving week. I opted to get my own breakfast rather than hotel type. There was a donut shop on the corner of hotel with Bart police cars out in front that never seems to move. Maybe to ward of potential problems that may arise because the area is not too good. Got crackheads,prostitutes,pimps and thiefs walking around like everyday life. My advise is to walk with someone or if you must keep your hands in pocket or purse with thumb on pepper spray nozzle. Not trying to scare anyone just wanted you to get heads up of area.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be better...”
Reviews.Author: ChienYeat
Reviews.Content: Good experience on a whole. Got a warm reception by Brett who was very helpful. Can't say the same for the rest of the front desk crew. I felt like an interruption to their work, especially to the concierge. Encountered 2 different concierge staff and both were very quick to dismiss me. One was reading a newspaper when I approached her! Also, I am astounded by the front desk's lack of knowledge of the hotel's services! I got this staff, Jessie, who told me that the hotel does not have laundry service! What hotel doesn't have laundry service for guest?! I call the valet laundry from my room and got my clothes picked up. Room was impressive, good view of the city. House-keeping is superb. I enjoyed my stay, but the front desk crew is hopeless, except Brett of course. Hope Wyndham will look into training their front desk and concierge crew.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melhoutz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business. It is pricey but everything in SF is. It is close to shopping, restaurants and night life. I got one of the corner rooms which was beautiful and unique. There was plenty of space and the view was great - you could see the lights and the night life. However, when I first got there I saw that they gave you ear plugs and wondered what on earth for. After my first night trying to sleep I could see why. Because the corner room has huge windows on 2 sides the noise level from the street is very loud and goes on all night long. I have a terrible time sleeping anyway and this made it nearly impossible. So I would suggest that if you are a light sleeper that you ask for an interior room instead of a corner one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, magnificent views, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lindagn1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in Union Square, downtown. It's within walking distance to shopping, Chinatown, Union Square Park, etc. As other reviews stated, the parking fee is on the high end at $48/night. The room rate was low so it made up for it. We took advantage of the room upgrade for an additional $12/day and it was so worth it. Amazing views of downtown and the bay. The room had the usual amenities but was lacking a refrigerator. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. The noise wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be; in addition to shampoo and lotion, they provided ear plugs as well, which we didn't use. We were on the 23rd floor and was able to hear people on the street but it didn't keep us from sleeping throughout the night. We didn't take advantage of room service or eat at the restaurant but there's a cafe located next door where you can grab a quick bite to eat for breakfast or lunch. It's always nice to have room service available though. There were a bunch of taxes and fees added on to the final bill, so be aware of that. If you are on a budget, ask before you book so you know how much you'll be spending. The original room rate was $109/night but after all taxes, fees, parking, and $12 upgrade, the room rate was an average of $200/night. Overall, I would visit this hotel again if I wanted to stay in Union Square. The front desk service was great and the hotel lobby was nicely decorated. The bar area was nice with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Fools4Food
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate through Priceline. The hotel is at the edge of a dicey neighborhood. Made a wrong turn last night and had to step over a dozen homeless sleeping in the street. Its also on the edge of a great area with world class shopping. Rooms for a four star are beginning to feel dated. Very expensive internet. Had to call desk to figure out how to watch tv that wasnt pay for view. That option is hidden. Not a service oriented hotel. Had to carry own luggage to room. At 100 US is value. Cant wait until wifi gouging is a thing of the past!

Reviews.Title: “Location but with a price”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is in the heart of Union Square which makes it very convenient. The drawback is how expensive it is to park your car during your stay. So be warned. Otherwise, the room is clean and the bed is comfortable. The bathroom needs a little updating though. I was also expecting Internet access to be free in the room considering how much I paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staf, decent room, be careful picking your room”
Reviews.Author: tubeguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel supposedly went through a remodel. It was neat and clean inside, but there was no sound system which I would have liked and is more common nowadays to plug your ipod into. At least in 4 and 5 star hotels. The staff was wonderful at every turn. I can't think of a single flaw. So why four stars? (I would have really tended towards 3 stars). The street noise. The good news is you are just steps away from the BART and cable car station. The bad news is you are just steps away from the BART and cable car station. There are so many loud drunks on the street and they how...even at midnight. Got I wanted to throttle someone. The location made it a reasonable walk to China Town, North Beach, Union Square, and you could even get to Pier 39 if you are a healthy walker. So I would maybe stay there again. But ask to have my room pointed to an opposite direction. FYI we were in room 2411. Jesus...even up that high it was blaringly loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mela123
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, the staff was very friendly (I was able to check in at 8am), and the room's are wonderful as well. One of the best hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle B
Reviews.Content: Ericka at the front desk is absolutely great. She is extremely customer oriented and was very helpful at working out some issues we had with our reservation from a 3rd party source. This is our favorite hotel in San Francisco. The service and staff are extremely helpful and the location is perfect. The views are stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - close to BART & Cable Car”
Reviews.Author: Rob-the-Traveller
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in San Francisco, as we were only staying for 3 days we wanted somewhere close to a BART station (for getting to/from Airport) and close to Cable Cars. This Hotel is one block from Powell St BART and the Cable Car starts from Powell Street. This hotel looks very impressive from the outside. As soon as we entered the hotel we knew that it would be a good hotel for us. Check in very quick and efficient and we were given a room on the 37th floor looking east. The room was very comfortable with two large beds and a well equiped bathroom. The hotel room was very clean and tidy. We did not eat at the hotel - there are plenty of good value places near by. Overall very impressed with this hotel, the location for us was important when booking. My only complaint is that they charge for internet access, we needed to check in for flight so went to Starbucks who have free wifi for the cost of a coffee! Will definately stay here again next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: highmileclub
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been renovated not so long ago, so they are definitely nice and clean. I booked a smoking room thru booking.com but at my arrival they told me, that they don't have any smoking rooms in the hotel at all. + Central Location + New renovated rooms - No lunch - Only Breakfast and Dinner Room Service

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Hotel, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn K
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the hotel staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on the 26th floor in a 'view' room & it was great.”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarriedTravel
Reviews.Content: A good hotel... seems like it is a big 'conference-style' hotel. It is also where some airline staff stay (we saw them all in the lobby area). Charging for internet at a hotel like this is quite ridiculous - the hotel would be advised to just 'include it' really (in my opinion). Also, the air conditioning unit was noisy. We chose to stay at this hotel because we required 2 nights in a King Size bed as we both had really sore backs. The bed was comfy - a big plus!!! Staying on the 26th floor in a 'view' room was great & had an amazing view across San Francisco. The location of the hotel is also good. Would recommend the hotel. Budget conscious: Have breakfast down the road where there is a cafe (not in the hotel). We ate fresh cooked eggs brekky & coffee for two for $25 including tips. [The hotel charges $26 per person for a cooked brekky.] Please vote if you think this review has helped you! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: bw73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice area; lots of shops and restaurants nearby as well as some sights. The foyer is impressive and the bar looks great. In the morning the area is used for breakfast: this as well as having to pay for wifi are my only complaints: the breakfast I had ordered was of very poor quality (extremely greasy and cold) but great customer recovery as it was taken off my bill. The receptionists, restaurant manager and concierge are extremely friendly, knowledgeable and always happy to help: personal, polite service with a smile. I'd recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: roo15
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times and compared to other business hotels in the area parc 55 is great value for larger rooms with plush duvets and decent bathrooms. The room decor looked a little tired this trip, but quite adequate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, but seriously($50/night parking)”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is in an excellent location, literally across the street from the metro with shopping and dining in any direction. We watched Cirque du Soleil - Totem at AT&T Park and walked back to the hotel which was probably a 15-20 minute walk. We booked online at hotwire and when we checked in I asked for an upgraded room - for $40/night we got a 29th floor city view room with access to the Club Lounge on the 31st floor. Free continental breakfast, drinks, amazing views...worth the extra few bucks a night. So with taxes, internet, parking and the upgrade...what we paid on hotwire was cheaper than the costs we were charged at checkout. Worth it...for sure, but be aware that you pay for parking($48/night) and internet($15/night). All in all, we were very impressed with the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique feel; terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Mannyma
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference over a long weekend. Couldn't have been happier with the proximity to BART, which is right across the street, and the ease of getting to all the other hotels for meetings and the Moscone Convention Center. My husband loved the bar and restaurant. The room was lovely. The service was outstanding. I was about to give it five stars when my husband just came back from the coffee service downstairs where he was charged for a coffee and a croissant. Now really! Parc 55 should be more generous with breakfast and with bottled waters, which are 4.50 in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the middle of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Europe_Maedchen
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a weekend in San Francisco to go shopping. The Parc 55 was the perfect hotel for this, right across from the large Westfield mall and a few minute walk to Union square and a block to the cable cars. The hotel was impressive, very modern and open architecture. I especially liked the room: 1972, a spacious room with a view of the city from 2 sides. The bed was large and comfy and the decor inviting and well thought through. Even the bathroom was spacious and well appointed with Bath and Body amenities. I have stayed at some other high end hotels in San Francisco, but they were much smaller and claustrophobic. We had a great time and were looking forward to relaxing in the room every night. This will be my number one choice in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Fabulous City!”
Reviews.Author: NancyZed
Reviews.Content: We searched numerous properties to get the best hotel to fit our needs. When in a city, we usually like a good downtown location close to transit and great shopping possibilities. We knew we did not want to spend most of our time at fishermanâ€™s wharf. We decided on Union Square or downtown area and this hotel did not disappoint. We took advantage of a great special that allowed us to stay in this fantastic city for five nights. It also gave us a high floor room as we both love nothing more than a gorgeous cityscape. The first thing either of do when we enter the room is; walk over to the window and whip open the window coverings and admire the cityâ€™s offerings of architecture. LOCATION: we were so happy with the location. There was a Walgreens around the corner on Powell where we could buy our water and breakfast protein shakes. The hotel was within a few blocks or less of Union Square, the cable car turnaround on Powell, the trolley on Market, the main tourist branch office and BART. There were many restaurants including a Japanese, Indian, Italian and a great Dim Sum restaurant all outside the back entrance to the hotel. In fact we ended up eating at the Dim Sum restaurant many times when we wanted a quick lunch or dinner it was nice and had many dumpling choices and also offered a full Chinese menu as well as the Dim Sum. It was just under $50 (+tip) for a cab from SFO. You could easily walk to Union Square, ChinaTown, Financial Dist & Nob Hill from this location (careful: Nob Hill is an uphill walk). We did walk to FW and North Beach as well but our legs hurt. It was just the right number of blocks away from The Tenderloin where we felt the Hilton was just close enough that we would have felt unsafe at night if we stayed there. It was just one street too far over. We looked at staying at The Fairmont and the Intercontinental as they are such beautiful poperties but that uphill walk everytime we went back at the end of the day when you are so tired, would have been painful. You would have to take a cab home at night if you were staying there. STAFF: The front desk staff was nice, professional and helpful - everything they should be. Mavis at the front desk was extra special. The concierge was not helpful and didnâ€™t even try to help answer my questions. I was not impressed by him he had a bad attitude. Thanks to Trip Advisor I had most of my required info so I wasnâ€™t relying on him anyway. If the mgmt wants to read this and rectify the problem with that dept. this took place at 11:30 on Thurs Oct 27. He wouldnâ€™t give me his name. There were always many bellmen and door staff to help with parking, packages, bags and calling taxis. The valet parking was expensive at $50 which is in keeping with the rest of the city. We did have a car on our last night and they did a great job. The housekeeping staff was extra special. We requested some special pillows and a gentleman came to our room as we were getting settled and he brought us pillows, more coat hangers and friendly service. We asked for extra towels and everyday it was like towels were breeding in our bathroom. ROOM: The room was nicely decorated, comfortable and functional. It was very clean and well kept. Bed was nice & comfortable which is necessary after long days. The TV was nice HD good picture and good selection of channels. Excellent bathroom, good setup, makeup mirror, nice bath products. The soap was really cute it had bumps on it like a massage bar which was so nice to massage your feet with after a long day tackling the SF hills. The shower and toilet water pressure was nice and strong. I would have to look for a complaint about the room, we were very satisfied. The view in our room on the 24th floor given to us by Mavis made us very happy. Iâ€™ll attach some pictures of the great view. There were numerous elevators and you never had to wait long. The lobby and elevator area had a great setup in regards to entrance/exits. This Wyndam hotel will absolutely see us again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Incredible Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SJM1110
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is my favorite hotel in San Francisco. The location couldn't be better and the facilities are outstanding. This hotel at 5th and Market is in the center of everything - convenient to cable cars, BART, and Muni. Rooms are bright and much more spacious than others in similar price ranges. But the best feature of all is the personal attention and hospitality - amazing for a hotel this size. Brett Leonard, the Front Desk Manager ensures the welcoming staff pay attention to individual needs and help you feel "at home". He is an outstanding asset to the hotel and knows how to give this very large hotel a small hotel feel when it comes to personal detail for his guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Review71
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and staff were very helpful. Had dinner in the restaurant and this was fantastic. Personally I love the location although some may find it a little busy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gravesend_foodie
Reviews.Content: Westayed here for 3 nights in November and would highly recommend this hotel! Our room was clean and modern with a comfortable bed and proper pillows (very rare in the US). The real winner though with this hotel is the fantastic location, its right by Union Square and the Bart (rail from teh airport), its also right by the Trams, so we NEVER had to use a taxi the whole time we were there!!!!!We ate in the bar one night and the food was lovely, and we're fussy. I'd definatly stay here again in San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: Indytravelinggrl
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was decent. It didn't exceed my expectations but it didn't disappoint either. We booked this during a very busy weekend in San Fran and paid more than it was worth (in my opinion). Reading other reviews on here, I realize we paid substantially more than some others. This clouds my view as I'm comparing it to other almost $300 per night hotels I've stayed in. But, we wanted to go during this weekend and were willing to pay the higher hotel rates. My husband and I decided to stay here because of the location. However, when we go back, we will pick another location. This is in the heart of the touristy areas and very close to shopping (Forever 21, Nike town, etc.) but mostly stores that are all over the US. It is true that it does get loud due to the location - you hear sirens, etc. throughout the night. We knew this going in and therefore weren't disturbed. The hotel does provide ear plugs which is a nice touch. The room was small, but sufficient for both of us. We stayed on the 10th floor and looked out onto a pretty ugly view, but our sliding doors opened and we had a tiny balcony which was nice. The bathroom was nice and the bed was so-so.
