The front desk staff were courteous but we didn't find the concierge to be helpful (or particularly friendly) at all. Overall, the hotel was ok and didn't add anything to our trip in San Fran. I think there are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: wrzbm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, near shopping and restaurants, and the BART station. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. There were a couple minor annoyances though.The biggest was the street noise. I stayed on 9th floor, and was amazed at how much street noise I heard. Since the area is busy, you would hear people on the street talking or yelling until early morning. And you hear things like dump trucks and ambulances very clearly all night and early morning. So if street noise bothers you while you're trying to sleep, you should consider getting some ear plugs. The second annoyance was the absence of the a coffee maker in the room. I can't remember the last place I stayed that didn't provide coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kellythirteen
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding the hotel but once we did, the parking valets and hotel personnel were very helpful. Check-in was quick and easy; we requested a corner room but none were available for that night. The room we did get was on the twentieth floor and was very nice with a great view of the city skyline. The only drawback was the connecting door to the next room. We could hear way too much of what was going on in the next room. I would definitely request a room without a connecting door when staying here. We liked both the bar and restaurant in the hotel; the bar was a hip, fun spot with plenty of people and lots of seating options - bar, lounge, couches, etc. The restaurant was next door to the bar but with a quieter feel to it. Service at both was great and the food was good. The hotel is in a great location near Union Square and we were able to walk to the cable car line or take a cab to wherever we needed to go. The parking fee is high - $50 per day - but parking is an issue in San Francisco. We parked the car and didn't use it at all. I would stay here again; the views are wonderful and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Chic with great service in the middle of all the Union square shopping.”
Reviews.Author: inthelooper
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this hotel is pricey but since I bid for my room, which ended up having a fab view from the 20th floor, I was overally impressed. Very large and modern. Quick walk to shops and good dining. Also, there is a car rental place as well as a "Go Car" (these lil yellow death traps are a memorable way to see the city).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty positive and negative things”
Reviews.Author: mammak61
Reviews.Content: Positives about Parc 55: You are very conveniently located in Union square, clean, comfortable rooms, fairly elegant. When the people across the hall caused a ruckus, security was on it quickly! Free access to computers/printer. Can also walk to chinatown easily and the view of the city was pretty neat. Negatives: Noisy, cost of internet in room was around $15 per day, cost of parking was over $40 per day.

Reviews.Title: “They give you earplugs - nuff said! Don't go here if you want quiet”
Reviews.Author: slambiase
Reviews.Content: the windows are very thin and it sounds like everything going on outside is actually in your room. I checked a couple of times to make sure the windows were closed! Overall, it is a nice hotel in a good location in downtown San Francisco. Easy walking distance to Union square and Moscone center. Clean room and common areas. Nice bar and front desk. Cool plug in center for your iphone, computer and other electronics

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with no amenities”
Reviews.Author: nlgladstone
Reviews.Content: Good: big rooms, great views, very clean. Hotel is one block from BART and Market Streetcar lines. Union Square is not the most fun area, but you can leave really easily. The staff was very pleasant and professional and you never had to wait in line for the bell hop, concierge, etc. Not So Good: wifi is not included, which I always find ridiculous. In this case, it was also per device, so if you have an iPad and a laptop, you can only connect one of them for the wifi rate. No fridge/mini bar in the room (which given the size, is surprising) and the coffee maker didn't have a place to be plugged in. I had a conference rate, which was quite reasonable and I think I got what I paid for. If I had been paying full cost, I would have felt like I got poor value.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience to a great anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: Youngkeems
Reviews.Content: Where do i begin, from the moment i arrived at Parc 55, the staff was unbelievably helpful, professional & friendly. From front desk to housekeeping to maintenance crew, when i tell you they go above and beyond, they really do (and i am a big stickler when it comes to service) and with a smile! I like extra towels for the bathroom and it so happened housekeeping was next door and i asked her if i can have extra and she gave me more than enough. My bedroom was fairly warm for my liking and immediately called maintenance to look at AC and adjust temperature. Not only did they fix it, they provided me with a small fan just in case it still wasn't cold enough for me (well more for my bf - he likes it tundra cold!) I believe maintenance guy's name was John. Beds are super comfy, lots of pillows which i love! Bathroom very clean and great water pressure with bath and body works products. Noise level is pretty loud unfortunately b/c you are right in the middle of union square so theres lots of going ons but i personally dont mind it b/c i live in NYC and need the 'white noise', but i would ask for a higher floor if you want less noise. The City House restaurant in hotel is good if you don't feel like exploring city and just want to stay in hotel. Location couldn't have been more perfect, the POWELL Bart Station (you can take the BART from SFO Airport to this stop - 30-40 min ride for $8.00! Beats $40 cab ride any day and its faster) is literally across the street by Forever 21 and the Powell cable street car where it starts/finishes, guys literally have to turn cable car around to start up line again. There is a fairly long line b/c its the HUB so buy your tickets ahead of time (located 20 ft from cable car, across from Bank of America). I also want to thank the hotel (i can't remember her name off hand) for sending two chocolate roses to my room, while the bf & i we were out and about with out tours. I made them aware that it was my anniversary weekend and again went above and beyond their call of duty. We will make this a yearly trip and this will be my SF based hotel moving forward!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: S R
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times now. The Front Desk Manager, Brett, is great. Truly went out of his way to provide me an excellent experience. I travel to SF quite often on business, and vary my hotel stays. I am now a fan of Parc 55 and will be booking there moving forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Location and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Christy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property recently on business. The location, close to Union Square is ideal for business and leisure stays. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly, knowledgeable and very customer service oriented. I only had breakfast at the in-house restaurant, but it was quite good and reasonably priced for San Francisco. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but average standard”
Reviews.Author: Mascha
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 its perfectly located for exploring San Francisco. Public transportation nearby, as well as a plenty of places to shop. The staff is very friendly but the standard of the rooms is not what I expected. We stayed in a view room, with view to a backstreet and the gym! Not spectacular at all. There's no free Wifi in the hotel (we stayed in 8 different Hotels on our trip, everywhere else they provided free Wifi). The room service nocks on the door before 8 am, if you put the "do not disturb" sign, they vacuum in front of your door to wake you up. We missed a Minibar or at least a fridge. Next time I would not stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Wyndham San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SaraMarieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The location is great with so much shopping right out the front door. The hotel is very modern, clean and safe. I stay here whenever I can get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! Brett-manager”
Reviews.Author: Asteves1
Reviews.Content: Brett was a great manager and was very accomodating. The room was ideal, and our stay was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honest153
Reviews.Content: Satay away from this hotel (Parc 55, SF). They don't honor the specials they have on their own web site, One good example : "Wyndham Weekendar - Second night 50%" . It's B.S., I tried to book it this way and comes up full proce. I even spoke to the Reservations Hotline and I was told even they are having problems with this Hotel since it became Wyndham. Further, last here at about this same time, I tried to book a room there and I had a similar problem, to the extend that I even called the Hotel and had an ughly argument with them ---- I even had to insult them with 4 letter words to get my point across ------ they did the same and I doubled my 4 letter words to 8! Long story ..... In short, STAY AWAY !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and you'll have a better and enjoyable stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: fybr01
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham for a 5 day vacay in SF. The location could not have been better!! Surrounded by shops and sights, it was convenient to everything. The hotel was clean and classy. The amenities were very nice as well. I didn't use the gym but my friend did and thought it served its purpose. The rooms are spacious and tidy. My friend did wish there was better natural lighting in the room. Also it would have been nice if there was a minifridge. All in all, it was such a great stay and would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler1727
Reviews.Content: This is a corporate hotel with conferences and meetings, but it's perfectly located in downtown SF. We've stayed here twice, and probably will come back again. We walked to several museums, it's right next to the cable car line, and surrounded by shopping malls and dozens of restaurants. Prices are reasonable for the area and there are often special rates online. Upper floors have spectacular views of the city or the bay, if you get lucky and snag a good view room. Rooms are clean and updated, the beds are fine, and the bathrooms are small but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Trish W
Reviews.Content: I was able to book the Parc 55 Wyndham on last minute travel . com for a really reasonable rate. They let us check in early which was nice! The rooms, while nothing special, are roomy and clean. The location is very convienent to many things. It is right next to the BART station. Very close and easily walkable to Union Station. It is a fairly noisy area with many type city noises, but we were able to sleep ok. overall a great hotel for the money

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Another typical stay here. Better then my last trip in August however. Room was clean, I had a balcony too which was a pleasant surprise even if it was about 2sq ft! I found every staff member to be pleasant and helpful. I asked for one of those Macy's Discount cards for foreign visitors and next thing I know the receptionist was getting all excited and letting me know about various sales that were on, I was DELIGHTED with her to offs cos I ended up getting half my Xmas shopping done! However I am still very concerned about the security access to this hotel! The ground floor has no staf so access to the lifts are open to anyone. There are a HUGE number of homeless people outside the hotel and they can easily gain access to the hotel and bedroom floors as the lifts do not require key access! I really wish they would address this! Otherwise it was fine!

Reviews.Title: “While in San Francisco,you have to try Parc 55...”
Reviews.Author: mirianmayumi
Reviews.Content: While in San Francisco,you have to try Hotel Parc 55... The impeccable service and cleansiness of The Parc 55 only leaves you to desire more. Great thank you to Riecky for the best treatment ever. She definitely made our stay a very special and memorable one. Parc 55 is amazing. From the minute we arrived for our 08 night stay the staff in front desk(Sarah,Mavis and Christina) were pleasant and helpful..The hotel is perfectly located close toUnion Square and the shopping area. The room is clean, comfortable and spacious. And the beds and bedding are to die for.. The bathroom is huge with gorgeous fluffy towels. Don't look anywhere else!! Thank you for all Warm Regards Mirian Shida

Reviews.Title: “Location says it all!”
Reviews.Author: lawfamily
Reviews.Content: Super renovations, very hip, cool and fresh. Fast and easy check in, our room was nice and spacious, with a great tub and shower!!! We paid a little extra for the "club room" and privileges, which was so worth it. Great view, nice choice for breakfast and the nibbles in the early evening were handy and good. My new hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: LJ7777
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! The BART Powell station is right next to the hotel, so if you are coming from SFO it is VERY convenient. Watch out for the BART impersonators; those who are willing to give you maps, ones that you can get from the visitors center yourself for free, along with advice, for a cash handout! With the expense of food in the area, I would highly suggest purchasing the hotel club option. The hours de vours in the club are excellent, along with the "continental" breakfast, which is much more than run-of-the-mill, featuring bagels, cereals, meat, cheese, and homegrown granola, which is awesome on yogurt! Johnny Foley's is very good, a quaint Irish pub, in my opinion priced just right. Earlier today Johnny Depp and entourage were at the pub, and Johnny was chowing down on the bangers and mash! Unfortunately, I find the hotel itself as an oasis in a city of present turmoil, where there are beggars on every corner asking for money. Very sad, as it deepens my present regret of visiting such a fine city compared to so many years ago. Sirens, sirens, sirens! So many sirens. What are they for? I am not exactly sure, but the concierge suggested it has something to do with the Tenderloin district and the re-development that is on-going there, removing the homeless to other venues. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, but I would think twice about visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SandVBFan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Parc 55. The rooms were renovated somewhat recently, and were clean and comfortable. Our room was spacious and quiet, as we were on the 24th floor. Considering it was the Nike Women's Marathon weekend, and many guests were a part of this amazing event, we were happy to find the room so quiet! The location can't be beat for its location in Union Square, and easy access to the F tram to go to the Embarcadero or the Wharf. We didn't keep our car based on the price of parking, and public transportation was very easy to get around other areas of town. The lounge was busy every night, and enjoyed drinks only once. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 in the Middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: RadioLady2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in my dream area of San Francisco, one block from Nordstrom and other shops and restaurants. The hotel is lovely, well appointed and the service was OK. Had a few problems with the front desk, but they were later resolved. I was on 24th Floor where it was quiet. Some people on lower floors complained of street noise. The hotel is spotless and the brunch buffet is fantastic. The mattress was not totally comfortable...too hard. We walked to our event at the Moscone Center West and ate at Le Central and had great food in China Town! Beware: The doorman/taxi caller put me in a town car instead of a taxi and told me it "costs" the same. It didn't. It was 60.00 with a tip to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting - in a good way”
Reviews.Author: anneastascia
Reviews.Content: To be honest we booked this hotel on hotels.com.au for a very cheap rate compared to all the other hotels in the area so we were not expecting alot. We figured we were only staying 2 nights so we could just deal with however bad it was... After surviving an earthquake in san diego, a delayed flight, a terribly turbulant flight and then raining and cold trip to the hotel we were dropped at the lobby and before we could tell the driver we were at the wrong hotel he had driven off leaving us there stranded! However it was the right hotel afterall - just so much more than we were expecting! This hotel is quite impressive - expansive open lobby area, bell boys at your beck and call it was something right out of a 5 star hotel. We were ushered to the second floor to check in where the desk clerk was fully up to speed on both of our names and thanked us immediately for chosing to spend our honeymoon with them before upgrading us to a corner suite of the 22nd floor which had amazing 180 degree views of the whole of SF! We were so impressed. The room was quite spacious - with everything your would expect - very clean and comfy bed for a good nights sleep. Hotel is central to everything we wanted to do and central for public transport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay again and again and again! The only thing I would agree with was the street noise was pretty clear from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Leeds31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 4 nights in September. Its the second time we've stayed here. It is very convenient to be able to get here on the BART from the airport - only 50 yards from the nearest BART stop. Its only 50 yards from the cable car terminal - a 20 minute ride to Fisherman's Wharf. Central location for good shopping and restaurants. Staff in the hotel were helpful and friendly. We had booked a view room - really pleased, fabulous views with windows on 2 walls. The hotel is in a fairly busy spot - but room was very quiet. Would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ozlover1023
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Wyndham for 2 nights. It is a very big place in the heart of the city. The atmosphere is very impersonal - so is the staff. The room was a little outdated but clean and quite nice. As business hotel it is ok but nothing more. It would have been ok if the not existing customer service would not have ruined the stay completely. We stored our luggage for our last hours in SF before we had to return to Europe. When we picked it up it was kind of a little chaotic - bags here, staff there. In this muddle we carelessly left our camera with all the holiday photos on it behind. We realised this on the plane and this was too late. We called the hotel right after landing but no one knew anything. We wrote three emails desperately trying to get the photos back - not even the camera and added a reward. They did not even bother to answer one of the emails. This was so disappointing - although it was our mistake of course - that we will certainly never come back or recommend this place. We would not dare to put the blame on someone but when we picked up the luggage there was only staff around ...

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is one on the best hotel values in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: BBillingsley
Reviews.Content: After staying in the W for days , we thought the Parc 55 would be a downgrade - however we were pleasantly surprised. Great location , staff went over-and -above, and the rooms were spacious and clean. The only knock on the hotel is that the walls seem thin and your hear a lot of outside noise. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: jjones4180
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying here and it is right across from the Powell St. BART (train to SFO and Oakland airports) as well as MUNI (local train, bus and Powell St. cable car). Also easy access to the F line trolley car that runs from Fisherman Wharf to teh Castro. My room was on the 6th floor and would recommend if you are bothered by street noise, ask for a room on a higher floor. The last time I stayed here I was on the 13th floor (yes the hotel has a 13th floor) and did not experience any street noise. The rooms are a good size. If it is a sunny nice day you will want to keep the blinds closed while you are out as the rooms tend to heat up rather quickly during the day. The club lounge staff on the 31st floor were very friendly and a great view from the lounge. Overall, all of the staff were pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Right where the action is happening!”
Reviews.Author: Adriana027
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a prime area close to public transportation and shopping centers. The hotel staff are very friendly and accomodating and the rooms are very well kept. I also enjoyed the hotel's Club Lounge which was sooo tasty for breakfast and for appetizers in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed many stays at this good hotel. The location is great, the rooms are spacious, up to date and very clean. The bathrooms are well equipped. The views are lovely and the beds very comfortable. Reception staff efficient and friendly. My only negative comments would be that there is not a mini bar in the room and the wifi is expensive at Â£14.95 + tax for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing spectacular in the rooms, and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: jacobsjs
Reviews.Content: Room is good, very large with a huge bathroom. Location is close to the convention center and easy access to mass transit. My only real complaints are the noisy streets below and the lack of a coffee maker in the room. I understand I'm in the city by my corner room is really loud, I can hear everything happening on the street 16 floors down. I also find it strange I don't have a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: MAWilbur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in central location but it verges on the "Tenderlion" district which is where you DO NOT want to go - dangerous! - it was noisey with the sounds of police and fire but they give you ear plugs in your room. The staff is very freindly, the service great, the Cityhouse restaurant had great food. Parking is approx $50 a night. Can walk to lots of places as long as you go out the front door and up and away - if I were to stay with just females think I would go to the Westin or Sir Francis Drake - safer and up a block.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomadations”
Reviews.Author: MassSmiley09
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, convenient located to cable car. A lovely upscale hotel that makes your trip to San Francisco all that more enjoyable. Stayed on the 26th floor and had a fantastic view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say remodel?”
Reviews.Author: TonyPSP
Reviews.Content: This place is tired...the rooms were not clean, dated, and in need of a total remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay rooms, expensive and awkward internet”
Reviews.Author: JohnNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights recently. Location just off Market St by Powell Station couldn't be better if you are into the city scene, shopping, etc. Just steps to the MUNI/BART so access to and from the airport is quick and easy. The hotel is quite modern and the rooms are nicely fitted (great 40" widescreen TV with good connections for computer). Bathroom was large and spotlessly clean. But what really let the hotel down for me is their internet policy. $15 a day is out of step with the market. And then their wi-fi system is awkward in that you can't use it for multiple devices - even one at a time. I have a PC that I use for work stuff and then an iPad i like to surf the net with, run my apps etc and that's not unusual these days. Foo - well I don't eat in hotel restaurants so cannot comment about the food. Why eat in when there are so many great restaurants just waiting to be explored!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find, spectacular view, noisy hood”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRogers46
Reviews.Content: Got lucky and found a room here after a convention had emptied out. Front desk staff was charming and helpful, bumped us up to the 24th floor. I'm not often impressed by views, but this was STUNNING! Room was nice, bed great, but I'll remember that view of the city forever. Only negative -- the hotel is on the border of a busy area home to some sketchy types. Lots of winos during the day, sirens and trucks at night.

Reviews.Title: “"The Good, The Bad and the Ugly" 4 Star Maybe but 4 Star Pricing”
Reviews.Author: Bleuemoon2
Reviews.Content: The Good 1 Great Location 2 Clean and Modern 3 4 Star quality (kind of) The Bad 1 Asked in our Reservation in advance for a king bed, which was never forethcoming 2 Very busy front desk not very responsive to requests 3 Never felt we got what we paid for The Ugly 1 Leaving the hotel with a taste that you got hit for a big bill and didn't get quite what you paid for 2 Being treated like you were just another of oh so many customers, no one tried to make our stay memorable, other than the fact I remember I paid a lot and never got what I had asked for at the time of our reservation (a king bed) 3 Served in a snobbish and cavalier attitude by a front desk that was obviously over worked Ok so I have cut this hotel up quite a bit. It is very clean, and has modern 4 star quality which we enjoyed, but the downside to that was the way we were treated, or should I say the way in which we were not treated as someone special, or as a valued customer. I am in the service industry and every customer should be treated with some degree of civility, and appreciation of their business and made to feel somewhat special, if only a kind smile or a thank you. The pluses are the location, downtown, and right next to the cable car and BART. The actual quality of the hotel, the cleanliness and the room amenities, which included very comfortable beds and linens etc. is definitely 4 star. This really is a 4 Star hotel, but they need to improve their "Service" quality if they are in the "Service" industry, either that or charge less money. I'm sorry I guess their attention to detail and customer satisfaction lacked, maybe because we arrived on a Friday night and they were busy is an excuse, but why should we look to give an excuse for a 4 star hotel in terms of customer service and satisfaction regardless if they are busy or not, it's an attitude, and it is a taste left in your mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nickodeemus
Reviews.Content: Took the park and stay package which removed the car parking niggle. Used the club level. All good. Nice and central on market - lottsa bums, but that is market...

Reviews.Title: “Served the Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicole H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and it was comfortable. The only reason I wouldnt stay again is that there was no free WIFI and also the restaurant was quite over priced and really not that nice. But the service was good, the bed comftable and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Jillacious
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect location if you are into shopping and going to the famous places in San Francisco! The staff are friendly and very helpful if you need something from your room. Clean room, bathroom, great view also from our room when we stayed there! I'd definitely stay in the hotel again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, but rather noisy!”
Reviews.Author: curlywurly68
Reviews.Content: I found the Parc 55 just a little too noisy. You can hear everything that is going on outside-and we were on the 18th floor! I suppose that is the downside of staying in a downtown location. Another negative point is the surcharge for accessing the internet, though across the road in the Westfield centre you can get free wifi. The staff are friendly and the reception/concierge will endevour to answer all your questions. The rooms are clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler187
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time in Parc 55. The location is excellent, just 2 blocks from Union Square, BART station is right in front of the hotel just like the cable car station. We had very warm greeting from the check-in lady, we were upgraded right upon arrival, everything was smooth, rooms are very clean and spacious, the property went through renovation recently so the rooms are really nice, I can just recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mamagoogoo
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Got a great deal of 30% off 5 nights, in the tower room, with free breakfasts, cocktail hour and desserts in the Club room. Sooooo worth it. The service was wonderful, housekeeping, hospitality....the only problem was noise at night. You are in the city and hear sirens, emergency and police warnings. They supply ear plugs, use them and I recommend them for light sleepers (like myself), my husband didn't hear a thing, but he would sleep through a riot!! Loved the location,close to BART, trolley cars, walking tor restaurants...What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good service, some amenities not impressive”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_in_DC
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, if you're planning to do a lot of public transport or walking. The service was great throughout the stay. I was disappointed with the quality, size, and ventilation in the gym. And I was bummed at the limited/expensive Internet options (no free wifi in the lobby, $15 fee for in-room Internet PER DEVICE).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, great service!”
Reviews.Author: JustinFree08
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a family vacation. The hotel location is fantastic, it's within close walking distant to Union Square, Market Street and one block where you can get on the trolly car to go down to fishermans warf. Parked our car here it's $40 a day which is not bad for San Fran and once again the location. You can park your car and not have to worry about driving because of the location enjoy joy a little bit of walking and the trolly cars!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lemondrop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Got a corner room on 19th floor. Circular outside wall that was all windows. Wonderful views. Saw fireworks that seemed to be over ATT Park. Friendly staff, good restaurant and we had the continental breakfast that was plenty for us before we left for Napa. Drawbacks - very slow elevators altho there were plenty and pricey wifi. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nicky R
Reviews.Content: First of, don't write this off as a business hotel. We stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. The room was a great size on the 29th floor. We were facing the city and was amazed at the view every morning. We had a 40inch HD TV which was very welcome and the bed was very comfortable. It has one of the best locations of any hotels I have stayed at. One the same line as the airport and 5 minutes from the nearest MUNI station.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Good Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: katherineiris
Reviews.Content: This is a old hotel that had some upgrades to be modern. I stayed one night to visit up to tour Golden Gate and up to Napa. This hotel strikes me as very Business and uptight. I did find the staff helpful and I loved the lounge/restaurantas I stopped for breakfast. The parking is very high so maybe consider an alternative. For a good deal on orbitz or expedia it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: aprilnightrain
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 nights here but fled after the first. Arrived to snarky reservations clerk informing us that we could not have the rate we had booked, and b/t/w there was one night missing from our reservation and they were full for that night. No reason, no apology. Decor in the lobby tired and in need of an upgrade. Room was miniscule, had a dirty feeling and the towels were USED! Someone who had obviously wiped their hands and nose on the handtowel. Eewwww. No apology, they just sent up more towels without taking back the dirty ones. Beds were terrible - lumpy, smelly and really old. Everything just felt kind of scummy. Having travelled all day, we were tired so headed for the hotel restaurant - *not* a good idea. This cheaper version of Outback Steakhouse likely last had a menu update around 1974. For almost $300/night, there has to be a better deal in this town! At least they only charged for one night. We left and luckily found what turned out to be one of the most pleasant hotel experiences I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to smooth thai a must!”
Reviews.Author: HCT120
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over the Labor Day weekend. I had booked 2 king bed rooms through hotels.com and was told on arrival that there were no rooms available. After kicking up a fuss and asking for a discount on each room the receptionist was suddenly able to magic 2 rooms with king beds out of nowhere. When I arrived in the room I was impressed. Very comfortable bed, decent bathroom and flat screen tv, and a pretty good view. The hotel is close to Union Square and the start of the Trolley route although if you are going to use the trolley, would recommend that you walk up to the next stop on the Trolley route and get on there rather than queueing for half an hour at the start! My only criticism is that the room had a connecting door to the next room, and therefore there was quite a bit of noise which I could have done without. I ate in the Smooth Thai restaurant twice during my stay. Very good service, value for money and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient area”
Reviews.Author: redsamp11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference and was not disappointed. Hotel was well kept and rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Hotel was in great location.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of service”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: These people go 360 degrees out of their way to provide you with anything you want or need. Jennifer in the lounge is the most astute hostess I've ever seen. The concierge does not even know the word no.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: carogza
Reviews.Content: My husband and me stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We booked it through their own web page and we got a pretty good deal (compared with the rates they have in the lobby) and we got (without asking) a big suite (1608 if I remember well). The decoration is amazing, very modern, they have the barcelona chairs all over the reception (iÂ´m in love with that chair!) very nice pictures, the bedroom was very clean and with a modern decoration, everything was perfect. The location is great also! just a few meters away from the cable car station, a ticket station, the BART and subway station, and thereÂ´s a Walgreens pharmacy, starbucks and many places to eat really really near (walking). The only "bad" thing is the internet, pretty expensive!! I wonder why the cheapest hotels give you online access for free while the expensive ones charge you for it, I wish it was for free. But anyways, there was a starbucks nearby and a sephora store which had complimentary internet access. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Just check the rates online!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with upscale ambience”
Reviews.Author: TA_Parag
Reviews.Content: I typically care about two things - location and the quality of rooms. Location wise, you can't beat this. It's a 2 minute walk from Union Sq and right by Market St as well as the Bart and the Trolley. It's always a toss up between the Marina versus Union Sq, and as a very frequent traveller, I think Union Sq is far more convenient. The rooms seem to have been recently renovated. There is a fresh look about the decor and the finishes. The size of the rooms is VERY substantial by typical San Francisco standards. Also, request a high floor because the views are fantastic. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for great value to the upscale customer.

Reviews.Title: “Actually 3 blocks from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelman
Reviews.Content: This isnâ€™t a bad hotel, but there were several things I found annoying. First, this hotel says itâ€™s â€œjust a block from Union Squareâ€�. Huh? Check any map. Itâ€™s easily 3 blocks and several turns to Union Square. Mind you itâ€™s not terribly far, but this is just false advertising, plain and simple. On my stay I paid big bucks for a Club Level room. The room was decent, but the Club (3 floors up) was disappointing; primarily the food. The evening fare was sparse: a cheese assortment, a lettuce only salad, and meatballs. Later in the evening they offered just two desert items that were virtually identical. Compared to other hotel club offerings, the food variety here was mediocre at best. But the real outrage was the fire alarm testing that occurred on several floors â€“ obviously mine. Upon checking in this was NOT mentioned. When I got to the room there was a written notice, but it implied that sometime between 11am and 3pm, someone would need to access the room and check out the alarm siren. In reality, the alarm siren IN MY ROOM (incredibly loud even with ear plugs) went on and off for 4 hours. Work or rest was impossible. When I finally couldnâ€™t take it any longer, they did offer to move me to a regular room on the 5th floor. The hassle of packing and unpacking wasnâ€™t worth it for 45 more minutes of agony and the downgrade to a regular room. As for me, I wonâ€™t be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Definite must stay in the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Tito G
Reviews.Content: I started staying at the Parc55 in June and havent looked back...On paper its a 4 star hotel but its really a 5...i cant believe they are rated the 45th best hotel in San Fran on here...Thats absolutely preposturous. They are easily, EASILY #1...im a very frequent traveler to San Fran and ive stayed everywhere...ever since the Parc, i havent looked back. Ive stayed there 17 times this Summer...the rooms are huge, and if you get a small room, its not "small" at all. its normal size...excellent rates, with wiggle room sometimes. You just have to ask at a hotel for a discount...there is a fine line between the hotel staff/front desk being overly nice (and seemingly fake, i hate that) and hotel staff being not nice. This staff from top to bottom seems very attentive,which i attribute to the managers because all shifts are cool.They wanna know how you're doing, is everything ok, etc...but they do it without bothering the [---] out of you and being phony and overly nice (which happens alot in the hospitality industry..again, i hate when people are phony) So yeah...the Hotel is great top to bottom with all the Bells and Whistles....cant find a better location, its in the heart of downtown San Fran...Theres a super Posh shopping district on the East side and a super seedy neighborhood called "The Tenderloin" on the West side if you are into that kind of stuff. No worries about safety here, big burly security guards everywhere with the suits and earpieces (which is a bit much for me, but im sure the Simpleton traveler will feel secure)....the price of the hotel may seem a bit high,but compared to other hotels, especially the lower starred ones, its a great bargain....The drawbacks of the hotel is parking is expensive, but unlike other hotels and garages, you get to go in and out, so its not bad. The hotel store is a bit small (and they are aggressive trying to unload their goods...just say "hey man, i want a pack of smokes and THATS IT" to offset this)...stay here for sure, if you dont you are blowing it..... i might look like a plant or a mark with this rainbows and waterfalls review, im not. I just stay there quite frequently and i always tell a manager how happy i am with the joint and the manager said "cool, you should write a review"...so i did.....anyways great hotel and staff. respect all around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, helpful, good value compared to others in the area.”
Reviews.Author: alison303
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel through Priceline and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The front desk was efficient and helpful. We didn't use any of the amenities so I can't rate those but the room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. The street noise didn't bother us, we could barely hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: veebeeque
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very nice. The front desk staff was extremely friendly, the rooms were very spacious, it was quiet. Very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Union Square, fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Cathy090911
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online the night before I arrived and requested early check in (flew in 9am) and high floor. On arrival was fortunate to check in immediately into a corner room on 23rd floor. View from room was stunning from two large windows. Great desk to work from looking out of one of the windows, great large screen TV, good bathroom and really comfortable king sized bed with 7 pillows. Couldn't fault the room. Whilst the hotel is unassuming from the outside with a somewhat bland reception area, the staff were great, printing out the BART timetable for me when I asked if they knew how often the trains ran the next night when I was leaving. Very convienent Union Square location across the road from the BART station (ideal if travelling light from the airport and costs only $8.10 each way) and accross the road from the SF visitor centre and perfect location if you like shopping as all the major shopping is located in Union Square. Will stay there again on my next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good conference facilities, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JB24SD
Reviews.Content: convenient via BART train from the airport, and in interesting walking distance from Chinatown, piers and ferries, shopping if you like that sort of thing, financial district. close to cable cars for fun, and restaurants nearby are varied from fast food to elegant. Expensive but worth it. this is not a same-as-every-city hotel. wish they had a pool but San Francisco offers great walks for business-trip workouts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: cemckeon
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that is centrally located in downtown San Fran. I stayed here while attending an event at the Hilton across the street. It was easy to get to the Hilton from Parc 55, and Parc 55 is centrally located for San Fran tourist activities. Hotel room was nice with spacious bathroom, great water pressure, and HDTV. Tub was slow to drain, and the carpets throughout the hotel did not seemed to be vacuumed regularly. I was on the 5th floor so street noise was an issue. Would recommend going for a room on a higher floor with a better view. Tried the Smooth Thai restaurant in the hotel, and they had great pad thai.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Wsh2905
Reviews.Content: Not inexpensive but a very nice hotel. Junior suite was worth the extra money. Staff was very considerate. Wrth the money!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: linglor2
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, friendly staff, convenient location, will go there again. but abit overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located and Good Services”
Reviews.Author: cool_hale
Reviews.Content: We booked this through kayak.com at discounted price for my five day stay at this hotel. The price was reasonable for such kind of location near Union Square. All services were of decent standard as expected from this rate of hotel. Internet connectivity was an issue which I got resolved through their help-line. Overall it was a nice stay here for my business related trip.

Reviews.Title: “Kept waiting”
Reviews.Author: Blossom055
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in (at 4:00pm) we were told that our room was not ready and that maybe we should go and grab a bite to eat and come back in about an hour. Needless to say we were very hungry and tired after traveling from RI to CA. We returned to the hotel at 5:30pm and our room was still not ready! We were offered complimentary cocktails in the hotel lounge while we waited. At 7:00pm after much complaining our room was finally ready!! Very impersonal staff. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pay Extra to Stay in a Club Room!”
Reviews.Author: Shaynassister
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy a personalized, friendly hotel experience, this is not the place for you. This is a very large hotel with the feel of a busy airport. The ground floor restaurant/bar lacks any kind of atmosphere or intimacy. If we had paid $125 like a previous reviewer, my review would have been less critical. But paying over $200 (with taxes), I noticed that the carpets in our "clean air" room were stained and when I turned over the cushions on the 2 chairs, it was obvious that the undersides had not been vacuumed recently. The bathroom electrical outlet was grubby, although when I called housekeeping, they were ready to change it immediately. When I pointed out some small black dots on the edge of the bedskirt, we were moved to a Club room. Why? Because the management of the hotel takes even a remote possibility of an infestation very seriously. I have to give them full credit for this: they offered to launder all our belongings (not necessary, since we had just arrived), and sent someone to move our luggage to a new room. We were repeatedly told that they take this issue seriously and we could see that this is really the case. Several men wearing gloves came into the room as we were leaving, and proceeded to take the room apart. I think that their quick and decisive actions were admirable and speak to a high level of operational efficiency. We LOVED the Club room that they upgraded us to; it also included evening snacks, desserts and an honor bar, as well as a lovely breakfast in the 31st floor Club Lounge with a gorgeous view of the city. I would totally recommend paying $30-40 more per night for a Club room; it's well worth it! So, although I was originally intending to rate the hotel as a 3, because of their swift, decisive actions and also the fabulous Club room experience, I think it merits a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 831jen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times all on business. Love the location. It's a quick walk to union square shopping. And the rooms even the basic ones are nice. I always feel safe here. The Cobb salad from room service is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Navygasser
Reviews.Content: Woke up several times because of noise from the party goers on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at an excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: CreekFLMom
Reviews.Content: We took an impromptu weeklong trip to California, including a one night stay in San Francisco. Being a â€œplannerâ€�, I was a bit frazzled to find a nice hotel in San Francisco but at a reasonable price. After reading endless Trip Advisor reviews I knew there were more luxurious options but â€œsettledâ€� on the Parc 55 because it seemed acceptable, convenient and I got a AAA rate of $107 per night! Upon booking I took the $19 upgrade option (if available) and also noted it was our 25th anniversary trip. All I can say is we did not feel like we settled at all! From start to finish, the hotel staff did everything to make our stay special. Valet parking was fast and efficient and we didnâ€™t really mind paying the $40+ parking fee as we left our car there until we were ready to leave the following day. At check-in we were informed the upgrade to a â€œviewâ€� room was available, although I think we got more than a standard upgrade as we were on the 23rd floor in the â€œcornerâ€� room with views in 3 directions! The desk clerk also provided us with access to the Club Level which was great for evening snacks/drinks and breakfast in the morning. This hotel is unbelievably close to the cable cars, MUNI, F-line, everything we needed. We had heard the hotel was on the edge of a not so good area but we went walking in the evening to a nearby restaurant and up and down some streets and never felt in danger. Just be smart and stay where everyone else is. If you want ultimate luxury and can pay the price, stay at a $500 per night hotel, but if you want a nice, clean, convenient place to stay in the city, at a great price, this is a wonderful choice!

Reviews.Title: “Edge of Tenderloin, otherwise great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ROCKintheUSA
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a trip here on a priceline bid of $125 a night which for pricey and overtaxed San Fran is a steal. First the bad news: When I arrived, the place was overbooked and had the longest line for reception I have literally ever seen, and I've been to 5 continents, stayed at dozens of hotels. Next, do not, repeat do not walk west from this hotel particularly after dark. San Fran is one of the most vagrant-infested cities in the Western Hemisphere (they seem to like it that way) and I grew up in NYC, so I should know. The hotel sits right on the border of tourist district and the Tenderloin, which is replete with some of the scariest meth and crackheads this side of jail. My sincere advice. Do not walk west. Every other direction is fine, as Union Square is just to the north/northeast and the mall is right across the street eastward. The room was nice, hotel staff nice, but I wouldnot pay above 200 a night for this due to the location, unless part of your itinerary includes massages, buying drugs and or getting into fistfights with homeless people. Also, another huge negative, we were on the 25th floor and we could still CLEARLY here the constant sirens, so either SF has super sirens or the glass windows were astoundingly cheap. Again, I gre up in NYC, so sirens are nothing new to me, but this is one noisy city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationer519
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled here over the Labor Day holiday. The hotel looks a little dated on the outside but has been totally redone on the inside. We had heard that the check in can take a little while but we only had to wait about 10 minutes. Now the next night we did notice a line of about 10 people waiting to check in so maybe we just got lucky. The rooms are what you expect out of any hotel. They were very clean and the beds were comfy. Yes you can hear sirens outside during the night but they provide earplugs if it bothers you bad enough. My suggestion is to ask for a room on one of the upper floors. We stayed on the 22nd floor and it wasn't too bad. The restaurant is nice and we found all of the staff to be very friendly. This hotel is located in a very convenient place. Only a few steps out the door is an entrance to the Bart station and since it is in Union Square there are tons of stores and shops within walking distance. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler10057
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a fitness room and it was very spacious. The front desk staff was very courteous and although we had two reservations ensured that we did not have to move rooms. The breakfast buffet was provided with our package and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: pitahead
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very clean, very comfortable. We were upgraded to a junior suite & it had amazing views from 3 giant windows. Room had a couch and 4 chairs, large desk, tv, coffee maker, wine glasses. No mini frig though- which would have made the room perfect. Daily housekeeping was great- they actually read our notes for extra regular coffee (no decaf). Bed was comfy- mattress was firm, had 4 regular pillows & several sham pillows.Shower had very hot water. Counter top was a little tight for all my hair stuff, makeup & my hubby's toiletry bag, but it worked out OK after we put some stuff on the little shelf underneath. Front desk staff & doorman/bellhop were all very friendly & helpful. We were invited to the social hour & breakfast although were too busy most days to go. We did go one afternoon for an appetizer bite before we headed out to a late dinner, but alcohol is not free. We had a glass of wine & enjoyed the view. Some complained of the gym- but I don't work out on vacation, so I can't review that. Location is very convenient to cabs, bus, cable cars. Walking distance to several dining places (fast food, diners, finer dining). It is about a 15-20 min walk to the water/Embarcadero area. Cityhouse in the hotel was actually one of the best meals we had in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Typical large city hotel - with some added annoyances”
Reviews.Author: desidou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It's HUGE, so you don't get the personal service of a small, boutique hotel. We checked in and had a room with two beds, I asked to be moved to a room with 1 bed and was denied citing "We're really full". Funny that a friend of mine staying in the same hotel on the same dates was switched from a 1 bed room to a 2 bed one with no issues. I suppose it's the luck of the draw on who you get at the check in desk. Our room was okay, typical hotel room. The high speed internet had issues and my husband (who was working from the hotel room for the week) had to call tech support because the connection kept dropping. The ability to have a wired connection was the main reason we chose this hotel and the connection was still unreliable. I should add that this hotel charges for high speed internet access, which is terribly annoying since most places offer it for free these days - and to have it be unreliable only added to the annoyance. The area of town (Union Square) is noisy as I found staying in the area last year. The hotel provides earplugs in the bathrooms as an amenity. I found a sound machine app on my phone worked better than the earplugs. The walls are also paper thin in this hotel. We didn't hear much during the week - perhaps our neighboring rooms were quiet business travelers or unoccupied. Come the weekend, though - we heard EVERYTHING in the rooms next to us. I even knew the cell phone ring of the occupant in the room next door and could hear every word of his conversation. That's no fun, especially when your neighbors come in at 1AM from a night on the town and want to loudly tell one another stories. Not a pleasant way to be woken up in the middle of the night. One more thing - the internet charge is not per ROOM, it's per DEVICE that you use to connect to the internet. We had two laptops and had two charges on the bill and had to get that resolved. I even called down to the front desk at the beginning of our stay to confirm that the charge was per ROOM and not per DEVICE. The phone was answered by someone who did not understand the language well and she just kept saying "Yes", so I repeated my question and just got a "yes" response. Upon check out, I explained my conversation, cited the date and the extra charge was removed. I am still annoyed greatly that (1) there is a charge for high speed internet access (2) the connection was unreliable at best and (3) the charge is per device, not per room. I think that's a bit greedy, if you ask me. Oh, and our TV didn't work, so we had to call for assistance with that, too. The cable was bad or something to that effect. It was still annoying. I have an annual conference in SF and I probably won't stay here again. There are too many other hotels in this area to deal with the annoyances I experienced in my week here. Oh well :/

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: todd k
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights for a vacation trip to San Francisco, and loved our time at the Parc 55! The staff was excellent: the concierge was extremely helpful and the front desk was very accommodating to us. We had a corner room with an excellent view of the city thanks to two walls of windows. One of our concerns was hearing the city noise, but that was not an issue. There was no problem sleeping at night. (Make sure the window vent flaps are closed!) The room was kept very clean during our stay. We were able to get anywhere using the many forms of public transportation which are all very close by. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Another business trip and another hotel”
Reviews.Author: colesyboy1978
Reviews.Content: I popped to SF from the UK for 2 days, for work. Being English I got the BART from SFO to downtown. My US friends say I'm mad getting a train, but it's so easy (30 mins). Getting off at Powell St station, the hotel is just 3mins walk away. Simple. Reception great you and sort out the room Witt little or no fuss. Sometimes you queue but really this is just minutes of waiting, not a lifetime. Getting my room key I get one of the half dozen lifts and I'm in. Clean, spacious and quiet. After an afternoon walking about SF I sleep like a baby in a very big comfortable bed. In the morning I use the gym (big and lots of equipment) and go for breakfast. Breakfast is about $25, perhaps cheaper to book as part of the room but I didn't check. My only compliant was the hotel bar closing at 1am. I'm used to bars staying open later in hotels, bit maybe it wasn't a bad thing!!! The hotel is well located, by BART, next to a big mall, a short walk from the designer shops (union sq) and near a collection of food, drinking and other outlets. In comparison to other SF hotels, the location is perfect. You're not far from anyone. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous upgrade”
Reviews.Author: claza_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a 35th-anniversary trip to California and, in several instances, that fact paid off. When booking the Parc 55, we took the option to pay an additional $19 for an upgrade, if one became available. We also booked the "parking package," avoiding the $50/night fee. At check-in, we were told that as an "anniversary gift," the hotel was upgrading us to a suite. For our two nights at this hotel, we were in an enormous suite on the 31st floor for less than $300 per night (including all fees and taxes). The king-sized bed was probably the most comfortable we had on the trip. Having a door to close between the bedroom and living area, each with its own TV, was helpful, as was having one-and-a-half bathrooms. It did strike us as odd, however, that the full bathroom had no tub, just a (large) stall shower. Our view was of Union Square and neither one of us noticed any street noise. Check-in staff and concierge were efficient and helpful. The hotel is in a busy area and was bustling with activity during our stay (busloads of students/campers arriving), so we were doubly grateful for the upgrade! We would definitely choose Parc 55 again when visiting San Francisco. [And just a general tip if, like us, you're driving throughout your trip and not relying on taxis or public transportation ... bring a GPS or rent a car with navigation. We brought our GPS from home and it was invaluable on our 10-day trip in central-northern California.]

Reviews.Title: “Great location but better choices close by”
Reviews.Author: KTNashTN
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Aug/Sept for a conference. The location is great. The room was large & the bed was really comfortable. However it didn't matter due to the all night extremely loud street noise that kept me awake most nights. Housekeeping was inconsistent. Dirty glasses stayed on the floor in the hall all week. Room service got my breakfast order wrong. Wouldn't choose this hotel again with all the choices within a couple blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: IJKBF
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel in 2+ years and on arrival Michael was as attentive and helpful as ever and importantly, knowledgeable of what is going on in the city. Check in was quick and as before, we stayed in a Club level room on 33rd floor which was clean and tidy. Shortly after arrival Housekeeping knocked the door to ensure we had everything we required, which was considerate and a nice touch. The two Queen sized beds were comfortable but note are similar to UK double bed size, not King. View out over the city was excellent with Giants stadium to our right, Alcatraz island just visible to our left, Union Square is 5-10 mins walk and Powell Street turnaround is just round the corner. However, even though we were high up in the building you can still hear police sirens during the night as street noise funnels up between the high rise buildings. Also, as the hotel is in the financial quarter/slightly downtown of the city there are a number of homeless/down and outs wandering around. These did not cause us any problems but may be unsettling to those who are less well travelled or of a nervous disposition. Club breakfast is continental style/reasonable, with cereals, cold meats etc. and the three staff present could not have been more attentive in finding English tea for us! The hotel reception area is spacious and has several pieces of nice, decorative artwork around. Overall, we enoyed our stay at the Parc 55 which was comparable to our previous visit there.

Reviews.Title: “I will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Anita B
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, my cousin and I went the 19th thru 23, .this was my treat to myself for my 50th birthday. If you friend the hotel on facebook, they have specials on there rooms. When I first registered my room, i started off with 4 nights at 20% off, so it was a $199 a night that went to $159 I belive. The hotel would run specials for certain dates, I ended up getting my room for $125 a night. Sounds good to me! If you coming to San Francisco, the Parc is the best hotel if you want to stay in Union Square where everything is. It's right at the Powell train station, up the stairs and you walk across the street you are at the hotel. You have to look carefully when booking rooms in expensive cities such as SF, especially if you feel you need to get a car. If you are coming for pleasure and are staying in Union Square, you don't need a car. The parking in the hotels garages are very expensive. You have the trolleys cars, the Muni, sightseeing tour buses, and if you like walking you don't need a rental car. I can go on and on, but overall, that was my first time in the city and third time to California. I love SF and Parc is my choice for when I go back. We had double beds, the beds are very comfortable. I loved the place! We were on the 13th floor, whether you were on the 32 floor of the first floor, you are going to hear the sirens regardless!

Reviews.Title: “Great end to a bad start thanks to Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: es_in_tx
Reviews.Content: My trip to SFO started off bad as my original hotel (Nikko) somehow canceled my reservation. They sent me next door to Parc 55 and in was skeptical at first. Hotel staff at the front desk were fantastic. They upgraded my room knowing my experience at Nikko was bad. Room was excellent - very good sized for downtown San Fran. Breakfast was good although a little over priced. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Service. Very nice suite.”
Reviews.Author: SCTO42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on a short business trip and was very happy with my experience. The hotel is a short BART ride from SFO to Powell and a short walk to the hotel entrance. The hotel is modern and inviting for a corporate type hotel. The bar is better than most corporate hotels and the Sunset Suite was large, clean and with very nice views. The hotel is close to shopping, Bart and Union Square. The Front Desk was capable, but nothing special. I would stay here again without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Allyson S
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very modern and chic. I was lucky enough to stay on the Club Floor and had a great breakfast compliments of the hotel for being on that floor. My room overlooked the downtown area and the view was stunning from the 31st floor. The staff was very polite and helpful for my first SF experience. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ViajerosMAD
Reviews.Content: + Excellent down town San Francisco location. Just a short walk from the bart from the airport to the hotel (powel station); Perfect location to explore the city! easy walk to shopping and restaurants without hills. very close to Union Square. Short walk to all the main attractions and also you can easily get the trams/buses to Fishermans wharf and the other tourist attractions. + Friendly staff , because of our special occasion they offered us an upgrade in check-in. helpful and accommodating staff. + Fantastic room: good size (spacious), clean, and with great views and good bathroom. - Would prefer shower had glass enclosure, rather than curtain. Everything was great, very good value for money. Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: kathg
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to san francisco, the hotel was fantastically located near Union Square. It was good value for money and the rooms and the rest of the hotel were of an excellent standard. The gym facilities were good but busy in the morning. The best thing was the big and comfortable bed! Would definitely recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fairly standard chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: off-for-a-ride
Reviews.Content: This was a very convenient hotel for a business trip to Union Square. The rooms and service are pretty much standard fair for a chain hotel so nothing much to write about. Average.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sleephla
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay here based on the good reviews and the deal we got on Expedia. This was a sub-par at best experience. First the good: The Parc 55 is centrally located at Union Square so if you're in to shopping, this would be your place. It was easy to get to off of I-80. There was an LCD TV (to which you would expect paying over $175/night for a hotel). That's about the jist of the good things. Here's what it didn't have: We booked a room with a king bed... yeah, they didn't have any available. We were stuck with two full beds. Wi-fi was extra $15 per day, parking was an extra $50/night (had no choice), the hotel is also centrally located to a gang of ambulances. Understandably, this isn't the hotel's fault, but being on a higher floor (floor 29), you would expect it be less noisy. Not the case. We were both up a majority of the night every 20 minutes because of this. No fridge, no microwave. Bathroom and shower were fine, room was okay size, elevators were good. All in all, it was nothing that you couldn't get from a travelodge for a hundred bucks cheaper per night. The staff were kind and friendly, as were the valet guys. But, being that there are hundreds of hotels in SF, I would definitely recommend staying somewhere else, unless you have a huge fix to shop and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, fun location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lettezilla
Reviews.Content: Month long roadtrip means a lot of nights in hotels and motels. This was the first place where we decided to splash out a little, and also to stay for 2 nights. We got a corner room with a great view over the bay and city, and the room was huge and very comfortable. Sheets were super soft, and it was very easy to relax here. Service was super friendly, and check in and out were both pretty easy. Valet parking is very expensive here, I think $45/day? So we looked online and found a garage around the corner that was $25/day. No in and out, but we didn't want to drive, so were happy to save a few bucks. Only other note I'd make is that the front neighborhood was fancypants, but if you go around the back, you're in the Tenderloin, which is...colorful. There are a lot of homeless shelters and people sleeping rough here, only a few blocks away from this luxury hotel. Didn't feel threatened at all, but I can imagine it might be a new experience for someone that hasn't been to a big city before? We loved the location-- went to Dottie's for breakfast one morning and BlueBottle Coffee for breakfast and coffee the second day. Also enjoyed cocktails at Bourbon and Branch's secret detective agency, and cheap but tasty bahn mi sandwiches for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would go back”
Reviews.Author: hoteltalk95
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a little small, but big enough. Staff were polite and helpful. Beds - very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 enjoys a convenient location just above Powell Street station -great if you're coming in on BART from the airport, for example - and spitting distance from Union Square. Upper floors have decent views. Otherwise, there is little to distinguish it from other chain hotels around. Pleasant service, nice rooms, no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel view the night views”
Reviews.Author: TiggerGalHollister
Reviews.Content: We took a fun trip for my husbands birthday with family and little ones. The staff all greeted us with a smile upon entering the hotel. Our rooms were very clean and a little noisy but what do you expect you are high up. Great view of the city and the Giants Stadium. Their Lounge on the higher floors has a great Continental Breakfast that is offered for the higeher rooms. The only down point was not haveing a restaurant that really fit towards little kids as well. Great Amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: bekkSanDiego
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is just average. I booked with American Express. Our flight was delayed and by the time we checked in it was 11:30pm. The 2 doubles room I had booked was not available. They told me rooms booked with Travelocity are not guaranteed for room type. I told them I used Amex... and they said Amex is the same as Travelocity. Live and learn. They put us in a room with a king and brought in a roll-away. My trip was a shopping trip with 2 teenage girls. I let the girls sleep on the King and i took the roll-away. The walking space was pretty tight with the rollaway. I wasn't terribly upset that they did not have my 2 doubles room because the room they put us in on the 29th floor was an upgrade of sorts, since the higher up you are, the less street noise. The room was clean and had a tub and shower. There was a nice size flat screen tv and a large bay window with a city view. There was an in-room one cup at a time coffee maker.... but I never use these as the water tank areas are always cruddy and gross... this one was no exception. There was no refrigerator. There were two nice robes in the closet for use. Towels were good quality, as was water pressure. When I went to use the business center to print out boarding passes all the printers were empty with no paper. It took me 40 mnutes to get someone to reload the printers. That was pretty annoying. My other experiences with staff were better and mostly above average. Next time I will stay at the Powell Hotel across the street - as it is a better value in the same great location.... and I don't mind the smaller rooms of a botique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A loud, flashy place to stay - did not enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Bklynf00die
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night and would not recommend to others. When checking in, I asked for a quiet room and front desk gave us a room on one of the upper floors - supposedly more quiet but ended up being a loud and awful night. We got to our room - handicapped, even though we didn't request that and not mentioned and it was quite small and cramped compared to other hotels downtown. It was across from the elevators and unexpectedly loud throughout the night. The kicker was the guest next door was a drunken mess and mistook our room for hers and tried to open the door - at 2am in the morning. She was then arguing with her boyfriend for a half hour. Seems like this hotel can attract a loud, noisy crowd. If you want a hotel with a cool looking bar (from afar), check this out but seems loud and flashy and not a good value at all. Location good.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to see San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: familytrippers_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 5 nights during our visit to San Francisco. We chose it for its central location, club breakfast,.price and the good reviews on TA. We were not disappointed. Everything touristy was easily accessible. Large shopping centre across the street. Check in was quick. I was slightly disappointed as I had booked directly with the hotel 9 months previous and had requested a corner room. However I was told that this was not possible as the rooms were all occupied. It didnt matter really as we still had a good view over the city and out to the bay from the 28th floor. The room was compact but not cramped (2 adults and 2 teenage boys). It was nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. Bathroom was a good size and shower was powerful. The hotel itself was quiet as was the aircon. There was some traffic noise and music from a club across the street but that didnt affect our sleep. Turn down service each evening and mints on pillow. Club breakfast on the 31st floor was included in the price of our room. Only one morning (Monday) proved to be very very busy.( no where to sit and no plates or cutlery) The other mornings were pleasurable. Unlimited tea, coffee and fresh juice. Cereals, pastries, toast, cheese, ham, boiled eggs, fresh fruit and yoghurt. Selection of different finger foods between 5pm and 7.30pm tea and coffee and an open bar. Dessert from 7.30pm til 10pm. Good gym although we didnt use it. Bar and restaurant inside hotel but again didnt use this. Well stocked hotel shop. We had a great stay and would recommend to anyone looking for a clean comfortable modern hotel in an accessible area.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GemC1985
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying here, the lady who checked us in was very nice and helpful and our room was upgraded to a junior suit without the extra cost. I think the suit would maybe be a little pricey but from what I saw, the other rooms were perfectly adequate. Clean and right in union square near plently of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “good environment & good service!”
Reviews.Author: joey t
Reviews.Content: the location is great & it's very convenient to shopping and taking the tram to travel within downtown & fisherman's wharf. The staffs are nice with good service. I'll stay there again if I travel to S. F. next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: lucylu210
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Wyndham because they catered to a family of five with the adjoining room. The location is unbelievable as we could access some great restaurants and all kinds of stores including the Westfield mall. The staff went out of their way to make our stay a great one and I cannot say enough good things about the hotel. We would definitely come back. One thing I would say is that it is quite noisy at night especially on the weekends but that is something you have to live with being so centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Started rough, but the hotel made up for it.”
Reviews.Author: Ledsak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our trip up the California coast. We booked the room on Hotwire and got a pretty good deal. When we arrived, we were a little worried because the outside of the hotel looks a tad outdated, but once inside, the hotel has been completely modernized. We were given our room keys and headed to our room. To our dismay when we arrived in the room, it had not been cleaned after the last guests had checked out. Obviously a bit surprizing, but not unheard of (mistakes happen). We called downstairs and complained and they sent a bellman up with new keys to another room. When we arrived in the new room, not only were we upgraded a few floors, but they had given us a suite. The room had an amazing view (when it wasn't foggy - which isn't often in SF). There is a great bar in the hotel and there are many restaurants, diners, and other shops all within walking distance. All in all, the hotel made up for their mistake and we would definately go back if we are in SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and security lapses”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfortable if dated rooms, clean bathrooms and excellent location! As for the rest....well I had room 725...there is a very good reason they supply earplugs in the bathroom...For the two nights I was here I didnt manage a full nights sleep once! The noise from the street below was horrific. The windows were not insulated enough and the noise seemed constant. I have stayed here before and managed to get rooms on the other side which doesnt seem as bad (the hotel is L shaped, if you can get rooms on the side that looks onto the other wing of the hotel you may be slightly better off noise wise). As well as the noise I found that my Air Condistioning was ineffective and provided very little cool air, certainly not enough to keep the room at my required temperature. On top of that I found the bathroom flooded everytime I used the shower regardless of how I arranged the shower curtain which could present a safety issue for some. But perhaps my greatest concern about this hotel is security. The lobby is a level up from the entrance. I arrived in the hotel a 11pm on a Saturday evening only to find the entrance level empty of all apart from one rather aggressive homeless man who had clearly wandered in. As I made my way to the lifts he tried to follow me. The lifts have no key access so they are open to everyone who enters the hotel and anyone can gain access to the room floors. He tried to follow me into the lift but I told him not to, to which I got a hurl of abuse shouted at me. This should not have happened under any circumstances especially in an area which is known for it homeless just outside the hotel.
