All in all I would not recommend this hotel for any reason other then its location and only then if there was little else available!

Reviews.Title: “This was our second visit to this hotel -- we love it!”
Reviews.Author: JillD1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel -- friendly and helpful staff, nice clean, modern rooms. Great location close to shopping, movies and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: carmineruby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literaly 2 blocks from the BART stop which will take you to & from SFO airport for $8.10 each way. I took BART at 8:30am and it wasn't crowded at all. The hotel is also 1.5 blocks away from the cable car stop (the end/start of the line) which will take you to Fisherman's Wharf/Embarcadero. On the downside, one of the complimentary items in the room is earplugs--if you're a light sleeper, you will need them. My room was on the 5th floor and I could hear street noise as if I the room didn't have windows! The room was also a little dark, there were two lamps, both near the window but that could have been because I was in a connecting room and the connecting door was next to left side of the bed making it impossible to have a nightstand there. Despite those two things, I'd likely stay here again because of the location--lots of places to eat, lots of shops, great staff, good public transit connections, and still close enough to the tourist sites that I could walk them. Note: there is no refrigerator in the room but there is a convenience store in the lobby, Walgreen's is also a block away.

Reviews.Title: “We were so well treated and would love to be back”
Reviews.Author: Mejap
Reviews.Content: The location of the Wyndham in San Francisco is just fantastic. One block from the beginning of the cable car ride, and across the street from some fantastic shopping. The hotel itself is very appealing, clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful. We were travelling with my daughter and grandaughters and wanted rooms that were close by. When we arrived the first night, we were quite late and that was not possible. The next morning we were able to switch rooms and we were placed in a beautiful room right next to my daughter on the 27th floor with a fantastic view of San Francisco by night. Because we were on the 27th floor, this gave us access to the 30th floor club which served a continental breakfast every monring, serve hors d<oeuvres at 5 p.m. and desert at l0 p.m. We found this very appealing and was well worth the extra few dollars. There is a concierge on location who knew her stuff and was very very helpful in discussing with us the many things there are to see and do in San Francisco. Her tips were very useful for our stay. All in all staying at the Wyndham was a wonderful experience and I would definitely stay there again if I go back to San Fran. This experience has made me want to stay in other hotels owned by this Chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RichardE_8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights in a spacious, clean and reasonably appointed room on 12th floor. Easy walking access to the BART rail system, trams, shops etc. Wifi a bit pricey at US$15/day ! Noisy streets below but that is San Fran. Didn't use the restaurant but looked OK. Great cafe called Daniel's next door.

Reviews.Title: “A formerly good hotel that needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: arizonaac
Reviews.Content: I wind up returning to hotels that I had positive experience at over the years. I had not stayed at the Parc 55 in over 10 years and I doubt I will return. There are far too many 4-star hotels in San Francisco to stay at one that needs to be remodeled. I will say the bed was wonderful but the rest of the room was pure trash.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: isis_kitten
Reviews.Content: Each one of the staff member greeted us and hasked me and my mother if there was anything they could do. All staff was friendly and professional at all times. The rooms were very comfortable. When we arrived in SF, our designated room wasn't ready, but the front staff went out of their way to find us a comparable room so we could relax right away. Valet was quick to get our car. And the gentlemen in the gift shop was so easy to talk to and really went out of his way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ana O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc55 for business a few weeks ago and had a pleasant experience - the hotel is nicely decorated and very clean. The bed was comfortable but the non-feather pillows (I have allergies so I had to use the foam ones) were not comfy - feather ones seemed great though. You do hear any hallway noise from your room, so if you are a very light sleeper, try to get a room at the end of a hall. At Check in and Check out, there was only one staff member there to process me so it took a little while, but they were helpful and friendly. Internet is a good price but painfully, painfully slow, so bring a wireless card or maybe try to business center, the land line internet may be faster.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: CoastCrystal
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying here after I read the reviews on the discount website that I used to make the reservation. They only show you what hotel you are staying at AFTER you pay. But the Parc 55 was a nice hotel. The room was nice and clean. Great water pressure in the shower. And, yes, there is some noise, you ARE right in the middle of the city. I was on the ninth floor. I sleep with earplugs anyway, as I'm from the country, so the noise didn't bother me. It was a Thursday night though. Might be worse on the weekends. There is a great shopping mall right across the street which we visited. There ARE some homeless people around, but I didn't feel "unsafe." One BIG negative for me was the parking! $50 for overnight, and it's ONLY valet. It is nice to not have to walk to your car in a parking garage given the area, however. It was a bit pricey, but I don't regret staying there. It was only one night, so I didn't get to try the restaurant or spa.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: AliciaLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: I must say the Parc 55 consistenly delivers a quality hotel stay. After a full day of meetings, it is nice to be able to rest in the comfort of a beautiful room, or, have dinner in the many restaurants in the area. Located in the Union Square Park area of San Francisco, it is easy access to Bart, and is a perfect base for my business trips to Oakland and the East Bay. I have also walked to Chinatown and Little Italy with no problems. If you have time for shopping, the Westfield Mall is a block or two away. I appreciate your knowledgable and welcoming staff (and the Club Lounge.) Makes the business trips more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL/AMENITIES/STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Scott K
Reviews.Content: I stay in 50 hotels a year and never take the time to write a review but felt my stay was so enjoyable that I just had too. The view was fantastic, the staff was second to none and the amenities were fabulous. Every staff member encountered seemed to love to take care of thier guests and knew how to as well. I will forever remember this hotel stay as the best ever! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Fernando G
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times, my wife loves the central location easy walking to Macy's, Norstroms, etc. and does not have to walk uphill carrying her finds. Easy in and out parking and plenty of close restaurants to eat at. And very close to the SF Muni systems and Bart. A nice walk to the SF Giants ballpark. Staff is very friendly and very accommodating. Prices do vary so you need to find the right time to get the best price.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: pdou2484
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodations; needs mini-fridges in the room; internet connection is horrible and $15 a day!; this type of hotel should offer free internet for the price you pay for the room; no swimming pool!; hotel bar is expensive, but what you would expect for San Francisco; location is excellent for public transportation; wouldn't stay at this hotel again unless the internet was free."

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Parc!!”
Reviews.Author: Samiam1st
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times and have never been disappointed. Rooms are very nice, staff is friendly, location is perfect, service is outstanding. I highly recommend the Parc!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the city”
Reviews.Author: RedBeanie_11
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here a couple of times whenever I need to spend a night in the city. This time I spent the night there for my San Francisco Marathon. The location is superb! It is right in the center of Union Square shopping center, right outside of the bart station AND right next to one of the biggest Forever 21 in the country. The lobby is nice and clean. The check-in process was painless. The guy who helped us check in was so nice to hold a high level room for me with fabulous view of the city. As a partner hotel for the SF marathon, guests were given the privilege to check out at 2pm. This is the best thing for runners as they would love to have a hot shower after a 26.2 miles of sweaty running and take a little nap :) The hotel deserves more than 3 stars. The service is definitely a 5 star hotel. It doesn't look as nice on the outside but the inside is clean. The room is clean. The bed is comfortable enough for a deep sleep before a race. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not totally 'in love'”
Reviews.Author: stuckathome007
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days in San Francisco with my husband... we stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham. I was leary in making the reservation at first because I hadn't had any experience with this hotel, but it was a last minute trip and options were limited. The rate was significantly lower than the other hotels we usually choose, but the pictures looked nice and it was definitely in the area we were interested in staying. Upon arrival, valets were super friendly and very helpful, and so was the help at the front desk. In fact, ALL of the personnel we encountered on all levels was VERY friendly, and accomodating... a definite FIVE-STARS in that department! The room was nice (very tasteful and modern decor)... spacious bathroom with granite countertop. The only thing I wasn't thrilled about was the shower. Nothing luxurious... not even a tub... just a standup shower. Even had a handicap seat in it. The gal at the front desk told us that all rooms with 1 king size bed had a "handicap shower"... and all rooms with 2x double beds had a tub/shower combination. I also didn't love the fact that our room had a "buzzer" outside it for "handicap reasons?!" IF someone chose to push it, a siren sounded INSIDE OF OUR HOTEL ROOM! And, our room was RIGHT next to the elevators... so all evening I was preparing myself for the SHRILL of someone playing a game and pushing the button. lol! Luckily, it didn't happen... but I really couldn't figure that one out. Our room was on the 28th floor and had a SPECTACULAR view of the city AND of the Bay... it really doesn't get much better. Also, our room smelled like smoke when we arrived (YUCK!)... and when we complained/asked about it, we were told there were no other rooms available. The front desk gave us a $25 coupon (which was unneccessary, but VERY kind!) good in their restaurant/lounge and said they'd move us the next morning. They also sent a air purifier to our room which actually helped the situation... totally cleared the smell in a matter of an hour... so we ended up not switching, and appreciated their attention & concern to the situation. The hotel was in easy walking distance of great shopping and eating! HATE the "oversized vehicle" charge of $66/day for our SUV... but I know parking is a premium in the city. We love San Fran and will be heading back often. I'm not 100% sure I'd stay here again as I like a little more plush a hotel. HOWEVER, there is nothing wrong with this hotel, it's quite lovely, and the personnel was fantastic! I would certainly recommend it to others! PS: Bring your own pillows!!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: olsonator
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location The location of this hotel was awesome! For the work portion of my trip I was only 5 blocks walking distance. For my personal time afterwards with my wife we were within a couple blocks of Union Square, a block from the BART (rail transit system), and a block from the cable cars. The hotel is somewhat across the street from a Westfield Mall and Market Street where there is a lot of shopping. The hotel is also around the corner from the GAP flood building which my wife loved. San Francisco has great transit and this hotel is close to street cars, cable cars and the BART. My recommendation for the cable cars during lower season is to go up near union square to get on the cable cars. This is how the locals do it and they skip the entire lineup scene. You can simple pay for your ticket once you hop on. This will NOT work during peak season as the cars seem to be jammed right full. Service Other than check-in I did not interact with the hotel staff much. They were pleasant. Value This was a part-work, part personal trip. The value was pretty good for the area. Parking was extremely expensive, but parking anywhere in San Francisco is extremely expensive. Sleep Quality I was located higher on the building so the street noise was a little less intrusive. Luckily I sleep like a rock so the street noise was not an issue at all. Cleanliness The room was cleaned very well and all areas of the hotel were kept immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: stephp
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at quite a few hotels in Union Square in the past, including this one when it was owned by someone else, and the Parc 55 met all of our expectations. We reserved 2 rooms and one of our rooms was ready early, at 1pm. The other room wasn't ready until after 4 pm, but was just a few rooms away from the other room so we didn't complain. The rooms were clean and well appointed. I had forgotten my toothbrush and the front desk gave me a small kit with a new toothbrush, a small toothpaste, and a flossing pic. My room was much quieter than my parents room. It almost seemed like my room had newer windows which blocked the outside noise. I was able to sleep with the city noise and my parents had a much more difficult time with the noise. Actually, watching tv in the evening before dinner was much more pleasant in my room than in theirs. There really was that much of a difference in noise and, like I said before, we were only a few rooms apart. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and it was delicious! All of the entrees that we ordered were outstanding, as was the service, and desserts were delicious. We would return to the hotel again to eat dinner there. Breakfast, on the other hand, was almost inedible. Actually, I was not able to eat my waffle. Parking was not cheap, but we expected that. I did get the rooms for $200 each on priceline, which was a savings. I had looked at other hotels in the area before bidding on priceline and this was a decent deal. 3 star hotels were going for more than this for the same night, so we were happy. I have read other reviews of this hotel where the staff was noted to be less than stellar, this was not the case for us. We were extremely happy with the front desk staff, valets, and the concierge. We did find the lack of bell hops to be disturbing, but we had relatively few things and managed to get our luggage to our room by ourselves. The concierge was extremely helpful in recommending great restaurants located extremely close to the hotel. We ate at an Italian restaurant just across the street from the hotel, something and Puccini (I can't remember the name) and it was excellent. We would return to the Parc 55 Wyndham again, we just won't eat breakfast there!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll ever stay in SFCO!!”
Reviews.Author: GJo3814
Reviews.Content: This facility was SO easy to find, has a great location, amazing staff, outstanding food and drinks. The room was more spacious than most places I've stayed in the city, twice as big as the Sr. Francis Drake and much nicer. I'll never stay anywhere else when we visit San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Amsel4
Reviews.Content: After our 12 hours flight to SFO we got on the BART to Powell station and were in a few steps in the hotel. This was a bonus. The view from our room was stunning! We had a club room for our familie of four and it was fabulous.The room had enough space for the luggage and we did not feel cramped.The bathroom was very clean and had a good shower. The breakfast at the club lounge was good with fresh fruits and had also enough to choose from other food.The lounge itself is a bit on the smaller side and maybe it takes a moment to finde a place to sit. We never feeled afraid around the hotel area and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “definitely would stay again”
Reviews.Author: turkmurphy58
Reviews.Content: Great location, very helpful staff. Rarely have breakfast in a hotel but did this time and was surprised at how reasonable the price was.

Reviews.Title: “This pace never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: nmcmorran
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is amazing and the view from any room is spectacular. It's centrally located near Union Square in San Francisco; it's so close to shopping in Union Square and the Westfield mall. I've stayed here several times and I've never had a bad experience. My boyfriend and I stayed at another hotel down the street once and it just couldn't live up to this place. If you stay here make sure you get a corner room; it has more windows and you get to more sunlight!

Reviews.Title: “NOT super close to Union Square, but close enough!”
Reviews.Author: Carlii1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 1998 AND July 2011, both times for me and my moter's July birthdays. The rooms are very large for a major city hotel room. The view was OK, we only saw the tops of hotels (NOT the SF skyline or oneof the 2 SF bridges) I THINK you could ask for a room with that view, but I seriously didn't care. Anyway, the check in was nice BUT I had added an extra night from another websight and even told the reception to make SURE that the maids know I have 2 nights ,well the maids Even WITH THE "dO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door. Well, at 1PM the maids knock , I was asleep and I told them I have an extra night. Then at 5PM my daughter calls and said I need to check out! I am diabetic and walk with a cane and at the time I was walking around the city and had to rush back and explain I had added a night, and the woman behind the counter kept saying "YOU only have one night" WELL, make a long story sort odf shirt, she ,eant I only had onenight (This night) sso everything was OK. The Thai restaurant in the hotel is good AND reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Definately would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting SF”
Reviews.Author: dez069
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a trip to beautiful San Francisco. After a bit of research we booked at Parc 55 Wyndham. I must say after staying at other hotels in the same vicinty in the past, we were extremely impressed with this particular hotel. From the time we arrived to the day we departed we were treated with nothing but kindness. Hotel was accessable to the BART and shopping in Union Square. You can take the BART from the airport and be within one block of this hotel in no time at all. The room was better than expected and extremely clean. If I had to identify any downfall about Parc 55 Wyndham, it would that it has no pool...other than that it was exceptional. We will definatly be back.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: gilaga
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Rooms are spacious and clean. Hope for another opportunity to stay at the hotel.Amazing view from the room

Reviews.Title: “LOVED EVERYTHING- STAFF, ROOM, ETC.”
Reviews.Author: OscarColorado
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and the Parc 55 was a great place for us to start. The location was absolutely wonderful as it is convenient to BART, the F Line, major bus routes, and the cable car stop at the end of Powell Street. The room was very nice (obviously recently remodeled) and also comfortable and quiet. From the moment we arrived we were treated exceptionally well by the staff who were friendly and also extremely helpful with giving us tips on getting around and places to see. The location also provided a welcome respite from the major tourist attractions such as Fisherman's Wharf that are just a cable car ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: MelissaE50
Reviews.Content: The past year I have stayed at the Parc 55 at least once a month for over 4-5 days at a time. Each visit here is remarkable. These folks treat you as if you are home, the rooms are outstanding, great views,and very clean. You have access to all the shopping and food you could imagine or simply eat in the dinning area there. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Remarkable stays

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: JonW_62
Reviews.Content: Location is good - right in heart of teh city, but a little clos eto some neighbourhoods that are a little 'dodgy'. Car parking is extornionate - DON"T park there. there are garages in the area that will park you for literally 1/3rd of the price. Nothing actually wrong with the hotel, but it is expensive for what it is. Next time I would stay at teh Marriot close by - same price, but nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and modern - missing a little quirck and charm though”
Reviews.Author: D_Shi_12610
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, following a disastrous stay in Yosemite, where my husband got pneumonia. We left Yosemite early, came down the mountain cold, hungry, tired and in desperate need of pampering. And we got it. Parc 55 let us check in a day early at the same discount rate we had booked with months previously. They also upgraded us to a wonderful suite on the upper level floor with a gorgeous view. That first night we just snuggled in and relaxed! And magically, the next day, we were feeling much better! The breakfast option on the top floors is wonderful and plenty to get you started on a great, busy day of sight seeing. The rooms themselves are large and wonderfully luxurious. The view was absolutely amazing. The staff was also extremely helpful. One night, I asked one of the security guards to escort me to a nearby restaurant to pick up a late, late dinner. He was very helpful, and kind to do so. (I was afraid of getting lost by myself, and my husband was still sick as mentioned above). Overall, I have no complaints. It's a wonderful hotel with great staff and amenities. My only regret is that it was so modern and luxurious, it lacked the quirck and charm some of the older San Francisco hotels have that make me adore the city so much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: noegdurts
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Fran. The hotel was gorgeous and located in the heart of the Union Square area within walking distance to dining, shopping and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Street noise on the 12th floor? Yup!”
Reviews.Author: DarkHeineken
Reviews.Content: I specifically asked for a room without street noise, having read some yelps about this place and was assured I would be ok. I can sleep through noise, especially when I'm out of town, but damn...it was a lot. other than that, this place is pretty nice. The staff are rather oblivious to customers...I saw this many times to others and us. It could do better, especially at those rates. Oh, and $25/day parking? Welcome to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMoss6382
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in San Francisco celebrating our anniversary and having never been there before we picked a hotel based on the reviews of others; boy were we glad with our decision! We thoroughly enjoyed The Parc 55. Each person associated with the hotel that we interacted with was professional and quite helpful. Although it was probably a little farther from Fisherman's Wharf than we would have liked it was otherwise fairly centrally located. We would definitely stay here again and again. If you are in town this is a must stay at place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with large, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cpowers
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through a Priceline bid. The location is great, especially if you are taking public transportation. The BART took us from the airport to just across the street from the hotel (Powell St) for $8.10 per person. Buses and cable cars are also very close. Sarah was very pleasant and helpful at check-in as we requrested a king bed on a higer floor. The room was spacious and very clean. If attending a Giants game, you can easily take public transportation, or it is about a 40 minute walk. We did both. The only negatives are that the internet connection is slow (and you have to pay for it), and you can hear some noise from the other rooms/elevator, but it wasn't unbearable. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: mdmjw
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby and restaurant very nice and modern. Good fitness room with a lot of equipment and cool temperature. Room was large - like a suite, with large windows. Had been recently remodeled, but still reminded me of a Wyndham property (i.e. not the W). Rooms could have been more modern in feel. We received a nice welcome amenity (Wyndham rewards member) consisting of nuts, 6 sodas, waters. Right across the street from the train, so you won't need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Suite”
Reviews.Author: PSI31
Reviews.Content: We booked a Sunset Suite and we were surprised to be upgrade in the Presidential Suite! Beautiful city view from the top floor, huge living room with kitchenette, dining table, sofa chairs and big screen TV, hi-fi for iPod, work desk. Very nice room aavec quality beds. Very nice bathroom with Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, 2 separate toilets. Service quality and considerate. Fabulous stay ...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: njmom4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our four kids ages 16, 14,11 and 8 while on vacation for 2 nights. We had two rooms that were connecting. I was very impressed with the service as we pulled up, checked in and then delivered our bags to our room. The rooms were slightly small, but not too small. The location is great. You can walk or take whatever means of transportation you like. Everything is right there. I wasn't sure what to expect at this hotel, but I was really impressed with the service and would definitely stay here again. The rates were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, a Couple Things to Consider”
Reviews.Author: doctor16
Reviews.Content: Great Service, clean rooms, comfortable beds and covers. Amazing staff that was ALWAYS friendly and helpful. A doorman that gladly got you a cab when needed. The rooms could use a little more drawer storage and the rooms are starting to show a little age, but that is the extent of my complaints concerning the hotel. The location is great in terms of, you can take BART from the airport to the Powell Street Station for $8.10, and when you come out of the station, go up the stairs to your left, you are standing in front of the hotel. There is a mall across the street, and a cable car location a block away and several good places to eat all nearby. (Side Note: Get pizza delivered from Uncle Vitos one night, they deliver to the hotel quick and for free, and the pizza is even better than the Trip Advisor reviews for it!) The only draw back for this hotel is that it is in the SUPER BUSY Union Square location, where literally you can walk 1 block and get solicited for money from homeless people 5+ times.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, EXCELLENT LOCATION SHAME ABOUT THE RUDE CONCIERGE”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at the Parc 55. This is our 3rd time in SF but, our first stay at this hotel. We caught the BART in to the city from the airport after dropping our rental vehicle off. It takes about 20-30mins and is clean and very safe to use. The hotel is about a 5min walk from the Market Street / Powell Street station. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were friendly and helpful. We were in a standard room on the 14th floor. The room was spacious and clean with a good size bathroom. The king size bed was very comfy. There's a good selection of channels on TV, there's also a sofa and work station to work from. The only thing missing was a fridge/mini bar. A fridge is available but costs $35. Internet is reasonably priced at $14.95 for 24hrs. Previous reviews complained about the street noise. Whilst we could hear traffic throughout the day and night it wasn't bad enough to effect our sleep or request another room like other people have done. It is a central city hotel after all so expect some noise. We used the gym daily. There was a good selection of cardio and weight machines. Whilst the cardio equipment is okay and serves it's purpose, the machines are old, noisy and in need of an upgrade. The hotel is ideally located practically in the center of the city. The BART and trams are nearby, the Westfield shopping center opposite the hotel and Union Square is a 5-10min walk. The only issue we had with the hotel was Hanif the concierge. We found him to be rude and unhelpful. We initially thought he must be having a bad day but we encountered this behaviour a further two times on two separate occasions. Overall we found our stay to be excellent and highly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of San Fran”
Reviews.Author: bucket_list30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend. The location of the hotel is perfect for a tourist looking to be near major transportation and shops. However when we return we'll hopefully stay somewhere off the 'beaten path' as it can get a little crowded just outside the hotel with the trolly station. As the for hotel itself...it was great! Rooms were very clean and well maintained. The restaurant/bar was a nice amenity right off of the lobby for a pre-dinner cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CoastalCass
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my husband and I have stayed at Parc 55 and I must say we would go back in a heartbeat. The valet is steep but we expected that in San Francisco. The check in staff were very polite as well as helpful. Our room was clean and very spacious. This hotel is very close to a BART station and one of the trolley stops as well. My husband and I walked to the Starbucks, which was only a few block away, every morning to get our day started. If you want a hotel that is walking distance to restaurants, bars and shopping this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE - GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: maggie030
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked in here after an awful first night experience in another hotel in San Francisco! We arrived just after 9am and were greeted at reception by Erikka. We explained that we were on our 'trip of a lifetime' to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We arrived in SF late the previous evening, and had the worst hotel experience ever! On hearing this, Erikka was absolutely brilliant. She checked availability of rooms and appointed us a fabulous Bay View room on the 26th floor.The room was spacious, spotlessly clean and had everything required to make our stay memorable. We were really impressed with the level of customer service given to us. Erikka was an absolute gem and she is a credit to the hotel. During our stay in the city we took a ferry to Sausilito. Beautiful little place. Spotlessly clean with lots of good restaurants etc. We visited Fishermans Wharf and tried the famous Clam Chowder - delicious! We then queued for 2 hours for a cable car - boarded it and then had to jump off quickly as the clutch had snapped! It took quite a while to have it repaired so we decided to walk back to the hotel. Bad idea - we obviously looked as if we were lost (we were) and a lovely lady stopped to give us directions. Great to know that people will take the time out to help strangers to the city! We found eating out to be quite expensive but it no different to any other city. I would love to return to San Francisco one day and I would definately stay at Parc 55 @ Wyndham without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IMA7588
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square, Market St., and BART. Everything you expect from a reputable chain hotel - good service, clean room with nice amenities, pleasantly quiet despite the busy location. Found a great deal for $129/night for a king bed, sitting area, and great views of Union Sq.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Luckyforward
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! Service was excellent, rooms were fabulous. Special "shout outs" to Sarah and Mavis at the front desk and Joe, who insured that my PPT presentation worked at the conference where I presented. Even the bellman got an earlier airport shuttle for us than we originally booked. Had fun at the bar; wanted a Long Island Iced Tea and the bartender created a special version for us. Great first night promotion gave us a suite at a regular room price. Room for the rest of the week was just right: not too big, not too small. Only negative: $14.95 a day for wireless internet access is too expensive. Some complain about noise at the Parc: it's in the middle of the city! If you want want city noise, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_Owner_11
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in a standard room. We were on "standby" for a room in an upper floor for the view, but passed. The foggy weather wouldn't justify the added expense. The hotel is in a great location if you like to shop. Lots of great restaurants in the area. Amenities in the room were fine but not outstanding. You can take the Bart to the Powell St station from the airport and you're right there. Also the terminus of the cable cars is also there if you want to go to the Wharf. Biggest cons: internet charge of $14.95 a day. Please, in this day, it should be standard. Also, panhandlers are everywhere and can be a nuisance. This is a general problem for this city. It works against the tourism efforts, but they probably already know this.

Reviews.Title: “A great night in san Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ghsonoma
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful room with a outside deck that I could take pictures from .We sat outside in the chairs and had a nice bottle of wine before heading down to dinner.The room had a separate room for the bedroom with a awesome bed with lots of pillows.We slept like a baby.The staff was very helpful and the free continental breakfast was just perfect to get the day started.

Reviews.Title: “Good value room...but expensive everything else.”
Reviews.Author: joemackjoe
Reviews.Content: Can't best a $130 room downtown sf, but parking $48 plus tax? Wifi 15 per day? C'mon! Dont get me wrong, the hotel delivered on the room and great view for the price, but getting nicked takes its toll. Great for shopping downtown and very clean, just wish the "extras" came down a bit to get it in five circle status.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tobusy4fun
Reviews.Content: Ladies birthday celebration trip. There were four of us, so we wanted to be together but not in one room. Parc 55 had wonderful adjoining rooms, so we never missed a minute of gossip! When we all arrived, we were so impressed with the friendliness of the staff, and the hotel is beautiful. Very posh! The rooms were clean, nice and so were the bathrooms. The gym was much nicer than other hotel gyms that I have used. Would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travellinsusie
Reviews.Content: classy hotel, most comfortable beds and cannot beat the location in downtown. also used their conference rooms, though pricy was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “safe bet in the city”
Reviews.Author: Totality01
Reviews.Content: strange entrance, good views, good pricing. Great location for public transportation and cable car. Hotel parking expensive but unlimited 24hr access. can park for under $10 a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location and service....well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Lily0911
Reviews.Content: We chose Wyndham Parc 55 for it's location, familar brand name and recently renovated guest rooms. The entire experience exceeded our expectations. The location was perfect since we didn't want to stay at Fisherman's Wharf along with the thousands of other tourists and tourist shops but wanted to be in the heart of SF within easy walking to shopping, dining and most important...for our three kids....the start of the trolly car! We took the trolly car directly from Wyndham Parc 55 to Fisherman's Wharf then chose to walk back to the hotel which in itself was one of the highlights of our visit as we saw the city firsthand. The hotel was very clean and updated. The hotel concierge created a plan for us to see the city which was a huge help. We would highly recommend staying at Wyndham Parc 55. We used the hotel's parking garage which was a few more dollars than a local garage but we were able to go in and out at will and we didn't have to wait long for the car.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BronaghB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November last year (didn't join tripadvisor to this year, hence the delay). We were actually on our honeymoon and were supposed to be flying from Vegas to St Lucia but due to the hurricane had to make alternative plans. Since we had only got summer clothes with us, we didn't want to go anywhere too cold so it was basically a choice between San Francisco and LA. The hotel is clearly used as a stop over for plenty of airlines and has a dedicated check in for cabin crew. It is busy and impersonal. However, it is clean and the room was a decent size. On the first night we arrived, we decided to go for a walk. We walked out of the hotel doors, turned left and left again to go around the block. Not a good idea, since this went straight into one of the more dodgy areas of SF. Within a matter of minutes one of the local tramps had treated us to an impressive vocabulary. This hotel would be great for business travel. The restaurant is fine, the hotel is fairly central and the staff are efficient. However, we didn't especially enjoy our stay here and wouldn't come back.

Reviews.Title: “A decent home base”
Reviews.Author: fregien
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in San Francisco. Last time we stayed at the St. Francis. It was running about $400 for a room with a view for July 4th weekend, so I started looking for something more reasonable downtown. Park 55 sounded great. We booked through the hotel website and upgraded to a "view room" on the 24th floor. We took the BART from the airport, which has a stop right in front of the hotel. That was very convenient. Renting a car, driving in horrible San Fran. traffic, and paying crazy $50 parking fees didn't interest us. We spent about $60 in cab fare getting around the city for the entire 4 days. Anyways- Check-in went smoothly and the woman at registration was very pleasant. We headed to the elevator bank and waited with about 50 other people. After finally getting into the elevator with around 12 squished people, it took about 5 minutes to drop everyone at each floor. I thought- Uh Oh! My boyfriend is not a patient man... We arrived at our room, set directly behind the elevator and ice machine. I was a bit worried as many reviewers complained about the noise level. (Indeed there are a set of earplugs offered as an "amenity" in the room.) The room itself was fine- tastefully though blandly decorated. Our "view room" gave us a view of the city, though it looked out on the not so nice side of town. The bathroom was average- nothing special. The outlets and wallpaper look to be 25 years old, but the fixtures where relatively updated. After dropping our luggage, we went down to get a bite to eat. Another 10 minutes in the packed elevator, stopping at every floor.... and we were down. Cab service was convenient and always available out front. Overnight- The bed was comfortable enough. We didn't have any problems with elevator or ice machine noise, but there are always sirens at night from emergency vehicles. I think this is more prevalent as we were so close to the not so nice part of town. I am happy to say the elevator situation became much less busy during our stay, so either there was a big convention that left or maybe some elevators had been out of service. Who knows. Anyhow, if you need a hotel that is reasonably priced downtown, Park 55 isn't bad, but it certainly wasn't a luxury hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: juicylala
Reviews.Content: great hotel except for your next door neighbor(s) you can hear them talking and the TV and the outside noise was horrible. please wear your eye plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Very large, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rickpw
Reviews.Content: The hotel has 32 floors and about 1000 rooms. It is a block from Powell Street and conveniently located next to the Powell BART/MUNI station. The room was nice and contemporary. I stayed on the top floor and had great views. The breakfast buffet was good but over-priced (true of most hotels, to be fair). My only complaint was the noise coming from the room next door. Why do hotels have so many connecting rooms with only a door separating them? I got a good rate on quikbook.com for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it. What was that noise in the morning?!”
Reviews.Author: lorly_rivera
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Shopping & restaurants are within walking distance. Valet was close to $50.00 a night and internet $15.00. But who's keeping track, you're in San Francisco right? I had to call down for a mini-fridge and sewing kit because they're not kept in room. Housekeeping is prompt and courteous. Beautiful view of the city from the 12th floor.If you have a notebook you can connect it to the HDTV if you have the cables. We left the Hotel early in the morning when "speaker" testing began for almost 40 minutes non-stop. The sound was the equivalent of a fire alarm. When we returned to our room there was more testing. OMG! aside from that excruciating noise the stay was very classy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trey85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from our first trip to San Francisco. We stayed at Parc 55 and loved it! The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was clean and very modern. It took us 2 months to decide on a hotel, and I'm so happy that we chose Parc 55. We never spent more then $10 on a cab ride because it's located in the center of everything. If you are looking for great hotel and willing to pay a little more it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay I've Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: ReallyRick
Reviews.Content: After a very unexpected 4 day hospital stay upon arrival in San Francisco which caused me to miss one of the cities most famous events, I found myself at the Parc 55 for some rest and recuperation. I could not have been treated more fantastically by everyone on staff than I was! From the concern about my bandage by Wendy at the front desk to the personal, superior compassion and thoughtfulness shown by Julia, the hotel office manager and executive assistant I felt like a King in a grand castle! I hated to leave so much that now just 2 days later I am returning! You cannot go wrong at this property! The location is absolutely ideal for anyone visiting San Francisco with attractions, food, transportation and entertainment just steps away! Rooms are immaculate, beds comfortable and inviting, bathrooms and amenities are impeccable, business center and Internet computers around the hotel are extremely convenient and that staff goes above and beyond you ensure you feel as if you are truly a valued guest. Do not hesitate to stay at this premier hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice !!”
Reviews.Author: travel_nolimit
Reviews.Content: First impression of this hotel was it was admist all the buzzling downtown ! the cable tramps were just below the hotel. Rooms were good enough and best thing was that the rooms had humidifiers which people like us coming from asian countries for holidays there, deffinately need that. So thumps up to that !!!!!! :). Hotel was very busy. Guess it was in downtown area. Here again we booked 2 rooms as we are 4 adults, and the rooms were quite roomy. Staff and service was alright. I guess we asians expect a little more hospitable service when it comes to star hotels. But overall not bad as the location was good like the way we wanted it to be as we were there on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A standard business hotel, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: OsloKrisa
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is very good, but you pay the price too, so I wouldn't say it is excellent. It's location on the other hand is perfect, so we would choose it again just for that,.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in union square”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times since 2001 back when it was part of the Marriott family. I stayed there this past weekend for gay pride and it has been my first stay since they have joined Wyndham. This is my favorite hotel in Union Square due mainly to it's convenient location. Seeing I never go outside the city when I am in SF, I have no need for a car and take cabs or bart/muni. It is very easy to find a hotel and coming from the SFO, it is only a $8 BART fare and all you have to do is go up the escalator from the bart station and cross the street and you are at the hotel. Same if you need to use the muni. The rooms are good sized for that area and recently renovated. This past stay I had a really nice corner room. The by request welcome gift waiting in my room was very nice, a couple diet cokes were waiting for me on ice when I entered the room at checkin along with a couple bottled waters and a generous tray of organic fresh fruit. I have seen others complain about the internet speed but I had no problems with it. I used my IPAD to connect and the speed was fine. One thing that was sort of a pain was having to create an account to log on and having to log on again every time I wanted to use my IPAD and it would never recognize the user name and password and I would have to create a new account. At other Wyndham properties, I just had to enter my byrequest number for the access. Staff was great this stay as always. I never rent a car in SF, but I am told parking is very expensive at the hotel and is valet only, so if you have a car, the parking charges could be a drawback. Also noise can be an issue, I was on the 17th floor and heard a lot of street noise, but it is in a very busy location and they do provide ear plugs if someone wants them.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star hotel for its value”
Reviews.Author: keonigaspar
Reviews.Content: I always stay here at the Parc 55. I am a Wyndham rewards member, and for the longest time Wyndham never had a property in the Union Square area in San Francisco. Recently 2 years ago, Wyndham bought out the Parc 55. It is a fairly priced 5-star hotel, but priced as a 3 or 4 star hotel. Rooms are big for San Francisco. Other hotels have rooms that are 150-200 square feet. The Parc 55 is a well 250-300 square feet, flat screen tv's, ipod hookups, marble bathrooms, plush bedding, and rooms all with a stunning view for the price. Rooms are very quiet, cant hear any neighbors all the times that I have stayed there. I have stayed here maybe 6 times in the last 2 years and love this hotel. Perfect location above the BART station, in union square. The only bad thing is no pool, and parking is $65 which is average for hotels in the city but I usually take BART to the city and park at SFO. All the employee's are very accomidating. Best 5 star hotel for the money. Usually its $150-$200 a night compared to the other 5 star hotels which are usually $200-$300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Business with family along for a great trip”
Reviews.Author: Lbh1478
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We enjoyed our stay the staff was wonderful and knowledgable of places to see and the best food. It was a bit noisy at times but we managed to live with it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice accommodations in SF”
Reviews.Author: ltangelo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and the rooms well-appointed. The location was good - we like to walk, and could see many sights on foot. My only complaint is that free wi-fi would have been nice. We "hotwired" the room, so the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: KOC44
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and was so pleasantly surprised with this hotel! Great service and great location! Clean rooms, free breakfast, great pool! Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hung_La
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. Our room was huge and had a nice panoramic view of the city. Situated directly opposite the Westfield Shopping mall, its location is ideal for anyone who would like to explore the city and the many fine restaurants SF has to offer. Excellent value for money and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great location/excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bagman3914
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. Easy access to SFO with BART just outside the entrance. Union Square area, lots of shopping, restaurants within walking distance, including Chinatown. 1 block to the Cable Car. The rooms were spacious, clean and updated with widescreen TV. The concierge staff was very friendly and had consistently good recommendations. We did not eat in their restaurants but they had a great breakfast option in the lobby where you could get 3 items for $5 - Starbucks coffee, bagels, croissants, danish, fruit. great quick way to start the day. We had a great rate thru Wyndham on line specials. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mccainmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel before it became a Wyndham about 2 years ago. Close to a lot of shopping /dining options and also close to the convention center. Hotel is very clean and comfortable. Only meal I had there was breakfast which was just OK for $26 which is most likely low for San Francisco. They did have a very nice scones.....I had 2 complaints regarding this hotel. One is there is no coffee in the guest rooms!!!! I can't remember the last time I did not get coffee in a guest room. The second one was that we had to schlep very large packages to an upper level for FedEx pick-up and trust me this was simply not very convenient and this was after I had been told by the bellman to just bring it to them on ground level and they would handle. When we took to the bellstation as directed, we were told we had not been given correct info. Once we found the location to ship the packages had to wait forever for someone to come to handle.....very inconvenient. The shipping is handled by the A/V company which is contracted service.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our club room”
Reviews.Author: CY83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park 55 at the beginning of June 2011 and had a club room. The location in down town was great as you can easily reach your favourite tourist attractions from there. The club room was nice and spacious. It was very clean and we had a great view. The club lounge offered snacks, free soft drinks during special times in the day/week. The view from the lounge is even better than the view from the room. When available, you have to enjoy a wine up there (they charged for the alcoholic beverages). We also tried the main bar near the reception which was for us a little too full of corporate people. It suits people who like it a bit more buzz. The breakfast at the lounge was superb. It included healthy fruits, muesli, toast, Starbucks coffee and more. The staff in the club room was very attentive and helpful. The only thing which was not so good, was the Internet connection. It should have been better especially as we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, average service/amentities.”
Reviews.Author: em5585
Reviews.Content: The location is the only reason this gets a "Very Good" rating instead of "Average" because the location is just that good. Right in the Union Square area and just steps away from the Westfield in SF. BART is located right out the doorway of the hotel which is good and bad, but there were always several BART police cars parked right nearby. The cable car stop is also right outside. Shopping and food choices were great for someone there working most of the day. Other than the location and the fact that the hotel looked upscale, everything else was pretty average. Maybe it is because I don't ever stay in SF, but hotel parking was pretty ridiculous ($48/day + tax) and so were internet charges ($14.95 per day or around $50-60 per week). No fridge in the room and housekeeping kept turning my A/C off so it was always really stuffy when I came back to the room (temps were around 70, so fairly warm for SF). I did like the Bath & Body Works amenities. I was supposed to get a "view" room but ended up on the 9th floor, which didn't really seem to qualify in my opinion. My room definitely reeked like pot one day but it was gone by the time I got back from work luckily. The fitness center was good, with lots of machines to choose from. The other bad thing was the walls seemed pretty thin. My room was the first one by the elevators, so I could hear a lot going on. They do give you earplugs in the rooms. On the 9th floor I couldn't hear much ground/traffic noise other than sirens. Bed was pretty firm and not that comfortable for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Key”
Reviews.Author: kcribb1
Reviews.Content: San Fransisco is one of my favorite cities in the US to visit. Got his hotel on Priceline ($78) during a trip for 49ers and Buccaneers game. I was very skeptical when I was "assigned" this hotel but after arriving I discovered it was prime real estate. Everything I needed was at the door step of the hotel: Metro station, shopping, cable cars, and restaurants. I would stay here again without hesitation. Dottie's True Blue Cafe is around the corner (get there early) and the food was fantastic as advertised on Food TV's Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. Also, I definitely recommend Momma's on Washington Square for breakfast. The place is small and the line can be long but it is worth the wait!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: jh12349
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 and had a great time. The hotel was very accomodating and allowed me to check in early. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and eager to please. Ericka at the front desk was super friendly, super nice and just a wonderful person overall.

Reviews.Title: “Falling in love with San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: cjsmith_11
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a night at the Parc 55 Wyndham in San Francisco arriving on Monday, June 12 and leaving on the following day. I booked the room through priceline a couple hours before arriving, however when i made it to the front desk I was told that there were some technical difficulties with their systems and computers and that I would be given my room as soon as available. While I was waiting Ericka from the front desk routinely checked on me, offering me something to drink and doing all she could to make me feel comfortable. After a very short wait, she called me back to the front desk and personally took care of the matter and put me into a gorgeous room facing the bay. Since then, she has gone far above normal duties making my stay as easy and smooth as possible. She and Rhodora have made my stay so great that one night was simpy not enough and stayed the entire week. I spend half the year in hotels and this is the first one that I've felt obligated to comment on. Thank you to all the staff. I look forward to visiting again very soon. Christian Smith rm 2219 7/12/11-7/18/11

Reviews.Title: “Best location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VitalSpring
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about the Parc 55 Wyndham was the location. If you are planning on taking BART from the SF airport, get off at the Powell station, and the hotel is literally across the street from the station. So if you're lugging a suitcase, that's very convenient. No trekking up hills or through the downtown area. You just take the stairs up from the BART/Muni station and cross the street to the hotel. And then whenever we went out, we were so close to the station, so it was just fabulous. The hotel itself is very nice. We've stayed at the Hilton Union Square too, and the Wyndham is more updated and nicer. Once you check in, you never see the front desk people again because you enter the hotel on a different level, but that's okay. The rooms are spacious. You do get a lot of street noise. We were on the 26th floor, so even that high up, you could hear drunk people singing down at Union Square, but I don't think that's the hotel's fault. Overall, the location made this hotel perfect, and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: melhojo
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I didn't know what to expect from this hotel based upon the reviews that I read on TripAdvisor. Staying in San Francisco is expensive, and we got a great deal on this hotel. Overall, I'm glad we stayed here. We were kind of frantic when we arrived at the hotel because we were due to return our rental car any minute (we had just arrived from Sonoma), but we wanted to drop our stuff of first. The staff helped us unload the car and get in and out quickly so we could take care of business. While some people on here claim that the hotel looked dated, it looked nice and modern to me, but hey, what do I know? The room was a size that you would expect for a major city, maybe even a little bigger. There were no king bed rooms available yet when we arrived, so I took a 2 double bed room rather than wait. It was less comfortable, but it was my own choice I guess. There was some street noise (we were on the 14th floor), but no more than you would expect from staying in a downtown area of a major city, and not anything that would keep you from falling asleep if you're at all acustomed to urban living. If you want total peace and quiet, why on earth would you stay in downtown San Francisco? The location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing. The cable car, street cars, buses and the BART are all within a block of the hotel. You can walk to Chinatown, Union Square and City Hall. It simply could not have been easier for us to get around the city. Some people on here complained about the neighborhood. San Francisco has a homeless problem. It's not a secret. From what I observed though, the problem is all over the city, and not just in the area surrounding the hotel. If you exercise common sense and ordinary street smarts, you should be fine. Or you can just stay in a hotel by Fisherman's Wharf and not leave Fisherman's Wharf (but why on earth would you want to do that?). Or you can just not go to San Francisco. There were a few things that irked me. On the first day, housekeeping inexplicably took all of our towels but didn't replace any. We had to call down for towels. This did not happen again, though. Also, I am a Wyndham Rewards member, and should have been entitled to perks like free wi-fi, free domestic calls and a welcome basket. None of that was given or offered to me, although I admit that I didn't ask either. We did have a good experience with the conceirge. My husband wanted to go to this restaurant he had seen on the Food Network. All he knew of the place was that it was on Food Network, they served roast beef, and the outside is colorful. The concierge knew exactly where he was talking about and gave us directions for walking and by bus. Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: mtntrvlr
Reviews.Content: Good location, very close to transit and great shopping. Took a cab from the airport instead of BART because the plane was very late and was traveling with older family members. Cab ride was only $35 to and from the airport. Hotel is close to all of the union square shopping, less than one mile from China Town, and we used the "F" street car stop to access Ferry building market place, Fishermans' Warf, etc.. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, and service was prompt. Try not to park at the hotel - the fees are $48/night + tax. There are other lots around town that are a better deal and you really don't need a car in SF unless traveling to Napa. Also, the neighborhood west of the hotel is not very nice - stick to the areas north and east towards Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Bedrooms ok, meeting space nothing special, internet dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Pro-Travel-Buyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week beginning of June for a company meeting. Hotel bedrooms are on par with a Holiday Inn from the 80's so major updating needed, no minibar, cheap coffee machine, internet both wifi and cable failed to work when the hotel had many clients staying and working in the hotel. Bathrooms tired and toiletries standard for a 2/3 star hotel (no molton brown,gilcrist & soames or anyone else of quality here). Didn't experience breakfast in the restaurant apart from during our early morning meetings, served infront of the meetings room, pretty disappointing. The lunch that was served was ok, no complaints there. Time to raise the level/standing at the hotel, needs a refit and major rework /investment as hotel is not in the best location (right on edge of Tenderloin-bit dodgy area) and to command the rates it charges, it needs to raise the bar. Advice, San Francisco is noisy , hotel is not double glazed and they supply ear plugs for you, so request a room as high up as possible and if possible on the quiet side (if it exists).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and style but with street noise!”
Reviews.Author: Bronail
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large, clean and comfortable. Room service is fast and friendly. Dining is in a fun area. Our room faced Ellis street which is a late night venue w lots of traffic, so use the ear plugs (only one set provided in bathroom). Would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: funkymusic
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice looking lobby but the rooms are in desperate need of a make over. Very old hardware in the bathrooms, dim lighting, no refreshment bar, a charge of $5 for a bottle of water, and dingy. The flat screen TV is nice but beware that when you turn it on it immediately defaults to "On Demand" movies and pay television. I ordered a movie while I was trying to find a news channel. Reception took the charge off of my bill but I had to have directions over the phone how to use the remore properly. There are no directions in the room. Service is just average in this hotel. If you get a low rate you can probably put up with the less than wonderful surroundings and average service but San Fran has so many wonderful properties it would be a shame to waste your time here. There is a wonderful Italian restaurant across the street - Puccinni & Pinetti where you can get a good meal with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for more in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: travlinandyjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day Weekend and were blown away. We visit San Francisco Often and have usually taken to the boutique hotels but got a great deal on the Parc 55. This hotel is about two blocks from Union Square and one block from the Cable Cars. There is a shopping mall across the street and bart/muni are just outside the front doors. You are right on Market Street so there is shopping and eating galore. The service of the staff was excellent. We were always greeted at the door and everyone truly seemed to be enjoying what they did. Our room was on the 27th floor facing Twin Peaks and blew us away. Room was clean and spacious (for San Francisco it was Huge!) Bathroom was also pretty large. Big TV in room and all the other amenities you expect from a hotel. **Tip - Parking is expensive in San Francisco. We called ahead and were told that parking was $55 a night. Upon arrival we learned it was $45 a night. I would recommend just paying the hotel parking rate. If you intend on parking in a local garage, you may end up paying for it in other ways. You are only a few blocks from the Tenderloin and some of the garages in this area don't seem to be very secure. The Parc 55 Whyndam puts you right in the middle of all the action in San Francisco and if you want to experience other parts of the city, you are a short ride away on public transportation or via cab. We were impressed and will very likely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: GeeGeew00t
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent. It's close to all sort's of public transport which makes travelling around San Francisco a breeze. Could do with more counters at the reception desk. Checked in the day before the Zazzle Bay to Breakers Run and the queue at the reception desk was long. However there was a supervisor on site to talk to guests which sort of negated the frustrated feelings one would get when a queue does not move. Room was cosy, The room service excellent (the chocolate coins is a nice touch). The WiFi however I felt was a bit of a letdown considering I paid good money for it with the slow connection being my main gripe. The breakfast service at the Exclusive Club Lounge was so-so. Could do with a larger selection of food. Despite my gripes I still think this hotel deserves a Very Good rating as the location, the cosiness of the rooms and the friendliness of the staff makes my stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms great value”
Reviews.Author: jmfox1985
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting this hotel for $110/night after bidding on Priceline. It ranks, to date, as one of the best Priceline values I've ever gotten. The standard rates are reasonable too and I would pay the advertised rate for a room here (which is not something I often say). The staff was incredibly pleasant and check-in was a breeze. The lobby is strange (on the second floor), but very nicely appointed. We had a room on the 7th floor that wasn't huge (which is to be expected in SF), but space was used very well. We had a decent view considering our room was on a lower floor. The room was clean, comfortable (great bed) and even a bit stylish. While we never ate at any of the on site restaurants, we heard good things. The reason we never ate on site is due to the location. It's very good. It's immediately adjacent to the Powell St. Transit hub (BART, Muni Metro, F-Line- Buses and yes, the Cable Car all right there). It's a great jumping off point for tourists, and also ideally located for business travelers. It's about 2-3 blocks to Union Square and shopping. A nice, easy walk. As has been noted, the Union Square area quickly transitions into the seedier tenderloin. While I never felt unsafe at the Park 55 (the entrances are strategically oriented towards Powell Station and Union Square while turning their back on the Tenderloin), you'll encounter some panhandlers (who congregate around transit hubs and busy areas) without a doubt. This is true no matter where you stay in San Francisco. It should be noted, that the Tenderloin isn't as horrible as it's often made out to be. I've been to a few good bars over there and had some great eats (late night tacos without going to the Mission). In fact, I'd go so far as to say it has a unique flavor/character all of its own. Still, it's not what most tourists want to see when they visit SF and it IS right next door. A bit of advice. San Francisco is a walking city and has good public transit. Parc 55 is right on a transit hub too. Parking in downtown SF can be expensive. I would suggest NOT renting a car for the duration of your stay (you will pay $35+/night to park downtown) and renting one only for when you need it (i.e. a 2-day window where you head to Napa or down to Monterey/Carmel). There are a bunch of car rental places (everything from the big chains like National, Budget, Enterprise, etc. to smaller, local companies) within a block or two of the Parc 55. Save money on nightly parking and only rent on the days that you NEED a car. When you're in the city, you won't need one. In the end, Parc 55 is a great hotel and pretty reasonably priced (even if you don't use priceline/hotwire). It's wonderfully located. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromBadgerState
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my daughter for a conference at the Moscone Center. We found this hotel to be conveniently located, clean and well cared for. Make sure the little vent on the bottom of the window is closed securely--we had terrible street noise the first two nights and I believe the vent may have been partially open. Hardly saw anyone in the hallways, staff was friendly. We were disappointed with the selection of local dining options. There is a great little cafe/pub a block south that I HIGHLY recommend. This hotel definitely needs free wireless in the rooms and a minifridge/micro. With the limited food options nearby, this would be a great feature. Jasmine at front desk was wonderful at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideAC
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Hotwire for this place. Hotel is nice and great location. We stayed for 4 nights on the 15th floor. Checkin was quick and easy. Rooms were fairly small but nice. Comfortable king size bed with flat screen tv. Only problem was the noise. Paper thin walls. First night two ladies sytaying next to us coming back at midnight and up at 6am talking normal could be heard very clearly. Even heard a story bout some family member in Dallas!?? We yelled at them to shut up a couple of times but it fell on deaf ears. Asked to switch rooms the next day but nothing available as it was Memorial Day long weekend. I guess thats why they supply ear plugs in the bathroom. Outside noise wasnt too bad. Yeah the sirens and street sweeper at 3am sucked but it is right in the middle of the city. I just turned on the aircon fan all night to drown out alot of the noises and that helped to get good sleep. Having to pay $15 a day for internet is a joke but there is free internet in the business centre and on the 2nd floor. Apart from this and the paper thin walls, this place is ok

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay A Few Things To Say”
Reviews.Author: MyAbundance
Reviews.Content: I live in SF so this was sort of a out-of-street stay. The Parc has good package deals and the location is right in the middle of Union Square. For tourists I imagine this to be ideal. You cannot hear the street noise which is a huge bonus, atlease from the higher floors. I also recomment a corner room, goes without saying. Union Square is obviously bustling and a great many things to do around the hotel and BART and MUNI are directly below at Powell and Market with several surface entrances. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jjones4180
Reviews.Content: Hotel check in was easy and effecient. I needed a refrigerator for medication storage and thanks to Donna at the customer service, it was noted in my reservation. The refrigerator was delivered within 10 minutes of my check in. Also the house keeping woman stopped by about 15 minutes after my check in to make sure I had everything I needed. The bed was comfortable and I did not hear any street noise. I was suprised that the hotel had a 13th floor which I was on. The room was average size and the shower drained a liitle slow. I was surprised they had no Kiosk to print bording passes in teh lobby however the concierge offered to print it from his computer. Overall the hotel was a good choice and the price was less than other hotels. I will probably be staying here again in October when I travel to San Francisco with Friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of SF in a spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: mzmelanie
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this isn't your typical review of Parc 55. I stayed in a suite on the 31st floor. And let me tell you, the views are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!! The suite was huge.. master bath w/ jacuzzi, enormous half bath, fax, sitting area, dining table, desk in room, mini bar/kichenette. There was 4 of us but you could easily sleep 8-10. Pros: spacious suite, VERY clean, comfortable rollaway/cot (I didn't get to try out the bed), True Blue Spa (Bath & Body Works) products, =) I *love* the little vent thingie under the windows... can breathe fresh air any time. Con: The TV remote didn't always work (may just need new batteries). Gets a little noisy even that high up. Expected tho since it IS downtown. Their solution.. provide earplugs! Awesome. =) Concierge Lounge: Hor d'ourves -- soda, Starbucks coffee, crab cakes, artichoke/veggie dish, various cheese & crackers, fruit. Dessert -- lemon meringue cake, cookies. Slept in so didn't get to check our continental breakfast. =( My favorite memory: Coming back from spending the day downtown and finding a box of Le Helge chocolate on the bed.... and on the dining table.... complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries!!! =) HEAVEN. I do have one suggestion though for the manager (should they ever read this): PLEASE invest in a full size mirror. It can easily go in one of the bathrooms or in the bedroom. Us girls love to do a head-to-toe outfit check before we head out on a night (or day) out in the town. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Calle77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smack in the middle of it all! A few minutesâ€™ walk to the Moscone Center and 5-10 minutesâ€™ walk to Union Square. Public transportation to the rest of the city is easy accessible. The entrance and lobby area can seem a little hectic, but overall I enjoyed my stay here. Check-in was smooth and the concierge a good help. Rooms are large and clean and beds are comfortable â€“ I slept like a baby. Only drawback was the WIFI fee of $ 14,95 for 24hrs use â€“ I just donÂ´t get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JSpaulding
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for a getaway night for our anniversary. We live in the suburbs and were looking for a "night out on the town." The staff was very helpful and responsive. The hotel is a couple blocks to Market Street, Cable Car turn around, and Union Square. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We were on the 6th floor so we did hear some traffic noise but this is SF. Got a deal on the hotel and would stay here again. If you are looking for a getaway or a hotel close to a few areas then you should look into the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wagales
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a convetion at the Moscone Center. Parc 55 is an excellent location. You can walk there in ten minutes. I had breakfast every morning and the staff was very pleasant. During the evening you can walk to dozens of restaurants of all types, and when you have leisure time, the cable car is100 feet from the hotel. Unon Square is a ten minute walk. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking...”
Reviews.Author: snlpacific
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for our 10 year wedding anniversary and upgraded to a "King view room". When we reserved I even made sure to request "a great view room please" as this was a special occasion and we we paying full price for a lengthy 5 day stay. However, once we got to our room we realised we were on the bare minimum floor to be considered a "view room" (25th) and because we were the first room off the elevator and in the wing of the hotel, our view was half obscured by the adjacent wing and our privacy was close to nill! When we went to the window to admire the view, several times the room next door had people standing looking out their window too, the rooms across in the other wing waved at us. There was no privacy. We called down to front desk see if we could be switched to a different room due to the view blockage, privacy issue, etc... all they offered is the room directly below ours, which wouldnt be considered a "view room" which we paid a preimium for, or a room with 2 double beds on the same floor, which also was no acceptable as we were there for our anniversary. We were so disappointed as there was no way the hotel was full and we were there for 5 days and paid ALOT of money to stay there. The view and location we good but there are other choices that would be comparable. The lobby is beautiful but once you get to the rooms, they are standard, nothing special, except for the view. We feel there was no perks staying here and felt nickel and dimed. They charge a ridiculous fee of $15 a day for internet access that you can get at a hostel or Comfort Inn for free! Seems crazy that a hotel is still charging for what has become standard service in most other hotels. Also they charge $4.50 for the Aquafina bottled water in your room. Parking $50 a day. We were disappointed with there in room coffee as well as it is individual 1-cup-at-a-time deals and ordering a pot of coffee in was over $12! Breakfast prices were outlandish. I made a direct long distance call home (Canada) and for 69 seconds I was charged $12! The walls between rooms are really paper thin. Several times we were woken up by the neighbouring room flipping over in bed. There is alot of noise from the street below, but we didnt mind that as it is apart of the city life we came to experience. The king bed was fine, but they give you 3 standard size floppy pillows and then 3 ginormous cushions that are far too big to try to sleep with and we ended up chucking them on the floor everyday. All in all the hotel is fine, but not worth the $$ they charge, and then to be charged for every extra thing that comes standard in many other places, left a bad taste in our mouth. We were really very disappointed that they didn't try to be more helpful with finding us a better room considering we were staying there for a good stretch of time and we made it clear we were celebrating a special occasion. I was also put off by the $15 a day internet charge, charge for local calls, charge, charge charge.
