On general principle I refused to pay for the internet and went to the mall right across the street and used their FREE wifi.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly2010_10
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a sisters trip to San Francisco. Â We stayed at the Parc 55. Â Upon arrival we walked right up to the desk Â with not wait,and Daniel Jones checked us in. Â Daniel was very helpful and informative. Â He instantly upgraded our room to Â club level, and gave us a list of great restaurants and thing to do. Â  We stay on the 28th floor in room 2814, the goal was to stay on the highest level possible to reduce the city noise. Â The room was nice for San Francisco, and we had a great view of the city. Â  Being on the club level was nice because we had access to breakfast, snacks for lunch, and cocktail and dessert in the evening free of charge. Â  The only problem that I have with this hotel is the $48.00 charge for parking. Â During our stay we had a total of a little over $300.00 in parking charges. Â I think that this is a rip off. Â  In a conclusion I would stay at this hotel again only if I got free parking or a reduced rate in parking. Â Although everything else was good, the parking took the cake. Â So beware if you are parking your car there. Also, I would like to say again that Daniel did a great job making our stay great. Â

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with some great staff”
Reviews.Author: Shirlene5757
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for shopping last Thanksgiving. Picked Parc 55 because of its location and it used to be one of our corporate hotels. I chose Pacc 55 even without our usual corporate discount because we love the location and service. The response and service from Donna from the reservation dept has always been consistently great. I had some issues with billing and I had to get through Donna to get a response. Although she is from reservation and not billing, she tried to help me get a resolution from the relevant dept. Unfortunately, i did not get any resolution but i decided not to pursue the case because the service from the hotel is overall still satisfactory. A plus point is the internet connection is reliable (although you need to pay) - impt as i am required to work even when im on holidays. We are from Singapore and a little obsessed with cleanliness and glad that the room was very clean when checked in and throughly tidied every day. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and did their job very well. The staff were attentive and quick to help. When we were checking out one day at 5am, the staff on duty was quick to help us get a taxi and help us with the bags (and it was raining that morning) Beside having some issues with the billing, our stay in Parc 55 was great and enjoyable.. I am planning a trip to SFO again this month and will stay wiith Parc 55 again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. Generally pretty good. The rooms with a decent view face Union square but they are also noisier at night. PROS: - Fantastic Location with a Muni/BART terminal at the front door and many shops around. - Very friendly and courteous service from Front Desk Staff. - Decent Fitness Centre - Free internet access in Business Centre CONS: - Breakfast quite expensive and service not very good. No omlette included in buffet which is pretty standard with most US hotels. - The lobby and restaurant has obviously had a refurbishment but rooms and corridors could definitely do with one also. Though rooms are clean and comfortable. - i was jetlagged with the UK/west coast time change and was asleep/awake quite odd times. I was really disappointed that there was no Room Service between midnight and 6am. I wasnt expecting the full menu but at least the option of sandwiches or SOMETHING...even if it was something delivered from outside the hotel. But absolutely nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible attitude”
Reviews.Author: allancsn
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the first thing the clerk said was she would change our booking as we must have got a king bed in error. We hadn't - we're a couple who like to sleep together - but that wasn't right in her eyes. Not the bigotted attitude I expect from a 4 star international hotel- especially in San Francisco. When I told her the booking was correct she looked annoyed and then proceeded to give us a room set up for disabled clients without telling us - I phoned down to complain as we were not willing to stay for our six days in a room with no bath tub and hand rails all over the place. Guess what we got the same clerk who huffed and puffed about the hotel being short of king bedded rooms and then allocated us another room this time with a connecting door - which I find really creepy - again without tellingus and making us feel she was doing us a big favour. We asked to be moved again and again over the next three days and we're given the run around - on the third day I was promised a call from a manager - never happened though. We just gave up in the end as it was clear they reception staff didn't give a damn about us being unhappy and made us feel thet they didn't want us to be there. The hotel itself has seen better days and feels tired - the rooms are cramped and the room seating isn't sufficient for two adults to sit unless one sits on the bed. The lack of free wi fi is amazing in this day and age - the weird thing is you could stand outside and get free access but not in the rooms. The area is full of beggars durung the day and turns really scary at night. All in all I'd say avoid and stay somewhere that gives a damn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmantexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife on a weekend adventure in San Francisco. Perfect location, beautiful room, and great service. This is our second stay here, and we love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BryceReading
Reviews.Content: Being located right by the cable car this hotel couldn't be in a better position for seeing San Francisco. The room was clean and the shower was great. Staff were also very friendly and helpful.The fitness centre was well-equipped. I would definitely stay here on my next visit. Great hotel, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, comfortable beds, windows that allow fresh air”
Reviews.Author: gregnashleigh
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 accepted our bid via price line. We weren't familiar with them and after looking at some of the reviews on trip advisor, i have to admit, we were a bit concerned. I know there can be various experiences at the same hotel, but sometimes I wonder if some of these reviews are done by other competing hotels as a smear campaign because we didn't experience any of the problems that others have written about. Location- one of the best! Steps to the trolly car(must do in Sf), buses and train to the airport. Yes there are homeless people around the block ( not outside the front door), but this is seen in a lot of big cities. San Fran seems to be a city that allows panhandling to happen more than most, but it's not dangerous and you can keep walking Staff- very friendly and accommodating. My wife is fighting cancer alternatively so she needs to have a clean possibly hyper allergenic room and a fridge for her supplements and specialized food. She called parc 55 and explained her need for thos things plus a quiet room since and they put us in one of their 'pure' rooms. This is A Hyperallergenic room that has a medical grade air purifier in it. This was huge for us. They also put us on the 19th floor so road noise was not an issue. They also delivered a minifridge minutes after we asked for it. Thanks to Winnie For helping to make our stay a great one! Pure Rooms- very clean, very comfortable bed, decent layout, great views. Furniture is not super modern,but they do have flat screens with a ton of channels including movie channels. Business center- was able to scan a doc to my thumb drive at no cost. Windows- we love fresh air and most high rise hotels do not have windows that open. The parc 55 has a luver at the bottom Of each window that Allows fresh air to come in. Simple, but Great invention! We are heading back to SF today and we hope to get lucky with our price line bid and get the Park 55 Wyndham again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing! Poor service, dated accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Discerning12385
Reviews.Content: Decided to reserve a club room so I could get daily breakfast, evening dessert, soft drinks and snacks in the afternoon, etc... Upon checking in, the front desk clerk said I was a club guest but then proceeded to put me on a NON-club floor. The interior decorations look very 90s, the bathtub is out of the 60s, so I called to ask if there was a renovated floor. The operator said all the rooms were recently renovated (yikes!), and only the club floor rooms are bigger. Telling him my room was small, he said that I was not on a club floor. Then told him I paid for a club floor room, he checked my reservation, said I was correct and put me in touch with someone in the executive offices. She quickly told me I should have gotten a club floor room and would send someone to move my belongings. A bellman soon came to the door. My belongings were waiting, basically in easily movable form, and he told me he wouldn't move my shoes. What? He told me I had to pack them up. He had a giant travel cart and couldn't put my shoes on it? So I took a laundry service plastic bag and packed them up. He finally took them. I arrived on a Thursday night, so I enjoyed the gym and then got some sparkling water in the club room. It is then that I see the placard stating that EVERYTHING except breakfast is UNAVAILABLE Friday through Sunday. No dessert, no free soda, no quiet views - nothing that I paid for except breakfast. That should be stated in large letters before one books through the website or any vendor. Finally, to add insult to injury, I woke up Sunday morning around 9:30 am and got to the club room breakfast at 9:45, 15 minutes before the place was closing. The pickings were slim. No more bagels, no more croissants, the dregs of yogurt. So I asked if there were any more croissants, and the Wyndham employee looked at me like I had asked him to donate the contents of his wallet to me. It seems to me that I paid for this breakfast, and everything should be available at the end of the meal time as it was at the beginning. The Ritz Carlton makes sure everything is filled consistently from beginning to end at the club rooms. This was a disappointing hotel experience from beginning to literal end. I am typing this in the club room at this very moment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MacAlex1975
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, newly renovated lobby and restaurant, comfortable sleep, excellent location right next to Union Square. Only complaint is the gym, most of the cardio machines are broken and no-one at the hotel seems to care!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: klingerkrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Extremely nice staff members. We enjoyed our stay very much and the location was within walking distance to many great San Francisco sights!!!! Room was spacious and large bathroom as well. If I ever go back to San Francisco, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls make for an unpleasant night”
Reviews.Author: Westlakeguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for a conference, at which I was a speaker. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor, and the hotel check-in person said she had a "very nice" room for me--#2511. The room had a terrific view, but the room was small and more importantly, the walls were paper thin. I was awakened by the guy in the next room at 1 a.m. speaking (in a normal voice) on the phone, and then again at 6 a.m. It wasn't his fault because I could hear he was using a normal voice, but the walls are obviously paper-thin. If you must stay at this hotel, make sure that you at least don't get a room that connects to another with double interior doors. In addition, several personnel insisted on having conversations outside my room (which was small) early in the morning. Also, the bathroom sink drained very poorly, and it was not cleaned well: there was mold on the grout in the shower walls. The hotel is designed to cater to airline crew (they have a special airline check-in desk) and large tour groups--I saw a coach with 50+ suitcases in the downstairs lobby, so they clearly don't expect to need to cater to repeat business. While the location was excellent, the price reasonable, and the bed comfortable, I was glad I only had to stay one night.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD, RUDE, NOTHING SPECIAL!”
Reviews.Author: afficionada23
Reviews.Content: i thought the hotel will be sexy and trendy, it was just average. the worst part is, it is extremely LOUD there. you are in the middle of the city, yes. however, i always stay in centers and have never experienced such thin walls and such drunken screams from outside. we were on the 9th floor right by the elevator, there was construction and the men spoke right in front of our door, LOUDLY. when i called to complain about a broken light bulb and the fact that my room was cleaned when i put the "do not disturb" sign on, i was told, i didnt put it on, ummm, why would i lie about that? i suggested for them to give me 1 morning of free bfast and that didnt go anywhere. at check out, no one asked me how the stay was. there are better hotels in the area, im sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SavingMama
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The price is high. I was on the 28th floor and could hear the garbage trucks arriving at 4am! Then the jackhammering started later and could be heard throughout my meetings. The food and bar was great and really enjoyed being a mom away for a few days! I was able to reconnect with a former coworker and she showed me around her hometown. We had some great dinners out and went to the Italian part of town for late night desserts and espressos. I even got to ride a cable car-so much louder than I anticipated! However, the city is so expensive and very dirty. Beggars/handicapped/homeless people are everywhere and you are constantly bothered. I was happy to stay in the last night and not have to bothered with the begging. The hotel was a sanctuary from the street. Beds were comfortable but being awoke daily at 4am by garbage trucks makes the sleep quality rating lowered.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Picassox3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Parc. Both times have been a pleasure. We picked Parc because I was having a 2 day outpatient procedure at UCSF. My husband wanted some where close to the hospital, quiet, relaxing and stress free . Parc 55 met our needs . We had a lovely room and were greeted with a fruit basket and bottle of wine. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, 1 block from a bad part of town, lots of external noise”
Reviews.Author: paulamwilliams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I called twice before our trip to confirm that we would have a King bed. Once we got to Parc55, we were informed there were only double beds left. We were staying 3 nights and were very uncomfortable in a double room. Every day we asked to be moved and were refused. While this hotel is near the shopping district, it is loud at night and is very close to a suspect area of SF. I would pass on this hotel--especially considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mau_nj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Parc 55 for two nights at the beginning of April. We booked this hotel through Priceline and got a great deal. The location was perfect for us...we went to many of the nearby bars and restaurants, walked to North Beach and then to Ghirardelli Square and took BART to visit a friend in Oakland. The BART station really couldn't have been much closer, so that was great. We had a room on the 10th floor and had no issues at all with noise. The room was okay...a decent enough size and clean. We were hoping for a little more from the room, but as we got such a good deal on Priceline, we definitely couldn't complain. We appreciated the free internet in the business center which we used for printing out our boarding passes, but would of course preferred free WiFi in the rooms as well. Overall, I'd say with this location if we could get another good deal, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellerCalgary
Reviews.Content: Great location. The property is clean and well maintained. We liked the restaurant but food prices are a bit high for the current market. We can't say enough good things about the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. My partner had a medical emergency (all is well now) and we very much appreciated the assistance provided in contacting medical help (on-call Dr), arranging a wheelchair and transportation to hospital. After the incident we were approached by many staff who we had not been in contact with before expressing concern and asking if anything else was needed. They hotel very kindly offered an excellent rate for our unexpected extension. This should not detract from the friendly service in the restaurant etc whose staff were not involved in our emergency. I would come back just bescause of the service. The no-charge internet access, under the circumstances, was a Godsend as we worked through all sorts of insurance and transportation issues. Thank you VERY much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, informative staff and a very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: poli11
Reviews.Content: A great location with many fabulous restaurants within walking distance. Lots of shopping, cable cars close. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf three times. The Moscone Convention Center is a nice walking distance away. Felt very safe walking everywhere. The service at the hotel was superb, right from check - in, to the maid. All personnel were friendly and willing to help out in anyway possible. The restaurant was pricey, particularly for breakfast. Lots of machines available in the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “used to be better... very, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: mikek0118
Reviews.Content: In the good side, it's well maintained. Clean, comfortable. Awesome shower heads and water pressure. Very friendly staff. Good food and room service. However, the Parc 55 USED to be a good business hotel in a decent location. Market Street has really gone down hill with the economy - and sometimes dead scary (two homeless people started a fight next to me as I was waiting to cross the street last evening about 9pm). The hotel, while well maintained, has an old infrastructure. The plumbing is noisy. The doors don't keep out any hallway noise - and many tourists come in large groups and congregate outside of their rooms. I can hear every footstep in the room above me (despite it being carpeted?). The street are very noisy (even late at night) and the windows not particularly sound-proof (they're vented, which is good when you want fresh air, but not when you want quiet). On this stay, the fire alarms went off three times in the middle of the night (no apparent fire, thankfully) - which I expect is not a regular occurrence. I grew up in NYC, so being in a big city is not strange to me. This hotel just isn't meant to be a big city business hotel any more. Finally, bring your own wireless hotspot - they want $15/day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Very well done business hotel”
Reviews.Author: GHG4
Reviews.Content: Had only one problem....lady at check in spoke/understood English as a 3rd language. Caused a problem with getting in room internet service. Overall,very helpful hotel re excepting incoming packages, didn't lose any or charge for the days storage. Have loaner umbrellas, went by the green rules regarding not giving out new towels if you hung yours up. Business centers well equipped and at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out! Parking costs $60/night!”
Reviews.Author: Yellowdogcafe
Reviews.Content: The bed crashed to the floor in our 1st room. We took the offered upgrade on the 14th floor, the same grade room only higher. The beds were worn out, the room a bit tired. Staff were friendly and attentive. Good biz value only if you don't need to park!

Reviews.Title: “Centre Of It All In SF”
Reviews.Author: Sorefeettoproveit
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the thick of it. Basically the transit hub for all of SF, you can get there from here. Asked for corner room, got it, no extra charge. Would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful location, not great for sleeping...”
Reviews.Author: Where2Gowhere2go
Reviews.Content: Noisy. Needed ear plugs and was still woken up by the people in the adjoining room at 4 am. Lots of street noise. Wonderful downtown SF location, but soundproofing in the rooms could be MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and view”
Reviews.Author: guleed
Reviews.Content: Best location and view i can think of. Close to all forms of transport. Service was very good. Room was clean and well serviced. The hotel is fancy but the rooms are basic. It still doesn't make sense to me to charge for internet access in the room. Business center is small and has 3 computers that you can print boarding passes from. Food prices are high. There is a small cafe right next door where you can get good breakfasts for cheap. Exercise room is large and full of equipment. We could hear some street noise but it was not a problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dr_randevil
Reviews.Content: I liked staying here. I had a city view room in one of the corners, it was great. Seemed like newer decor, but had phone next to toilet and power outlet that didn't match the newer feeling. Little thing, but I noticed. Good views, I'm amazed how far street noise can travel upwards. Conference @ hotel made price more than what I wanted to pay, but in line with other nearby hotels. Can't say enough how good it was to be close to bart entrance and cable car turnaround @ market st. Good neighborhood, some panhandling going on, but not too bad. I would love to stay again next time out.

Reviews.Title: “great location, cleanliness not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: forrest73
Reviews.Content: overall this hotel was ok. it is a four-star hotel and the service is pretty good albeit a bit slow at times. the location can't be beat at just a couple of blocks to the powell bart station. cleanliness wasnt the greatest as i realized the bed sheets hadnt been changed prior to my check-in to the room (there were some hairs which were a bit longer than the ones on my head). i called down and they changed the sheets right away but not the quality of cleanliness you'd expect from a 4* hotel. overall id say its a decent hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay! Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: hotmissy71
Reviews.Content: I loved the location and thought the hotel had wonderful service and were very courteous. I would stay there again matter a fact I plan on it!!

Reviews.Title: “My Top Choice In San Fran”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on three occasions, although this is my first review. Simply put, this hotel is in a great business location, it is nice, clean, professional, and it has a great price to boot! I do not even check anywhere else anymore, which as a chronic Tripadvisor junkie, is hard for me. The rooms are good sized, with big picture windows with panoramic views of San Francisco. There are a ton of restaurants and bars of all variety right outside the doors. The service has always been good. But I do have one teeny warning. Many flight crews stay here, so reception can be challenging if you are behind two or three flight crews waiting to check in. Save your money. Don't bother with the Westin. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...”
Reviews.Author: yme031885
Reviews.Content: I would not consider this place once more. The beds were terrible, I woke up with back pain every night I was there. The rooms were extremely small and not to mention this place was overpriced and also had a daily charge for internet. I ordered internet and it was extremely slow connections and would constantly loose connection. The heater in the room was not working. The housekeeping staff was extremely pushy when it came to coming into the room and cleaning. They were knocking on my door early in the am the date of departure when checkout is at noon. I am very very unhappy with this place. The day I went to the fitness center the machines were out of service. The food was overpriced and nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “i liked”
Reviews.Author: ntxhais
Reviews.Content: only misadvertisement is beds are NOT queen size, full size. they might need to change their misrepresentation of that or change all the beds in the hotel to properly represent themselves great view/ layout front desk didn't inform us of layout of hotel, but eventually found a map near elevators to get a gist & walking around asking ppl; bellboy was helpful with sightseeing tips; housekeeping is accommodating overall stay, I enjoyed it. But for a 4 star hotel to NOT have a refrigerator is kind of inconvenient for people wanting to refrigerate their dinners from a night out, medication, drinks, etc. (another disappointment) didn't stay in room except to sleep in and bathe. saw the exercise room, it was nice, but had no time. water vending machine was at $3, I think, so bring your own water to the room. it offers a nice view and mostly cardio equipment don't take a room next to ice machine, you can hear it operating at this hotel side note: I enjoyed the town a lot. there is much to see and the area is a little dangerous, so go in groups--someone i knew got hit in the back of their head in the area by a bunch of prankster men (men! what the heck--they have not grown up enough) scared her and her boyfriend so much they left town and didn't stay the night. just BE CAREFUL, SF is still fun.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to check-in on time”
Reviews.Author: SARCruzer
Reviews.Content: We spent almost an hour waiting with several others that were trying to check in for our room to become availabe. We were in a hurry since we had other things scheduled, and being told " We are not sure when your room will be ready" doesn't really work for me. The room was fine otherwise but won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cupcake1Reading
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we had some reservations about the location but we need not have worried at all. This hotel is in a fantastic location for visiting San Francsico, its central to all local attractions and some brilliant restaurants. The trolley bus stop is 2 minutes walk away and the Westfield shopping centre is on your doorstep. All the big name American shops are all in walking distance too. The hotel is faultless, the staff were absolutely fantastic and cannot do enough to make your stay comfortable. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean with nice views. I have recommended this hotel to some friends who will be visiting the area this year. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Definitely 4 star +.

Reviews.Title: “I will happily stay again, great value, lovely staff and very clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lee_bear
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be lovely here, very helpful indeed from check in to help with facilities. I found my room to be very nice and clean and the bed really comfortable. One negative out of the way, everyone else is of course correct that of you choose to stay directly in a busy city centre you will hear noise if you are on the lower floors, I was on the 6th floor and had no problem sleeping though but can understand others might. When I visited a group facility on club floor 31 you couldn't hear anything so if I come back with my other half I would pay more for a higher floor. As it was I got a group rate because I was attending some parties at the hotel and so the five nights were not expensive at all. The bar area is especially nice but the bar prices are a little high. The location is amazing for public transportation right near Union Square, so near the cable car turnaround, Bart, Muni, Street cars etc.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and not friendly”
Reviews.Author: ARGIGGLES
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel close to Union Sq, China Town and the Street Car, this is a good hotel. But if you actually want to sleep, stay away from this hotel. The room was extremely noisy from the outside traffic to the neighbors next door you could hear everything. The hotel staff was not friendly. When we checked in my husband asked for some directions to local pizza place for a quick lunch and the receptionist told him he would have to go wait in line and talk with the Consierge. Overall we were treated as a bother than a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: D5Irl
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 6 nights in November 2010. Booked a queen room but nice lady on reception offered to switch us to a double double (which was our preference but we chose not to pay 90 Euro extra for this when we booked thru www.ebookers.ie). Room was spotlessly clean, very comfortable beds, big HD TV etc with a great view of the city (from 24th floor). Only noise was occasional firetruck or ambulance but it's a city so that was to be expected. Room serviced & fresh towels daily. Very impressed with housekeeping particularly on 1st morning @ 5am (major jetlag!) when hairdryer was broke & a quick call had replacement at door within 5 minutes. Hotel is perfectly located near Union Square. Opposite Bart, Cable Car & Westfield Mall. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and wil be back. Despite reading some other reviews, we felt very safe in the surrounding area. The staff were pleasant & very helpful. Special mention to the lovely doorman who found us a stretch limo to the airport when the shuttle was late - for only $45 plus tip!!! A couple of minor negatives - (1) Wifi - very expensive daily charge which we didn't opt for. There are free PCs on floor 2 lobby and in business centre complete with printers (great for online check in) but would have like free Wifi in room. (2) Security - elevators & floors accessible without using room key. Can make you feel a little vulnerable. PS - a lot of reviews mention the homeless people around the area. I didn't think there were any more than anywhere else. Didn't encounter any hostility, in fact the same homeless man asked us politely every day to buy him lunch!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel that almost made me stay in room and not see city”
Reviews.Author: Dacrow1970
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with bed linen that is so soft and comfortable that I wanted to sleep all day and all night. It was very comfortable and the rooms adminities were amazing. I loved the coffee in room, the TV was great with lots of good channels. There were alot of great resturants right next to hotel and it was centrally located. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: CandCandC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a birthday eve, away from kids and responsibilities. It is truly a 4 star hotel. Nice service, super fast elevators (think shooting star here, 16 floors up in 4 seconds!). Modern, pretty furnishings. Everything worked well in the room. Nice soap and amenities. The bathroom counter space was a little small, and the room itself somewhat snug. But real estate is at a maximum here so the smaller room was understandable. Only a block or so up from Market St. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. We got a 2 double bed room to have the extra flat surface to put luggage, and it was worth it to do that. The bed was a little hard, but we slept well. The strange thing was the bar/restaurant was closed by 1 am. A little on the early side for SF I think. iNice view of surrounding buildings and even a peak at the SF bay. Parking is $48 overnight, valet only, but with in and out privileges. This seems to be about the going rate for the area. We got this hotel for an awesome price on Priceline, ($139) but I would pay up to $175 for a room here. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE AND COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: Silviaround
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and clean. Hotel has a good location, close to transports and good services. We had some missing towels from our room but they provided us with them immedeately. Then someone the day after put on our door the sign do not disturb and the room wasn't made up..but overall it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Street Zombies”
Reviews.Author: Antkneee
Reviews.Content: Our corporate travel department made us stay at this hotel and I was amazed at how nice it was. The last time I stayed near market st was like 14 years ago and I vowed to never do it again. The area has definately gotten worse. The homeless people are more aggressive then ever and there is someone attacking you ever 6 feet. It just makes this are incredibly negative. Thanks to the Wyndham by Request Club I had a bottle of red wine and peanut M&M's in my room...just a nice perk. Our corporate travel agents also got us free internet and a Grab and Go Breakfast...which gave us two items and a cofffee...nothing incredible but it was nice. The rooms were really nice too...comfy bed, flat screens, showtime, amazing views from the 28th floor, Bath and Body Works Bathroom lotions and shampoo, Coffee Pot....etc... Door guys were great too...very funny and helpful with any of our questions. I also asked many people why they called this place Parc 55 and no one knew. I finally figured out that after taxes and tip it cost us about 55 bucks to park here each night, so maybe that is where the name came from. Also the first elevator I have ever seen that stands up for a cause...it is repectful to vertically challenged people...the numbers go in opposite directions on each side. One side starts at 1 and goes down and the other side starts at 34 and goes down...confusing to us tall people at first but once I figured out I wasnt crazy I thought it was very cool and caring to others. There was also a really nice health club...this was the first time that I did not have to wait for a machine...I went down here at 5am and 6am and there was never a crowd. The equipment is new and has a TV attached to each one. I would highly recommend this hotel, but beware once you go outside you will be bugged for money from all of the homeless people...it is kind of like a movie where the zombies keep coming and they try to eat your brains!!!

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: NuclearAli
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotel options around union square- I'd suggest choosing another one. Hotel is clean, good location, nice rooms but we experienced some of the worst service I've ever received in a hotel. We stayed there two different times in July and both times had line ups of 20+ people to check in. Also was woken up at 2 AM the second time we stayed there with a call from the front desk asking who we were and what we were doing in the room! Turns out we were not properly checked in (though obviously we had working room keys...) and other guests were trying to get into our room. Good thing I bolted the door or we would have gotten a surprise! Complaints were made to the manager in the morning but he didn't seem very interested. Oh well, plenty of other options for hotels to choose from. Don't bother staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: sasanqua
Reviews.Content: Great location if depending on public transport - BART at door. We were travelling with three older children and we all loved being able to emerge from the hotel into shopping central and stop for a coffee and donut in the shop under the hotel on our way home. Good food options in basement of Westfield mall - fresh fruit and veg, and if you don't mind the 'piggery' atmosphere, good value and quality meals. Streetcar also right at door, making accessing Fisherman's Wharf/Ferry Building etc very easy. Like all American hotels (as we were to discover) , the lack of a jug to boil water for tea was painful! For many English/Australian/Kiwis, a decent cup of tea is a staple of life and so comforting - a simple jug is all that's needed to make a real difference! The water has to be boiling, not hot - coffee makers cannot produce water hot enough to make a decent cuppa! Bathrooms are showing their age, but perfectly adequate and for the price, it's hard to beat. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: ks1547
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying here, the staff are all very friendly, the accomodations excellent, very close to BART (their subway system, literally across the street!) and just a few blocks from Union Square, and the conference centre, and the 24h gym is convenient too and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: y5740
Reviews.Content: On the morning of December 28, 2010 I woke up in Room 764 at the Parc 55 with two bites on my hand which were in a row (classic bed bug). After returning home we began getting more and more bites. Nightmare. Spent the past two weeks trying to get rid of them ($200 in covers for every bed in the house, vacuuming, washing everything that can be washed, taking apart bed, DME, Spray, more vacuuming, cleaning the house). Nothing worked. Terminex is coming tomorrow to get rid of bugs for $700.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: millyc28
Reviews.Content: I must start with the disappointing factor. I uncovered the sheets to find dried blood stains in the middle of the bed, this is totally unexceptable as if they didn't bother to look or change these, what else did they not do. Reports on bed bugs 3 months ago. A great hotel which has been newly refurbished. Good and attentive service. Excellent central location if you want to be in the heart of the city although some rooms I'm guessing maybe noisy. Across the street from the BART!! The roonm in general was lovely and 3 members of staff came to change the sheets and I received 50% discount on the room, still no excuse for dirty bed sheets though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAB4MEE
Reviews.Content: I flew in for the Giants celebration parade and made my reservation based solely on price and location. It is a beautiful, quiet hotel with wonderful and friendly service. The views were OK, but the price and location and room itself made it well worth it. It is located right next tro Union Square and across the street from the BART station, making it extremely easy to get to Oakland airport. I did not eat at their restaurant, but the bar area is very nice. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, fine bar - AOK”
Reviews.Author: agena10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend trip to SF--great central location, right across from Powell St BART and trolley. Nice lounge/bar area also, good drinks/apps, and reasonably priced for a downtown hotel. Would stay here again easily.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Great rate. Nice room. 5 star staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shastaboz1
Reviews.Content: I got an incredible rate directly through the hotel web site. It was a "Monday" special. It was so cheap that I knew it would probably be a terrible room. I was so wrong. The hotel was beautiful. The staff was pleasant and efficient. The room was clean and great. It wasn't a 5 star, but I didn't pay for a 5 star. I would say 3.5. However the staff was 5 star. The location is outstanding. There was a coffee maker and a safe. The walls were a little thin, as we had a noisy group next door. However, that can happen at any hotel. They even gave us earplugs for the traffic ten stories down. I have stayed in SF many times, and this introduced me to a new place to stay. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “so so accomodation and service. overpriced. disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 4blinkies
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed 4 days in Dec 2010 at 55 parc hotel in san francisco. we paid $189 for a club room including parking ($44 night). Although we enjoyed the convenient location of union square, we find the hotel accomodation and service disappointing for the following reasons: 1. Upon arriving at the entrance, we were told by the valet staff to "unload your bags and leave the keys". there were no concierge staff or luggage carts to assist. Better service would have been a hotel staff member with a luggage cart meeting us at our car to help with our luggages in. 2. Checking in was smooth until we got to our rooms and discovered that the rooms had one king bed each instead of two queen as requested. we called the front desk and were told by Jeff, the manager, that there were no other rooms available and the options were to have another bed brought in or stay where we were and got changed the next night. we told jeff the choices were unacceptable. we were then told to wait in our room until concierge call us back. after half an hour wait, we went down to the front desk, waited in line for another half an hour before talking to another manager, Tasha. she then was able to change our rooms without any problem. Instead of the run around, better service would have been to switch us at our first request. 3. A club room stay included continental breakfast between 6 am to 10 am. At various time, the room was packed with no seats. There were people standing with breakfast in hand while eating. ?Requests to take breakfast to the room to enjoy was denied. Better service would have been to use a larger room for breakfast or allow guests to bring their breakfast to their rooms or have more than 2 hotel staff to clean tables and have them ready for next guests. 4. I used the gym once at 5 am during our stay and was disappointed at seeing used towels on the floor. at that early morning, the gym is empty but should have been clean. Better service would have been a staff attendance to clean the machine and pick up dirty towels. A nice touch would have been a water dispenser or some kind of refreshment corner for guests to enjoy. Instead, the hotel had a vending machine. Guests usually don't carry money when going to a hotel gym to exercise. 5. Room was comfortable, limited storage place, had two 12 by 12 inch drawers for clothes storage. Better service would have been more than 2 drawers that size. We ended up using our luggages as storage. Internet use was $13 /day. The hotel boasts its reputation for business/leasure travelers. Better service would have been free internet. 6. Upon checking out, we found out that the hotel charged us for parking anyway, despite confirmed reservation for free parking. The staff was quick to fix the error, but again, at our inconvenience of waiting in line for a resolution. 7. Security was poor. Anybody from the streets could have walked into the hotel, taken any elevator to any floors. Room access requires a key, but the hotel halls and bathroom facilities are open to all. Better security would have been a room key access at least to the elevators. With its prime location, parc 55 would have to step up its service and accommodation to justify its room rate for travelers to choose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, especially for a quality room and good location.”
Reviews.Author: FBFandCo
Reviews.Content: We stayed because of Trip Advisor reviews, and were not disappointed. Our room was $110 a night, with a king bed (which is really important to me), and I thought it was a good value. We arrived early and were offered early check-in, a huge convenience. The location was really great, we used Muni for everything. Although there is street noise, they provide ear plugs right away, which I used and slept very well. (My husband slept well on his own; he's less prone to ambient noise.) Similar to the courtesy of early check in, after check out we were able to easily leave our bags for a few hours while we finished our time in the city. I do wish they offered free wifi (it's about $15 a day), but that was the only downside for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable room, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerYYZ
Reviews.Content: I was given a great large corner room on a high floor with an excellent view in top condition without asking for it on a great rate from Expedia by the friendly front desk staff when I checked in. I had read the reviews about the location being noisy but other than the odd muffled siren from an emergency vehicle typical of any large city downtown, it was very quiet during my 10 night stay. Along the bottom of the windows in the room there is a lever to open and close a narrow space if you wanted fresh air, and perhaps those folks who found it noisy had that open without knowing it. The thermostat in my room worked perfectly if I wanted more heat on a cool night. The location couldn't have been better and very safe for walking to restaurants, theaters, shopping etc. The tenderloin is just West of the Hotel and I would avoid that area as there is nothing to see there anyway, [except for a great restaurant/bar 'Farmer Browns' close to the hotel] and as is the case in SF panhandlers are out in force around the West side of Union Square but only want spare change and will not hassle you if you pass them by from a distance. They are a fact of life in that part of the city. The Hotel service staff were skilled and very friendly. At times I could see a line up to check in at the very large hotel but it moved quickly. For such a large busy hotel there was no waiting time for the elevator and the common areas were not crowded or noisy. I had the breakfast buffet there twice and it was very good as was the service. The only criticism I could think of was that the Wi-Fi in the room could have been faster as it was slow during peak periods, but I was able to use it just fine. I would definitely stay here again and I highly recommend the hotel to anyone. It is a very good choice and excellent value for families, couples, or single travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mrsant27
Reviews.Content: Thanks for such a wonderful stay Parc 55! The room was clean and the service was amazing. I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Another stellar experience at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Gary_n_Kimberly
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best people working there. The rooms are cozy and clean. We stayed here before, and this last trip was from Dec 24 - 27. It only gets better. What I really liked this time was the relaxing lounge area at CityHouse, their restaurant & bar. Anna at the front desk completely took care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go if you ever need the Internet!”
Reviews.Author: DimmieAzu
Reviews.Content: If you need the Internet connection for work or like your email to load in less than five minutes (seriously) avoid this hotel. Don't even bother using the secure connections here (like manage your bank account), it won't work at all... If you don't believe me, check the reputation of the Internet Service Provider this hotel uses - "XO Communications". It has one of the worst reputations in the world! It's a very nice hotel, well situated, but Gmail takes over five minutes to just open. So, if like me you use Internet, be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Location is unbeatable!!! Hotel is fantastic :)”
Reviews.Author: HonestLadyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was in San Fran during the summer for the San Fran Marathon. We stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel, and our stay was AMAZING! We were directly across the street from the bart, which we used all the time - including transportation to and from the airport/Berkeley, which would have been super costly if we took a cab! Besides the bart access, the hotel is only one mile walking to the Embarcadero! We would run there everyday and then run down the Embarcadero towards the Warf. It would be quite a walk to the Warf, but you can take the F tram (the stop is also right down the street from the hotel) and this will take you right into the warf. We were surrounded by shopping and restaurants! The staff at the hotel is AMAZING! They were so friendly and helpful, giving us recommendations for dining and the public transit system. If you are staying here there is no need to rent a car as it is located so close to all forms of public transit. If you do drive, the hotel has its own parking garage though. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Fran! We hope to be back soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pooh_bear_tx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it is close to the BART station and bus stop. We took BART to SF for a concert and had to walk from the bus stop (5th and Market street) to the hotel at late night. We definitely made the right choice. The actual distance between the bus stop and the hotel is much closer than it looks on the Google Map, because the hotel has an entrance on Eddy (where its valet parking is). We were allowed to check in at about 10:30am. The front desk staff was very friendly. We were upgraded to a high floor room with city view!!! We enjoyed the beautiful night view as well as the the sunrise in the early morning. The room was clean and quiet; however, around 8:20am the housekeeping started to knock doors on the hall way. It was quiet annoying although our room was skipped because of the "do not disturb sign". My children were still asleep at that time, but they were not awaken by the knocks, so I think it was not too bad. Our TV remote control did not work, so we called the "guest response". They quickly delivered a new one to us. The next morning we had some problems with the hot water temperature, they also fixed it promptly. I am very satisfied with their services. Overall, I highly recommend Parc 55 especially if you travel by BART and bus!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lightofnyx
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right in Union Square and by transportation. Room on the 27th floor was very nice, super quiet, and had amazing views. The club room was excellent and we loved having a great breakfast there every morning-definitely worth the extra cost. I know other people mentioned noise problems, but that high up it was very quiet and we got a very restful sleep. Customer service was excellent. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome accommodation. We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: dandmrose
Reviews.Content: Great location. Caught the BART train from the international airport $8. Stopped right at the door. Streetcars and cable cars to anywhere right nearby $20 for 3 day unlimited pass. Huge room with magnificent views. Clean and comfortable. Only complaint coffee available in foyer $2. Should add $5 to the account and allow patrons to access at will.

Reviews.Title: “So Noisy! But hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: 400driver
Reviews.Content: Ok. This is an average hotel in good location but for some the good location may be the problem. The level of noise from the street is very high. If you have a room on Cyril Magnin street you will be woken up by the constant siren noise from the fire department. They seem to need to keep the sirens on to avoid running down the countless people of questionable mental health who frequent the down town area. At 0400 local i was awoken to the shouts of a "local" at street level doing his best to wake up the neighbourhood. Now my room was on the 15th floor and every word he was shouting was audible! The windows in the hotel seem insufficiently glazed to keep out the local noise. The hotel staff seem very nice and the rooms are typical by US standards but when a hotel leaves you ear plugs as part of your amenity pack then be warned! I realise this is not the hotel's fault but to have such close access to the down town area is not without its price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CNPREME
Reviews.Content: Staff is absolutely amazing! Everyone from the bell hop, check-in/check-out (Ericka & Riecky), conceirge, room service and maids..... they were all VERY pleasant and always smiling, Location of the hotel is "spot-on"; BART is approximately 250' away (easy to tote bags to/from), mall is across the street and Union Square is a short walk away. Rooms are very comfortable and inviting. One downfall... the windows are NOT sound proof and you can hear all the vehicle traffic.... if you can handle that, it is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location, excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: Girasol66
Reviews.Content: My two night stay was great. Had higher floor room so it was fairly quiet. Check-in was quick & easy. Housekeeping had everything well stocked & spotless. Reservation through hotelâ€™s website: unbeatable price. LOCATION is perfect. Just steps from Bart station, cable cars, F bus. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Parc 55!

Reviews.Title: “Book a room on the Club levels...and ask for a view of the bay!”
Reviews.Author: CaliCarol
Reviews.Content: We paid about 40 bucks extra and got a room on the 31st floor...ask for a view of the bay...you won't be disappointed! We also had a corner room with windows on 2 walls...a great panoramic view! We stayed on a Sunday night and got free delicious appetizers in the club lounge before we went out to dinner, and had continental breakfast in the morning! The location is AMAZING...right at Powell and Market! If you're interested in exploring Union Square, this is the place to stay. We hopped on the Powell/Market cable car and rode to Chinatown for dinner, then walked back through Union Square to watch the Christmas lights and ice skaters. We only stayed for one night, but we'll be back! Can't wait to visit San Francisco and the Parc 55 again!

Reviews.Title: “If you like cold showers, you'll love the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 with 5 other colleagues for a conference. The first night the internet access didn't work for anyone. The first morning we all took cold showers because the hot water was gone. We tried to eat breakfast at the hotel restaurant but they couldn't handle the crowd, so we went elsewhere. The room phone has buttons for "Guest Response" and "Express Checkout", but they don't work. I completed the form on the hotel's website and never received a response. The only positive about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - in my opinion expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: crystart
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location. 1 block from cable bar and Market Street. Don't go behind hotel as you can easily see the beginning of the Tenderloin district. Rooms were average to nice. Decent bathroom. A/C/Heater/Fan was loud in room. Would kick on throughout the night but was loud....I didn't sleep well for the 2 nights we stayed at this hotel but I chalk that up to the fact I was drinking each night. Buffet breakfast was $22 or $24 or something - didn't do it as I couldn't bring myself to spend that on eggs. Vale parking was $55/nt (oversized vehicle) - again expensive in itself, but seems average for the city of San Francisco. I forgot to take pics of the room but the pic on Trip Advisor are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: chalioacosta
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at. Just a couple of blocks away from union square and less than one block away from the bart system. Very good service for a great price. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel indeed in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gwokypoodle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near Union Square and is therefore in an ideal position for shopping or as a central point for exploring the city. The public areas were recently refurbished and it now has a wonderful modern openplan lobby/reception area. The bar and restaurant are at the far end of this openplan arrangement and it all has a very pleasant atmpsphere. I was here for two nights and on the first night dined in the restaurant. The service and food were very good indeed. I had goats cheese salad and an excellent salmon entree with a wonderful bernaise sauce. Staff were friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet was average and there is no omelette station so I had to order a la carte. I could not get the wireless Internet to work properly but was given a no quibble refund. However, I would have preferred it to work as it was supposed to do! There is a very good Italian restaurant right opposite the hotel called Puccini & Pinetti which is worth a visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: stirling98
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a sales kick-off. The purpose was business and to be near our offices - centrally located in SF. The hotel fulfilled this purpose very well, but unfortunately struggles to stand out from the crowd. The positives for me were: Great bed and sleep quality Central location with only minutes walk to Union Square Friendly staff It is difficult to say where I felt the hotel could do with an improvement, but it did not stand out in any particular aspect. It was all very mainstream and standard. Even large hotels like the Parc55 can do little things that make your stay more special. Having said that - there is nothing wrong with reliability and if you want romantic and boutique you'd be staying elsewhere anyway. There is no lack in things to do in the area and the hotel bar has a good choice of bar, food and sports TV as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a tasteless and expensive Thanksgiving dinner”
Reviews.Author: Johnrmaniz
Reviews.Content: Room was nice but small. Our biggest beef was the Thanksgiving dinner. Expensive at $59.00 without coffee and wine is extra. Turkey and stuffing tasted terrible, salad was good and dessert was ok. Waiting service incredibly slow! Would not recommend their restaurant for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best service I've experienced in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LDeRose
Reviews.Content: I had previously spent time at the Parc 55 for a conference and was really impressed with the rooms. Recently I was planning a romantic weekend with my SO and thought it would be the perfect place. Our plans were to see the city and spend little time at the hotel so service wasn't my main concern, but I knew we would be happy with the room. Since my previous stay, the Parc 55 was purchased by Wyndham Hotels. Upon our arrival, we were greeted with a very warm smile and the desk clerk seemed genuinely happy to be assisting us. I had requested the same room-type as my previous stay, but thought my chances were slim as we were checking in quite late and it was a busy weekend. To my surprise, we got the room we requested! Not only did we get the room we wanted, the hotel has had a complete renovation of the lobby. The restaurant, (which is very comfortable and the bartenders certainly know their craft!) is spacious and full of friendly and attentive staff. I recommend this hotel to anyone. It is conveniently located just off Market near the best shopping and restaurants. Union Square is a few short blocks away and we were able to walk most of the city with ease. I will certainly return. Thank You for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Hanora79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem, well located, right in the centre of san Francisco . the rooms were well furnished and the view we had from the 25th floor was amazing, never needed a taxi throughout our stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrav-7
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a five-night visit for a conference. I upgraded to a club-level room, which was perfectly nice, if nothing luxurious. Lovely view and it was nice to have a little couch to hang out on (I turned it around to face the window). The club-level lounge is well-run and all the folks who work there nice. Actually, contrary to a lot of reviews, I had good experiences with all the staff, save one outside valet/doorman (?) who actually stole a cab from me before he realized I was a guest at the hotel. The room was extremely clean, the bedding nice, and the in-room coffee surprisingly good. The elevators are fast for such a large hotel. The location is good, though there are a lot of homeless people in the area, so be prepared for that, and in one direction (towards the Tenderloin neighborhood) it gets a little rough. There is a mall very conveniently located about 1.5 blocks away (great for traveling on business for those forgotten things and there is a grocery store on the lower level). Traveling in and out on the BART was a breeze. Cons: The Internet (paid) is really slow, both on wifi and wired. The bar has a really bad selection of wine (I have my priorities!) relative to the area. The biggest problem was actually noise (as many have mentioned). The windows don't seem to be well-made, and I could hear people laughing on the street on the 27th floor. There is also a sizable gap under the room door. I stuffed a towel under to mitigate hall way noise. Otherwise, nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Ginsberg
Reviews.Content: The location, near Union Square, of the hotel is great. Though the hotel looks and feels a bit outdated for its pretensions. Not great, not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that does the business...”
Reviews.Author: ethy12
Reviews.Content: Primarily a business hotel (conferences) this hotel is still great for tourists in down town San Francisco. We contacted the hotel ahead as we had booked through Priceline, they replied, but understandably, there was no guarantee of our request of a high floored room, however this information was still communicated and reception honoured the email - we were given a room on the 23 rd floor (great view) which seemed to avoid most of the street noise and anyway there's something very charming about hearing the bell of the cable car whilst you're lying in bed. Superb bed with great mattress and high quality linen. Flat screen TV and good toiletries were welcome; on the down side the tea and coffee making facilities were less than adequate for 2 people- 2 tea bags and 2 sachets of powdered creamer in a hotel of this calibre is mean isn't it? We were given a disabled room which whilst large, had an adjoining door to the next room- we wondered whether this was the reason for being able to hear our neighbour's conversations relatively clearly and their TV noise? The area felt safe (although please note there are more homeless people than in other cities we have visited). We used the business centre for free internet access everyday and only had to wait once. They have a printer so you can print off your boarding pass too. We heard the corridor outside our room being vacuumed as early as 3.30am and whilst housekeeping were excellent they did tend to knock our door as early as 8.30 am. Location is great for Union Square and is perfect for the BART to the airport but it will take you 30 minutes or more to walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were polite and they don't charge you for looking after your bags on your last day. Access to food outlets and restaurants was superb, we even bought a few meals from the diverse food hall in the Westfield shopping centre and took them back to our room. Overall, we thought it was great and with a few minor tweaks it would be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: chloe1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and my self stayed there for are anniversary (19) We were on the 32 nd floor All I can say OMG Even the next day breakfast was on the 31 floor Cannot wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Local, Easy Travels & Clean!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineSomma
Reviews.Content: Great things: 1. Clean-The Room, Bathroom, Floor, Elevator, Everything. 2. Close to...-Union Square, Market Street, a block away from the Trolley system & 30 seconds away from BART their subway system. So easy to travel to from the Airport. Not So Great things: 1. Bed-Looked comfy, yet was extremely firm. 2. Noise-We stayed on a Friday, Saturday & found they give you earplugs in your room for a reason. Union Square gets busy and is right below your hotel. Couldn't sleep without them. A Little of Both: 1. Amenities-No refrigerator in the room. Many guides and magazines. Coffee maker with coffee & tea complimentary, but if you tried to refill in the lobby they charged you :/ 2. Staff-Encountered 4 or 5 staff members & 2 Concierge. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly, while BOTH Concierge were rude & not very willingly helpful. Overall: a fairly pleasant, definitely easy, definitely clean stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, so central...!”
Reviews.Author: SanchaP
Reviews.Content: Great location, so central and so easy to explore the city from ... Staff were really friendly.. and so accommodating to our needs would definitely recommend to a friend or family traveling to San Fran .. the only thing that I missed in this hotel was a pool.. the fitness centre was great though

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, good rooms, great location in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: TeachMKE
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Parc 55 Wynhham. Staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were very clean, and the beds were comfortable. We had a great view of the city from our 13th floor room! The best part about this hotel is the location in Union Square/Downtown San Francisco. It is within blocks of great shopping, restaurants, and bars. It is across the street from the BART line, easy to get to from the airport. It is also close to trolley cars and bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Otinel
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 3 nights in this hotel and we had a great experience! We were traveling with our 10-month-old son and the king room was a great fit, we were able to put a crib (provided for free by the hotel) in the foyer and hang a blanket in the doorway to the bedroom so he had his own little room. Our room was huge and, even staying on the 4th floor, street noise was not an issue. We were visiting in the middle of a heat wave (80+ degrees) and the air conditioning in our room was inadequate but the hotel kindly provided a fan which helped a lot. This hotel is centrally located and it was easy to get around using public transportation. We will definitely stay in this hotel again next time we visit San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: venicegirl05
Reviews.Content: This is a great gem of a hotel. Large hotel but not overwhelming. Service was efficient and attentive. Got a good night sleep. Great for a business traveler and leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GEM0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 for 5 nights in a club room. The location of the hotel is great - right across from the BART station (easy transport from the airport for $8) and the cable car. It's a block away from Market Street giving easy access to most attractions with both the cable car and street cars going to Fisherman's wharf etc. There are lots of shops, restaurants and cafes around with good meals and cheap drinks. The room was clean and comfortable. I had read a lot of reviews about the street noise - however our room was quiet and even sirens were not a problems (or no worse than any other inner-city hotel), we were on a high level which might have helped. Staff were very good but not intrusive and check-in/out was quick. I thought the club room would come with a few more extras but apart from the included breakfast (good) and being on the higher floors with access to the lounge, it wasn't that much better. They still wanted a ridicules amount of money for internet access (why do big hotels do that?) and charged $7 a drink from the 'honor bar' in the lounge. The business center gave free internet access but was busy. I paid a fairly good rate for advance (no refund) purchase but I haven't seen that particular rate again - I don't know if I would want to pay any more than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Next choice”
Reviews.Author: crod80
Reviews.Content: While the location is near the Bart and close to the shops, it borders a neighborhood where you find very sketchy characters. I didn't feel particularly safe walking around at night there. I would recommend staying on the other side of Union Square and not near the Tenderloin area. The staff was also not friendly and our room was not ready at the time of arrival (mind you we were checking in at 11:00 p.m., how can it not be ready). They also blamed booking on expedia and travelocity as the reason why there was no non-smoking rooms available, which that was later remedied after we complained about that. We later discovered that there were plenty of non smoking rooms available. So they lied to us. The room itself was nothing to brag about. It could definitely use some fresh paint on the walls. And it's a noisy area of the city, so they have to provide ear plugs for your comfort, yikes. Overall, I think there are better hotels in the area at the same price in a safer location.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it”
Reviews.Author: jeanfrombos2n
Reviews.Content: I was there for business but I wanted this location and a reasonable rate. The Parc55 has a reduced rate for staying 3 or more nights, which I was. They have free WiFi various places in the hotel but in the room it was $12.95 a day, pretty standard for big hotels. I fussed about getting a quiet spot and they upgraded me to the club area, 28th floor and use of the club for breakfast. No noise at all. Somewhat difficult to get the room cool enough to sleep in, but I've seen worse. I might look for a lower rate if I were here on a vacation, but it was just fine for my purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: felicarrillo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great location, there are several restaurants near by and if you have plans shopping spare spending the big bucks on hotels that are on Union Square and instead stay at this hotel, just 3 mins from the square. It was my first time at SFO and wanted to get to know the city. Since I could not visit all the places I wanted to see, next time I might stay closer to the piers and the golden gate bridge. Rooms are nice and service is very good, the hotel was at full occupancy during my weekend stay and staff were at full, still they took the time to spend time with me and answer all my questions.

Reviews.Title: “A Truely Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: indie_jewel
Reviews.Content: We were first time visitors to San Fransisco and wanted a hotel that was near everything and clean. Parc 55 really exceeded our expectations! We stayed for 5 nights. This hotel is located within 2 minutes of the bus line that takes you to Fisherman's Warf, or the Trolley is right across the street. Chinatown is also nearby the hotel. The street that the hotel is on (Market) is one of the main streets with all the shops. The mall is also a couple of minutes away, which is convenient. Parc 55 was very clean, we did not find any complaints with our room. Beds are large and so comfy! There is also a nice flat screen t.v. A large window offers lots of natural light, and a wonderful view of the Financial District. The rooms are very cozy and comfortable. The employees are very helpful and answer any questions you may have. We would definitely return to Parc 55 as we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special at all -- lots of better options right next door”
Reviews.Author: Gimmeshelter76
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews have said most things that need to be said - yes, the location is great, but so are the locations of scores of other hotels around Union Square. The room was very small; acceptably comfortable and clean. But no refrigerator or microwave for $160+/night? Huh? Other than Motel 6, no other hotel has attempted to charge for wifi...until I found this jewel: $15/day for wifi. Oh well....I laughed it off as I tethered my cell phone. The extras and hidden charges (including $46/day for parking) continue ad infinitum. Unacceptably long wait at check-in followed by rude service by asinine staff. Their attitude is that they're granting you a special privilege in letting you stay there. What a joke. Outdated 70's schlock architecture and interior design passes as "avant-garde" at this concrete hulk. They will always be able to sell rooms to the wide-eyed tourists who don't know better. That doesn't mean you have to be one of the chumps. Do yourself a favor and check out the Fairmont, Handerly, Triton, or one of the many other wonderful hotels in this world-class city!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT PARC55”
Reviews.Author: PeterFraser
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving in San Francisco, I was concerned regarding reviews about homeless people near the Parc 55. Hopefully this will put the first time visitor to San Francisco / Parc 55 mind at rest. I found that there were homeless people in all areas of San Francisco that I visited. It doesn't matter where you stay or visit in the touristy parts of San Francisco, you will be confronted with homeless people. They generally don't bother you. This is not an issue relating to The Parc 55 and it did not detract from my enjoyment while staying at this hotel. I stayed at the Parc 55 for 5 nights at the start of October as a family of 4. The hotel is situated in an excellent location in the hub of Union Square. The tram turn around to Fishermans Wharf was a 1 minute walk from the hotel as was Union Square where there are lots of good shops and restaurants. This hotel exceeded my expectations, I was greeted on check in by Sarah, who was pleasant and helpful. All other staff were the same. The entrance, check in, and elevator areas area all very spacious and well kept. The room was clean, well maintained and an adequate size with 2 double beds, desk, TV and 2 seats. The room also had a great view over the Financial District. Street noise was not a problem if the vents at the bottom of the windows were closed. The only small draw back was that there is not a great deal of storage for clothes for 4 people in 1 room (no chest of drawers). I cannot comment on the restaurant at The Parc55 as we ate out either at Union Square or Fishermans Wharf. I did use the computers situated beside the elevators at the reception area for internet access, which was useful. All in all, we had a great stay at Parc55 and a great time in San Francisco. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and hotel - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: stsang
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with a 6 month old baby and the noise from the 6th floor room was incredibly loud (especially when the clubs let out). We asked if we could change our rooms (we had ajoining rooms - 2 doubles and one King) - they accommodated us perfectly and moved us up to the 23rd floor while we were out for the day. We also needed a fridge for the baby formula - they sent one up at no charge. We paid $165 US per room (which included parking) - can't beat the price in that location. I'd definately stay there again. We thought the rooms were well kept, clean and the service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55, Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BearsRus
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 Hotel is near Union Square in San Francisco, near both buses and trams as well as load of shops, restaurants and entertainment. Westfield shopping centre is only 2 minutes walk, with a huge foodhall on the bottom floor, great shops and on the top floor when you've shopped and seen all the sights, there is a cinema complex with all the latest movies. The hotel has a very good restaurant, the rooms are very comfortable, wifi available at a cost $45.00 for 7 days, but no bar fridge, however there are ice machines on each floor, with ice buckets provided in your rooms. Tea and coffee is also available in your rooms, with powdered milk, but having this facility in an American Hotel is quite rare and welcome. Get yourself a 7 day bus/tram passport for just $26.00, you will save this amount over and over. Overall a great hotel in a fantactic location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with incredible views”
Reviews.Author: elaine r
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at Parc 55 because the location is in the city, right across the street from the Bart station and also the cable cars. This part of the city is so wonderful for shopping, dining, nightlife, etc. We almost stayed at the wharf, but it's so q u i e t there, we prefer a more high energy location. Hint---call the hotel directly, NOT the 800 number, and you can often negotiate a better rate. Rooms equipped with a safe and a rather large bathroom, though the shower is pretty dark and could use an overhead light. Friendly staff, but location is the best part of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! They cancelled my whole weeks reservation”
Reviews.Author: GoneAwayToday
Reviews.Content: In August, I was to attend a Oracle conference for one week. I made reservations through Oracle to arrive on the 18th. My job asked me to leave on the 19th instead of the 18th. I called the hotel to let them know of my change of plans and that I would be arriving on the 19th instead of Sat the 18th everything seemed fine. When I arrived they told me that I was supposed to arrive the day before and that may room had been given away. I said "no I called and told you that I would not be arriving on Sat but on Sun today" They asked me who did I speak to I said I dont know I did not think to get a name. They cancelled my entire weeks reservation. My suspicions were that I had the room at a government rate and the Oracle conference is a big conference with lots of business people attending and the hotel rates jack up 3X the normal rate. Cant prove it but I the whole ordeal ruined my whole week there. I spent most of the time looking for vacancies in other hotels in a over booked city and ended up staying with a friend from my job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the City”
Reviews.Author: CorndogCorndog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for 4 nights in late October. The location is fantastic. Close to great shopping. A block from the cable car station. Easily walk to the water. One night we did go to the bar and have drinks/appetizers. Both were very good ... highly recommend the pizza! The fitness center is one of the best in a hotel that I have visited. About 10 treadmills and 8 eliptical. Free weights and lots of machines. Personal TV's on all the machines Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise is in store for you.”
Reviews.Author: K-traveler13
Reviews.Content: I have passed this hotel in a taxi countless times without ever staying there. To be candid, the bland hotel name was a psychological turn-off. When a client recently booked me into this hotel, I remained a doubting Thomas. Not any more! This hotel is good in every dimension.
