Its location is ideal--off Union Square, a hop, skip and jump from the Powell Street cable car and BART station. You can take BART to or from SFO in 20 minutes for $8.10, and not worry about traffic jams. The deluxe room boasts a king size bed, sofa, desk, dresser and closet and doesn't feel in the least bit crowded. The closet is full sized. The bathroom is spacious. Although the bath tub and shower are combined, the shower was excellent. Hotel service was prompt and competent. Concierges were cooperative and knowledgeable. As in most hotels that cater to business people, buffet breakfast is the default. You can order a la carte but it is advantageous to take the cold or hot buffet-- service and pricewise . In the evening the restaurant serves an assortment of small plates. I tried two and they were both quite good. The bar was a popular evening gathering place when I was there--most of the patrons were cheering on the SF Giants. Finally, you should check the travel websites for price deals at this hotel--for whatever reason (is it the bland name?), it can be highly price competitive--a superior value to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: blacklabsocks
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 has a super convenient location. Highly accessible whether by Bart, streetcar, taxi or bus. Right in the middle of shopping and numerous food choices. While the room (especially the bathroom) looked a little tired it was very clean. I didn't hear street noise but that's probably because we were on the 29th floor. Free Internet access at the business centre was much appreciated. One comment was that the breakfast at the lounge was understaffed. There was inadequate seating and staff to guest ratio was so bad that we had to eat with the previous occupier's dirty dishes and trash still at the table because the staff were too busy to keep up with the guest turnover!

Reviews.Title: “convenient, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: miffyninja
Reviews.Content: my review isn't going to add much. the hotel is located a stone's throw from market street - and the hallidie plaza entrance to the powell st bart station - and union square, so there is a lot of pedestrian traffic. we checked in early so we ended up with a 7th floor double. you can hear street noise, sure. muffled, background noise. i live on a busy street so personally it's no problem. the room was clean, large enough, and you can control the ac. we didn't rent a car so it's proximity to the bart is great, going to and from the airport. it's about a 23 minute walk to the ferry market building, to lombard st, to at&t field.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but I won't go back”
Reviews.Author: love2travel040
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline for a fair rate for three nights. Were put in a smoking room on the first night and it was incredibly smokey as soon as I stepped off the elevator. Our clothes smelled like smoke for a couple of days. Management moved us to a non-smoking room as soon as it opened up with no hassle. This hotel is is a good location, close to Union Square,shopping, BART and cable cars. The kicker for us was after we checked out, the doorman arranged a ride for us to the airport. A few blocks into our ride, we were pulled over by the police because the driver made an illegal turn. The officer told us that it is illegal for doormen to arrange drivers for tourists and if they are asked, they must put the customer in a taxi cab. We were told that there has been a number of issues with town car drivers robbing customers or worse. I'm not usually a fear monger but I do not trust a hotel who's staff is not concerned about their guests safety, even after they've paid the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: CrankiestOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel having booked through an opaque travel site (i.e., we didn't know the name of the hotel when we purchased). Many times this means you are given the worst room in the hotel at check-in; however, the hotel honored our request for a king bed and gave us a huge corner room. The representative at check-in was very pleasant, as was all of the other staff we encountered. Our room was very nice, with windows along two walls. The bed was comfortable and the housekeeping staff was patient. They never bothered us to clean the room early. The bathroom was small, with one sink and a regular tub/shower. The room was noisy, and earplugs were provided with the bathroom amenities (although neither my spouse nor I used them). I woke one night to sounds of a woman screaming outside and another night to sirens. The location is excellent. Westfield Center (shopping mall with great food court, Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's, Barney's) is across the street, as is the BART station and bus stop. It is 2-3 short blocks to Union Square. Taxis are readily available at the front door. Free internet is available on the 4th floor but there is a charge for in-room use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - and very friendly and effective staff”
Reviews.Author: TCLP
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two sisters travelled to San Fran to my sisters wedding. Having spent a wonderful week at the Russian River we spent our last 3 nights at Parc 55. On arrival the receptionist was very friendly and thorough. Our room was at the side of the hotel so we had a view over the roof tops but not of the Bay - no big deal. The air con was not functioning fully in our room and we called housekeeping and within 45 mins John the engineer arrived to explain what might be the problem and also to advise us on how he was going to fix it which he did in rapid time and also phoned us later that evening to see if all was ok. - we very much appreciated his efficiency and friendly customer service. We booked a room with 2 x double beds - the room was a normal size more suited to two than three t- the beds were very comfortable and the linen was of a very high quality. A large tv screen and comp coffee and tea are supplied and ice water on the landing which we thought was a nice touch. A negative was the expensive bottled water at $4.50 and a very pricey hotel room menu. The bathroom was again a good size with plenty of accessories - plus a shower and bath. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned everyday. The hotel is very centrally located - which is excellent! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and found the staff very friendly and accommodating they gave us great restaurant recommendations and the bar staff even gave us the use of their beautiful wine glasses and a cork screw. The only down side and nothing the hotel can do about it is the noise of the fire brigade and police sirens at night but it is a city!! The total cost of our accommodation was $1000 - not cheap for three people sharing - they could be a little better on their pricing. If staying again I would insist on a front room that overlooks the city and bay. In saying all that I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comformatble stay close to everything”
Reviews.Author: cityshopper10
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, quite big rooms with a very nice view over SF. Great location, close to Moscone center, Union Square and San Francisco shopping center. Excellent breakfast buffet and a nice bar. Great little coffee&bagel shop on the same block and a good italian restaurant cross the street. Needed earplugs at night even thou I lived on 16th floor.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, classy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eicher02
Reviews.Content: Above all, the Parc 55 has one of the BEST views and locations in the city. It is just a block away from the the trolleys, cable cars, and there are taxis shuttling around which are always ready to take you to and from. There is a great little donut/breakfast shop on the same block and the hotel is within walking distance to just about any food imaginable. There is great shopping close by! The front desk staff experience was the only part of our stay that wouldn't get a 5 star rating, but the hotel itself and our overall stay was truly fabulous. I would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at this hotel, and found very few faults. My room (a corner room) was spacious. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom excellent and well stocked. Like others, it always seemed busy, but never crowded - and there was very little waiting time for elevators etc. Staff were friendly, and housekeeping was great (a late morning/afternoon lie-in meant that I missed the housekeeping round, and the room was unmade when I returned in the afternoon. There was a voicemail on the room phone saying to call them and it would be done - I did, and when I returned that night, the room was made up. The location is excellent for central SF with many attractions near by, and excellent transport links (BART and MUNI) within easy reach. The BART makes it especially easy for travel to SFO. Yes, there is street noise due to it's location - but as others have pointed out, if you ensure the small vents at the base of the windows are shut tight, then it should be fine. Wi-fi was expensive, which is a shame, but I've seen worse prices elsewhere! I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not as many amenities as I expected”
Reviews.Author: ScreenName97
Reviews.Content: This hotel had beautiful decor, helpful staff, and a great location. But on the downside, it was noisy and did not offer the amenities that other 4 star hotels have. I'm usually a budget traveler for leisure, then stay at nice places for business. But I was disappointed. There was one restaurant with limited hours. The room service hours and menu were even more limited. I ordered a breakfast delivered one morning during my stay, but it was more than 45 minutes late and I had to leave for work before it arrived. The staff was very helpful about correcting the situation. I stayed on the 5th floor, next to the gym, and had the same problems as the previous post. But the gym wasn't the only noise problem. I could here everything on the street, entire phone conversations of nearby guests, televisions of nearby guests, etc. The hotel even supplies ear plugs with the bath toiletries. I had to use them because the street noise repeatedly woke me up every night This was not a bad hotel, but don't expect 4-star. If they advertised as a 3-star hotel then I would give them fantastic reviews. But when I hear 4-star, I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but avoid Floor 5!”
Reviews.Author: Kitten84
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location. We arrived tired after a long flight and BA strikes and got straight of the BART and saw the hotel, perfect! Checked in and even though we had requested 2 rooms on the same level discovered the two couples were on seperate floors. No problem but a bit annoying. We unfortunately got a room on Floor 5, next to the gym! The constant noice of the treadmill drove me mad! Hotel was perfect apart from the gym noise, close enough to all sights, helpful staff and very clean. We came back to this hotel after 4 days in Vegas, paid more and got a room on a higher floor, on a corner. the view was beautiful and the room much bigger. Get what you pay for i guess. All in all, i would stay here again, just not anywhere near the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Simonkey
Reviews.Content: Frankly I was a little worried about staying here based on some of the mixed reviews I read here and on Yelp. I stayed here for two nights over the recent Columbus Day holiday weekend with my partner. I had another reservation at an upscale hotel in FiDi (twice the rate of the Parc 55 but was still considered a fantastic rate for that particular hotel) but in the end, I chose to stay here. I thought I would regret the decision I made. I thought the Parc was going to be too large, too impersonal, and overall, just not live up to my standards. I was ready to be disappointed and regret my decision to stay here...boy, was I wrong! Valet parking was a breeze even though the hotel was booked to capacity on the dates of my stay. The cost of parking for a SF hotel was reasonable ($41 + tax per day). Check-in was easy as well. The hotel lobby was nice and spacious. When we got up to our room, we'd found that we'd been given a handicapped room. It would have been fine but we found the sliding bathroom door did not close all the way. Since I was traveling with my partner and this was only our second trip together, I did not find this to be acceptable. I went downstairs and the front desk staff was apologetic and searched for another room. Within a few minutes, they were able to locate another room (higher floor, same bed size, corner room! upgrade!!). They also rerouted our refrigerator that had been sent to our original room to our new room. There were no hiccups with our special request and they never acted like I was bothering them at all. Our new corner room had two windows, a large TV, and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was large and very clean. The shower pressure was awesome! We never heard another peep from the neighbors except for the occasional door closing. We did hear sirens from the streets below (we were on the 23rd floor) but this was to be expected. This was not an extremely large room but for traveling with one other person, this was a good size. No complaints here whatsoever with our room. For such a large hotel, I never had to wait long for an elevator. Even though the hotel was bustling (a good feeling), it never felt crowded. The valets were quick to respond and extremely pleasant and helpful. We never had to wait long for our car to be pulled around. Staff was also helpful with organizing cab rides at the taxi stand conveniently located near the entrance. The concierge was also helpful with directions and maps. The front desk graciously gave us an extra hour to checkout as well. Finally, the hotel is conveniently located to the 80 freeway making it very easy to get in/out of the city. I've been to SF many times over the last 15 years and have no worries about staying near the Tenderloin. As long as you don't make yourself a target, walk briskly and confidently, and don't walk through there at night, it's not a problem. I know this has been mentioned on here so I just wanted to put my 2 cents in... I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city. Fantastic value for your money and first class service all around! Thanks Parc 55 for making this one of the best stays I've ever had in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: nymancorey
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to Market Street, Union Square, shopping and downtown SF, this is a great hotel for you. It is extremely large (convention hotel and over 1000 rooms) but doesn't feel like it at all. Rooms are decent sized, but the bathrooms are plenty large with ample space on the counter. The service at the bar was underwhelming and the offerings were average, but we wanted to have more local food based on the city's reputation. One item I found obscene was overnight parking, which was over $50.00 per night! This is crazy. I would return as the value of the room to price paid was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: deepestBlue22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a business conference from September 17-24. This hotel is in the heart of Union Square. It is steps away from the Cable car stop, avenues of shopping and in the heart bustling city streets. I enjoyed waking up to the sounds of the city. Our room was a corner king on the 21st floor. We were upgraded to a room with Club Access. The room was very spacious with views of two different parts of San Francisco. It included a small couch by the window that provided a very pleasant atmosphere. Overall the room was very clean and the maid service was excellent. The one complaint are TERRIBLE pillows. Very difficult to sleep on. I would advise requesting extra pillows or inquiring about better pillows. Club Access includes a complimentary breakfast, evening snacks, cocktails and desserts. Club Access is a very good option for travelers with children because the breakfast offering is very diverse and includes fruit, pastries, various sliced breads, cereals, cold cuts and juices. The house coffee is Starbucks. Internet/Business center Wireless in the room is $15/day or $44/week. The business center is fairly small but has enough computers and printers. Health Club Health club is very well equipped, with free weights, machines and numerous cardio machines. The cardio machines have personal TVs, but not all of the TVs work. Cityhouse restaurant We ate there twice and the food was good, but pretty overpriced. The late night scene at the Cityhouse is very lively and it is a great place to grab a late night meal and drinks. Keep your eye open for celebrities that walk in. Room service We ordered room service one morning and our bill was $70 for two omelettes and a pot of coffee. The food was delicious and it was nice having breakfast and enjoying the beautiful views from the room. Overall a great hotel, amazing location, great for business travelers and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Upgrade to the club...”
Reviews.Author: lvpropguy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Upgrade to the club level...worth the extra bucks! Stay here and you have no reason to rent a car...just get a city pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain for Stay in Union Square (Except Parking)”
Reviews.Author: duckrb
Reviews.Content: I went to San Francisco with friends for a weekend in September. All my friends are in college and I just graduated so we don't have a whole lot of money, but we wanted to stay as close to downtown as possible. Parc 55 was a great place to stay for what we paid (around 150/night) it was centrally located and inexpensive (in San Franciscan terms), the rooms were modern, equipped with plasma tvs, clean white sheets, etc, etc. In other words for this kind of money it was definitely a bargain, everyone was very friendly at the hotel, prompt room service, great customer service, only complaint is that valet parking was around... 44 dollars a night, I think? But hey, it's San Francisco parking is expensive and at least this covered valet. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parcsfo
Reviews.Content: We traveled with family that had never been to San Francisco, and they absolutely loved the location of our hotel. It was within walking to the Westfield Mall, Apple store, cable cars, F Train pickup and Bart. We picked up a Muni passport which was also highly convenient. We love Parc 55 and will stay there every time we go to San Francisco. The rooms are clean and service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: thirstycanuck
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco for a short getaway and found a great deal on priceline - $113 CDN/ night. We have found this hotel even cheaper ($80/night) depending on the season. Since their renovation a year and a half ago, they lobby and rooms have been updated and are pleasant. Very comfortable and clean. However, the real reason to stay here (besides the great pricline prices) is the location - less than a block from a BART station, close to Union Square, and walking distance to the Ferry Building.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great prices.”
Reviews.Author: goduke150
Reviews.Content: I came to the Parc 55 for the Salesforce.com Dreamforce convention. It is extremely close to the Moscone center and the prices were much better than the other locations nearby. I was very happy with the rooms. Spring for the upper levels if you can. They're not much more expensive and are definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: pattim1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days, went down the coast for six days and liked the Parc so much, when we returned to SF we booked it for one more night before we left for home. It is located at Market and 5th, which is a great central location. Bus, trolley, and train are right outside your door not to mention fantastic high end shopping! We even walked to Chinatown twice. Also, several car rental stores are right there so you don't need to rent a car at the airport. I do suggest booking your car online in advance. The line on a Saturday morning to get a car was out the door and down the street at the Hertz rental! We booked a car online for a Friday to visit Napa and had no problem and it was a lot cheaper, too. The concierge was very helpful with directions and suggested some fantastic restaurants. Our room was clean and spacious, although pay the extra to get an upper room to avoid the street noise and for a better view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Iamirish
Reviews.Content: We took the Bay Shuttle from the airport to Parc 55, $17 each. It was a good experience. We had a very quick check in. The hotel is close to all transportation. We did not have a car so that was a plus. We bought a Muni pass, $20 for three days. It was well worth the money. We used it for the cable car and the street cars. We were on 29th floor, excellent view of the city with access to the club room. We had breakfast there and it was good, lots of choice. We did not go in the evening for the free cocktails. The club room is spacious with lovely views of the city. It is however closed on weekends which is too bad. Our room was a good size. It was well maintained, fresh and clean. We were not bothered at all by street noise. We never had to wait on an elevator. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Hotel is within walking distance to a large mall and many good restaurants are nearby. Would stay again, perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Rosedew78b
Reviews.Content: I travelled to California with my 20 year old son and very much chose this hotel based on previous reviews. All Trip Advisors' reviews were most helpful. It is a fact that you are much better off chosing a CLUB room which gives you access to upper floors, a separate breakfast room on the 31st floor and snacks which are handly for jet-lagged travellers who cannot face going out.after a day out on the town. You also have access to the business center which made it easier for us to print boarding passes or check some information on internet. Well worth the few extra dollars. Our room was on the 24th floor, large, bright with robes and plenty of towels. I enjoyed our 4 night stay there and felt at home. One drawback, there is no minibar/fridge. We did not have too much noise as we were high enough but it is true that if you close the small vent just under the window, it will be almost silent. Plenty of good restaurants around - good shopping on the door step and right in front of various transports. The staff was efficient at check-in, you can do an electronic check-out. We took a taxi from and to SFO airport and paid USD 30 which we thought was great. One small advice, if you are looking to buy 3 days or 5 days travel cards, go later in the afternoon for the next day or you will be facing a huge queue. I can recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing and not recommended”
Reviews.Author: duncan_kirk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in mid September and were very disappointed in the hotel. The reception areas are nice (and the food we had in the restaurant were excellent), but the rooms were poor, they were noisy and they were tired. I read previous reviews on here about the noise and thought it couldn't be that bad, but it is. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: heiditrekking
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotels in SF are located in the downtown/union square area. Parc55 is conveniently located on the MUNI/BART lines, plus Powell St. cable car. Also, located next to Union Square and Westfield mall - making it perfect if you plan to do a bit of shopping. The Westfield mall food court is one of the nicest I've ever scene with quite a variety of good food. Good for families. Pros: Good price/value. Nice rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. Cons: The hotel is downtown in a major urban area; it can be crowded with tourists, but it's to be expected... Not a good idea to walk around at night. Its perfectly fine to walk around during the day and easy to grab a taxi or hop on the train. No coffee machine or coffee shop in the lobby (but that may not bother you)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: lwa3
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very clean, with very helpful staff. The hotel room is cleaned everyday if you want it and they do make a very good job. They give lots of towels and cleaning products as well. This hotel is very popular with flight staff & pilots so does get really busy when waiting to check in/out. The hotel rooms are very big & clean. The air conditioning is a bit poor, doesn't make the room very cold. The hotel gives free computer and Internet access in the reception area which is very handy for online check in. The hotel is in a fantastic location, only 2 minutes walk round to Union Square. All in all, a very lovely hotel, which I would recommend to anyone! Definitely worth a booking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: kanata-pete
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. I wasn't pleased with the staff. They never seemed very pleased to help or answer questions. My biggest complaint would be that you had to pay for the Internet. No hotel should make you pay for the Internet . If I were to go back to San Francisco I would try one of the other many hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicho123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in late August 2010. The hotel is beautiful and modern and in a great location for shopping, eating and transportation. The staff were great and very helpful. We had a room overlooking the city which had two double beds and a very nice modern bathroom. The hotel was only a few steps away from the tram line which takes you down to the wharf area or in the opposite direction to the Castro. The hotel had complimentary internet for guests which is a big plus. We would definitely stay in this hotel again the next time we're in San Francisco and would definitely recommend it to anyone whether it be for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reddon14
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected. It was a standard, cleaner than average hotel. I stayed on the 27th floor which ended up having great views including downtown, the ocean, and even the golden gate. We didn't really spend much time in our room, but did find the rooms well appointed and very clean. The turndown service at night was nice, especially the chocolates!! Cant comment on room service, in house dining, etc, because we didn't use any of that. You cant beat this location. Convient to loads of shops and restaurants, and only a short cab/cable car/trolley car ride to everything else you might want to see and do. We never had a problem with noise, other than the odd siren (big deal). Yes there are homeless people around the hotel...Any big city with decent weather and lots of tourists has a problem with homeless people. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you get a good rate!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: owen30
Reviews.Content: i was happy to get this hotel on priceline, as the first hotel stop of our honeymoon trip to the US, and gladly my huch was correct. located in a good place near union sq. getting around was very easy. the check-in was fast and the room was clean and met our expectations. if you go to SF, i would definitely recommend PARC 55.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: CanalcruiserDerby
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via Hotwire. Great location. our room on the 21st floor was a reasonable size, very clean but lacking in storage space for our clothes. No problems with noise and a great view. staff were friendly and helpful.. The lobby and the reception area are a bit austere (where did they get the red plastic? chairs) a small change here would be a great improvement. we enjoyed our stay and at the Parc 55 and would recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “would come back”
Reviews.Author: Syneva
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, nice location, decent price. Would definitely stay again. The parking was $50/night so budget for it or take BART into the city. (BART station is about half a block away)

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with checkin and room readiness!”
Reviews.Author: Tuckerman41
Reviews.Content: We checked in and upon arriving in room discovered that it had not been cleaned from previous occupants. After a long (6 hour) flight, this was a great disappointment. Called down to desk to arrange another room and were told to wait for delivery of new key so we didn't have to lug bags back and forth. Never saw the key delivery after about 30 minute wait in dirty room, and two phone calls to desk. Went down to desk with all of our bags, expecting immediate attention (luxury hotel better attend to something like this immediately) and was brushed off by receptionist. When finally attended to, apologies started. A bit late considering that we were now almost an hour from the first check in. We were give a room key that allowed access to the 'club' level which basically provided us with free continental breakfast. Since we were touring we could not have taken advantage of any other privileges. Room we were given was also an upgrade but that was also a minor comp since we really were hardly in the room. Remainder of experience was fine but I have to say I've never had a check in experience this bad before. As such, I have a difficult time recommending Parc55 in San Francisco as a place to stay that claims to be luxury and strong attention to clients.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location-great value”
Reviews.Author: mblr
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Parc 55 were very friendly and provided excellent customer service. Walking down the hall, everyone said hello and was so attentive. The rooms were a good size and were very clean. Our room had a small deck and we were able to open up the door and get some fresh air into the room. The noise from the street made it challenging to keep the door open for long, but surprisingly never heard any noise at night. It is super easy to get to from the airport-it is 1 block away from the Powell street station and the bus/trolley stop is less than a block from the hotel. Save yourself some money and shop for food, drug store or liquor store before you get to the hotel-the neighborhood is expensive. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TimboCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel in a great location if you prefer to be closer to the city rather than fisherman's wharf. Right opposite the shopping mall and next to the Powell Street Cable car terminal turntable. Public transport is great, I recommend the All day pass giving you unlimited use of bus/tram/cable car. We were on the 22nd floor and some evidence of city noise. Earplugs supplied :) Can't recommend Alcatraz tour highly enough, DON'T miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dudley66
Reviews.Content: Situated just minutes from Union Square and Chinatown, Parc 55 is a great place to be based while in SF. The hotel rests comfortably between a smart desgner shopping area and the Tenderloin area which is home to crackheads, pimps, hookers, dealers and lowlifes of all kinds. The streets of the Tenderloin stink of urine and the buildings are run down. Basically if you like character and diversity you'll love it. If you dont, just stick to the front side of the hotel and you'll be fine. There are more homeless people in SF that anywhere else Ive been. A few asked for money but none were aggresive or bothersome. Look out for the cardboard signs that most of them carry and you'll see some very amusing scribblings. The hotel room was very nice. Good quiet aircon, a 42inch plasma tv, power shower, citrus flavoured free moisturiser and a spectacular view of the city made this the perfect hotel for me. At breakfast you can sit down for a $22 breakfast of you can get 2 pastries and a Starbucks coffee in the reception area for just $5. There was also FREE internet in the lobby! Great hotel and a fantastic city. GO THERE!

Reviews.Title: “10 anniversary - great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: dukeswalker
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I stayed here for 3 nights. We were placed on the 20th floor, in a corner room with windows facing West & South....what amazing views!! The room was spacious and incredibly clean. In fact - I place on calling the hotel in the AM to give kuddos to the housekeeper for our room. Was there noise? yes....you are in a city...in a hotel. When a firetruck goes by our neighborhood at home, I hear it. When the kids take a shower upstairs....I hear it. Why people think that you wont hear that here is beyond me. One night we slept with the vents under the window open but did need to shut them as it made a huge difference in noise. We also chose to keep the fan on (the fan on the a/c controls) to help drown out the street noise. We slept great all 3 nights. The only downside was the concierge that was on duty on Fri. night. We stopped by to talk to him twice - he was the least helpful person we met in SF. The concierges in general seemed to assume that "everyone knows how to use public transportation". Thats not always the case - hubby and I come from a large city - that has NO form of public transportation....trying to find a bus/street car in crazy Union Square during rush hour, is a daunting task. A little guidance - or even a step-by-step how to guide would be incredibly helpful. We spent 4 great days here - we stayed out of the "touristy" traps and really SAW SF. What an amazing city. If anyone is looking for any casual, easy, fun ideas for a 30+yo in SF...hit me up! I'd love to share what we did..

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: mattkrae
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights in early September. We stayed on the 27th floor in a club room which came with a very nice breakfast. The location is excellent (especially for access to the BART) and our room was very quiet. The service at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. We had trouble closing the window and after calling down this was remedied promptly. Beds and linens were very comfortable. The value was good (about $200 per night) especially considering the breakfast that was included. It would be nice if for that price, wifi internet was included in the price of the room (it cost an additional $12.95 per day). We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlinAlltheTime
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the fifth floor over labor day weekend. We found bedbugs in the bed! When I slapped one at night, it popped with blood! We ended up with bites on our arms and legs. Now I am afraid that they have followed us home. I looked up bedbugs on the web, and it turns out they are coming back and are very hard to get rid of once an infestation occurs. I am not sure if it just taking time to get past all of the bites - they are very, very itchy - or if they have hitched a ride to our home in our luggage. Yuck! Also, our room was very loud from the noise of people outside. The room came with earplugs in the bathroom that I had to use to go to sleep. That should have been the warning right there. The staff wasn't very nice either and gave us a hard time when we tried to change rooms. The bell man and the valet service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Parc 55 for 4 nites in September. Overall it was a very good experience. As noted in several reviews, its location is terrific being central to the BART, buses, and cable cars. The BART from SFO is $8.10 and has a stop at the hotel near Powell St. We walked everywhere and to Chinatown about a 1 mile and up to Nob Hill. Our car rental was through Enterprise which was located across the street. Valet parking is $45 per nite which was the standard for the area. A very touristy location with plenty of high end shopping (Nordstromâ€™s, Saks etc) and the very large Westfield Mall, all a few steps from Parc 55. This is a very large hotel 1,000+ yet the service both at the front desk and housekeeping was very good. We booked directly through the hotel and their special 20% off for 3 nites worked out to $120 per nite. The room was a king deluxe that was good size and the bath was large with strong shower and all the amenities with good quality towels. HD TV was in all rooms. In house safe was complimentary. The room was made up on a timely basis. The elevators were fast and for a hotel this size, (it was sold out) never had to wait. The 4th floor business center had complimentary internet with a bank of 5 pcâ€™s and there was always a free one. In room internet was $12.95. One foul up was our room on the 9th floor had a distinct smell of smoke that required an aerosol that was promptly delivered by housekeeping. The front desk offered an upgrade but we were so tired passed on their offer and the aerosol did wonders to correct the problem. We did take them up on the offer for our last nite and got a Club Concierge room on the 27th floor which came with continental breakfast. The front desk was very accommodating in some of our minor requests as well.. There is plenty of places close by to grab a coffee in the morning. There are a fair amount of homeless people in the several blocks around the hotel so be aware when walking. In sum, a great value and would definitely return to the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: camara73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Parc 55 over the Labor Day holiday and it was wonderful. This is a very nice hotel that seems to be located right in the middle of everything. There are 3-4 restaurants(from Thai, sushi, sports bars, burger king, Carls Jr. and too many more to name) located on every street surrounding the hotel so food options plentiful as is shopping choices. This was ouf first trip to San Francisco and the hotel made it a wonderful experience. We booked through Expedia and got a good rate, however if you get a rental car be aware of the $50/day parking fee. We knew this ahead of time as I read several reviews here so it was already factored in and the parking situation in the city isn't great and can get pricey. Looking forward to visiting San Francisco again and the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “AS Expected”
Reviews.Author: mirabili
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read about Parc 55 regarding its convenient location, the cleanliness of the room and the warm welcome came out true as expected. The little nice details included how the housekeeping people kept even the tiniest clutter (shoes, toiletries, pens) in place. There was a construction going on at the side of the hotel which made noise during the night, but it is something that is temporary. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel because of its convenient location and reasonable rates and pampered by housekeeping department. We stayed at the 21st floor for 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel... and some tips!”
Reviews.Author: JayH1977
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay. Very clean room, a good size, and well appointed. We had a room on the 12th floor (hotel is 30-35 stories I think) and even that high up you could hear the traffic, but it didn't impact our stay. The staff was friendly, and it was very convenient to BART. We are used to staying in hotels that have swimming pools, but they do have an up to date fitness center. I've noticed many of the reviews for this hotel mention three things: parking, a charge for internet access, and not getting the room type they requested online. The parking is very comparable to the prices other hotels in the area are charging, and public parking garages aren't much cheaper. If you book the room with the hotel directly or with Wyndham you can join their membership program Wydham Request which is free, and gives you free internet access and some other perks. The last thing applies to all hotels: if you book at an online website like priceline you cannot always guarantee your room type, which is part of the reason they often give you a bit of a better price, but you should read the fine print and not be surprised when you get the smoking room or double beds you didn't want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJ071103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 on August 10-13. As soon as I walked through the door, a staff member of the hotel ran over to help my carry my suitcase down the steps. Check-in is on the second floor. The front desk agent couldn't find our reservation and was only able to pull up a different one that was previously cancelled. I almost had an anxiety attack, but good thing I was able to provide her with my reservation code and they just used that to reinstate it. In the time it took to sort that out, a room became available (great since it was only about 11am). The decor of the hotel and the room was very nice and modern. Street noise outside wasn't that bad, but it's expected since it's downtown. Our room on the 15th floor was facing Union Square and we had a view of the Transamerica Pyramid. There are two computers on the second floor and a business center on the fourth floor with five computers. The location of the hotel is perfect - only a short walk to Union Square and right by the BART station, cable car turnaround, Westfield Shopping Center and Market Street where it was easy to catch various buses and the F-line trolley. The doorman always greeted us and opened the door. Overall a nice hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pamian37
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located so great for getting around. Rooms are great and check-in staff helpful ad friendly. Recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, room quality and cleanliness. Staff could improve.”
Reviews.Author: Diogo_Rio_de_Janeiro
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a good overall value (reservation through priceline.com). B-fast not included it has a good location (next to Union Square and BART station), great comfortable bed, room decor. Only downside was a hard time getting a friendly staff orientation at the frontdesk (not really a big deal).

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Link3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Parc 55 twice recently while visiting San Francisco on business and have gotten great deals booking through Hotels.com and Orbitz.com. The hotel is in a great location and I have been very happy with the size and comfort of the rooms. Staff have been friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location, comfy room and an awesome employee!”
Reviews.Author: stingah88
Reviews.Content: I booked this room even though I live in San Francisco, because I needed some alone time with my sweetie, and also due to the fact that I get an incredible rate here as an employee of the company. I loved the room, the decor of the hotel, the ambiance, and the helpful, professional front desk agent, Monty! He greeted us with warmth and fixed a mishap (not done by him) that ocurred in a swift and caring manner that made all of the difference in the world to us. Great service means the world, and is not easily forgotten. The bar and restaurant there are also awesome. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone in search of a San Francisco gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rmsht12
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel.Near everything(dining.shopping,transportation etc). Stayed @parc 55 last week & the hotel is very nice & all personel were fantastic. Never wanted for anything. They have a free continental breakfast every day & free desert @ night. Also free cheese & crackers in the late afternoon. Rooms were spacious & clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sci01
Reviews.Content: Got this reservation at the last minute through Priceline for a great deal -- and when I checked in they assigned me a wonderful room with a view. I will definitely choose this hotel in the future. Rooms are very nicely decorated and clean. Staff is very nice. Location is top notch -- steps from the Bart station and right by shopping, places to eat. At least on the twelfth floor, the room was quiet (i.e not too much street noise). Noise can be an issue at the smaller boutique hotels. Used room-service since I got a great deal on the room: good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Makes it Worth Overlooking Other Issues”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine103
Reviews.Content: First, a tip: If you have a car you need to park (no in and out) and are staying at Parc 55 (or any other parking gouging hotel nearby) check out Jessie Square Garage (google search). It is safe, secure and about half the price. It's about a 10 minute walk - one of the best moves I made in planning this trip. Now for the rest of the review: You could hardly do better than Parc 55 in terms of location. Right next to BART and the turntable for the cable cars. By taking a gamble on Priceline it was priced right. I would not have paid published rates. Due to such high traffic all the carpet and common areas look soiled and well worn. The place is so sterile and gray it seems fairly institutional and depressing - very stark. My children had a hard time believing we were actually in a hotel until we made our way to the room. If you're not planning to hang at the hotel all day - who really cares? The location really does make up for a myriad of deficiencies. The room was nice and of a decent size with an excellent view from the 16th floor. If you do have children who seem to be more interested in the hotel pool than they are in the Golden Gate Bridge - this may not be the place for you. Although, knowing there was none, we didn't hear the constant usual nagging as to when we might be able to swim. It seems they are very short staffed on housekeeping. We'd been gone from all day - 8a-4p. When we came back, no one had been to tidy up at all. At 4:30 they finally showed up and wanted us to leave so they could clean. 4:30? Really? We politely told them never mind but they kept interrupting us every half hour until about 7 to make sure we really meant it. Bottomline: If you can get it at near half published rates go for it. If you're paying published rates I think you could do better on all counts except maybe location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JMH79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a block from the BART, cable cars, street cars and bus stops. Couldn't ask for a better location! The only downfall to the location was the downtown noise that the windows could not keep out. Large clean modern rooms, a teriffic fitness center and free business center made it worth it though.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: Our usual hotel (the Westin St. Francis) has been so disappointing that we decided to try a couple of new hotels for this trip. We started at the Parc 55 and were not disappointed. The BART literally stops across the street from this hotel. Shopping, restaurants, and the Blue Bottle Coffee bar are all CLOSE! Our room was large, clean, and had a beautiful view of the city. We would have gladly stayed there for the entire trip, but decided to try keep our original schedule in order to have a few choices when we go to SF. In all, this is a nice hotel . . . it would be nice if there weren't such a vagrant population in this area, but that is beyond the hotel's control and seems to be an epidemic in SF.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel choice we ever made”
Reviews.Author: kellylauren
Reviews.Content: We booked a non-smoking room, and when we got there they put us in a smoking room. When we tried to change it, citing our reservation, they stated it would be $20 extra per night and it was considered an 'upgrade'. An upgrade when we already reserved the non-smoking? I asked to speak to the manager, and he said he was the manager on duty. He was very rude to us, and due to allergies, we were forced to pay extra for a room we already reserved at a specific rate. Not cool, dude. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JCL1903
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to Union Square. Big room & bathroom. Very clean. Lovely service from very helpful staff. 24hr fitness centre which is quite well equipped. Free fruit/newspapers/internet access. You can hear the city noise at night, but earplugs are provided. There is a reasonably priced Thai restaurant in the bottom of the hotel. Westfield is across the road, with a decent food court that is open till 8pm. And best of all, the BART (subway) station is only about 25 metres away, which means you can catch a train from San Fran airport directly to the Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard large hotel”
Reviews.Author: benmacd
Reviews.Content: Great location, situated right next to the Powell stop so easy to jump onto the BART or Muni. Rooms were standard for a hotel of this size (over 1000 rooms) and the staff were polite and helpful. Internet was extra, as was breakfast but we got this on Hotwire so didn't expect much. Overall, it was a good hotel for the price we paid and have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: captnkirk
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Parc55 on a stop over from Sydney to London. I had booked it 5 months in advance from the cracking photos of rooms and reviews on the website, in the event we arrived too early for the room at 10.30. they couldnt say when it would be ready and offered another room which as we were tired after the long flight we accepted. They also rang up later to see if we were OK which was nice. The room on 24th floor was perfectly adequate if not as cracking as the website, it was of reasonable size, great beds and linen, good tele, coffee maker, desk, nice bay window with slight glimpse of water through buildings and small table and chairs. The bathroom was a good size with good shower and fitments but the bath was very low indeed which made it difficult to use without flooding the floor and there were bath requisites with soap bars rather than shower gel. There was very little drawer space which didnt matter too much to us on a short trip, there were two suitcase frames for suitcase living. There was a connecting door but this didnt impact on us. The decoration was a little tired as were the public areas, we saw a lot of cleaning going on but I dont think the colour scheme helps.The room was quiet (high floor helps) and we slept well. We taxied in quite reasonably from the airport, and the hotel luggage attendant offered us a stretch limo back for a little extra. A couple of niggles about unneccessary meanness : there were 2 bottles of water in the room which were charged at quite a high rate, complimentary wouldve been a nice touch: The room wifi charge was high, OK for business users on expenses but annoying for poor tourists, there was a free business centre with 6 ish PCs and 2 printers and a further 3 or so and a printer in the corridor but it was generally clogged with facebook refugees from the room wifi charge. I had to join a queue at various times including trying to check in, might be worth designating a pc and printer for checking in like other hotels. Also it would be nice to have more seating by the door area while waiting for taxis tours etc. The location was great being near Union Square but also near the vintage cable car terminus and the interesting trolley buses stop, both for Fishermans Wharf. A favourite trip was trolley bus to either the Ferry building and/or Pier 39 and then cable car back from the Mason Street terminus. We breakfasted at the Sunflower Cafe in O'Farrell Street a block up from the hotel and we liked Swiss Louis on Pier 39 for its views of the Rock, the Bridge, the sealions and their food and service .

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Taqone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and enjoyed it very much. As stated by other reviewers it is very easy to commute from SFO by BART underground system to Powell Street station (which takes 30-40min). The station is very close to the hotel within viewing distance, (2min walk). The reception staff were very nice and so were the cleaners. Our room was on the 10th floor at the back of the hotel, which meant that we didnâ€™t have much of a view, but we didnâ€™t suffer from any traffic noise that some reviewers had commented about. The room was also larger than I had expected with a king size bed, large flat screen TV, desk, sofas (one of which was a sofa bed). It also had a wardrobe which contained the typical safe and also an ironing board and iron which was a first for me. The bathroom was clean and adequate and the shower was nothing special. It is also worth mentioning at this point that it seems that this hotel is favoured by airline companies. We have noticed large groups of staff from BA and Lufthansa waiting for their rooms . We enjoyed a buffet breakfast at the restaurant which was very good. It had a selection of cold meats cheese, cereal, juices, smoothies and also a selection of hot food with egg, bacon etc. Just behind the lifts were 3 computers which were free to use, with access to the internet, which was very useful. The hotel location was great near all forms of transport, almost on Market Street, which has all the top end shops. It is near the Westfield shopping centre, near Union Square and near the tram that connects Market Street to Fishermanâ€™s Warf, which is a big attraction for tourists. Just one note I would like to make here. If you are new to San Francisco please look up the areas that you should stay away from (its easy to do with your search engine), as for some reason the top end hotels seem to be in or next to areas that are not very nice and you wont want to take a wrong turn to these places which is easy to do. SF also seems to be full of homeless people who are on the whole harmless but when it get darker can make you feel unsafe. (donâ€™t let me put you off I just want to warn you what to expect, the people in the city are nice) Over all we thought the hotel was great but we would suggest if you are new to SF to try to find a place near the Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, which is more pleasant and offers more activities for you to do away from the shopping area and safer during night time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hip lobby, not so good service”
Reviews.Author: StrangeTripper
Reviews.Content: So, i read a few other recent reviews---and there were some familiar issues........... My wife Pricelined this hotel for something like 80-90 bucks a night---not a bad deal for a hipster-type hotel in a kick-a** location in San Fran (REALLY near the BART, like 50 yards from the front door; near Market street and trolley line; restaurants etc.....). My trip was for a wedding and I stayed 2 nights. When i got there, the clerk told me the only room available was a SMOKING room. I'm thinking: WHAAAT?????? I thought smoking in public buildings was banned in San Fran, or even the whole state! She told me the Parc 55 somehow loopholed its way around the smoking ban... And since it was booked thru Priceline, there's no guarantee of what type of room you get, so she said.... OK, so i accepted it. The entire 8th floor is smoking, so when i got off the elevator, it hit me like a ton of bricks.... The room was a bit better, but when i woke up the next morning, i had a headache... Meanwhile, my wife learned of my situation and called the Parc 55 to raise hell. The manager said she will make sure i have a non smoking room my 2nd night. Well, she came through with her promise and it was great! In conclusion, eliminate the smoking floor, and you have a great hotel in a great location. The rooms (and bathrooms) were roomy and not gloomy. The beds were comfortable. The lobby was kinda cool and hip, as was the restaurant, from what i could tell.... But, as long as this hotel has that dreaded smoking floor (and seemingly routinely sticks its Priceline customers there), i can't give it a great rating. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mriguana
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location, above average service, facilities appear to be recently renovated Cons: Must get a high floor room because it is very noisy at night in downtown San Francisco! Review: In the middle of the summer in a tourist city like SF you more of less expect to a bad hotel experience because it's the crowded high season. I was pleasantly surprised to find the Parc put out the extra effort and make our stay actually pleasant and memorable. The staff was universally friendly and accommodating. They were not fake or snobbish or constantly shaking us down for tips, which I have experienced in other SF hotels. Although there were times when the staff seemed disorganized, they worked to correct mistakes instead of offering glib apologies. In sum, I would give the service an A for effort, if not flawless execution (which I didn't expect anyway). The hotel itself feels clean and contemporary, but not so cool that kids are unwelcome. We had a good room with a nice view (we were on the 21st floor), so no complaints there. Good value for money. The hotel deserves kudos for not being just another San Francisco tourist dollar factory.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay”
Reviews.Author: JM07Wirral
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel in the UK months ago, before we left - at a non-refundable price - which was good but not what I would call, "a deal." The hotel was easy to get to from the airport via BART and also great for all other tourist transportation links including MUNI, buses, cable cars and street cars. We had an easy check in, Sarah on reception was very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 25th floor was large and extremely comfortable and cleaned impeccably every day. Yes, we could hear the city traffic (apparently the fire engines are called first in an emergency as they have paramedics on board) but after a hard day sightseeing we were out like lights - even my husband who is a light sleeper. The ice machine by the lifts was very useful and we used the business suite several times - although I would have preferred the convenience of free internet connection in my room as we had in the MGM Grand the previous week. There were plenty of lifts which were very quick- nothing worse than waiting to go to your room or to get out. The homeless people do not approach you but can be disturbing if you are not used to a city environment. We would recommend this hotel and use it again if we went back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great time in san fran”
Reviews.Author: khyron1969
Reviews.Content: Just got back from parc 55 and it was great! Check in was quick and easy, Asked what floor we were on and the desk person (Denis I think) asked what floor do we whant to be on and we got a room on the 26th. The room was large and had a great city view. The bed's were not the most comfortable but I could sleep on anything after a day out in the city. Sure there was noise but you are in the middle of a large city (suck it up). The location could not be better with access to miuni and bart with in feet of the hotel. Also the resturants are to many to count around this hotel and for those who need their starbucks there is one a block away, and several withen 3 blooks. I can not to say enough about this hotel from the front desk to the cleanning staff thing 's were great and the hotel made are first trip whith out our little one a great vacation

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonVince
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in San Francisco, and I think this has to be my favorite. The rooms are very clean with a nice large bathroom. Check in was a snap, the maid was wonderful, and the location is tops. Got a AAA rate of $97/night over the 4th of July holiday. Would absolutely recommend and stay here again. Thank you Parc 55, you made our week in SF just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Hey it's a place to sleep..”
Reviews.Author: raptor418
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Fran for the first time for a one week vacation at the beginning of the month and we basically picked this hotel because of the price and location. It was a very good deal considering that is has public transportation passing right next to it that will take you to all of the major tourist locals and its also far enough away from the Tenderloin area that you don't feel in danger when your walking around outside. Yes it does have its issues, #1 being that you can hear everything that's going on around outside even though I was on the 29th floor, but it really didn't bother me ounce my head hit the pillow after an exhausting day of playing tourist. Someday when I go back to San Francisco I'll probably stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Sijxn
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great comfy beds with big pillows of different shapes and sizes. Flatscreen TV, coffee maker, desk and armchairs. Bathroom is your normal American hotel bathroom, they all look the same. Service here is always good. Staff friendly and attentive. I always enjoy staying here. Nice restaurant, bright with big windows. Good location, just next to Market Street. Hotel is quiet but as in most big American cities there is occasional noise from fire engines who seem to think they need to use their horns even at 2am when the streets are empty. Hotel provides earplugs in the bathroom but its not a problem falling back to sleep if woken up because the beds are so comfortable. I dont know the room rate, my company pays it, so I cant comment on value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Another hotel guest open my door with his key !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blackhole_child
Reviews.Content: Sunday night 8/15/2010. I stayed at room 2469, just got out of shower, standing naked in the room. Another guest opened my room door with his key!!!! I was so shocked !!! I have been staying at hotels about 100 nights per year for the last 10 years. Never had anything like this happened to me. But Parc55....wow...a total crap hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. I'm writing this review at 3:15am after getting an erroneous wake-up call from the front desk. Just another in a laundry list of mistakes the staff here has made. Our reservation was supposedly prepaid, but on arrival we were informed that the charge for the room was never made 8 months ago and that they would have to charge us now. They then booked us into a smoking room, even though our reservation clearly said nonsmoking. The credit card hold for incidentals is $100 per room per night, even though there are no minibars in the rooms. The bell staffs' idea of opening the door is hitting the handicap door button while they ignore you as they text on their phones and the valet service took an average of 25 minutes to retrieve our car, even though we were paying $50 a night to park here. Now to be fair, the rooms are clean and the location is excellent, but the awful, awful service just ruins that fact.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TripGal_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation in San Francisco, and the Parc 55 was the perfect location for us. We took the BART from the airport and when we exited at the Powell station, we looked up and saw the hotel right away. The Powell cable car line is on the same block as well as multiple cable car and bus stops, a great location for public transportation. Jon at the front desk found us a room on the 23rd floor with a view and we were pleasantly surprised to find a small fridge in the room (I don't think that this is available in every room) and a safe in the closet. There are many Walgreens stores in the area, so we could stock up our fridge. The housekeeping staff did a fantastic job of keeping our room clean all week and the room was in good shape. Even the grout in the shower looked new. We had read some negative reviews about noise, but we quickly figured out that we simply needed to close the little louver under the windows to block out most of the noise. The business center on the 4th floor had 5 computers that were a nice feature, in fact, we preferred that to having access in the rooms since we didn't bring a computer. We did not have concerns about panhandlers during our stay. All the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for hotwire price”
Reviews.Author: BriannaJ2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire for the price of $89 a night, for 3 nights. Stayed on the 9th floor in a handicapped room with a walk in shower. You could definitely hear the street noise, but our air conditioning unit in the room was loud enough to drown the noise out. Check to make sure the little vents under the windows are all closed, the second day we realized that one of our vents was opened, and closing it helped to cut out some of the noise as well. We found all of the staff to be very friendly and willing to help us if needed. Nice to have little gift shop downstairs with snacks and souvenirs. We checked out at 12, but left our bags with the concierge. They were kept in a separate storage area that seemed to be locked, not just behind the desk, seemed very safe and felt comfortable leaving them there. The location was great for shopping, but the area directly behind the hotel was dangerous and seemed to have a lot of crime. I would not recommend walking in that direction. Overall we were happy with our stay for the price that we payed through hotwire. Could use an update for the prices that they are charging through their website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great price, rooms could use an update”
Reviews.Author: thelowest
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the outskirts of Union Square, but close enough to walk the area. The rooms were nice, but it needs some updates before it can be considered "luxury". Great price of $140, when other hotels in the are were 25%+ higher. I was on the 19th floor, but the street sounds didn't bother me. Then again, I don't mind that noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blaze_amaze
Reviews.Content: This hotel has clearly been renovated recently. The rooms are nicely decorated and extremely clean. The beds are super comfortable. Even the common spaces of the hotel have been renovated. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The location is absolutely perfect and convenient to major shopping areas and all transit lines. I had no issues with this hotel and I would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended. I booked through Hotwire so I was lucky to get a good rate. My rating on value is based on this price. I'm not sure what the regular nightly rate is for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Ollie03
Reviews.Content: Once we arrived at the hotel we were informed, contrary to my understanding that our rate did not include parking. The front desk informed methat no parking package was available. I asked for the manager who then ' tried to help me', by offereing a parking packag that was $219 per night! We had been quoted $189-she then reduced it to $209... Our room was not serviced the next day and I had to follow up housecleaning to have it cleaned. I felt misled and really dissapointed-the palce is as big as an airport and just as impersonal...try to find another place, it was not a good experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “OK but for the price would check elsewhere first”
Reviews.Author: jlafrentz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights for leisure activities in downtown. Its a very big hotel, rooms are on the small side. In addition to the room charge, you are charged approx. $50/night for parking ($44 + taxes) and $13 for internet if you choose to use it. The pop machine on our level was out of soda pop both nights so we had to go to other floors to get a soda if we desired one. There is no pool at this hotel which was a bummer for my two teenagers. Stamps in the gift shop costs $1.99 x tax for two - I thought stamps were $0.48/each? Things add up pretty quickly here so if business is paying go ahead and stay. If its coming out of your own pocket and you aren't a millionaire, I would look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Thal
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, access to shopping, public transportation, view, efficiency of staff, coffee maker in room, size of room Cons: Charge for Internet, no mini-fridge in room, parking cost, no soap in room first night, widely variable room costs depending where you book This is a big hotel, I usually stay at a smaller property when in the city and I was pleasantly surprized, for the most part. I paid substantially more than some of the prices described in these reviews. Some incentive should be offered to those who book directly with the hotel, such as free internet or continental breakfast. The view was great, the room was comfortable, everything was clean. I never found the business center, but I did see some teenagers using computers in a hallway where it looked like a bank of phones used to be.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel, snooty staff”
Reviews.Author: lilbopeep
Reviews.Content: Chose hotel based on location to Union Square and a previous stay at a Parc55 in New York. We arrived by cab and walked in to the foyer and looked for where to check in, all we saw was a concierge desk and when asking where we checked in we were told to go up the escalators rather abruptly. We had a large suitcase each, so this was no easy task. At reception i tried to check us into our king room as booked to be told they were very busy and are short of kings and we could have a double twin instead. Only when i complained were we issues our 'deluxe' king room. The room had a decent bed, a shabby sofa in a bay window looking out onto the rooftops of the city and a mini fridge that was sat on a piece of wood on the floor. There were no luxury amenities as described, just the usual soap, shampoo etc. We did try the hotel bar one evening where you could only get a drink by sitting and waiting and waiting for one of the bar staff to approach you and take your order, then eventually bring your drink over, we had to ask in the end for our bar tab bill as even though we were sat with an empty glass for 20 mins, we were just ignored. By checkout we had discovered the lifts rather than lugging the suitcases on the escalators again and asked the concierge to get us a cab. He poited us in the direction of the hotels own service car rather than a cab before we demanded a cab service out of there. Glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: novicetraveler51
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Parc 55. The location is ideal for first time travelers to San Francisco. It is close to all forms of public transportation. And, there are food options at every price level in proximity to the hotel. We got a terrific deal on our room through Priceline. Though we paid little for our room, we got great service from the hotel staff. The room was a good size and the bathroom was very spacious and VERY clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want be near Union...”
Reviews.Author: danp777
Reviews.Content: Good location if you want be near Union Square, renovated rooms, decent prices, friendly front desk staff. If you need in room Internet, though, stay somewhere else. $12.95 per night for slow, mostly non functional wifi. Abri hotel next door has smaller rooms, but is much nicer overall, with reliable in-room internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: jandres12
Reviews.Content: Very well located, specially for the $90 we paid on priceline. Nice if not sterile feel, huge lobby, felt very business oriented. Paid $44 for parking plus a $6 "parking tax", which is ridiculous but typical for San Francisco. I will caution that you should try to get as higt a floor as possible. We were on the 5th floor and could hear every time a merchant rolled out their transh and recycling, a car beeped its horn, or an ambulance came through, things that happen very often on the busy streets surrounding the hotel. I would not, however, choose this place if I had an option. But for $90 on priceline, I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “good place in SFO”
Reviews.Author: alex-s2000
Reviews.Content: San Francisco appears to be a bit difficult concerning hotels. This one seems to be a good choice, but make sure you get a room at higher levels, maybe even pay an upgrade. The advantage is quietness and a great view. The service was friendly and professional, however, we received two double beds instead of the booked king size bed, but this was changed quickly without any waiting time. They charged us a bottle of wine even though we did not have one, but this was fixed during check-out without problems. Since we were at a very high floor, we were scared of earth quakes and had trouble to calm down my parents. Of course this is not the hotel's fault :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: jasperpanda
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Parc 55 for 3 days last week. We really enjoyed ourselves and would certainly stay there again. We took BART from SFO and it literally drops you off less than a block away from the hotel. Our room was not ready at check in time but we had friends staying in the hotel and went up to their room. Our room was not ready until after 5 pm but as we had friends to hang out with it was not as big a problem as it would be if we had not. And on my check out day, we were able to get a 3 pm checkout which was a huge help to us. I was originally given a room on the 26th floor which had a lovely view but it was near to the elevators and had a connecting door, neither of which I am crazy about. I went back down to the lobby and was moved quickly and without any problem to another room. We found the new room to be fine - it was very quiet in terms of noise within the hotel and while you could hear sirens, traffic, etc outside it never bothered us one bit. The only thing we didn't like were the pillows; however the size of the room was plenty big enough, especially the bathroom, and it was very clean. In terms of location, it was handy to everything and we felt safe there. We also found the business center on the 4th floor very handy and if the 5 computers were ever all in use, you never had to wait long to get on. When we left, check out was a breeze doing it on the phone and while we (my daughter and our friends) were prepared to take BART back to SFO, one of the hotel employees said there was a limo to take us there for $50. Since there were 5 of us (meaning BART would cost $40 anyway) it seemed a no brainer. All in all, a great stay at Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Wine_n_Dine22
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire for $100/night. We were told at check-in that because of this we had to have a room with two double-beds, rather than one king (which we were fine with). That all changed after the first day, when the manager called us up and offered to move us to a junior suite on a high-level floor. Apparently they needed to work on the air conditioner in our original room. What nice luck! Everything else went smooth. Nice workout facility. Close to shopping, restaraunts, and transit. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: 59sunlady77
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been redone and it is great. Clean, well kept, great location and friendly staff. It is located in an ideal spot to use public transportation to get around the city. There are many great restaurants right in the area and loads of shopping nearby. The hotel bar/restaurant was a great place to unwind after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service, old hotel room fixtures but a great location.”
Reviews.Author: travel_luvr133
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Excellent location - very central. The room was quiet and big, and the bed was big and comfortable. And they did give me a room on a high floor with an ok view, as I requested. BAD: The service and the hotel itself looks quite old ('70 ish fixtures in the rooms). The staff at the front lobby were rude. I was never greeted in a friendly manner. When I did check in the lady at the front desk looked at my passport, walked over to another man and whispered to him and then walked behind a closed door, returning a few minutes later (to photocopy my passport I presume) but never said anything to me. She gave us our keys but didn't say anything welcoming such as enjoy your stay etc. I went to our 19th floor room and the room keys did not work for the room so I returned to the front desk to report the problem. The staff member at the desk sighed loudly and implied that I hadn't used the key correctly. He asked me for my ID (which I had just given to the lady a few minutes before) but had left with my partner in the hall of the 19th floor who was waiting there with out luggage. When I said that I had already given my ID to the person that checked us in so could he please refer to the photocopy so that I don't have to go back up and down 19 floors, he sighed again and said "You not got ID?".... Then he impatiently asked for the last 4 digits of my credit card. When I couldn't remember them in less than 2 seconds he said in a loud impatient tone 'E-Mail!". Very bad service! He reassigned the keys and gave them back but didn't even apologise for the inconvenience. On another occasion the same man at the front desk told me to "Google it" when I asked about the cost of and time it would take to get a taxi to Berkeley - "Google it" - Unbelievable! I would try to "Google it" if the so-called business center, which is three computers in a hallway with guests walking by, was ever free to use! I won't be staying in this hotel again - the Parc 55 Wyndham in San Francisco, and I will think twice before I stay in any Wyndham hotel again now. Very disappointing. Ironically, I stayed here on business travel and paid the full rate (approx. $300/ night) but then stayed on in San Francisco for some personal travel and booked another hotel through Priceline - I got the Westin St. Francis for a fraction of the price of the Parc 55, and that was a much better experience and an even better location - right on Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gmaroundtheworld
