Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is a really modern hotel. It is centrally located (although this is not good during the night due to the noise from the street). The decoration of the room was really cool but the available space wasn't sufficient. The staff was very very friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised about Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva2u
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the reviews about Parc 55 I was a bit leary about my choice. On my way to the hotel riding the shuttle to the hotel I noticed the area we traveled through to get to the hotel. My first thought was uh oh what I have gotten myself into. Previous reveiws commented on the homeless people near the hotel and that was a concern of mine. But once I got to the hotel and in Union Square I felt better about my choice. The hotel was very nice. The staff was courteous and aside hearing the guests above me walking across the room, I slept pretty good. I booked my room on priceline and got a pretty good deal so I did not pay the regular rate which in my opinion is a bit steep. If you want to be in Union Square I think it's a good choice. Shopping is a walk away. I even rode the bus from Fisherman's Wharf for $2. The biggest con in my opinion is that there is no free wi-fi. A hotel that charges this much for a room should offer free wi-fi. All in all, I would recommend it if you want to be in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “King Size Bed Unavailable Location still Excellent”
Reviews.Author: inaamak
Reviews.Content: Hi, we checked in around 2:00 AM as we missed our flight from Washington. The check in was smooth we got the bookings from Hotwire. Disappointing was that no King Size Beds were available as we were on our honey moon and still no favour was shown. Probably due to the booking being from a discounted website. The rooms were comfortable and nicely furnished. We were on the fourth floor. Noise was never an issue for the three nights we stayed. This hotel is a great location for visiting San Francisco. The Trams stop is very near and then the Powell St train leaving for SFO Airport is also very near. For the ladies stores for shopping are also nearby. At check out time they gave us two hours extension after check out time. We stored our luggage in the Concierge storage which let us enjoy our last day in San Francisco.We really enjoyed our stay with them the only disappointment was not having the King Size Bed. They could have showed some consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Potential Overbooking Problem”
Reviews.Author: sheryl0202
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with one King bed. I know we are going to arrive only late at night so I specifically emailed the hotel to inform them this to ensure that our booking will be secured. I received a response from the hotel and they take note of our arrival time. However, upon arrival at the hotel, we were informed by the font desk that the hotel is fully occupied and our room has been given to others. What was left for us was just a room with 2 queen beds. How can this even happen after my effort of informing the hotel? As it was late at night and we were tired from our 20+hours flight, we had no choice but to take up the room with 2 queen beds. The front desk staffs were not very understanding and apologetic, basically he was trying to tell us to take it or leave it. I believe our case is not a single incident because when we came down again to grab some food after checking in, I overheard that there was this couple at the front desk facing the same problem again. Further, I would add that there is no free wifi in the hotel, the internet would costs $12.95 per night. As part of the Wydham group hotels, I do not think this is justifiable. There is also always a queue for checking in, checking out and concierge service. I do not find the staffs particularly friendly, other than this chinese girl at the front desk. Most of them were kind of fierce and unfriendly. Other than these issues, the room was alright with a bay view.I hope the hotel can improve on this. This is one huge disappointment to us. I will never book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: OuttaHand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here due to the low rate we got and the location right in Union Square. As a first time tourist in San Fran, the location could have not been better. It was right in the middle of everything. The hotel itslelf was not really our style though. It was very clean, with comfortable beds and nice rooms, but the hotel itself is HUGE and very impersonal. Don't get me wrong, the front desk staff was nice and extremely helpful when needed, they just didn't go out of their way or anything. Only other complaint was the 13 dollars a day for internet. We stayed at about a dozen other hotels on this west coast trip, and not one other hotel charged for wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Really it is a no brainer. Stay here for a romantic get away!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBarta
Reviews.Content: Really it is a no brainer. Stay here for a romantic get away! This hotel is beautiful and unbelievably clean. My husband and I loved it. Our room was lovely and had a great view from the 24th floor. We slept like babies. The bed was very comfortable. It is perfectly located. We took the bart in so we never used their parking, which is around $44 per night. The staff was amazing (everything from the concierge, bellhop, frontline staff, and restaurant servers). We saw Wicked (3 blocks from the hotel) and got a 3 day pass for the trains and trolleys for $20, thanks to the helpful concierge. There is always a taxi outside the hotel if you want to go out late and donâ€™t want to drive (which I recommend). We had dinner at this great restaurant (Basil Thai Restaurant & Bar - 1175 Folsom Street) it was very romantic and packed for a Wednesday night. Make sure to call ahead before you go. There is a little coffee/pastry shop (right off the valet before you cross over to the bart) they had delicious croissants and fresh fruit! If you are into wine tasting check out the Press Club located between 3 and 4 streets just off of Market. We also did the 3 hour Mr. Toadâ€™s Tour located at the corner of Mason and Jefferson on Fishermenâ€™s Warf. We will be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfort in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is in an awesome location in the heart of Union Square area. The hotel is huge and stylish. There are eight elevators, so you rarely have to wait. The bell staff was helpful, and we were treated kindly by the front desk. Upon arrival, Jon at the desk helped to locate us in a nice king room on the 27th floor. Even though we booked through Hotwire (a steal at $89), he granted my requests without any hassle. The room was spacious and came with a great view of the city. The bed was extremely comfortable, and was one of the highlights of our entire stay. There are definite noise issues coming from the streets below (sirens are consistent at night), but we were never kept awake by them. One nice touch was nightly turn down service by the maids. They did a great job. We loved the location...steps from the cable car turnaround, bus and BART access, and the F Market street car. Also, there is more shopping around here than you can imagine. We would definitely stay at the Parc 55 again. For such a large hotel, it still made for a comfortable retreat for us during our first trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, PerfectCentral San Fran location”
Reviews.Author: Kurto125
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find the Parc 55 on travel search engines and review sites. We also compared vacation rentals,. Nevertheless the description of the rooms, location and the room rates made it worth a try. We were amazed when we got to the hotel. It is the best ocatio in the Union Square area. Across the street from the visitors' center. Diagonally across the street from the Hilton San Francisco, two blocks from union square central. Best rates of any hotels in the area. We got a 25th floor room, stunning city view. Great service. Buffet breakfast was great albeit pricey (@ $21). Staff was very helpful and responsive. Take the hotel limo to the airport $45 flat) cheaper for 4 than any shuttle or cab. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: lindsay012
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location. Right across the street from the BART which made getting to the hotel from the airport super easy. It is also right beside the bus and street car turn around. The hotel was clean and staff was nice. The rooms were nice and clean, but nothing special. My only two complaints are there were no robes... which are usually pretty standard in a 4 star hotel and we were chaerged almost $10 for making 2 local calls. I have never been charged so much at a hotel for making a local call. I have read in several reviews that there are issues around this hotel with homeless people. I would like to say that I did not find this to be a problem at all. Yes there are homeless people around but no more than in any other large city. I also did not find the hotel noisy at all and had no problems sleeping. We were on the 18th floor which may have helped. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for something right downtown with easy access to transit and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Shopping Location”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: I loved how easily this hotel was to get to using the BART from the airport into town ($8.20). Walk out the doors, up the stairs, a few steps and there it is! We were on the 26th floor and could see the Bay and the city. This hotel is located in a shopping mecca. If shopping is your thing, you will not be dissapointed! All forms of trasportation are just outside the hotel. There are a great deal of homeless people in the area, but no one bothered us. The hotel staff was very nice. Our room was roomy. We were close to the elevator, and really didn't hear anyone. I thought the bed a bit uncomfortable, but I am picky. I would definitely stay here again. My husband and I both enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice downtown business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vidiot42
Reviews.Content: Couldn't beat the location (literally steps away from Hallidie Plaza, where one can find the Powell St BART/MUNI station and the Powell St cable car turnaround), but know that it's right on the edge of the seedier Tenderloin neighborhood (it didn't bother this New Yorker, but I'd be careful what direction I walked in after dark.) Very close to Union Square shopping/attractions/etc, and an easy walk to Chinatown, Ferry Building, and other places. Good deal through Hotwire, which describes this as four stars. The rooms were nice and comfortable and clean. Great housekeeping staff kept the place immaculate and cheerfully accommodated our requests for extra towels. Comfortable beds (two doubles -- would've liked two queens, but that would've made the room pretty cramped), some oddly deep (but comfy) armchairs, inroom coffee, and a massive flatscreen TV were all features we liked. The "business center" down near the lobby was three computers and a printer, and it'd have been nice if all three computers (two of which worked) were connected to the printer instead of just the closest one -- rather than wait for the perpetually-busy computer near the printer to be free, so I could print out my airline boarding pass, I bailed and did it at the airport) Front desk and bell staff were very helpful (letting us borrow a wheelchair for the day to help an 89-year-old member of our party get around the city) and friendly, and I appreciated not getting the hard sell from the bellmen -- they hustled to do their jobs, but didn't hustle the guests. I also liked the big jug of ice water with lemon slices in the lobby -- refreshing while we waited to meet people. The only negative I saw was minor, but I didn't exactly relish seeing the open condom wrapper on the lobby carpet near the elevators one evening when we returned back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade worth every penny. Great location & view of city!”
Reviews.Author: redwoodsgirl
Reviews.Content: Started with moderately priced room and upgraded at checkin. We stayed on the 26th floor, with a city view and parking incl. in our room rate. Hotel location is centrally located so you can easily walk to almost every district in the city. There is a wide variety of dining and shopping options nearby. Rooms are clean & spacious and ours had a spectacular view. Because we got the "park and play" room rate, we could take our car out when visiting areas further away ( Golden Gate Bridge, Muir Woods, etc.) Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin wall with a yelling contest next door”
Reviews.Author: klpopp
Reviews.Content: Its hard to blame the hotel for the noise level of your neighbor, but we've been traveling a bit this summer & this hotel, although the nicest in many ways seemed to be the noisiest. Downtown San Francisco is a very noisy place, particularly in this part of downtown, the hotel abuts the Tenderloin, a neighborhood that has a variety of issues so sirens are a constant companion, garbage pick-up is around 2-3AM & S.F. garbagemen are a throwback to the pre-fab automated systems that exist in many places today. A common discussion in the elevator in the mornings was about the overnight street noise. We had the added pleasure of a next door neighbor that was a yeller, it seemed the majority of the noise came through the closed double connecting doors. We attempted to muffle the sound by putting items along the floor at the foot of the door, but there was discernible effect. We Pricelined it, we had 2 double beds, only used one & it was cozy, we were across the hall from the ice machine/vending/elevators & an employees area that they like to congregate at and have full volume conversation. It was great knowing when the elevator had arrived with the tell tale ding, so we could keep tabs on our floormates. The price on Priceline was right, but watch out for the parking fee, $40+ per day. Priceline lets you know that there may be additional charges, but if you knew the size of the parking fee you might not bid. Of course you have in and out privileges, so its a deal. We left the car elsewhere and used public transportation. I seem to be more critical of hotels than restaurants, I imagine since you spend so much more time in the hotel it is easier for items to be a bother. The desk staff & bell service was friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “More money doesn't mean better value”
Reviews.Author: ChumsMum01
Reviews.Content: We tried Priceline for the first time and were excited to see our bid accepted for a 4-star hotel in an neighborhood in SF we were interested in. However, we didn't take into account that Priceline gave us an AVERAGE price range of the hotels in the area.....so what we THOUGHT was a deal was really only about a $10 discount at the Parc 55. Live and learn. For the same price we paid in the Pacific Grove/Monterey area, we got a much smaller room with double beds. It was on the 15th floor and from the reviews I had read previously, anything above the 5th floor would be good, especially for street noise. I guess SF is really noisy because we could still hear everything. The room was very clean, had nice bathroom amenities, but $14.95 for Internet use and $44 for parking was difficult to swallow. Just so you know, you can find cheaper parking a couple blocks away. Not having internet access in the hotel was a greater hardship than we thought since we were not able to research activities/venues/attractions, etc. We did find a Starbucks around the corner offering free Wifi, but it would have been better to surf at the hotel rather than lugging a computer around, especially at this area. The hotel area was interesting......one block over is really seedy, but go the other way and it's really nice..... Having the Powell/Market cable cars stop was very handy and we made great use of it traveling all over town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynite7
Reviews.Content: We were unsure about the hotel due to mixed reviews but got a good deal (and unnamed hotel) online. The staff was friendly and kind (especially housekeeping). The room was luxe and spacious. The hotel was nice to come back to after a long day of sight seeing. Our room faced the inside of the hotel so it was a quiet and restful sleep for us. I enjoyed using the high-tech gym every morning. The shopping nearby is great with every store you can imagine and mass transit is at your doorstep. The adjacent area is a little sketchy but downtown is a tourist hub so what can you expect. There is a noticeable police presence as well as what appears to be hotel security outside. We ventured to the border of the adjacent area for SF's #1 burger and it was pretty safe. We would recommend this hotel! Good deals are there to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. A few nice staff members. Many complaints”
Reviews.Author: oliverlevitt
Reviews.Content: 1. The location is write in Union Square which is perfect for shopping, and using public transportation to get to the various neighborhoods. 2. There was one concierge( an older Asian woman) who worked during the days and was totally rude and unhelpful). I wouldn't be surprised if others have complained about her as well. The younger Asian woman who worked in the late afternoon and evening was great however. 3. Make sure you don't get a room next to the elevator because you hear them going up and down all night through the wall. 4. You can hear everything that goes on outside your room. 5. My girlfriend liked the bath products. She said they weren't cheap. 6. The price we paid was good, but I would have paid more for a better place. 7. They refused to store our luggage after we stayed there for four nights. They said it was a security issue. 8. I would not stay here again, but if you are on a budget it works I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal In San Francisco For The Money”
Reviews.Author: toothdude69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Parc 55 in June. Michael the doorman welcomed us as soon as we drove in the garage. Opened our doors and unloaded our luggage in an expiditous manner. Winnieford checked us in and we where fortunate enough to be upgraded to the 28th floor. This is one of the club floors with PURE hypo allergenic rooms. That night we took in the use of the clubroom for the view ,hor d'oeuvres, and no host bar , there we met Sergio who is in charge of the club at night. Wonderful host made us feel right at home. Our room was one of the best hotel rooms we have ever had, some costing twice as much don't even compare. The only negative we saw during our 4 day stay was the neighborhood is best seen during daylight due to the agressive panhandlers in the vacinity. On the whole on scale of 1-10 I would rate it a 9. We're looking forward to our next stay in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: wine_on_vaca
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for the overall quality of the rooms and staff. The concierge is one of the best I have ever seen, so friendly and willing to help. Just be prepared that this part of town has some sketchy people lingering around and you drive through some rough parts of town to get there. It was not anything that really made us concerned for our safety, but we wished we had chosen a different part of town because of it. The city does do a nice job of hiring security guards to walk around and they are very friendly and offer to assist with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from the Fifth Floor!”
Reviews.Author: Snoozan
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through PriceLine, and when we arrived the hotel was empty, and I asked for a room as high up as possible with a bathtub. The receptionist looked me in the eye and lied--said the hotel was booked solid--and she could only give me a room on the fifth floor, noting that I had booked through Priceline. It was punishment for using Priceline plain and simple: we walked through the convention floor (fourth floor) and they had no one coming in and no one leaving. Of course, the fifth floor was so close to the racket from the sleep that we couldn't get any sleep at all. The walls were paperthin and the family in the next room had a crying baby. The room itself was nice and large; the bathroom was roomy; the mattress was comfortable. The room service meal was okay but too expensive and they forgot my husband's entree. I have booked in four star hotels through Priceline before and been treated just fine--and I write recommendations accordingly. If you have any trouble sleeping, I wouldn't stay lower than the tenth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SaFot
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and we got a room with panoramic view. The stuff is very friendly and the amenities are clean. The decoration could use a fresh up but the location is just great. You have the cable car, bus and metro station right in front of the hotel. Union Square is just 2 blocks away and there are many shops and restaurants near by. We didn't have to use the car at all. If we go back we would probably stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service!”
Reviews.Author: crazy4travelalways
Reviews.Content: Had to carry multiple pieces of luggage ourselves from the curb all the way to the second floor because Bellhop Service refused to assign us a bellhop until we checked in FIRST! Unheard of logic!!! Jon @ front desk didn't give us the king bed we requested because we had reserved our room with Hotwire and didn't pay "retail". Enough reasons NOT to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased Indeed”
Reviews.Author: HappyRambler
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5-night stay at this hotel and was very pleased with the overall experience. My room was ready at check-in and was spacious and immaculate. Bed was very comfortable, and the pillow choice was fantastic. San Francisco had been experiencing a "heat spell" (at least, for San Francisco), and the air conditioning worked very well, The bathroom was well stocked each day and included a real hand-held hairdryer, rather than a box stuck on a wall with tepid air coming from a narrow plastic tube. Also, real hangers (my other hotel pet peeve are hangers that you have to hook to use). My initial concern had been about noise, as reported in previous reviews. Yes, ear plugs are provided. However, the room was absolutely quiet, perhaps because I was on the 13th floor and facing a side street. Breakfast was not included in the package that I selected, but there is a self-serve breakfast bar in the lobby with Starbucks coffee fot two dollars or a continental breakfast consisting of tea or coffee and a choice of two other items (choice of pastries, bagels, fruit) for only five dollars. Nice touch. Hotel staff were great with a helpful concierge, pleasant wait staff in the restaurant, and a charming young woman who was doing housekeeping on the 13th floor. As others have mentioned, the location is perfect for those using public transportation. Be aware that the street people can be overwhelming, even for someone like me from a large East Coast city with its own street population. However, this is certainly not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NZGrant
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Well located as next to BART, MUNI and Powell St cable car. - Good views (15th floor) - Really good continental breakfast - Sharp room rate - Clean and quiet Negatives: - Arrived from UK at 4pm and our king bed room was not available. Being tired, we took a room with 2 double beds which are on the small side. - Got woken up at 7.30am by a staff member wanting to take our bags, thinking we were part of a group. - Internet charges at $13/day too high. Better to push the room rate up and offer free wifi. - Close to some seedy neighbourhoods (6th) to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, but I got it at a decent price.”
Reviews.Author: senordukes
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is in a decent location, just as all Union Square hotels are, which made it easy to get around the city. But, don't be fooled by the 4 star rating. This hotel room just looks like any normal hotel, but I got a good deal on it through Priceline. It was around $100 per night. The hotel is pretty close to Tenderloin and there were a decent amount of street folks wandering right next to the hotel. But, that is to be expected. However, the room came with earplugs, which is not a good sign. The room was very noisy, so loud that we were woken up quite a few times during the night by police cars, this was clearly Parc 55's lack of sound proofing because I also stayed at Hotel Nikko (which is one block up) and it was silent. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. Spend a little extra and go to Hotel Nikko.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Customer Service/ Poor Cleaning, Dirty sheets, Condom Wrapper”
Reviews.Author: Beho88
Reviews.Content: The customer service is great, any questions I had were answered immediately. Although many of the desk representative were quick to answer questions, one seemed to not care at all. My room was nice, enjoyed the view. Being the attention to detail person I am, I noticed TWO HORRIBLE things that would disgust anybody. One - I noticed that the bed sheets were not washed because there was a big red stain on it as if something was smeared. Maybe some women's make up. Whoever is supposed to clean the room tried to conceal by folding it and flipping that portion of the sheet over. #2, a opened condom wrapper was found next to be bed..almost under it. Seemed as if the cleaner kicked it over to avoid having to pick it up.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a week. Amazing location...”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryFlyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. Amazing location, close to the BART station. I would stay again. I only have one complaint, in room Internet should be free. They do have a business center which offers free Internet. So I really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, fantastic hotel, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: HeywoodJ
Reviews.Content: Bid <$100/rm/night for a weekend stay using name your own price on priceline for 2 rooms in a 4 star in the union square area and got this hotel. I've never used name your own price before but figured this was a good time to start. I was concerned because there were 5 of us, and the hotel wouldn't pre-book anything when I called them after they had my money. All their connecting rooms connect 1K to 2D. Nearly all of their 1K rooms also have a pullout couch. Their rooms with 2D are so small they can not take a rollaway. They told me a rollaway in a 1K room would not be a problem. At checkin, they didn't treat me like a priceline deadbeat, they put me in the rooms we needed with no problem. By mistake those rooms didn't have a pullout, so by asking very nicely we were offered a free upgrade to one of the rooms to a minisuite, which was fantastic. The hotel is pretty much at the edge of the Tenderloin, the sketchy part of town - the area to the west and perhaps south is 'iffy'. If that bothers you, you're not likely to avoid 'sketchy' by paying more for another hotel in another area. The area to the north and east is the heart of downtown SF, which is why you're here. Walk 1 block to the cable car, take it to fishermans wharf, and enjoy the world's most beautiful city. The hotel charges $53/night for parking which is insane even for this area. I found Best Parking at 525 Jones St for $20/night - had no problems. Jones St area is a tad sketchy but I don't worry about such issues. Note that is you are flying in from out of town, it would be insane to rent a car to travel into SF - take mass transit instead. You do not drive around SF or to or from the airport - take bart, muni, whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Iwouldratherdrive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 1 night at the Parc 55 on our way through San Francisco. We got to check in quite early (Around 11 AM) and found the service at the hotel to be outstanding. The hotel is newly renovated and the rooms have all the updates you might expect (improved linens, flatscreen tv, etc). The only complaint that I have of this hotel is that the high speed internet costs around $10 and there is no Wi-Fi. However, the location is very convenient (1/2 block from the Powell St. BART Station) and we truly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: Zzamm
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get much better than the Parc 55. Both of us were happy with this find. Good service, nice room, XLNT location, super easy in & out, 1/2 block to BART, etc, 1 block to the Powell St. cable car turn-around... Well, you get the idea. The surroundings are fantastic too -- great Indian, Thai & soul food are less than a block away. Didn't try the Thai restaurant in the building, but it was packed w/ customers nightly. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't care for remodel”
Reviews.Author: Aunteen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Parc 55 many times over the past years, and I do not like the remodel. The hotel is cold and unwelcoming. There are no nice public rooms, the restaurant and bar were uninviting, the lobby is barely more than a counter where people work. Very, very sparse. Service in the bar was not good either. We had trouble getting the waiter back after we asked to look at their wine list. We ended up leaving. The hotel just isn't that nice anymore. The location is great if you want to go to the shopping center, but very seedy around the hotel itself. I won't be staying here again. It is too bad, I used to really like this hotel. The hotel seems to be trying to be hip, it used to be more elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money; 5 star Service”
Reviews.Author: luxe_mom
Reviews.Content: We booked Parc 55 through Hotwire for only 89USD per night. It was a steal! Great location, great amenities. Downside is that they donâ€™t offer free internet in lobby or in the room. If you visit their business center, they will let you use their PCs for free. The location is absolutely perfect. Itâ€™s a block from Macyâ€™s, itâ€™s right in front of Westfield mall and the Cable Car stop is right next to it. We woke up our second day very early and hopped on the cable car as there was still no line. It was one of the most memorable things we did in San Francisco. After reading about one of the reviews here on tripadvisor, i was worried about getting a smoking floor. I called the hotel in advance and told them about my asthmatic condition. They blocked a room for us in advance and it was a good thing as there was a convention going on when we arrived. We were given the 13th floor. Rooms were a bit dated, but clean and big. The cleaning ladies were friendly and approachable. The bed was comfortable and the linens were soft and luxurious, pillows were fluffy. Overall, we would definitely stay at this hotel again. I was expecting a package to be delivered to us, but the concierge had an incident. But they were able to fix everything for us at the end.

Reviews.Title: “You can never go wrong with this hotel...excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: r_sarda
Reviews.Content: I think a paid a little more but am not overly bothered because the hotel exceeded my expectations with regards to location and comfort. But I am not happy about the breakfast charges. It should be included in the room rate and then at the rate I paid to priceline this would have been a great deal. But the hotel itself is excellent. It is located at one end of Union Square but bang on top of a BART station. The sightseeing/tourist Trolley starts almost from the doorstep of the hotel. Going to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square etc. is very convenient because trams of this area stop in front of the hotel. Chinatown, Nob Hill all within short walking distance. It is in the middle of shopping district with lots and lots of showrooms nearby. A couple of Indian restuarants next door and I think Little Delhi is one of them which serves good food at reasonable prices. Negative: Can't think of anything but as mentioned before get the breakfast included in the room rate because I found the buffet breakfast rate very high.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, left disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bball2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 4 nights for our one year anniversary trip and had been told I would receive an upgrade if available. The hotel was nice, had a great location in Union Square. Upon arrival at 2:30 I was told our room was not ready and it would be about an hour BUT "They had a spectacular room for us!" So that got us excited and we left our bags with the people in the lobby and headed out to get lunch while our room was being cleaned. We came back an hour later and checked in and were told our room was ready, at the very end of our check in the front desk person throws in there that our room was a handicapped room and that the bathroom had been "slightly" altered. No big deal because we didnt wanna wait any longer for another room. We then went up to our room and while it did have the "city view" that we paid for the bathroom was extremely awkward with a sliding door that did not lock or shut well along with rails everywhere. At first we thought it wasnt too bad, until we showered later that night and the different shower head installed for handicapped people barely put out pressure turning showers into a 30 minute ordeal. By then my wife had unpacked everything and did not want to pack everything back up and move rooms after our long flight. I booked this room for 4 nights directly through Parc 55, so it's not like I booked through priceline and got the bottom of the barrel for a room. While this room might be good for our 50th anniversary, it was not ideal for our FIRST anniversary which I mentioned to the front desk before check in. I stayed in 4 other hotels on our West Coast trip and got better rooms at every other hotel, and I used priceline for a couple of them. I left Parc 55 very disappointed. Sliding bathroom door, that doesn't shut well in a hotel room.......just not ideal for a 1 year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, large spacious...”
Reviews.Author: Pennypincher5
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, large spacious rooms, Separate dressing area, large tv, updated bath with plenty of towels and toiletries, decent room service and good, if expensive, wi-fi. We got a great deal on Priceline, but be aware the front desk may not be quite as friendly since the hotel sells the priceline rooms cheap. But for everything you get, a little attitude is no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hiden fees”
Reviews.Author: Pensacolagirl
Reviews.Content: When you check in to the hotel the put a $100 a day hold on your credit card. That means if you are staying for six days they put a $600 hold on your credit card. The cable car is les than a block away. Every time I purchased anything from this hotel I was over charged. Such as the internet fee of $12.95, which I used one time, was charged $112.95. They did finally give me my money back. The purchase at the store, the price on the box of $8.99 and was charged $9.99. If you are on a budget this is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Andidroid
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 21st for a weeks vacation. Hotel greatly appointed for all amenities, travel shops and restaraunts etc. Hotel very clean spacious and airy. Had room 16th floor, which was also kept clean. Beds and pillows lovely and comfortable. Even though on 16th floor, could hear traffic noise below, but Hello you are staying in the middle of a city at the end of the day, and there are vents on bottom of windows that cut a lot of this noise out. Had a few minor issues, that were soon dealt with promptly, check-in was ok, just about bordering polite, but nothing above or beyond, think that maybe down to what member of staff checks you in! Above all had a great stay in San Fran, and would recommend this hotel!!.........Only slight niggle, no in-room safes

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.......”
Reviews.Author: clarkgriswold
Reviews.Content: When I submitted my bid on Priceline I was nervous about where I might be staying if it was accepted. Am I glad it was accepted by Parc 55 Wyndham. For the purpose of our trip, which was to be a quick get-away for an extended weekend for my wife and I, it was perfect. Before leaving for San Fran, I checked the property's reviews here, as I always do, and was somewhat daunted by some of the reviews which gave me the impression I may have made a mistake. I hadn't. Having never been to San Francisco before, I wasn't sure about whether the location of the hotel, among other things, might not be suitable for us. My doubts turned out to be unfounded. The location of the Parc 55 allowed us easy access to every important public transit mode available there, which is important if you're not driving. The BART took us directly from SFO to within a block from the hotel (and to Oakland later) and back to the airport again later. The cable-car turn-around is in the same location, and trolley and major bus routes are an easy walk away. Every major store on our list was within an easy few block walk, as were restaurants of almost every description, from Subway, to pubs, to classy Italian restaurants and some intriguing far eastern restaurants. Many attractions are also close at hand, Union Square chief among them. The accomodations were more than adequate. The lobby and supporting common spaces were modern, well lit, clean and spacious. The business centre is easily accessible and with properly functioning computers (free of charge to guests). The fitness facility is state-of-the-art with new machines of every description, bright and airy, they even had a bowl of fresh fruit (apples, oranges and bananas) which was often replenished (nice touch). I didn't get to the meeting rooms, which were busy during our stay there. The hotel never seemed too crowded. Elevators were always quick to arrive. The room we had was a king, non-smoking on the 16th floor. It was spacious, nicely appointed and VERY clean. The bed was comfortable with quality linens. The bathroom was modern, roomy and perfectly functioning. Water pressure was almost too strong. They are smart to have pressure modulating valve controls on the shower (you preset it from low to high), but the water comes out at very high velocity in the sink. You have to manually adjust the pressure to suit your needs. Yes, the sounds from street level were audible, you ARE in the centre of a large urban area. But the fresh air slots at the bottom of the windows can be closed which mitigates it somewhat. We set the A/C unit blower on high at night which provided some white noise, partially neutralizing the street sounds. We never encountered the seedy element I've seen mentioned by some other reviewers near the hotel. If I hadn't read about it here, I still would have no idea about the Tenderloin district. It never registered with us at all. Every city has some degree of that type of area, and one has to be a bit prepared when entering into the centre of a large metro zone. There were the inevitable homeless people around the BART station, etc., but with the exception of one slightly annoying panhandler they were almost polite. We always felt safe at any time of night or day. If we ever get back to San Fran we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, as long as it's still on Priceline's radar.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: sarhm
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull stay at Parc 55, good location, spacious room, good food at the restaurant and the staff was very helpful. All in all I would definitively stay at Parc 55 again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star but definately 4!!”
Reviews.Author: maccaj73
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fabulous location near both Market and Powell street. We were very pleased with a rate of around $130USD a night which is well worth it. Take advantage of the free internet and the nice restraunts in the surrounding streets. The receptionist on check-in obviously saw we were staying for 4 nights so gave us a bigger room on the corner, little thoughts like these do help! Obviously the airlines know its a great hotel as the crew for Cathay, Lufthansa and BA all stay here. My only negative points would be that we encountered a conciege who was not overly knowledgeable and didnt really show a strong desire to help us out. For those who are light sleepers this hotel could pose some problems as the walls are paper thin, on a weekend the sirens are blaring all night long and we could still hear them on the 23rd floor!!! The Pets friendly policy is also a bit disturbing!!! The person in the room next to be had a large dog and i find this unhygenic the rooms would not be cleaned adequately enough to make them safe. Despite the minor issues it is overall an excellent place to stay in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Came on a business trip and had a great...”
Reviews.Author: Bill1950z
Reviews.Content: Came on a business trip and had a great stay. Was checked into my room quickly, the room was very nice and clean, and the hotel was in a great location. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBUTAH
Reviews.Content: Very close to Union Square, easy access to Bart and Muni. We did an upgrade and stayed on the 25th floor. It was very quiet and we had a great view. Perfect hotel to stay at. We did the Bay to Breakers road race and it was very easy to get to the start of the race on the MUNI bus on Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: SydNat
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine. Nice, clean rooms in a great location. Got a great price on Priceline. It is in a noisy area -- they give you a pair of earplugs! Customer service was really poor. The people working at the desk were clearly just going through the motions -- not friendly, didn't say thanks, answered questions very shortly. Would be a different experience with happier staff.

Reviews.Title: “ROYAL TREATMENT”
Reviews.Author: kmoriarty
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to San Francisco, my husband and I ended up getting engaged in our room at the Parc 55 in SF. This was not initially his plan, but today it makes not only SF, but also the Parc 55 sentimental to us. We ended up getting married in California and planned to stay at the Parc 55 for a few nights of our Honeymoon. My husband emailed the hotel our story and told them that we would be returning. The most sentimental part of our engagement story was that we were engaged on the 22nd floor. When we checked in, we were surprised to see that they actually read the email! They put us up in a room on the 22nd floor with a fantastic view! That wasnâ€™t it; they also gave us access to the VIP club at no additional charge! We were highly impressed by this and by all of the staff members! We especially enjoyed Sergio, a worker in the VIP LOUNGE. There are so many great things about this hotel, It is located right in union square and is close to several great restaurants including an AMAZING Indian restaurant right across the street! We appreciate the great service at the hotel and will DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Got a great rate, but wouldn't stay here if I had to pay full price”
Reviews.Author: SydneyShane
Reviews.Content: Why I booked ========== I booked this hotel as because of its location, it is close to Union Square, the BART (rail) station and Westfield is just across the road. We got a fantastic rate and it was just behind the boutique Hotel we staid last time (Hotel Abri). Now the reality! Check-in ======= Be prepared to hand over your credit card, they wouldnt take a cash deposit for our room - I've never had a problem at any other hotel before (if you are travelling to multiple destinations you know how annoying it can be if all money is tied up in pre-authorisations). What was most concerning is that the check in lady simply started swiping away and charging my card before she'd even told me what she was doing or what the amount was Then on checkout we saw the fineprint on our bill that the hotel policy is that the funds dont get released by the hotel for up to two days after you actually checkout. Rooms ====== I STRONGLY suggest you ask for a room on a high floor or you wont be able to sleep. The rooms were clean and neatly appointed. Other things worth noting ================== Gym - Really good - good range of machines and free weights, all brand new. No Pool No Guest Laundry No in room safe - small deposit boxes (passport size) are available at reception Location ====== Generally good, the hotel located close to shopping in Union Square, Westfield San Fran Centre, cable cars, and street cars. If you catch the train (the BART) its easy and cheap but so you aren't shocked, there are a heap of homeless people that congregate around the BART station, it can be quite confronting if you arent expecting it. The area behind the hotel is pretty seedy as well worth being careful Overall ===== If I had to compare this hotel versus Hotel Abri where we stayed last time I would hands down choose the Abri. However the price we paid particularly over the Easter weekend was a really really good deal and if this is a consideration for your stay it may be worth while .

Reviews.Title: “can you say incompetance”
Reviews.Author: skizard
Reviews.Content: Staff lost my paid in full advance reservation with no recourse despite attemted interventions from my agent. Unhelpful staff. Cold and dreary.

Reviews.Title: “Best location!”
Reviews.Author: Simba0313
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is right in the centre of Union Square. The price was brilliant, the rooms were clean and the service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of it All”
Reviews.Author: jleuthard
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. It was exactly what I expected, very modern. We got a deal because we were there for a conference but probably wouldn't stay there for the full price. If you exit the hotel, you're better off exiting the main entrance because if you go out the back glass doors, you have to wade through all of the smokers hanging around the door.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: vacaynowplease
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Hotwire, so we paid less than $100/night. Hotwire has this hotel set as a 4 star, which I disagree with... I would give it max 3.5 stars. That being said, the hotel has its good (and best) point: location!! The BART station is right in front, the cable car turnaround is a block away and there is a streetcar stop right across the street. All your necessary means of transportation are at your disposal. Though I do see what some reviewers said about it being on a "seedy" part of town, I never felt unsafe walking around, though the latest we were out was around 10PM. The outside/public areas of the hotel are gorgeous. They have these amazing San Francisco "scenes" (cable car, painted ladies, gg bridge, etc) carved into the walls outside by the entrance behind the valet parking attendant. The lobby is also very big and modern. The service is ok. The staff are polite enough, but not overly personable. If you are looking for that, I wouldn't stay here. That doesn't bother me so much, so it wasn't an issue. I did, however, feel that because we were "pre-paid" customers, that we weren't "worth" getting our room request. It ended up working out in our favor but felt a little snubbed, lol. Another note, this hotel has smoking rooms. I'm not sure if this is the norm in San Francisco (I thought the city was generally about good health!) but that surprised me. We almost ended up with one but luckily a non-smoking room turned up! (Phew). Ah yes, about the noise, we asked for a room AWAY from the cable car turnaround and heard nothing at night or during the day. Earplugs not needed! The rooms are ok. Very clean, which is super important. Modern-looking, really very typical. Big enough, it had a small double couch in it, though made it feel a little tight. A few things though. The room did not have much drawer space at all. There is a closet to hang stuff but only a few hangers. It also did not have a safe, which really surprised me. I had thought that was the norm in hotels these days, maybe I'm wrong. The hotel does have safe deposit boxes at the desk but seemed annoying to have to go up and down to get things so we didn't bother with it. Actually, housekeeping was great and didn't really throw ANYTHING away unless it was obviously supposed to be so I actually had no problem with leaving stuff unlocked (though I didn't leave it out in plain view, of course)! There also isn't a fridge in the room. This may be expecting too much. But when we walked in, the TV is on a huge stand that when opened looked like a fridge should have been in it, but just had open space. Maybe it was supposed to be there? No idea. Anyway, overall this hotel isn't a bad choice. The location is great, the rooms are clean and the staff is polite enough. I wouldn't be as ok with it if I had paid even close to what they normally charge, but as I hadn't, I would have no problem "winning" this hotel through Hotwire/Priceline again!

Reviews.Title: “Not my first Choice”
Reviews.Author: timbradfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and the hotel is clean, the room was a good size but it is a really large hotel and is not very welcoming. I stayed here due to an online deal but would never pay what most people pay to stay here. The business centre is very lame (u can really only surf the net, wouldn't recommend it for a business person) and to get internet in your room is a $13 a night rip off. The food prices are extremely overpriced and the location leaves a bit to be desired. Surely it is close to Union Sq, the BART, MUNI, Westfield but is is also on the edge of a really seedy area. Lots of homeless people, beggars and that enchanting smell that goes with them. The reception staff also stuffed up my bill for the security deposit which was a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: VegasJetsetter77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline and got a great deal. We got the BART from the Airport to the Hotel and the hotel was literally around the corner around the BART station. Quick check in and the rooms were lovely. We did want a King Bed room but only Queens were available so we accepted this as we were only staying 2 nights. Bathroom was also nice and lots of towels. Room was extremely central and we didn't hear any outside noise. We would go shopping. come back, drop out bags off and go out again. The bar was also very nice and reasonable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a luxury central hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinerdogg
Reviews.Content: I agree with so many other reviews that the location of this hotel cannot be beat. Proximity to anything you could want to do while in San Francisco is just outside your door. I found the rooms to be very average and although the lobby has a modern upbeat feel the rest of the hotel has a kinda drab look about it. You definitely need the earplugs that are provided in your room (although we only got 1 pair for 2 people) since it is very loud. We were on the 22nd floor on a weekend and it was crazy both outside and guest in the hallway at 2-3am. I did expect this a bit staying in the heart of a city and enjoyed staying the next 3 nights at a quiet, peaceful, B&B in Yosemite! If you are only there for a few days stay in Union Square and deal with the noise. If you have a car or want a more low-key place to stay look outside Union Sq. The price and location were right for us.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: guoning
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, close to Westfield/tram (literally just outside the hotel), union square (a few mins walk) and many different restaurants are around. However, Tenderloin neighborhood is on the west of the hotel, friends who live in SF had told me to avoid this area is possible. The hotel itself was ok. I stayed in one of the standard rooms on upper floor, had a partial view of union square, room was kinda small, amenities were pretty standard, nothing really spectacular. I would recommend this hotel to budget travelers looking for great location at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunate experience”
Reviews.Author: bustravel23
Reviews.Content: I travel with my company on business regularly and have never experienced the poor service and attitude of the Parc 55 until this week. Mavis charged my card for a hotel room I had pre paid for and I had to spend hours at the front desk trying to solve the issue. After I thought we had taken care of the problem, I noticed my debit card charged for another $500+ amount that nobody at the front desk night staff could explain,and my account has still not been credited for the correct amount. In general, I have spent an extreme amount of time and energy dealing with a hotel when there are plenty of better, higher quality hotels in the area that I will use in the future. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rwk87
Reviews.Content: We got this place for a good deal via priceline and were extremely impressed! Really stylish, modern decor. Very clean. Awesome service - bellhops brought our luggage up, brought a bottle opener when we asked for one. Nice bar. Food was too expensive so we did not eat there, but that is typical for a hotel. Some noise from the street but with a pair of earplugs and the a/c running, we had no problem. No noise from adjacent rooms. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, but needed those earplugs to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for 3 nights at the beginning of May. The hotel has a fantastic location! The Bart, Muni, Cable Cars, Buses, etc are all virtually seconds away. We rode all of these types of public transportation as having a car in San Fran adds to much stress to your holiday. We dined in the restaurant one night and found the food to be ok and the service to be a little stale. We tried to have fun with our server but he was not interested. The rooms and lobby are very clean and the beds were comfortable. When the hotel supplies each room with earplugs, you will know that there is a noise problem. Wow, was it loud. We were on the 9th floor and heard everything that happened outside. It took us until our final night to start getting used to the noise. Would I come back to this hotel? Maybe... The price and location was right!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a VIEW”
Reviews.Author: maninomaha
Reviews.Content: I arrived on the 28th of April, think it was the day Wyndham took over the hotel. There was a lot of confusion. The computer systems were not functioning properly. I did arrive early and the room was not ready. I checked my luggage with the bellman, and went out to enjoy the day. When I arrived back a gentleman at the front desk apologized for the confusion and gave me a corner room on the 27th floor. The view was amazing. The room itself felt large was was clean. My luggage was sent up, but to my surprise and the bellman's it was someone else's. I had to go downstairs and easily found the right bags. The view was so great I ate in the room. The only downside is that bed was extremely hard. Every one at the hotel was great and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in a Perfect City”
Reviews.Author: Lin060
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a brilliant trip to San Francisco. We stayed at the Parc 55 which was in the perfect location for Union Square and all the sights/trams/and underground stations. Shopping was very easy - Westfield shopping complex (very posh) only a 50yds from hotel and Union square has the best department stores around. Banana Republic, Anthropologie,Sax on 5th Avenue, Macy, Tiffany, Chanel, Prada etc etc. Below the hotel is a really good cafe serving everything from hot pastries/ breakfasts and take-away yoghurts/toasted sandwiches. Opposite hotel is Puccini & Pinetti - great bistro with excellent happy hours and a superb restaurant.. Service in hotel brilliant - rooms very comfortable. Couldnt fault the place at all. Would definately return to this hotel if I was in San Francisco again. A hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - Staff is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: FitzLA1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here the weekend of April 16th for a last minute trip to San Francisco for a celebration. Upon check in, the front desk staff could not have been nicer. They were aware of our celebration and had reserved us a corner room on the 26th floor with access to the club lounge. The room and views were spectacular. The entire hotel has been recently remodeled and they spared no expense. The lobby is beautiful as are the rooms. FYI, it's San Francisco. I wouldn't go to a large city and not expect noise. The street noise was never bothersome and our neighbors could not have been quieter. The staff were amazing all weekend and really made for such an enjoyable trip. If you're planning a trip soon, I would not hesitate to book this hotel. Prices can't be beat for the quality and they really make you feel welcome. We can't wait to go back, and as a matter of fact, have already booked our next stay over 4th of July Weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the foggy city”
Reviews.Author: paulmac83
Reviews.Content: A wonderful corner room with a view that could not be described- A fantastic! The hotel was definately 6 star luxury at 3 star prices- very good value for money. Breakfast was fullsome, slightly pricey but lasted until dinner. Bill incorrectly calculated but on query was quickly remedied. A wonderful experience and would definately returnif in sfo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, central location!”
Reviews.Author: franciscob
Reviews.Content: Great experience!, the location is great, jus two blocks fron union square, and the cable car stop is around the corner. For shoppers, there is a big shoppping center one block away. The view fron the upper rooms is beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered in Luxury”
Reviews.Author: tmackEsparto
Reviews.Content: What a great night. And pleasantly surprised to get an upgrade for our 30th Anniversary night, Certainly not asked for but received and incredibly enjoyed. Its hard to really describe the atmosphere, the view, everything was just the absolute best. Thank you to the staff, management, valets, everyone for making number 30 for us that much more memorable

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Ries
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a long weekend in San Francisco. We stayed at the Parc 55 and were pleasantly surprised. We got a free upgrade that included a continental breakfast, all of the staff were polite, helpful, and customer service oriented. The views from the room were great and the location was perfect for the leisure traveler or business person.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dln40
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the staff made me feel like a valued guest and did all they could to make my stay nice. The room was an upgrade and I was very pleased with it. I had a wonderful view of the city. The location is in the perfect spot for shopping, buses, BART and eateries. The best part of my stay was how nice the Hotel was for the price and the courteous staff was very helpful in directions ect. I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else - lots of better choices are available.”
Reviews.Author: sparkerxx1
Reviews.Content: Neighborhood is convenient, but borderline in terms of the panhandler/hooker index. The internet access costs 12.95 per day and is limited to one device - which is not disclosed on the connection site, so I would have paid $26 per day to use my wireless hand-held and netbook. I did without the netbook, since I don't care to be taken advantage of that way. Parking is $44 per day, which is outrageous even for downtown SF. The amount of street noise on the weekend nights was excruciating, and providing earplugs is no substitute for dual pane windows. No mini-bar, fridge or in-room coffee - I understand some hotels consider those down-market amenities, but I travel so much that breakfast out has little appeal. There are many better choices in terms of amenties and cost right in that neighborhood. On the good side, it was sparkling clean and the furnishing were nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: patrickrward
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for DrupalCon 2010. The location was ideal for easy access to BART and the Moscone Center. The area around Union Square is a bit loud at times, but that wasn't an issue in my room on the 29th floor. Definitely get a room on a higher floor for less noise and a great view. The Parc 55 is attractive and clean. The bed was mostly comfortable, but the mattress was a bit too firm. The staff was courteous and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: bbb92
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate experience of staying at Parc 55 through booking a Hotwire room. Usually- I never have a problem using Hotwire. However- upon check in at Parc 55- I was informed that since I was Hotwire customer my room was not guaranteed. They said the only room they had for me was a smoking double room and it was my fault for not booking directly with the hotel. The room 818 that was given to us smelled terrible. Even the bedding smelled like smoke which made me believe that the linens were not fresh. The light switches had dirt crusted on them. The bathroom was older- the tile dirty around the tub. The staff was unfriendly. When I did call for new pillows that did not smell like smoke- they brought me towels. The entire 8th floor smelled terrible and I gagged every time I had to walk in the hall. I am sure the non smoking rooms were nice. And if you book directly with the hotel that they treat you better.. I would say it is a 3 star hotel that has seen better days. The location of the hotel was fabulous. Parking was $44. I wouldn't have stayed there if it wasn't pre-paid through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfortable, good location, but falls short of top notch.”
Reviews.Author: msqinc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location that is convenient to everything. I was at a conference and made my life easy that it was with in walking distance to the center. The one day I had free I was able to walk out the front door and hop right on the cable car. The hotel was recently remodeled I was told, and in general they did a very nice job. But there were small details that were overlooked that are the difference between a good place and a really top notch place. Such as the room was very clean, the bed and bedding beautiful a nice desk and large flat panel TV. The bathroom was spacious and clean. But if you looked at the little details...the outlets were old and discolored and dirty, the frame of the mirror in the bathroom had some touch-up work done with a paint that doesn't match the frame. The patches stood out like a sore thumb. The towels were hard. There was a phone in the bathroom which was a nice touch except it looked like it was from the 70s. It looked oddly out of date. The heating/cooling was loud and didn't work very well. It was the little touches that separate a good place from a great place. Also there was no safe in the room. That being said the staff was all very nice and did their best to accommodate with the exception being that I called and asked if I could get some utensils sent to the room and it took an hour. They were very nice about it but I thought it was excessively long. The other being when I tried one night to set up a wake-up call and the front desk wasn't picking up. I let it ring over 20 times and had to call back 3 times before someone picked up. House keeping I have to say did a very nice job. When I came back to the room at the end of the day it was nicely freshened up. I had a "special rate" for the conference I was at, which looking at their current posted full rates for this week were actually higher, which of course is annoying. It was a nice place..but for the money they ask they can do better...and possibly offer a cup of coffee or light breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blackwrx
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at the Parc 55 and it was as good as the first time. They have remodled the first floor since I as there last April so it just looks cleaner as you arrive. (Checkin is on the second floor) Overall the only complaint I could possibly have it that the rooms can get a little loud at times at ight due to the fact that you are in the heart of downtown. I accidently left the vent cracked on the window the first night which made it loud. Let me just say that the Parc is truly positioned perfecly to see down town. Its right across from the bart station and the cable cars and across the street is the mall. I'll be coming back here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and overall good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: stargazer59
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Hotwire without knowing what hotel we would get. We got a great price and although the hotel was not the nicest we've stayed in it was good and the location more than made up for any other shortcomings. We didn't try the restaurant or room service so can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rebster65
Reviews.Content: This is right on top of Union Square with all of the adjoining shopping and restaurants. Its also right near the beginning of one of the cable car lines. The staff was very helpful. The hotel is pet friendly and when my wife told the desk check in person that she was sallergic to dog hair he immediately switched her to a non pet hypoallergenic room with a spectacular view. Although the hotel appears to be slanted to a business traveler it was very accomodating and welcoming to us tourists

Reviews.Title: “very modern, fantastic location and unbelievable customer service”
Reviews.Author: markoshust
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc55 for 4 nights for a computer convention. The stay was just great - the customer service was amazing (everywhere from the front desk to housekeeping), and the bed was so extremely comfortable. One of the huge downsides was to valet your car, it was $44/night, and there is very little public parking anywhere in the area (I would expect parking at a hotel to be free for guests). The only thing this hotel was missing was a pool. I didn't check out the gym, but my brother said that it was better than a lot of the standalone gyms he's paid for. When you walk outside, you are right in Union Square which is a great place to be in the city - tons of food everywhere, and steps away from the cable cars to get to Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, my stay was fantastic and I would stay there again - but next time I would take the subway directly to the hotel (Powell exit). I would never take a car there again, as they are really unnecessary in the bay area - and I'm a guy who loves driving. I was in a room with a view and one king bed, and the room was very big and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location -- but a couple downsides”
Reviews.Author: adasmann
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice. Not great --- just comfortable, clean and in a good location. I opted for a view room. The view was nice with a couple caveats. The windows were filthy which tends to spoil the view. Also, I was in a corner room section with adjoining doors (closed). I could hear everything from the adjoining room. I also found that my room on the 23rd floor had a horrible wireless connection. Since I was in town on business this was an annoying problem. I could have paid for a separate wired connection but the wireless was free as part of my conference package. So overall I'd rate the Parc 55 as average. They're food prices are outrageous although that's pretty standard in SF. Fortunately, there are lots of restaurants, coffee shops, etc. right near by.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: jjdkj
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely perfect for a mother/daughter holiday! All the best stores were almost directly outside of our hotel. We literally shopped until we dropped!! There were a variety of restaurants either inside the hotel or very close, and all the ones that we tried were excellent. Both my daughter and I would highly recommend this hotel to almost anyone. We were up on the 23rd floor with a magnificent view and although we could hear the traffic below us, it was never intrusive. The cable car was only a block away for anyone who wanted to travel up and down Market St. The employees were all very helpful whenever we needed help. We will definitely stay in this hotel the next time we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: powerswitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and loved the quality, cleanliness and decor of our 23rd floor room with stunning view over the city and bay. Excellent price at about 90 a night, probably best value in whole 10 days of US travelling. If I have any comments I'd say the sit down breakfast buffet is way overpriced and your better off to take the grab and go breakfast. Location is excellent for shopping though do watch you don't turn down one street next to hotel which i took walk thru one early morning and regretted! All staff were great, thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LolTM
Reviews.Content: After staying in other Union Square hotels for our annual trip to the Moscone, we decided on Parc55 this year. It was a good choice - far better than previous hotels which had cost a bit more. Rooms were adequate and they still offer smoking rooms for folks like me allowing me to avoid the pan-handlers when waking at 5am due to jetlag. The bar was quite expensive and we didn't try and restaurant but in terms of location to central San Francisco, you can't really beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location of the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: Tabcolorado
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to San Francisco. We bid on a hotel via Priceline and ended up with the Parc 55 for only $82 per night. We took the Bart from the airport, and while we knew the hotel was just across the street, it still was a surprise how close the hotel was to the BART station. We literally walked out the door of the station and was looking straight up at the hotel. We checked in at about 9:30pm, and the very nice lady at the reception gave us a wonderful corner room on the 7th floor. The room was huge. As others have mentioned, the street noise was prevalent but luckily I'm a heavy sleeper. There are ear plugs provided in the bathrooms, in case you need it. We were there for 4 nights. We never ate in the hotel, or tried out the happy hour, club or restaurant. My husband used the fitness center - while I slept in - and said it was very satisfactory. Our bed was very, very comfortable. The location of this hotel is fantastic. A few steps away from the cable car turnaround, and all the shopping and restaurants of Union Square. We loved it, and would definitely recommend it to anyone else traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: DrGraves
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in (at 12-noon) to the time we checked out (5 days later), the Parc 55 provided professional and courteous service. I had no complaints about anything! The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and accomodating. The location was fantastic. I would stay here again --- even if my employer is NOT paying!

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: AtlNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very conveniently located. We walked to shopping, restaurants, China Town, and public transportation. We stayed on a high floor which helped to reduce the noise from the traffic outside. But we could still hear the noise. The hotel did provide ear plugs in the room. The pillows were a little too soft. The view was great but the windows were so dirty that it took away from the view. But overall it was a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel besides the horrible room service”
Reviews.Author: msipana
Reviews.Content: I stayed that this hotel for three nights. Everything was pretty good when I got there. When I first checked in I asked if they had any rooms on a higher level and they had one. When we got to our room we found out that it was a handicap room. Neither my girlfriend or I was comfortable with that. It would have been nice if he had told us that before he gave us the room. I called front desk and they switched it. We got a room that was on a lower floor but that was ok. The last night we stayed we decided to order room service. I saw on the menu that they were going to close pretty soon. When I called down they said â€œits good that you called now because we were going to close. Giving me no indication that there was going to be any problem. I ordered the ceaser salad and some cheeseburger sliders. I am serious when I say it only took them from when I got off the phone to when that brought up the food less than 10mins. I just thought they had really good room service but I was wrong. It seemed like they took a half of a head of lettuce and cut it in half and put it on a plate. Now with the burger, I started to eat the burger and I noticed it was really juicy. I looked at it and the inside was RAW. I looked at the other ones and they were all raw and only cooked on the outside. I called down immediately and I was transferred over to the restaurant manager. She said she was really sorry and she would take the bill off the room. I asked if she could cook them again because I was still hungry but she said she could not. She said everything was put away and she did not know where anything was. I was not too happy about that. And yes I do have pictures The next morning when I went to check out the lady there did not seem really sorry about what had happened. I told her that I do not think I will stay at this hotel again and she said that was too bad. So just a reminder to all, if you stay at this hotel do not order room service when they are about to close because that wonâ€™t cook your foodâ€¦. For the hotel manager: If you have any questions please feel free to ask

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TroubleTicket
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel in which I have stayed on any business trip. The location was great, the room was clean and modern, the staff was friendly and efficient. There was lots to see in the immediate area once the business day was done, cable car line is a block away, and we were able to walk approximately 10 blocks to the Giants game as well. I would not hesitate to stay there again, and would recommend it to friends. I thought the city was charming, although the homeless people are camped out in force and can get a bit aggressive by east coast standards. I never felt that it was unsafe, though. Overall, great trip, excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location; clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilikefishing
Reviews.Content: Checking in at 6pm and there weren't any clubroom available due to delaying maid services. But I was upgraded to a PURE clubroom on the 28th floor. The view was spectacular, but the room was too small for 4 peoples, there were not enough drawers so we have to live out of our suitcases for 3 days. The club lounge is a nice place to hang out for breakfast or some dessert in the evening. Overall, i highly recommend this hotel since it's close to shopping, restaurants and cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted”
Reviews.Author: Martin61Wales
Reviews.Content: All of our party were just delighted with our two-night stay at the Parc 55. The staff were extremely helpful, the rooms were very well appointed, and the location could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Beachmuse63
Reviews.Content: We were in town seeing a band and wanted a comfy hotel. Found it in the Parc 55. We drove in this time and they had a parking special price(SFO expensive to park).Never noticed the hotel before when we have been in Union Square area.Very modern and sleek inside lobby.Rooms were pretty large and bed comfy. Got a little warm at night had to turn on the air to cool it down. The gentleman in the little snack store was so charming(I needed chocolate). Only bummer was a end of stay car attendant drove husbands car like a maniac. He will not drive again there. Would stay again if we took Bart.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, amenities and view”
Reviews.Author: fiddle_man
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 20th floor to minimize noise from the City. Great view of City, beautiful, clean well appointed room. Everything fresh and new, great service. We would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel09010
Reviews.Content: I have never travelled out of Australia before and this was our first stop on our round the world holiday. Leaving Australia christmas day and arriving in san fran on christmas day was very exciting. Due to the day of travel (which I definiately recommend) it was very quiet. We arrived in San Fran at 10am walked straight through customs and airport directly onto the Bart train heading into san fran city centre. with in 30 minutes we were at Powel street station, got of train up one flight of stairs (can take lift) and directly infront of us was Parc 55. The location was better than we expected. Cable car turnaround one street away (1 minute walk if that), F-line directly across the road and smack dab in the middle of the shops Macey's, Bloomingdales fantastic. Across the street at the back of Parc 55 is an excellent little coffee shop would recommend. This is the best hotel I have stayed in. The service was excellent Michael the doorman (I think he was the door man) was the nicest person we had meet, nothing was a problem for him. The rooms were very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. We fell in love with San Francisco and the Parc 55. We are going back to San Fran in dec 2012 and we will not look any further than this hotel. The price was excellent as well. LOVED IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AllanMarston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous to look at right from the first minute you enter. The staff were fantastic and if you get deal with Elmer at the front check-in desk then you are in for an even more amazing experience. The room was very well laid out and the bed was extremely comfortable.
