I always miss my own pillow but they had such a variety of pillows that I finally found the one that made for a great night's sleep. The convenience of being so close to everything is also fantastic. Powell Street Bart is less than a block away and the famous San Francisco Tram that takes you to Union Square, China Town and Fisherman's Wharf is also less than a block away. The San Francisco Shopping Center, the massive Forever 21 Store and if you are like my wife and are addicted to the great deals at Ross then all those are within 3 to 10 minutes walking distance. Everything about this hotel was just first class. Having stayed at The Hilton and The Palace before both of which I loved I would still have to place Parc 55 at the top of my list of hotels in San Francisco even though the Hilton has a much grander lobby. But when I was in the hotel I spent more time in my room than in the lobby so that was okay. I will be back for sure and the next time I want to try out their Pure floor to see how it helps my allergies. Thank you to the Check-Out person whose name I can't remember unfortunately who took the time to tell me all about that feature.

Reviews.Title: “The best San Francisco has to offer”
Reviews.Author: ready2fly1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the parc 55 just off Union Square for a long weekend. The hotel itself is SPOTLESS---big, comfy rooms, quiet, beautifully maintained. The location is the best in the city. It is LITERALLY steps from the best shopping, dining and transportation in the city. Want to ride the Powell Street Cable Car---walk one and a half blocks. BART? Ditto. Buses and trams---across the street. You are in the middle of shopping Nirvana---The Westfield Center is across the street, and the neighborhood is packed with stores. If you can't find what you want here, you'll never be satisfied. I booked with my AARP card, and got a rate that beat the government and conference rates. The staff was superb, and I'm planning a return trip there in a few months. My advice---book yourselves in here for a WONDERFUL stay. You'll leave your heart in San Francisco---at the parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups and conferences”
Reviews.Author: csr123
Reviews.Content: Recently hosted a conference at Parc 55. Stayed there as well. The staff was excellent - very accomodating and friendly. Got lots of compliments from conference attendees on the facilities and the staff. The rooms were nice, spacious, and clean. Front desk staff - esp. Diana Lopez and Kat (?) - were great. They both worked dilligently and went above and beyond to help me with a problem charge on my credit card (no fault of the hotel). Would definitely stay and/or host an event here again!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: ReginaKat
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked good, but for the price we paid, the amenities were sorely lacking. $50 for parking, with the inconvenience of having to wait for the valet to bring us the car if we just needed to get something from it; having to pay an extra $12 for WiFi access; these were all things that were annoying. Yes, the rooms were nice, but honestly, for a place to just rest after exploring San Francisco, we could have paid less and gotten more.

Reviews.Title: “Double Check your Bill”
Reviews.Author: aussiefaraday
Reviews.Content: This was the most amazing 5 star hotel, and probably the one I will compare all others for the rest of my days. The bed was so comfortable, my husband was reluctant to leave to go sight seeing around the city. After 'roughing it' for a week in another city, this was the perfect hotel for sheer luxury. However the experience was spoiled by some incredible charges on our bill. It seems far too many people linger around the hotel, and we found over $200 in meals charged back to our room that we did not eat. Turns out (after much investigation of receipts) that someone must have misheard our surname, and saw us going into our room (we were on the floor with the gym). Only the fact they misheard, and thus misspelled our names on the dockets made them suspicious. We certainly didn't eat 3 times at the same restaurant in the one night. Better yet, just tell the staff to not allow any charges back to the room, and this problem will go away. A great facility, however, and I would go back again (but with a bit more caution about the people loitering around). The concierge even arranged a stretch limo to the international airport as we left - a beautiful way to end a trip to the USA!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RunnerGirlOH
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in March. Location is terrific, cable car, buses and BART are 1/2 block from hotel. Easy to get around the city to anywhere from the hotel. You can also walk to Union Square and Chinatown (if you are up to the hills). The hotel is average, I would rate it a low-end 4 star. Nothing "wow" about the rooms or the hotel overall. It is a good place to lay your head. It had all the basic amenities and the health club had a good number of machines. The price is hard to beat in SF. I liked the location, but would probably try a different hotel on my next visit that is a more solid 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: flargh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Parc 55 before when it was still a Renaissance hotel. Since then it's undergone a management change and a renovation, particularly to its lobby and registration area. The rooms are comfortable and roomy, the service is top-notch and the restaurant and lounge area offer a nice place to meet and socialize during the evening. Met several friends and business colleagues there during my week-long stay, always pleased with the service and attention. Really, I only had one annoyance during the entire week, and it's a relatively minor one: the cost of Wi-Fi Internet access, and its relatively limited bandwidth (had trouble downloading some files I needed for work because access was rather slow for file transfers, for some reason).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location, rooms, service, the works”
Reviews.Author: Davegol
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 4 nights with my wife and 14M old daughter. The location was very good, close to everything we needed, close to the train and bus stop. The rooms where clean and well kept, medium-large size. The service was very nice and helpful, very friendly and professional. I will definitely stay there again if I return to S.F !

Reviews.Title: “Great location,nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mountainportal
Reviews.Content: Near the famous shopping at Union Square this modern hotel is a perfect location. Often they have special deals making it a good choice. Nice rooms a solid 3 - 4 star property. We found it to be quite a bit less expensive then the Nikko Hotel that is across the street and almost as nice as the Nikko.

Reviews.Title: “parc 55 is cut above”
Reviews.Author: solotrips
Reviews.Content: parc 55 is cut above. I had a great stay for 10 nights at Parc 55. The staff was outstanding and fulfilled every request with a smile. Will definately stay again in S.F.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: LandonAuger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc55 for 3 nights. HUGE benefits to this hotel is that the BART train is only a couple hundred feet from the hotel and the Trolly is only about half a block. The Hertz only being about 2 blocks away is also very convenient. The hotel itself was very nice. There's a ton of elevators to waiting for one isn't a big issue. The Fitness Room is well stocked with treadmills. ellipticals, free weights and pretty much every type of weight lifting machine there is. Overall it is a very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and right in the middle of the city!”
Reviews.Author: jenniesarina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights during a road trip in California. The hotel is perfectly located at the Union Square surrounded by great shopping and restaurants. The parking fee was expensive but the same as the other central hotels. The room was very big and affordable, but we were there during off season.

Reviews.Title: “No requests please!”
Reviews.Author: GuptaDebjani
Reviews.Content: If the reservation services can be ignored, Parc 55 hotel is comfortable to stay with nicely appointed rooms and a great location. Its a stone's throw from the market street with resturants of all kinds of cusines surrounding the hotel and a short walk from the Union Square. Stayed at the Parc 55 for 5 days between Feb 28 - Mar 5, while attending a conference at SF. While booking the room I had requested for rooms at higher floors and a late checkout. Was amazed to note that none of the requests were taken into consideration during my stay. When I went to the reception desk personally on the day of the check out to request extension of my checkout time for a couple of hours, after some consideration I was given an hour extension. Quite disappointing to say the least. Will probably recommend this hotel but with a word about the reservation desk to others.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Nature4
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 2nd stay @ the Parc 55, I probably will never stay anywhere else. Top notch service, they put us on the 32nd floor upon hearing we were there for our sons birthday. Beautiful rooms with views, did we hear stuff in the middle of the night?? Sure we did, it's San Francisco baby!!! But we were snug in our very comfy beds with beautiful views. The accomidations were luxurious, took a bath in the oversize deep tub, utilized the complimentary robes. Took most of our meals take out just so we go enjoy our room. Can't wait to go back, hopefully in June for my b-day!

Reviews.Title: “Night & Day”
Reviews.Author: kendrick
Reviews.Content: That was the difference between the 2 rooms I had at Parc 55. As others have said, this is a wonderfully-located hotel, close to great shopping, food & the Powell St. Cable Car stop as well as the BART and Muni station. The first night I was given a room which was on a lower floor in this odd little cul-de-sac, I say odd because there was a large pole in the middle of it, making it impossible to see if anyone was behind there. It was kind of nerve-wracking as a solo female traveler. The room itself was gorgeous - it was an updated king and the beautifully appointed, the view was nothing to look at. The bathroom was oddly configured with a lot of wasted space - the towel rack was over the toilet, at least 6 or 7 feet from the tub and no hook near the tub on which to leave your towel. Huge, flat screen HD tv, not many options in terms of channel selection (I know, they want you to pay for the extras) The room was above a busy street and it was unbelievably noisy - I stayed on Bourbon St. during LSU football season and had quieter nights - someone was loading case after case of glass bottles onto a truck at midnight, bar revelers at 2; dumpster trucks at 5 - and did I mention that people were yelling in the hall in between? I called the front desk and asked to be moved for the second night. They could not have been more gracious or accomodating. I was given a room on a top floor and was able to move up early on Sat. morning. The room and bath were not updated, but the view of San Francisco bay and the blissful quiet was more than worth it. Staff throughout were warm and helpful. If you go, make sure to ask for a quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBfoto
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, clean, attractive, comfortable and convenient

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cewm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc 55 for a couple of nights. It was the last two nights of a honey moon trip to California. The location is great, near everything (Union Square, Shopping Mall, restaurants, cable car, etc.). Unfortunately, rooms in front of Market Street (my case) are noisy during the whole day. When I first arrived, there was nobody to help me with the luggage (did everything by myself, 4 large suitcases). Check in and check out was quick enough. The rooms are outdated and need some refreshment. They are ok, but i think I could get better places to stay for the same price and at the same region. Definitively not a 4 star hotel as some websites claim.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in union square-close to everything”
Reviews.Author: daisyi295
Reviews.Content: very accessible to all the fun things in san fran. We had a great view-I suggest you request a high up room. It was quiet and the bed was very comfortable! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is in the heart of it all...”
Reviews.Author: Gettin_My_Travel_On
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of downtown, totally accessable to all public transportation, the mall,cable cars, you name it. We had a corner room on the 29th floor and could see the bay and the cith thanks to the 3 huge bay windows in our room.. Nice staff, really reasonable rates as well... This was a very good choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location! Right across from Nordstrom and Forever 21. We had room service a couple nights. The food was good and normal...a great thing for a four year old :) As expected VERY expensive for room service. The hotel bed was very comfortable and we had a great view! If you watch Tough Love on VH1 the hotel was in that show.haha. Great deal only $99 a night. The hotel matched the deal we found on 1-800hotels.com. Great hotel and location we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: newstead5
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel by taxi our bags were taken for us and we were shown where reception was. Quicky checked in by a very friendly woman and about 2/3mins in the room our bags arrived. Very clean, very friendly and an excellent location. Right on Market Street where the trams, buses and cable buses which are really easy to get use to get around. Buy a 3 day pass for $20 in stead of a day pass which saves you a few pounds. China Town was a amazing, food great adn people so friendly. Mosty of the museams are free and the locals are very proud of thier city - when on the trams and they see you are visiting they will tell you where to go and what to do. The hotel though was so central and I didnt use the safe and still left me passport and moey arounbd in the room with no worries. If i go again to San Fran this is where i will stay.

Reviews.Title: “sadly lower class that it appears”
Reviews.Author: WinstonK
Reviews.Content: On the surface this seems like a nice hotel. Unfortunately, they have little respect for their guests. We booked a stay for three nights but stayed with friends the second night. We returned to find they gave our room away only when our keys did not work. After some pointless negotiation, we got a lower quality room for the remaining night of our prepaid reservation. In the mean time, our cell phone was taken from the car during valet parking. It remained missing until we returned home and agreed to pay for shipping. It was shipped only after the memory card was stolen out of it. This hotel may seem cosmopolitan on the surface but is low class at the core. Do not trust or believe the condescending attempts to make you feel comfortable. It is nothing more than a snake oil con.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SFVguy
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my recent stay. Although the parking fees are outrageous, the location is great and the room was very comfortable. There is some noise that filters in from the street, but hey, you're on one of the busiest intersections in SFO. I have only a few suggestions: toiletries made in China? Can't you do better than that? How about some Aveda or something that would be 4 star quality? And offering bottled water for $4.50 is tacky. You should have a couple of FREE bottles of water for your guests. And as previous reviewers have stated, a refer would be nice. Other than that the quality was very good.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay...but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: umwife11
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to deny we got a great deal on our room at the Parc 55...but that "great deal" became suddenly less so when upon check-in, we were informed there were no more rooms with king beds (just what a couple on a weekend getaway wants to hear...). We were told we could check back later for a king bed and when we did were told one would be available...for an additional $50 a night. We took it, but as I said--so much for the "great deal" on the room. As to the hotel itself, it's not bad. It's got a great-looking lobby and it's huge. And I think that's part of the problem--it's too big. And it felt understaffed. Any time we had to take the elevator, we'd have to wait more than a few minutes. Need to stop at the front desk? Be prepared to wait in line. Want to talk to the concierge? Get ready to do some more waiting. Overall, we had a decent stay (after shelling out the extra bucks), but I think in a hotel like San Francisco, you can easily do better. It just didn't feel like there was anything memorable about the Parc 55 that would make me want to stay there again (except the location...the location is absolutely wonderful).

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel, but they overbooked this time.”
Reviews.Author: neyugnanit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for the first time last March. It was great. The walls were kind of thin, but that's ok. We got a free upgrade & got a corner room. The view was lovely. For our recent visit (we celebrated Valentine's Day on the 13th), unfortunately the hotel was overbooked. Luckily, they had other options for us, so we decided to stay at the San Francisco Marriott instead of The Palace Hotel since our car was parked closer to it. The person that helped me at the front desk mentioned that we were helping them out a lot. Unfortunately, it was an inconvenience for us since we parked our car somewhere else & we were not given anything for it (such as an upgrade or free internet access). I understand that the Marriott was helping out Parc 55, but it would have been nice if Parc 55 gave us something for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Breath Taking”
Reviews.Author: Blessed312
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc 55 for our 22nd years of marriage and we could not have stayed at a better place in the world. Thank you Daniel for honoring my request it was more than I expected. My room was on the 27th floor and we had beautiful views of the city. I thought the staff was mistaking me as a celebrity because they were treating me so special until I saw how they were treating the rest of the guest (the same) The staff are so nice and helpful. I am a first timer in san franscio and all the questions I needed answered, were answered right at the hotel. I know some people mentioned the homeless outside of the hotel, if that's a discourgement for anyone reading this, they may not want to go to san franscio because they are every where. They are no problem. This was a great hotel and the staff are excellent I met a guy at burger king and he was smiling and speaking to me and when I returned to the hotel he was a hotel staff. The staff of Parc 55 are nice even when they are not at work. Thanks Drew and to the others that I did not get their names you guys keep up the good work. Oh yeah the only thing I did not like about my stay was "LEAVING" Hey I got to go now because I need to book my next stay at Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than enjoyable visit.”
Reviews.Author: hagadizzle
Reviews.Content: I was kinda skeptical of the hotel when pulling up in the taxi, it looks quite a bit older, but once inside the hotel has been beautifuly renovated with a great attention to detail and modernized accents. The price for the room was actually not to bad at all for the hotel type. My room was on the 18th floor in a corner view room, it was nice the bed was decent not the most comfortable, but the thing that caught my attention was the Ear plugs that are provided on the bathroom counter i just thought they were for picky guests. That night i soon realized why the yellow ear plugs are put in the room. I was 18 floors up and it sounded like my bed was on the shoulder of the freeway with firetrucks driving by every 10min or so, i used the ear plugs all 4 nights. On saturday night i was woke by the fire alarm going off, so i got dressed and went into the hall and asked an emploee if there was a fire they said they werent sure and to go back to my room!? not the most safety conscious hotel after this incident i had a drunk guy knocking on my door half naked for 15min until security finally came up after the 3rd phone call to the front desk, worst hotel experience i have ever had. Bar is nice though, drinks wayyy over priced. Oh and house keeping cleans rooms at 10pm?

Reviews.Title: “WOW...awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: dang29
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all...prime, downtown location; friendly, attentive staff; brilliant hospitality; clean, comfortable rooms; excellent cuisine and great amenities. Thoroughly enjoyed my short stay here and would recommend it to anyone visiting SF. It really was an awesome experience! I wouldn't think about staying anywhere else in SF. About as perfect as you can get...5 stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic"”
Reviews.Author: video4all
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Parc 55. The place to stay if you're in San Francisco. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “SalesForce Conference”
Reviews.Author: bauso1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Property Location, Staff and Accomodations of a five star hotel for the price of a three star. Highly recommend this hotel for both pleasure and business.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, front desk "Surrogates"”
Reviews.Author: Tschaller
Reviews.Content: Two nights at Parc 55: great rate on Priceline at $66/night; Negatives:front desk service was lacking and impersonal in this four diamond-awarded hotel. Great example of you usually get what you pay for on Priceline and a 4-star hotel really means top 25% of hotels in the area selected. Positives: very clean, fast room service response and business center staff terrific. Also, if you're looking to be in the middle of all that downtown San Francisco has to offer this hotel's for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay at an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spadine
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for the Joint Math Conference at the Moscone Center (January 14-17) and was lucky enough to secure accommodations at the Parc 55. I found the staff friendly and helpful and the hotel EXTREMELY clean and inviting. My room was very pleasant and the bed was heavenly after my long trip from Georgia. The walk from the hotel to the Moscone and back again was very pleasant and enjoyable. Lots of great shopping and restaurants within walking distance. When I got homesick, Denny's and Mel's diner were just a short walk away. There is a large assortment of restaurants offering a variety of different cuisines within walking distance. As a woman alone (my companions went off on their on) I was very comfortable walking in the area around the Moscone and the Westfield Mall. However, I did notice on the ride in that about a block behind the hotel, the area is somewhat seedy. Also, I do wish that their wireless internet was free, but they did have a nice business center that was free of charge. The hotel offered to take the four of us to the airport in the hotel limousine when we left for much less than it would have cost us to take a taxi. I had a great time here and will definitely be returning to the Parc 55 on a family vacation in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, glad we didn't pay too much though...”
Reviews.Author: LEBG
Reviews.Content: Thankfully we booked through priceline, so we got really good rates. I would have been disappointed if we'd paid their website price though. Rooms are nice, but very basic. The lobby is really nice, however staff aren't exactly what I'd regard as friendly! Parc 55 is in an excellent position, - shoppers dream position really, also so close to Powell st Tram and BART. There are lots of restaurants and cafes in the neighouring streets. Overall the hotel is nice, however nothing special. It's location is it's strong point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but drop it in a different neighborhood and it would be better”
Reviews.Author: Lorenti912
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline.com; it came up as a 4 star. While the hotel itself was very nice and clean, I do have a few gripes: 1) The noise. We were on a corner room facing a building construction site and they started at 6:30 to 7 am daily. GOOD MORNING! You could hear the machinery, the yelling, the banging. I should have known when I saw the earplugs on the tray in the bathroom with the soaps and shampoo. 2) The neighborhood. It is right on the cusp of a great shopping district and homeless squalor. We walked to a restaurant northwest of the hotel one night and we passed no less than 4 homeless shelters. While I understand it is a major issue in San Fran, we were really surrounded by it at this hotel. I lived in NYC for 7 years and I was uncomfortable walking to this restaurant. At night? Forget it, take a cab. However, the rooms were clean, roomy and nicely decorated. So there were pluses, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beat, but beds and pillows were poor”
Reviews.Author: jvg62
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in January for a business trip. I checked with several hotels before arriving and felt this one offered the best value. Overall, the value as rated above was very good. The best thing about this hotel is the location. You are a block from all BART, MUNI, and cable cars. There are a hundred restaurants within blocks of this hotel and you can shop for anything you want within a few blocks also. This hotel does border the shady Tenderloin district, so make sure you know which direction to walk when you leave the hotel in the evenings and you will be fine. I stayed on a higher floor and you should consider this as the noise in the area is quite loud at times. I imagine the noise on the lower levels must be borderline intolerable (from constant sirens, etc., not clubs and such). I enjoyed the free breakfast on the 31st floor during the week. I wish it was also available on the weekends, but not a major issue. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful enough, however one of the concierge's (I cannot recall his name) seemed quite aloof. Twice I asked for something specific and he directed me to something that did not match what I was asking for. He didn't take much time to explain things either. The beds and pillows were way too "Super 8" for my tastes. Very, very uncomfortable. You would expect more from a $200+ per night hotel. You are paying for location here, nothing else. There is no refrigerator in the room either, which for a week long stay was a big pain.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and poor food”
Reviews.Author: bedbug9
Reviews.Content: My wife and i were hospitalized from severe reactions to bed bug bites. Enuff Said! Oh and Parking is 60 dollars!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FIND IN DOWNTOWN!”
Reviews.Author: theallens04
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and 7 month old stayed at the Parc 55 during New Year's Eve. We were worried about the noise since we were traveling with our little one, but it wasn't a problem at all. We were on the 22nd floor with a beautiful view of the city. You can not beat the location! Across the street from the SF shopping center..you are in the middle of it all. DOn't bother renting a car..public transportation is great in SF. We have tried many hotels in SF since SF is one of our favorite cities to visit, but the Parc 55 takes our number 1 slot! Staff is very friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view from our room, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmikestlouis
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Parc 55 for five nights. We were on the 26th floor and had beautiful views of the city. The location was fantastic, we walked everywhere. Great shopping, restaurants and site seeing. The staff was friendly and helpful. Making car rental arrangements for a day to Wine Country. Two places we enjoyed for breakfast at good prices were Tad's Steak House and Lefty O'Douls. Lefty O'Doul's also has menu or buffet meals at good prices, as well and a very friendly neighborhood pub with a piano bar. Fun place! I had read that the homeless hung out around the Parc 55, but we didn't experience any near the hotel. We also didn't encounter any aggressive homeless on our ventures. We had room service twice and the service was prompt and good food. If you love burgers like we do, don't miss the Burger Bar at Macy's. Alcatraz tour is well worth the trip. We took the evening tour which was alot of fun. The hop on hop off buses are great for getting your bearings and where you want to site see. We chose the SF City Sightseeing bus and thought we had good service from the drivers and tour guides. The only downside that we experienced at the Parc 55, we felt the bath amenities were inferior and none of the computers worked in the business center. Which was frustrating when we wanted to check flights and print boarding passes and check e-mail. Overall, wonderful experience and will plan our next trip to SF to stay at the Parc 55 and will recommend to friends. I booked through booking.com and thought the price was a good value for the type and location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Clean and Comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ningen
Reviews.Content: I managed to get 2 rooms in this hotel for $95 each on priceline.com. We like the location and how close everything is to the hotel. Everything is clean and functional in the hotel. I noticed a 4 diamonds award they proudly display in the hotel lobby. However, the staffs are not interested in their customers who don't wear a suit. Seems like they welcome business travellers who travel solo more than family of 4 who travel with old parents. I understand that this is not Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, so I didn't set a high expectation. There was a big crowd that came for the Fancy Food Show due to the fact that its just a few blocks from the moscone center. I was surprised it wasn't unusually loud with obnoscious people all around. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were not offered help with our luggages at the lobby. They prefer to stand around and chat and choose to ignore us. We don't have a lot to carry so its fine. Check in counter was very busy, the girl helping us was friendly. We got into our room and was relief that it was at least nice and clean, not as bad as some of what was described in the other reviews. Perhaps because we got the rooms cheap, our views werent that great we were looking into the windows of the next building. Thats ok, becuase we only spent the morning getting ready and came back late. We didnt check out the restaurant in the hotel. Fifth Floor in Palomar was great. Ruth Chirs in town was great. I forgot the name of the restaurant in the Westfield mall. They have pretty decent dinner too. Overall the stay is not too bad. I wont say its over the top. But I do get what I paid for. So I am pretty happy. Despite the fact that Internet connection is not working the time I was staying here... Jan 15 - Jan 19

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tr1padv1ser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 on our first visit to San Francisco. It is close to all transport options and a very easy train ride from the airport. The room rate was reasonable (discount for a 3 night stay) however we found the bar / restaurant to not be competitive with surrounding venues. We were disappointed to find that there was no in-room safe. I can highly recommend visiting Danielle's Cafe across the road in Ellis for a takeaway breakfast in the morning and Puccin & Pinetti across Cyril Magnin St for an evening meal. While the free access to two computers in the business centre was welcome, I found that they were very popular. Given their out-of-the-way location you might find yourself making some abortive trips. Overall a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BinzAustralia
Reviews.Content: After considerable consultation with TripAdvisor reviews, we decided to try Parc 55. We were very happy with our experience. We checked in on 31 Oct and were met at reception with staff dressed up for Halloween. Prompt and efficient service. The room was pleasantly clean, and did not smell. We also discovered that the small vents at the bottom of the windows could be closed to minimise the noise from the street. Restaurant staff for breakfast were friendly and helpful, and as we stayed 7 days, the regular restaurant staff recognised you, and remembered your specific requirements. Parking valet was ok, but if you want to have your car ready by the time you get to the valet, give them a call about 15 mins prior. Great location, as already mentioned by other reviewers. We had some products sent to the hotel, as we are from Australia, and one did not arrive in time, but the service and follow-up provided was excellent, and we did receive our package duly forwarded to Australia - great service, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniet, courteous, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: SBurnsey
Reviews.Content: As first time travelers to SF we found the Parc 55 to be a fine base to explore the city. All reviews prior to this have pretty much summed up what you get. I tend to disagree with the reviews about noise. We found our 19th floor room with guests on both sides to be quiet. TIP: There are small flip up vents below the windows. When open they allow in plenty of city noise, but also nice fresh air. Keep these closed and you might hear a siren from time to time. I rise early and shower. The shower cannot be heard in the room and will not disturb sleeping family. You cannot hear other guests running water for showers. Hallway noise never intruded into room. We were right around corner from elevators and never heard them.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: circumventor
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Nicely renovated room, very comfortable, great bed. We encountered some of the nicest staff in the restaurant, lounge and on checking in and out that we have ever come across. Would definitely book the Parc55 again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, perfect location,friendly staff,great value”
Reviews.Author: annietravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights had great time, Checked in by Erica who was so efficient, friendly & helpful. Had requested early checkin as flight arrived 9am & room was ready. Room was large, modern & bed so comfortable. Caught bart from airport & hotel was close by the station. Also Market street trams took us to Waterfront area. Convenient location for price charged. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location; an awesome choice!”
Reviews.Author: BlooBunnie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Parc 55 from December 28 to January 2, 2010 to celebrate New Years and the anniversary of our engagement. We decided before the trip that instead of taking a taxi, we would take the BART. It was more than half the price cab fare would have been and it was fast, easy to use, comfortable and convenient. We noticed that a lot of other travelers were also using the BART. If you take the BART to the Powell Street station, the hotel is just across the street. It doesn't get more convenient than that. Check-in at the hotel was a breeze. Mavis helped us with our room and she was very friendly and chatted with us about our stay. She put us in a corner room on the 17th floor with lovely views of the City through the two large windows on two sides of the room. The room was spacious with a large bathroom, closet with an alcove for your luggage, large flat screen TV, writing table, coffee table, and couch. The bed was very comfortable and after long days spent walking around town, it felt really good to sleep on such a comfortable mattress. The shower was very good too with a massaging shower head and plenty of hot water. The room was always kept in excellent condition by the cleaning staff. At night there was street noise like police sirens and car horns honking but it was never so bad that you couldn't fall asleep. It was more like background noise than anything else and didn't have any negative impact on our trip. The hotel was very modern looking, clean and impressive. The elevators were always very fast and you never had to wait long for one. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to everything - BART, Municipal transportation, cable cars, shopping (Nordstrom, Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Tiffany, Bloomingdale's ... just to name a few) and restaurants. Everything is just steps from the hotel which made the location ideal. We went to see "Wicked!" our second night there. During the daytime, we had walked to the theatre to see how far it was from the hotel It was a bit of a walk and we wouldn't have minded walking there to see the show but we noticed that along the way, there were many (and by many I mean A LOT) of homeless people and people smoking pot. For some reason the theatre is located in a very shady neighborhood. This is coming from someone who lives in New York City and sees shady people on a normal basis and thinks nothing of it but what we saw there took it to another level. In fact, there wasn't a single day where we didn't smell someone smoking pot or where we weren't standing near someone who reeked of it. It was nasty. Also, we've never seen such a concentrated mass of homeless people anywhere either. Anyway, not too many of them approached us or bothered us but a word of advice would be to take the BART from the hotel one stop to the Civic Center and get to the theatre that way. That's what we did and that's what many other theatre goers did as well. It's cheap, fast and safe. If you plan on going to Alcatraz and booked tickets, you can go right onto Market Street by the hotel and take the F-line Streetcar right to Pier 33 where the ferry to Alcatraz is located. When you get back from Alcatraz, you can take a short walk to Pier 39 (Fisherman's Wharf). There you can find shopping and a whole lot of restaurants. Then when you're done, just take the F-line Streetcar back to the hotel. If you plan on going to the Golden Gate Bridge, you can take the Municipal Bus there and just ask your bus driver for a transfer ticket although they really do automatically give you one. The transfer ticket is good for a few hours so you can hop on and off buses until it runs out. Not bad for two dollars. You'll need to take the 45 bus (we hopped on while in Chinatown) to Chestnut and Laguna and then get off and transfer to the 28 bus. The 28 bus will drop you off a few steps from the Golden Gate Bridge. That's what we did and it was pretty easy and convenient. We walked part of the bridge until it started to rain and we had to turn back. When going back, be aware that there are two 28 buses that stop there. You need to make sure you get on the 28 bus headed to Fort Mason and not the one headed to Daly City. The Fort Mason 28 bus will bring you back to Chestnut and Laguna where you can get off and transfer back to the 45 bus. As for food, we didn't have the best of luck finding good food while in town. We ate at a Chinese place by the hotel called Tian Sing. It was the most expensive dim sum I ever ate in my life! We had one plate of vegetable lo mein and about 6 different dim sum and a pot of tea and it cost us about forty-five dollars! I almost fainted. In NYC that would have cost us like $20 maybe. So yeah we wouldn't recommend eating there. We also wouldn't recommend Blondie's Pizza. Being from NYC, we know what good pizza is and Blondie's was inedible. It was too doughy and had practically zero tomato sauce. We had pizza another night (because nothing else was open) from Pizza Prada and that was much better. It wasn't too doughy and had a decent amount of sauce. I know this is going to sound absolutely insane but it's so true ... the BEST pizza was at the airport! I swear to you. It was from Firewood Pizza and it was amazing. They make it fresh to order and it was like brick oven pizza with a thin, but not too thin, crackly crust, a flavorful generous heaping of sauce, mozzarella and fresh sliced tomatoes with basil. I know ... the airport?! But yes ... the airport. Crazy but true and trust me ... you have to try it! Okay so back to town. We also ate at the hotel's Thai restaurant (Siam Thai) twice. The food was good but sometimes they could have used some more spice or something to make the food more flavorful. They could have also used more sauce in their pad thai because it was too dry. We ate at Boudin Bakery where we both had bread bowls filled with soup. One word - Amazing. The bread is fresh, flavorful and so good and the soup was just delicious. My fiance had the clam chowder and I had the rustic tomato. If you're going to eat anywhere, we positively recommend Boudin Bakery. They have a location at Fisherman's Wharf and another location bu Ghirardelli Square. There was also a location by the hotel and on Friday night we wanted to eat there so badly but when we got there at 7:00 it was closed and we were so devastated and that's when we went to Pizza Prada. We also ate at Bellini and had the bruschetta, garlic bread and the capellini pomodoro. The food there was really good and was actually much better than I thought it would be. We wanted to see the sea lions but while we were there, reports on the news stated that the sea lions were gone and that scientists believed that they left due to the dwindling food supply. In the end, we would definitely recommend the Parc 55 Hotel. It was a wonderful hotel in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great in many ways, but missing some standard (and necessary) amenities”
Reviews.Author: dbsccp
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Spectacular location, central to virtually everything (including many transportation options). Impeccably clean. Hip and modern, but still very comfortable. Extremely reasonable pricing. THE BAD: The rooms are somewhat small, but that's not unusual for San Francisco. What was most surprising (and disappointing) to me was that our room had no fridge/mini-bar, and no safe. The lack of a fridge meant that leftovers from SF's great restaurants basically had to be trashed. More troubling was the lack of a safe. Because of that, we simply left our "privacy" sign on the door for the 3 days we were there. That worked out fine, but it would've been nice to have been able to get our room cleaned and been secure in the knowledge that our valuables were locked away. Overall, though, a great, central, hip, cost-effective option in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous staff, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: 40andFabulous2010
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is an incredible hotel for the value. Very friendly staff. We stayed in the renovated king size bed room. Nice, clean and roomy room. Bed was a little hard. My biggest complaint would be the price to park at the hotel as a guest. You pay the same price as a non-guest would. The cost is much to high for parking. Parking cost us 50% of what we payed for our room. Please check all parking fees before you book any hotels in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with fantastic city views”
Reviews.Author: chbruce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for Christmas eve and Christmas night. Got the room for $62 a night through priceline. After reading reviews of the hotel, I knew to ask for a corner room on an upper floor -- we were given room 1301 which had windows on two sides and beautiful views of the city -- especially at night. the staff was friendly and accomodating. The room was large, with LOTS of bay windows all around, a spacious changing room, and a good sized bathroom. Good selection of TV channels. A previous review said there was no coffee maker -- there's actually a one-cup coffee maker hidden in the console below the TV. The complaints are minor -- the bathroom could use more counter and towel rack space. The curtains didn't always open in a direction that allowed the best possible view of the city. The TV set was positioned directly across from the bed -- for most hotels this would be perfect. For a hotel with these kinds of views, it blocked some of our city view while lying in bed. The "easy chair" in the room was not very comfortable. However, relative to the value we got from the hotel, these complaints are all minor. When you arrive, check with the concierge about which parts of the neighborhood to avoid -- when you go in one direction, everything's fine. In the other direction, it gets dicey very quickly. The gym is fantastic! Lots of treadmills and ellipticals, along with weight machines. mats. balls, etc. The only complaint here is that the view out the gym windows is obstructed -- would have been nice to watch the goings on below while working out. I had read that parking was expensive, so we came prepared. My companion is handicapped and has a handicapped permit -- we parked at UCSF for free and took the N-Judah directly to the hotel. (the stop is 1 short block away from the hotel). The hotel is also about a block away from the Powell cable car, which goes to Fisherman's Wharf -- a fun ride and destination. I noticed on Saturday morning at 4:30 that some of the local businesses receive deliveries. I guess this explains the free ear plugs they have in the bathroom. But it's a city -- there' s going to be noise. It wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “San Fran”
Reviews.Author: KevinS2
Reviews.Content: Good location and reasonably priced. Rooms were well maintained. Cost of parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Never Too Old to Travel
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I reserved a room in the Club Level (Floors 27-32) at this hotel. It was a wonderful room with a 180 Degree view of the Bay and the city. The location was perfect for us as we were right on the bus line at Powell & Market and right across the street from the Nordstrom (Westfield) Mall and only 4 blocks from Union Square. The staff was the friendliest I have ever experienced to include the housekeepers, the wait staff, the concierge and front desk staff. The 2 night trip couldn't have been nicer. The hotel is very contemporary inside with stark, minimalist decor. The Bed and Breakfast package we booked included a plentiful morning buffet breakfast and as a club member we had access to the club on the 31st floor where appetizers, desserts and drinks (and honors bar) were served from 5pm to 11pm Sunday - Thursday. A continental breakfast is also served at 6:00am in the Club Room. The only slight negative was that we were surprised that there was no coffee maker in the room, but that was minor. The room was spacious with a very comfortable bed and flat screen TV. A perfect getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend in SF”
Reviews.Author: MiaLora77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a wonderful weekend in downtown Union Square for my birthday weekend. We normally do this every year and have stayed at various hotels, however, this hotel became a favorite of ours in the city. We found awesome rates on the web and decided to give this hotel a try. We live about 2 hours south of San Francisco and decided to stay for the weekend in downtown. We stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel and I was simply amazed how nice it was, and how close it was to almost everything! This was our first time staying there, and we truly enjoyed our stay . Upon check in, the woman that assisted us was very kind and informative about the hotel. This hotel was recently renovated and re opened a couple of months ago. What was even more nice was she even upgraded our room to the 28th floor belonging to the Executive Level. Having a room at the Executive Level provided awesome views and complimentary breakfast at their clubroom on the 31st floor. The rooms had a nice contemporary look to it, plenty of space, and were very clean! The beds were very comfy as well! The hotel is situated in a widely popular centralized shopping area. It's right acoss the street from the San Francisco center and Bloomingdales. And right around the corner, not even a block away, is Powell St. which leads you to Union Square as well as Market Street. So you can imagine all the shopping and dining you can conquer being that the hotel was so close to everything! At night we walked up about 2 blocks up Powell Street to the Sir Francis Drake hotel where they have a nice dining lounge at their very top floor with amazing views of the city called the Starlight Room. There are also so many others that are only a walking distance away! The only downside we experienced was the valet parking. It was way too much. They charged $45 a day. So even though we felt we scored awesome rates staying at this hotel, the cost of valet makes it even more costly. But that's usually what you should expect in the city. There are parking garages nearby for half the rate, however they're not as close as you think and you'd still have quite a walk to the hotel. Overall, this hotel is awesome. If you want to stay centralized to everything, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's really nice, friendly staff, clean, and fairly new!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Wonderful Stay! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Todd5218
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. The service is world class; the rooms were very modern and had all the amenities. People keep complaining about the homeless people outside but that is not the hotel's fault it is downtown San Francisco. We would recommend this hotel to anyone! I am not sure why others are writing negative reviews. We booked a room through Priceline and thought the hotel might give us a lesser room but in fact they gave us a room on the top floor with club access. Thanks Parc55.

Reviews.Title: “Enhanced our trip”
Reviews.Author: keybjones
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline and got the Parc 55 for an excellent rate. I called the hotel to request 2 beds and they said no problem. When we checked in, I asked for a room on a high floor and we got the 25th floor facing the Bay. We really enjoyed the view. The location was perfect for the sights we wanted to see. The parking at the hotel was about $50 a day with tax but most parking in that neighborhood is $40 or more. The vallet guys were quick and careful, thanks! Check in was hassle free and the concierge was very helpful. If you are going to the King Tut exhibit or Alcatraz tour, get your tickets in advance. The room was clean and comfortable. I wasn't crazy about the mattress but the kiddo and hubby didn't mind. We ate at the Italian resturant right next door, Puccini & Pinetti. We all really liked it. The pumpkin cheesecake was great! I read other comments about the riff raff around the hotel but that's all over downtown. My husband and I have stayed a few times at the St. Francis and we saw even more homeless types being right across from the square. You will encounter pan handlers and some of them are mentally ill and/or under the influence. Just be extra careful/observant and that element won't impact your stay. Overall the Parc 55 was a good hotel in a great location. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 let me down”
Reviews.Author: tag78747
Reviews.Content: I know not every one reads these all the way so if you do decide to stay here do yourself a huge favor deman a room on the club level and make sure its a corner room, these are the only rooms in the hotel that are fair. Big diff from the reg club room and the corner club rooms trust me.. This is one of the hotels that you view pics of and say wow this look nice and the price is reasonable. However the pictures are of there finest rooms. I booked 3 rooms at this hotel on the club levels. 1 Room was very large and was well laid out. However the furnishings are strait from the motel 6 catalog. Now, to the hotels defense I did just check out of a 5 night stay in Las Vegas at the Encore a 5 star and by the way most fantastic hotel I know. Our other two rooms was Dim, lacking wall coverings or art, Very bad layouts ect. Oh yes and if your planning to eat breakfast in the club or go to the club for drinks don't. Bottom line is if your looking for a quality memory of your hotel on a romantic or magical trip to old san fran do your self a favor and stay some where else. The bell hops and valet were very nice and quick. Thank god this city is so freaking beautiful otherwise I would have let this hotel ruin it for me.. Just keep looking for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kurt12
Reviews.Content: Judging by the reviews, I'm guessing that some guests may have stayed in an unrenovated room at Parc 55. Our room was large, clean and lovely. It was an inside room, and we heard no street noise. We also didn't have any problem with noise from the adjoining rooms. Check in was perfect. The lobby is lovely, and it feels like you are in a much more expensive hotel. I am from San Francisco, so I was not surprised by the presence of homeless people. I don't consider it to be a fair criticism of Parc 55. In my experience, the area around Parc 55 is completely safe. My only complaint is we were given a room with two double beds instead of one Queen or King. It was late and we had unpacked before we noticed the size of the beds, otherwise we would have asked for a different room. However, I was disappointed that the hotel would assign a room with two double beds to a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable, especially if you book the exective room levels”
Reviews.Author: ben2k
Reviews.Content: This was the end of a road trip around San Francisco and we really enjoyed it. I read some negative stuff about this hotel and its location, but I couldn't find it. Of course the building doesn't look nice, but all the rest was brilliant. We booked an executive room for a few bucks in addition which provides complimentary ors d'heuvres at around 6-7pm and breakfast. On top of that rooms are on the 28th + floors which results in quiet rooms with gorgeous views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: wrenmelb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 on two occasions in October for two nights each time. Each room I had was spotlessly clean and furnished to a high standard. On my request I had a smoking room so I was on the 8th floor. I obtained my room through Priceline but nevertheless my request for a corner room was granted on my first stay. I preferred to leave the window vents partially open but the noise in the street below after dark funnelled up into the room as my room overlooked Mason Street. The loudness of sirens was disconcerting but it was the shouting and arguments I had most difficulty with. I didn't want to use the earplugs provided as I was worried I wouldn't wake at 7 AM but it only became quiet outside around 3 AM. I'm sure it would make a difference according to the level and location of room allocated so I would suggest requesting a room higher up and away from Mason Street. The location of the hotel can't be beaten for access to BART from the airport as the Powell St station is just a few minutes walk away. Any hotel in this location is going to be subject to noise and I was perhaps more sensitive to it being somewhat jet lagged after a 20 hour journey when I first arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: kjtrunky
Reviews.Content: If you want a good hotel in downtown SF which is close to BART (Powell) station from airport, this hotel is it. Downtown and Waterfront are within easy walking or MUNI and Tram stops making this a great location. Can be noisy at night, even on the 18th floor as I was.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Harmony177
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious, hotel had nice amenties, and was in good location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but great location”
Reviews.Author: erntravels
Reviews.Content: We had a large, well appointed room on the 19th floor so it was astounding that the noise level was so high. You could hear sirens, drag cars, police chases, etc. at all hours. The amenities include earplugs but you can't sleep with those in your ears. Also, whoever picks out the music played in the common areas must be a zombie. The music is awful, not at all soothing, loud and unnecessary. The hotel location is terrific. Close to the cable cars, BART, and within walking distance of shopping. If it were not for the noise, this hotel would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: DigitalDub
Reviews.Content: We booked a club level king room at this hotel for 5 nights. The room was great, we had a great view of downtown, we were on the 23rd floor. The room also had a LCD TV and had a built in outlet to plug in your one AV equipment (RCA/SVideo/VGA/MP3) and watch it on the TV, great for families who might want to bring a portable DVD player. The bathroom was great, nice a big, lots of room for our toilette bags. And the room had a nice closet to hang our cloths and well as provided us with 2 robes. We also had access to the club lounge which provided breakfast every morning and snacks and desert weeknights. I think it was great... we didn't pay that much extra and always had a great breakfast. The location was great, just across the street from the Bart and Muni station and a cable car stop. And just across Market street was the downtown shopping mall. We didn't really eat around the hotel, just one night we went to the mall, in the basement food court there is a great farmers market kind of store with tons of pre-made meals. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “never stay here ever!”
Reviews.Author: troyathome
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the hotel we find out that our room we booked through expedia got "bumped" and the one king size bed we reserved got changed into two full size beds. Our room was cleaned the second day but the garbage, which was over flowing wasn't taken out, when we came back the garbage fell over spilling all over the floor. When we called to notify the front desk about the garbage and our discontentment with the room, all they were offering was to send a supervisor up to investigate our garbage situation that was already cleaned up (by us) at 1100 at night and were very persistent on sending someone to our room. The person who took our phone call was not concerned with our needs but rather looking to reprimand someone. We are not picky or hard to please but the hotel aspect of our trip was so bad that we felt the need to post a complaint. The rooms aren't that great, your basically staying for the location. Save your money and stay at a Holiday Inn. This is my first review of service/products, i wish it could've been a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't really like it”
Reviews.Author: CJSLubbock
Reviews.Content: If you can stay for less than $100/night, then this hotel is fine. There's nothing disgusting or unsafe about. However, if you are looking for a nice place to stay for $100 or more per night, I would choose somewhere else. First, on Tuesday night around 9 p.m., I called for a wake up call and no one answered. I hung up and kept calling back every 15 minutes with the same results. After an hour of trying, I called every number I could find -- front desk, conceirge, housekeeping, room service, etc. and NO ONE answered the phone. This was very frustrating. (However, I was able to place a wake up call request on the other nights of my stay) Second, I wouldn't rely solely on the wake-up call. It wouldn't ever be right at the specified time. Third, the street noise was extremely loud. I heard sirens and construction noise all day and night the entire week. As I was checking out, a colleague told me there are floor vents that are left open, but if you close them, it quiets the noise significantly. I wish I had been told I could close those vents (or if those vents had been closed in the first place.) In conclusion, this hotel is fine, but I'd stay somewhere else with all the great hotels San Francisco offers!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be suckered by the appearance”
Reviews.Author: MarkP_9
Reviews.Content: This is a nice looking hotel (W-esque) hiding what's underneath an old decrepit building. When I turned the tap on in tub, the water ran brown for 20 seconds. When I turned on the tap in the sink, it spewed water all over my suit. The walls are PAPER THIN. I could hear everything happening in the halls or next door (a room inhabited by a mother and her pre-teen daughter, who spent much time debating what she would wear) And for a hotel located downtown, it fails miserably in the basics for a business traveler. The business center is closed and there's no way to print anything should you need it for your meeting. The wifi on my floor kept going in and out every 10 minutes. And finally on my last morning, their internet billing system refused to let me sign up for more access. Just appalling. An utter failure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cspinelli
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute and was very happy with it. It is right across the street from the Westfield shopping center and the Powell Street BART station; quite a convenient location. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. It felt very safe, which was important to me as a female traveling alone. When I arrived I notiiced there was a conference of Ebay taking place there, and also that many pilots and flight attendants stay there. To me, that says the hotel is good, because big companies and airline employees know where to stay. I had some drinks and appetizers in the bar which were tasty and reasonably priced. The bartender served my wine with a "back"; a little extra portion in a seperate glass, which was nice. during happy hour, buy one appetizer and the second is 55 cents. We had the fried calamari and chicken satay and both were very good. The room was on the smaller sie but fully equipped, and the beds were comfortable. the view of the city was fantastic. The only complaint I had was that the movies on the tv were very expensive ($16.99) and the tv was hard to operate generally - I could not find the local channels at all. Also, there was a wireless internet connection in the room but it was quite slow and they charged $12.99 for each day. Overall I was very satisfied with this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value”
Reviews.Author: GaryinSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights end Sept in a Club room. Firstly, it was a breeze to locate and adjacent to the Powell St BART station, so no taxi necessary from airport. I couldn't imagine a better location, as its opposite Westfield SF shopping centre and right on the Powell st cable car stop and Union Square shopping district. Choosing a club room was well worth it - the views from the lounge were fantastic and friendly Sergio made everyone welcome. The breakfast in particular was really good and cheese & bacon bagels with Starbucks coffee, set us up for nicely for each day's sightseeing. Overall we were extremely happy with our choice and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Choice!”
Reviews.Author: JupiterBeach
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great rates, great hotel! Stayed 5 days in October and was very convenient to Union Square Shops, very very convenient to BART, Cable Cars and the MUNI. Would recommend in a minute for budget concious travelers looking for a little luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rayderr
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I spent our Honeymoon in SF and stayed at Parc 55. We had a club room located on the 29th (out of 33) floor. Judging by the pics I've seen of rooms on here, it doesn't look like the Club Room was all that much bigger than a regular room. But they are on higher floors to help keep you away from traffic noise and get's you access to the Club level which serves a continental breakfast, hor d'ouerves (sp?) in the evening and desert starting at 7pm. The hor douerves were only so-so in my opinion and seemed to be the same every night. The deserts changed nightly and some of it was very good. The Continental breakfast was rather basic, but plentiful enough to make sure everyone gets plenty to eat. Given a choice between the continental breakfast and going out to a restaurant/diner for breakfast, I'd take the continental. Given the extra cost of a Club Room, I was expecting a few more amenities like a small fridge or free internet access but overall, I can't complain as it was still far cheaper than comparable rooms at other hotels. The main draw is the location. It is right across the street from the Powell Bart/Muni Station (note: Go up the stairs to the left. The escalator will point you in the wrong direction) And you're within one block of the Powell street cable cars and various Bus/street car lines. As we were relying strictly on public transit to get around, this hotel was perfect. The hotel does tend to nickel and dime you for services that you might get for less of free elsewhere. Internet access has a daily charge. They have a mail service that charges $8 per package (in addition to the shipping cost) They have 2 computer rooms, but even those charge you per 20 minutes and charge you per page printed ($1 for B/W and $3 for color if I recall) The staff was very helpful. The concierge was able to answer all of our public transit questions. We were flying out on Virgin America. While the hotel does have computers (free of charge) set up for people to check in and print their boarding passes, for whatever reason, the Virgin America site was partially blocked making it impossible to print out the boarding passes. The front desk print out the boarding passes from their computer for us. We had the "Do not Disturb" sign on the door one time when housekeeping came around. Housekeeping called and said we could call them anytime and they'd come up and take care of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: IdoTLV
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Beautiful rooms, especially those on high floors with view of the city - Great location at Union Square - Well maintained and clean - Airconditioned rooms (which is not trivial in SF) Cons: - Staff isn't that friendly (especially front desk) - No fridge in the room - No safety deposit box in most rooms (there are deposit boxes at the front dest for free) Overall, a very good choice for visiting SF.

Reviews.Title: “Only let down by the little things”
Reviews.Author: JeffBarnes
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms etc but just lacking a bit of class and thought. First example is when you check in. Total bedlam if it is busy. Never enough check-in staff and because there is no roped line people just jostle for position and hope that no one tries to jump the (non-existent) queue. I'm sure it turns ugly there sometimes and all for the sake of a rope and some extra staff. I was upgraded to a suite on the 31st floor which was great. However whoever did the lighting in the rooms favours chic over practical. Even with all the lights on I could have done with a torch to find my way around. And with all that space they couldn't find anywhere to put a full length mirror? And $50 for overnight parking?!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: ScarletDublin
Reviews.Content: We paid 200 euro for a deluxe king room, this was two thirds of the actual price, as we got it for a reduced rate. The room was decorated really well with a wide screen tv, and the bed was very comfortable. It was in an excellent location, central to everything. Do not pay more than 200 for a room though as it's not worth it. I only have a couple of criticisms... 1). The coffee maker was bogging! So it needed a good sterilizing before use. 2). As we were staying for 9 nights we thought that they might give us a complimentary breakfast or dinner, but the manager kept telling us to call back to the desk later. I wasn't impressed by this at all. It would have been a nice touch at a small expense to the hotel. They seem to favour the more lavish guest (a lot of business people stay here, pilots and I.T. professionals) and not give the same welcoming to all their other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Value - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: wucrew2
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 has a great location. Next to the cable cars and on the base of Market Street, It's an excellent hotel for the casual vacationer. It is also 3 blocks away from Union Square, a great area for the tourist. We lucked out and got a room that isnt facing the street (11th floor) and didn't hear the street noise, except for the occassional fire truck. You can notice some things that they haven't gotten to in the renovation, such as the carpet and the service issues. Room service trays were left in the hallways for a couple of days, and carpets in the hallways were a little worn. Don't try to call concierge or service, just go down there ans ask the question in person. You'll be on hold on the phone for a while. Otherwise, its a stay again, and honestly for the value, you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Good Value via Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Bristolians40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 3 nights at the beginning of Oct. We paid Â£64 per night through Priceline, which was a bargain. We were on the 11 floor and didn't have any problem sleeping. You need to remember that you are in the middle of a city, so there will always be noise! The location of this hotel is fantastic. Its in the downtown area of San Francisco, 2 blocks away from Union Square. All the shops are on your doorstep as well as the buses, bart and trams. Parking is pricey at the hotel but there is a couple of car parks within a block or 2 away. We would definately stay at Parc 55 again and we recommend eating at The cheesecake Factory on top of Macy's, Union Square on th outside patio!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent deal through Priceline.com”
Reviews.Author: naterday
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 has expensive parking. If I had not Pricelined my room I don't know if we would have stayed there but I am glad that we did. The staff was super helpful and friendly(including a girl named Tip). The bar was a wonderful addition to our stay, we frequented it often. The room was clean and attractive with all the amenities. Taxis are always waiting outside and the subway is a two minute walk. Not to mention the trolleys are close. The one problem is our room was hot because of no air movement. When I checked the air conditioning filter it looked like it had never been changed. I called the front desk and the promtly brought me a new one and the roon stayed cool the rest of the trip. Always check your air filter. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: BobbyFrings
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the Parc 55 and were very pleased. The rooms were clean, the location was good and the hotel staff was courteous. It may not have much character, but it provides a soldi's night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the bar staff...”
Reviews.Author: lukeybaby100
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to say that generally I thought the hotel was very good. The location was great, just across the road from the Westfield Shopping Mall, and a few blocks from Union Square. The views from our room were pretty good too, even though we didn;t get a room with a premium view. All that disappointed me was the service from my one visit to the bar, which just left a disappointing taste in my mouth before leaving the hotel. Without going into too many details, they were running their Happy Hour promotion of buying one round, and getting the same again for 55 cents. On not fulfilling this, and then pouring a second set of drinks not anywhere near the first standard of the first (it was a cocktail) I was told I must have had too much to drink when I queried why the drink tasted so much different. I found not only this attitude pretty pathetic, but also in a hotel that size which charges teh price it does, to make me pay just a handful of extra dollars which would perhaps make me not personally visit again, I thought was quite disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn82
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant hotel! The location is second to none - a minute's walk from the Bart Powell station (which costs $8.10 per person from SFO). It is also right near the tram Powell line Cable Car turnaround which makes it very easy to get around the city. We bought a 7-day 'muni passport' (which costs $24 per person) which enables you to ride any municipal railway passenger vehicle within the bay area - this paid for itself within about 2 days as the cable cars alone cost $5 each way. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and had a 'club room' which was fantastic. We were on the 27th floor, and the views were amazing.Breakfast was also included in the 'club lounge' on the top floor which was very good. On arrival, our greeting was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was heavenly! I would say the only improvement would be to offer free wi-fi (we also stayed at the Donatello hotel which did offer free wi-fi).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: radman_9
Reviews.Content: Newly redone rooms, comfortable beds,some rooms with view,located close to union square shopping and muni for transportation...a little street noise...sirens...we were only on the 8th floor

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: mmatics
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Parc 55 because it had so many good reviews. It was a little pricey but we went for it. The rooms were nice and the hotel was clean but as for customer service is was terrible. They charged us extra fees with out telling us so we had less to spend on fun in San Francisco. Also, when we wanted to talk to the concierge about restaurants we had to wait an hour (along with about 10 other people) because he was on a break (on a Saturday night). When I asked a receptionist to call the concierge from his break, she told me that she couldn't pay attention to me because it wasn't her job. Made our anniversary very stressful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mistymulan
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous time at the Parc 55. The renovations were spectacular. Great service. clean room. Best Location!! Short walk to all the best sites, shopping and food

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: GinnyHR
Reviews.Content: I booked our hotel through Hotwire, so I didn't know where we were staying until after booking. Then I read reviews online and I must say that they were all over the place -anywhere from poor to excellent. So I was a little concerned and I called the hotel directly to see what our room would be like. I was told I could make a request for the type of room and location, but that they couldn't guarantee I'd get that. When we arrived to check in, the clerk said "I have the perfect room for you." She was absolutely right because she gave us a corner room on the 17th floor and we had a fantastic view of the city through two huge picture windows! The room was bright, clean, large, and quiet. The shower had great water pressure and we had absolutely no complaints. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was perfect for us. It was close to all public transportation, restaurants, and shopping. All in all, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SHORT STAY”
Reviews.Author: SuzyWM
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night pre cruise last month and had a great stay. Caught the BART from SFO, walked out at Powell St, turned left, walked 1 block and there it was.....very handy for our weary bodies! Room large with good view, 2 king size beds, very clean and lovely reception. Very handy for both the Union Sq shopping and the tram....always a must for the SF traveller! Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great”
Reviews.Author: gemneye
Reviews.Content: I go to SF at least once a year, sometimes twice and have for almost ten years now. Consistanly, the Parc 55 hotel is always a pleasant stay and a reasonably priced hotel to stay in. Another key factor I like about Parc 55 is there seems to always be a room available. It's not the only hotel I have enjoyed in San Francisco, and it's not the only one I will return to, but it's one of the few I can say I loved the stay, I loved the room, I love the view, the price is always reasonable (comparably) and I will be back. Try to get into one of the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: Little_Traveller80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for 3 nights after getting an excellent rate on Expedia. We stayed in a newly renovated room and it was fantastic. The room was well decorated, very comfortable king size bed, large flat screen tv and large bathroom. The Hotel is located right next to train station - which connects to the airport - which was great and there is a large Westfields Mall across the street. Within 10 mins walking distance to Chinatown and other city locations. 1 min walk to the cable car turn around. We even stored our luggage downstairs upon check out and staff were more than happy to accommodate us. Make sure you get a newly renovated room to appreciate the luxury of staying at the Parc 55. Compared to other hotels on our trip around the USA - this one topped our list - wish we could take it everywhere around with USA.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Clean, Friendly Room”
Reviews.Author: Janet060
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, clean room, friendly staff, great bar! The Hotel is located about a block from the Cable Car ... easy walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hkwikai
Reviews.Content: We were in SF for a few days and thought the hotel was in a great location. Booked several months in advance so got a really good rate. Very close to Union Square and lots of shopping. The parking was expensive (about $50/day) but that seemed to be the going rate at most nearby hotels. The room seemed to be recently renovated and was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again bc of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel ...front desk service however is questionable”
Reviews.Author: krzy_kuching
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel ..great location and very central to shopping, restaurants etc . The room was amazing eg View room with panoramic sight of the city lights. Was a little disappointed however with check in as when I got there, they couldn't find my booking!! Booked it online with hotel website and yet it was confusing to them! They made up for it however after standing around for 15 mins. By the way concierge was amazing - thank you crew as they managed to make reservations at my favorite restaurant the Slanted Door at the very last moment. Will I go back..absolutely!
