Reviews.Title: “Great price in the heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: vacationfan35
Reviews.Content: A very nice room - couldn't beat the price. It was very convenient to be right in Union Square, but also extremely loud. There was plent of noise throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. very clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bk2002
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean, very friendly staff. The room was a nice size. the bed was very comfortable. Price was Excellent for a downtown location. And hotel is walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the sound of ambulance sirens, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTerry92
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 hotel, near the Union Square in San Francisco, has wonderful cushy pillows and beds, but the noise level is a bit disturbing, especially when one is trying to sleep through the night. We heard ambulances throughout the day and night at different times, which was annoying. If that doesn't bother you, then the location is stellar and close to the main downtown attractions (e.g. Chinatown, Coit Tower, etc). The accommodations were comfortable and inviting, and the service was fine. We got a good deal from Priceline-$79 per night, although parking fees can add a hefty amount of money if you choose to use that service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: kammil
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms are very well presented, clean and spacious. Check-in was smooth and receptionist was very nice and friendly (we were upgraded to higher floor room with view). Hotel is in really good location and if you drive, you can manage to see a lot as the hotel is not far from anything really. I have not experienced any noise whatsoever as some complained, but maybe it's because we were on a higher floor. There are awful lots of homeless people around the hotel though. Also, parking in the hotel is very expensive but there are lots of other places around the hotel where you can park and they are a bit cheaper. I would not hesitate booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: scmcb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located mere steps from the Powell Street BART station and the cable car turnaround on Market Street. I stepped off the plane, stepped on to BART and in 30 minutes stepped into the hotel. In addtion to its perfect location, the hotel was extremely clean, comfortable and updated. The service was great as well. Could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, would stay again. Located to EVERYTHING!!”
Reviews.Author: Raider78
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. Our room was very nice. I recommend to upgrade your room to get a better view of the city. We stayed on the 22nd floor, had a corner room and had views that were AMAZING!! Staff was very nice and helpful. Hotel was clean and didn't smell like smoke/cigarettes. Just steps from the hotel is the Visitor Center where you get a lot of transportation information, maps and help on where to go and how to get there. There is a lot of places to dine,shop and explore galleries in that area too. Cable car is 1 block away and that one takes you right to Fishermans Wharf. You really don't need your car in this city, just take mass transit everywhere and if you get the $11.00 daily pass at the visitor center it is well worth it. Yeah parking is expensive, like $50.00 a night, but we didn't mind. The hotel was well worth our stay in San Francisco and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Fabulous Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bahama_Gator
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of a trip to San Francisco, Parc 55 is the hotel to stay in. I visited San Francisco for 5 days including my birthday and we had a great time. The staff were unbelievable and very helpful. The Concierge was wonderful and help us arranged tours of the city and Alcatraz. She also assisted us with dinner reservations at Morton's steakhouse, where the service was excellent. The view from my room was spectacular. At the heart of the shopping district, the proximity to the BART train and public transportation, the location cannot be beat. Thanks Parc 55 for making our first trip to SF memorable and enjoyable. We will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: laketimeAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc for 1 night last week as the first night of a 6 day NorCal trip. For our $71.00 rate through Last Minute Travel, we got a very nice room on the 22nd floor with a bay view. I'm not sure we would have been as happy with a lower floor and higher rate, but were very happy with everything - cleanliness, service, location - nothing could have been better. We even had a bedtime view of the fireworks at Candlestick Park - a great start to a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel adequate, location great”
Reviews.Author: holadebbo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Parc 55 over Labor Day weekend. We called ahead to say we would be arriving late and to make sure that a room with a king bed, which I had reserved a month earlier, would still be ready for us. We were assured it would be. When we arrived, we were told there were no rooms with king beds available. After fifteen minutes of discussion, we were given a room with a king bed on an upper floor. I assume the upper floors with views of the city were considered upgrades. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The hotel itself is nothing special. The reservation area/lobby is stark and bare. Not much atmosphere. There is a restaurant which has a wonderful breakfast buffet but it is pricey. The location of the hotel is wonderful..near the BART, the cable car stop, and across the street from shopping at the Westfield San Francisco Center. Parking was expensive but that's to be expected in the city. There is a business center with 24 hour access using your room key. The hotel room was clean and the location was great so I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Average large American city centre hotel.Though lobby area being updated at time of visit.Nice room great view though lots of street noise.Great but simple Thai cafe on 1st floor.Great location for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - we truly enjoyed our say . . .”
Reviews.Author: earldobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Parc 55 last week and could not be happier. The location is perfect, central to most areas in SF. When we checked in we asked if they had any rooms available with a view. This was an anniversary trip for my wife and I and we were upgraded to a lovely room on the 24th floor with a fantastic view of the city. The staff was excellent in all areas. We would recommend the Parc 55 to all and look forward to our next visit to this wonderful city. When we do return the Parc 55 will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: LS-Los_Altos
Reviews.Content: From the hotel's website, we expected a much more luxurious experience for the "club floor" reservation we paid extra for...still can't figure out where the floor to ceiling windows are in the hotel, having seen nothing that resembled the pictures on the hotel's website. Biggest disappointment was with the "complimentary" appetizer/happy hour. Food selection was minimal--far below what is normally offered at a boutique hotel or B&B--and there was a charge for wine, which was not apparent either from the website or when making reservations. The staff in the continental breakfast "club room" wasn't overly friendly and began putting items away before the end of the posted hours of availability. While our room was nice, it wasn't anything special. However, the location of the hotel was GREAT! One final note...We were somewhat uncomfortable with the fact that anyone could enter the hotel and directly access the elevators, and thus room floors, without a card key.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location ok, great staff”
Reviews.Author: omvilla
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, updated, and clean. Rooms were spacious enough. Staff was very accommodating and professional. Location could be better and was more evident at night. Only con is the large groups of airline employees congregating in the lobby make it difficult to enter/exit with luggage. Overall good hotel and would stay again for good rate on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nipper100
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel five stars if it wasn't for the $44.00 a day for valet parking and $12.95 internet access. However for $99.00 a night, it made up for it. You can't beat the location. Right next to a BART Station and Trolley stop, you don't need a vehicle. Get a $11.00 day pass and it will get you where you want to go. Rooms were clean and spacious. The staff were very friendly. The noise and street people are to be expected for downtown San Francisco. You just have to learn to ignore it.

Reviews.Title: “great location but very noisey”
Reviews.Author: Karkstraveltips
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ver central to everything. Tourist infomation is just across the road and are very helpful. The reception area is up one level. The rooms are quite good and they are clean with great linen and towels. The room we were in faced the road and i should have know when they give you ear plugs that you are in for a load night. Beacuse of the location there is an ambulence or police station very close and so there are sirens all night really load so not much sleep was had. we had 2 double beds in the room and they were quite big rooms. The other downfall is the amount of homeless people near the hotel and also they did not give us a map of the area when we checked in which I think is really important for out of towners. On the plus side there is grat shopping with the main malls right across the street, and also very close the the tram and cable car. the cable car is good if you want the experience but expensive it is cheaper to pay the $2 to get the the pier then I think an $8 for the cable car. We did not eat in the hotel but the breakfast buffet look quite nice. there are great resturants around and the indian across the road is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: bigbadbruins
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 5 nights on Expedia, great rate (under 500$us with taxes). The location is perfect. Took the BART from the airport. Arrived at the hotel at 2:30 PM, the only room available was with 2 double beds. After a long flight, didn't want to wait 30 minutes for a room with a King bed so we took it. We were told we could change room later in the week but never took the time to do it. The room we had was fine. We were on the 5th floor, so no view. I read a lot of bad reviews about the noise at this hotel. It wasn't that bad. Of course we heard sirens at night, but it's not a bed & breakfast in Vermont, it's a downtown hotel so you should expect that. The CityPass was a great buy. the Muni 7 day Pass is a must. I would recommend Parc 55, you cant beat that location !!

Reviews.Title: “great location but a little soulless”
Reviews.Author: the_jetset_chick
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotwire for this one, so the value for money was excellent. However, the hotel itself is lacking real charme..But you couldn't fault the rooms, the amazing location, the great view or the cleanliness. I didn't get to see a lot of staff in the place, it's just huge. I would recommend the park 55 for business travellers or for shopping trips. One word of advise: There is pleanty of "flat rate" parking in lots just a block down the road. No need to pay 49$ a day (!) for valet. We found a place that charged 20$ a day and we left our car there- the location is so central, we didn't need the car in 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: tstrayer76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at Parc 55. We paid under $100 a night on Hotwire and were pleased with the hotel. The room was clean with comfy pillows. Their laundry service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms were fine”
Reviews.Author: Carrie105
Reviews.Content: This is a very tall hotel! We had the huge fortune of having a room really near the top and as such we had fantastic views. The sunsets from the room were amazing. We had to wait a couple of extra hours after check in for a high up room to be cleaned, but it was definetly worth it. The rooms are pleasant enough, clean and do the job, nothing in particular to rave about. We have an interconnecting door and could hear the man snoring in the next room, so try and avoid this if possible. One of the best things about this hotel is it's location, it is literally on top of all the useful transport links, you arrive at the train stop from the airport and the hotel is right there. The cablecar turnaround is a 2 minute walk away as well that takes you all the way down to fishermans wharf. Also, if you are hiring a car when you are moving on from the city as we did, the big rental companies all have offices on the adjoining street - perfect! I would be quite happy to recommend this hotel as a base to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it --- great rooms, staff, and location -- will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ouch-I-Tripped
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is a delightful hotel. Airy, large bright rooms; pleasant staff; cozy bar; good location. We came to SF for the Outside Lands music festival and stayed four nights here. Everything went smoothly -- from checkin (early, at 1:00 p.m., with no fuss), checkout (late, no charge, again no fuss), larger room than expected (corner), charming and pleasant staff from desk clerk to housekeepers to doormen. Our room, on the 12th floor, was our base for exploring and for take-out food at night. The room was very clean and well-maintained (one evening housekeeping brought a bed bolster that we never knew was missing). Large LG flat-screen TV was fine, on a credenza with multiple electronic media outlets and two cables in drawer. View was reasonable and nicely lit up at night. Loveseat/sofabed combo, small coffee table, desk and desk chair all allowed comfy seating and relaxing/snacking. Water bottles provided in room at $4.50 USD for 1 liter each were pricey: instead, run to the corner and half a block east to Walgreens and grab a sixpack of H2O. We didn't use the small coffeemaker, but ran to Starbucks and local coffee places each morning (expect 15-20 minute waits, coffeehouses stay busy). Air conditioning (internal unit) was responsive, audible but not too loud. By the way, there are vents under each window that roll open to allow fresh air in! I didn't notice these until the third day. We didn't visit the hotel restaurant but it looked elegant and the menu was appealing. There are numerous restaurants within a block or two: Indian/Pakistani, Thai, sushi, Irish, Italian, pizza, etc. (Punjab was our favorite, on the southwest corner behind the hotel.) The bartender did pour generously on our visit to the bar, and the space was welcoming with relaxing chairs and careful lighting. The Parc 55 is located near the Powell Street transport station, so it's near buses, underground, surface rail, and streetcars. Easy walking distance to shopping, museum area, Union Square, and a bit longer hike to Chinatown. Taxis are queued for longer trips. On noise: San Francisco is a busy city. You will hear traffic, fire engines, police sirens, and sometimes loud voices frequently during the day and night, no matter WHERE you stay. The Parc 55 provides a set of foam earplugs in the bathroom if needed (we didn't). We will definitely will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs. Need I say more.”
Reviews.Author: annezan
Reviews.Content: We left at 1:00 am in the morning after turning on the light and realizing it was a bed bug that had been crawling on me. The night manager and a security person promptly came up and confirmed our finding. It was awful and we will not ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Girl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: cdafft
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the hotel for a long weekend and we were looking forward to shopping during the day and going to the clubs at night. When we approached the concierage to plan our excursions and to get suggestions for the "best" areas to go to shop and then be put on the guest lists at night for the "best" clubs for our type of music that we preferred...we were treated very rudely. We were handed a map and told if we wanted anything more detailed to go to Walgreens. When asked about clubs he had no clue as to where to go. We thought we would try later as we had a few already in mind with a different staff person, but found that the night shift to be no better and even less informed as they didn't know what being put on a guest list meant??? The staff the next day was no different and didn't even call us back or follow up like they said they would on making arrangements for us. To say we were disappointed in this type of treatment was an understatement. We ended up doing all our own leg work and research, but that is what a concierage is for for goodness sake!!!! I will not go back to this hotel although it is in a perfect location for shopping and getting to where you want to go...too bad!! But it truly is the little things that count and customer service is paramount in my books!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Alisrico1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 5 nights at this hotel. This was recommended to us by a friend, as he location is excellent for sight-seeing around San Francisco. It is situated close to trams stops, bus stops, and the cable car is just around the corner. Also, the underground is close by, meaning that the BART can be used to get from the airport, saving the expense of a taxi fare. It is close to shops , and many restaurants. We did find it a bit noisy at night -not the hotels fault, though, as the noise was mainly police and fire sirens, which seemed to go all night long! The hotel was spotless, and the room was beautifully furnished. We did not eat in the hotel, but there are so many places nearby to try. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Review with cheap tips for travel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Planbhorizon
Reviews.Content: Location: My girlfriend and I decided it was time for another San Fran trip. We love the city and this time we booked a week trip through a website traveling service. The building outside reminds me of the 70s, i love the look. Although i was paying more attention to the bums about to aggresively panhandle me like they did the entire week with their gimmicks for a buck or two. Although everything else about the area rocks, stores, union sq. and bars! The Old Siam across the street is the best Thai ive had in a long time. Dont bother going out late at night for the bars unless your a big dude or you have a load of friends with you, the bums out there are on full force and stop at nothing to get your attention (typically black dudes are the aggresive ones by my experience). Room: The room was whatever.. just a plain typical room on the 16 floor. The bed was really comfortable but thats not saying much since i still sleep on a 12 year old bed at home. The view was amazing! but you have to pay a lil extra to get the best sides. There is no fridge that is free or even a small microwave so all our leftovers always went fast. The shower was blah and high pressured. the drainage was HORRIBLE .. before you know it you were standing in 4 inches of water and a load gurrggling sound of the drain desperate to make way for the dirty water. gross! Also NO FAN! it would mug up the entire room and the window would fog.. but one plus is in the morning the people in the next hotel over sometimes wake up and look out the window naked and they are usually care free european tourists.. thats a plus or a minus really.. lol Service: It was fine.. cept this one asian lady at the counter didnt know how to work our room phone and said "ive never seen the phones in the room".. wow Value: the nightly rate was pretty good since its a recession but DONT BOTHER parking your car in their lot.. 1. you cant get the car yourself (valet and that means tip) 2. it now costs 44-49$ each night!.. there is secure parking garages all up and down union for much cheaper.. just got to walk a few blocks.. Dont bother getting their expensive room service breakfast or buffet.. since there is way cheaper restuarants down the street that serve breakfast. Their bar is really expensive but the bartenders are really cool.. there is a few bars right outside Parc 55 and a liqour store down a block.. IF your trying to thrift it out in san fran.. oh and their is wireless service for free at various coffee shops in the area DONT bother with the 12.95 per 24 charge in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice room”
Reviews.Author: clemson_grad79
Reviews.Content: We had great rates from the internet $87 a night. Hotel located next to the Powel ST BART station so it was super easy to get from the airport to the hotel, no taxi. Rooms were fine, 7th floor but view was on a side street. No big deal though as we used the rooms for sleeping and resting not looking. Made no use of any of the facilities other than the room. Always ate elsewhere But did have free internet even though the website indicated it was $12.95 a day. Location right next to the begining of Powel-Mason and Powel-Hyde cable cars. Plus one block over was able to catch most buses needed to go to other parts of the city. Area appeared quite safe to us, a block or 2 from Union Square so lots of restaurants. Chinatown within walking distance, not short walk but walkable. Really could ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “terrable”
Reviews.Author: tomfsantacruz
Reviews.Content: our room bathroom smelled of mold and mildew. the carpet was dirty and crums on the carpet floor. I complaned to the front desk . No change. The airconditioning was also sub par. We could smell what they were cooking in the kitchen thru the aircondition ducs We would never stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Even the Housekeepers are Extremely Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Emma_27
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel as it was newly renovated and found a great rate on their website for a club room on the 28th floor. I am writing this while curled up on a little couch in the bath robe they provide while looking at my spectacular view over the city and bay! The lobby and rooms are very nicely done and the staff are extremely friendly. You expect the Bell Hops, Front Desk and conciege to be friendly but here even the housekeeping staff is extremely friendly. Also great central location!

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful amenities and accommodations, yeah if you pay”
Reviews.Author: Classifiedtech
Reviews.Content: It is an OK hotel, the location was awsome. I like the Amenities and Accommodations they list on the website, basically every single one you have to pay for, you want a fridge, you have to pay for it, internet, you have to pay for it every 24 hours. Parking, even if your a guest you have to pay for it, $44 for 24 hours, as a guest. If you want to rent a movie,basically it will cost $12 for it to watch once, if you accidentally change the channel you will lost it and would have to pay again to watch it. It was totally rediculous, I'm surprised we didn't have to pay for air we breathed in the hotel. If you like wasting money for no reason at all, this is the Hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: lovedparc55
Reviews.Content: The views from the rooms were spectatular. They even do regular window cleaning. Experienced one while we stayed. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed on the club level and loved it. We had a 76 year old traveling with us and a 5 year old and the staff went out of their way to accomadate everyone. The bathroom had a bar for the elder to hold on to and the staff provided our son with special desserts for his taste. We would definetely stay here when we go back to San Francisco. We liked it so much that we booked a room to stay before we departed for home after traveling to other cities. The rooms were very clean and we don't have any complaints at all. We were on the 30th and 31st floors and their wasn't any noise of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the bellhops at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: LunaSeay
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with nice rooms, easy access to all the tourist spots in San Francisco and some of the worst service I have ever experienced. I am a regular traveler, staying in hotels about once every other month or so for several days, and I have stayed in several other hotels in SF that are rated the same as the Parc 55. The biggest difference between these hotels is that the Parc 55 really doesn't seem to value customer service. There was a convention going on during my stay, but from what the staff said there is usually a convention going on. This might have had an effect on my service, but if conventions are a regular event, then I doubt the service improves much from week to week. The good: I got a Club room on the 29th floor and the room and view were beautiful. The breakfast was delicious and varied and I was very glad I upped my reservation for this alone. The bad: The service in general was awful, but be especially wary of the bell staff. When I first arrived my luggage was loaded on to a cart and taken up to meet me at the 2nd floor registration. During the 5 minutes of travel time a small bag containing cash and other valuables went missing. When I pointed this out I was asked to check my car, person, etc. to make sure I had not misplaced it. I did and the bag was just gone, but I know for a fact it was on the cart. This was dismissed by the staff when I brought it to their attention and I was not even offered an apology. Then, on my last day, I had a bellman up to my room to collect my bags and AGAIN during the trip from my room to the bell staff area downstairs THREE items were lost. I was again told to check my room, person, etc. to make sure I hadn't lost these items. Unlikely, as the missing items were a fedora hat, a foam pillow and a t-shirt that was on the pillow. I did as I was asked, but my items were nowhere to be found. I was then berated by a bellman who insisted that I had lost the items on my own. I asked repeatedly for the bell staff to check the service halls and elevator for my missing items, but I was told they were not there. I spoke with managers, bell staff, housekeeping, everyone they could shunt me off to, but no one was helpful at all. I finally had to leave without my items, but I took the names and phone numbers of those involved. I called the next day and spoke with another manager who SHOCKINGLY said, why yes, those items are sitting here in our lost and found. I had to drive nearly two hours to pick them up because the hotel refused to mail them. I will never stay at this hotel again for obvious reasons, but if you choose to do so PLEASE DO NOT USE THE BELL STAFF!!! FOR THE SAFETY OF YOUR LUGGAGE BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NC_Rambler
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 was a perfect choice for several days of touring in San Francisco. We were able to get the hotel on Priceline for a very good rate several weeks before traveling. We arrived at the hotel a little after noon. Although the room was not ready this early, the staff gladly kept our luggage as we ventured out for the local sights. When we returned in the evening, we were excited to find ourselves in a corner room (panaramic view) on an upper floor. The view of the city was amazing! The hotel has been recently redecorated in a very trendy style, and the beds/furniture are very comfortable. The location cannot be better....right next to BART, MUNI, cable cars, shopping, etc. There is construction across the street, but the noise from this is not a problem unless you plan to sleep really late in the AM. Also, some other people complain about street noise at night, which is to be expected in the heart of the city. However, it never kept me awake. I would definitely return to the Parc 55 on future trips to San Francisco. The location is ideal, the rooms are large and comfortable, and the staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: mademego
Reviews.Content: Close to Powell St BART station with easy access from the airport. Quick check-in. Overall friendly staff thoughout my stay. Room was spacious and appeared to have been recently remodeled. Side chairs were pretty but not comfortable. Roomy bathroom. Great bed. Nice size closet, but limited size on the room safe...could not get my laptop inside. Internet connections for a daily charge. Plenty of good eating options nearby. Barbary Coast Coffee on the corner for breakfast and people watching. 5th floor room facing another building under construction. Very noisy during the day. That convenient location does translate into noise in the evenings too with BART trains and sirens and general traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: alloverem
Reviews.Content: Overall I can recommend the Parc 55. Great location, typical business class hotel with usual amenities, room in very good condition, staff very helpful. Our check-in experience was excellent. Notice a number of flight crews staying here, which I took to be a good sign. The only negative was the street noise on Cyril Magnin. It gets a fair share of traffic, and since SF drivers seem obsessed with horn-blowing, you'll get that in your room if you overlook the street, along with the usual big city sirens, trucks and such. I had no problem going to sleep or staying asleep, however, so, I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwat
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel. Clean, spacious,quiet and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bartleby
Reviews.Content: I was in SF for a conference and got a great rate at Parc 55 through priceline. For $100/night, this was a great value. The Good: - Fabulous location. One block from the Union Square Cable Car stop, 2 blocks from Union Square, 5 blocks from the Moscone Convention Center. - Room was clean, spacious. Had a double with two full beds. - No functional problems with lights, heating/cooling, internet. The Not-So-Good: - Our room wasn't ready when we arrived at noon (completely understandable). I was told by the attendant that a room had been set aside for me but needed to be cleaned; I should return at 3pm. When I returned at 3pm, I was checked in by a different attendant, who informed me that the first guy had never tagged the assigned room for cleaning, so the room was still not ready. After a short wait, however, she was able to find another room for us. - They have a limited number of small storage lockers in which guests can lock their computers when leaving luggage on your check-in or check-out day. However, if all of the lockers are already taken, they would not take the responsibility of checking my computer bag, and I was stuck lugging it around hilly SF on my check-in day while waiting for my room to be ready. I made sure to check my computer bag early on my check-out day to avoid a repeat of that situation. - No minibar/fridge. Very small in-room safe. Very limited drawer space, though the closet was sizeable. - it's never a good sign when the hotel purposely provides earplugs in every room. Having read the prior reviews about thin walls, the sight of the earplugs was worrisome. However, I never had any problems with noise during my stay. The Just-Plain-Weird: After an extensive recent makeover, you would think that this reasonably handsome hotel would try to exude a cooler vibe. Yet, on my various trips through the main lobby area, my ears were greeted by songs like the theme from Footloose. While I don't mean to insult Kenny Loggins, it just seemed odd for a hotel in an enviable location in a chic city - nothing wrong with this, just odd. All in all, I'd stay there in a heartbeat if I could get a similar rate. Not sure I'd stay there at the advertised rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, convenient location, great service, all at a low, low promotional price.”
Reviews.Author: JustRelaxGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We planned 4 days in San Francisco, but could only stay at the Westin St. Francis for the last 2 days because they were booked, so we stayed at the Parc 55 for the first 2 days. The hotel far exceeded our expectations and we found the Westin St. Francis far less comfortable and elegant. This 1010 room hotel has been renovated to a very modern theme (not my style) though, peculiarly, did not have a dresser. Our 23rd floor room was large and comfortable with breathtaking view of downtown and the bay. The location is a very short walk to the F line street cars that can take you to the ferries and Fishermenâ€™s Wharf along Embarcadero for only 2 dollars (75 cents for seniors). Nearby are numerous restaurants for a fast breakfast at moderate prices. Weâ€™re sorry that we couldnâ€™t stay for the full 4 days but we had already prepaid the Westin St. Francis, which turned out to be less than the elegant hotel we expected. If you are going to visit San Francisco, you should check the rates at Parc 55; you may be pleasantly surprised that this conveniently located, upscale hotel is offering very low promotional rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: vmagal1
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The rooms were nice and the staff was very professional. My only complaint was the price of the parking but I'm not sure that there was anyway around that. There was some noise from the street (I was on the 7th floor) but it wasn't unbearable. The ice machines didn't work and that was bothersome since I had a sick grandmother in the room with me. Also the vending machines were out. All in all it wasn't a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2MNtravelers_JnA
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel located in Union Square. Perfect for transportation as BART station & Cable car stop was located right by the hotel. Made traveling around San Fran very easy, and it was nice hotel to kick back and relax when returning from a full day of touring. The only downside is the restaurant/bar at the hotel is VERY expensive. Stay away from it. We were very disappointed how much they charged us for our drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: krissiejade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 in one of their double club rooms. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and allowed us to check in early which was great after a long long flight from Australia. The room was huge with 2 full size queen beds, cable tv and a great bathroom. Rooms were always incredibly clean and towels and amenities replaced daily. The location of the hotel is FANTASTIC. The cable car is right outside the hotel and Westfield Shopping centre only a 2 minute walk. Heaps of restaurants and other shopping within very easy walking distance. Staff at the hotel were always very helpful and willing to do whatever they could to make our stay more comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alxmaoboc
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel with a great location. Clean room. Great staff

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: TinCanArtist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had decided to spend an 8 day vacation in San Francisco, May 30 -June 6, 2009. The Parc 55 was part of a flight-hotel-rental car package she found on Priceline. We cancelled the rental car after finding out how expensive parking in SF was, and honestly, we never missed not having a car! The cable car stopped just around the corner from the Parc 55, and other public transportation was just steps away. The staff at the Parc were very friendly, and I cannot say enough about Rieki (spelling?), the concierge, who knew the city and it's public transportation system so well. She was great! We felt safe and relaxed during our entire stay at the Parc. Our room was spacious and compfy! I had a medical emergency on our third night. My wife called 911, and while the EMTs were on their way, Gene from the night security staff, came right to our room to assist in any way possible. Both my wife and I were panicking, but Gene, the front desk staff, and the EMTs were all super helpful. (Thankfully, the medical emergency ended up being a minor issue, and all went well.) Our only complaint is that our room check in was to be at 3 PM, but it was another two hours before our room was ready. At the time, my wife and I were beat and I had dozed off on the couch across from the front desk. Other than this minor issue, staying at the Parc was a positive experience and filled our needs perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is a "no brainer", sincerely”
Reviews.Author: Supergilbys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 for a week between July 4 and July 11 and my wife and I were treated like "part of the family". On arrival night (at around 9 PM), they gave us a junior suite on the 5th floor. Pretty convenient, but we wanted at first to be in an upper floor. Since it was the 4th of July, the lady at the front desk told us to come back the next day and they would take care of business. That's what happened and we moved to room 1701. Plenty of windows, great views of the city of San Francisco, and well furnished. Place was really quiet in both rooms we were and really nothing at all to complain about. Staff was first class and always ready to give you a hand. Besides, it's really difficult to find a hotel as "central located" as this one. You just have to cross the street to be at Powell St station (with the BART system coming from the SFO airport and going back to it for around 16 $ roundtrip). Same thing for the MUNI system and the trolleys... almost right at your footsteps! If I had to do it again, I would do the same way I did a few months ago when I made my booking through Expedia. And even if I have read a few negative comments about this hotel on this website, I can honestly attest that Parc 55 Hotel is a great place to stay and make the most of what all the magnificient San Francisco area has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Lot of noise and reservation group & hotel check in give diferent info”
Reviews.Author: 1bostonguy
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of over 300 staying at the hotel. We were given a gaurenteed rate, however the reservation group did not have the info from the sales group and they tried to charge me double. We were also told that a depostit at check in would be $50 per night booked, check in stafff insisted on full cost of stay. The rooms are noisey. If you say anything to the staff the answer is "we provide earplugs in the bathroom". Insulated windows might be a good investment for this hotel. The chairs in the newly renovated room were very uncomfortable. Maid service failed to show up one day of the stay. The supervisor asked if I wanted someone to come out, I said yes, but I needed to get ready to go out and asked for after 5 PM, they arrived at 4:30 disrupting my plans.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic, modern hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: dhodory
Reviews.Content: This hotel just went through a re-model and was formerly a Marriott property (it's now independent property). The lobby and reception areas are both very nicely done. The lounge is a great place to relax, enjoy a drink and some appetizers (the food was excellent, if not a little short on portion size). The rooms are nicely done for a hotel in this price range, but not extraordinary. The workout facility is fairly well equipped with multiple treadmills, bikes, steppers, free weights, and machines. The hotel location is great, as it's located right across the street from the rail system as well as a large mall (should you want to do any shopping or need to pick up some essentials). Overall, I'd give this hotel a solid B+ or A- for it's price range and even though it is not part of a chain (where I could get points), I'd strongly consider it if I were to go to SFO again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beds but laisy maids!!!”
Reviews.Author: THE_GOVERNATOR
Reviews.Content: Maids were not on par with the hotel level. Everything else was great. Also good service at the hotel bar and tasty food at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, nice location..”
Reviews.Author: SamiSeppala
Reviews.Content: Extremely thin walls in this hotel, you would think people in next door would be living with you all the time ! We were glad to have nice, almost quiet people in next room, horrified thinking if some youngsters would have been there... Otherwise service ok, nothing spectacular in there. Breakfast buffet small but worth the price. Nice location, but those walls....

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisloris
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great staff. Everyone employee went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Room was modern and comfortable with a great view and a fantastic bed. Ate in restaurant for dinner one nice - pleasantly suprised. Great food and good service. Price and location can not be beat. This will remain our homebase in San Francisco. Maybe the best hotel experience I have had in last 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend with Parc55 as our home base with "No Worries"”
Reviews.Author: CowboyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were more than happy with our stay at this hotel. Our weekend started out rockey, cancelled flights, placed on stand-by, missed a lunch cruise but, our stay and weekend was perfect. We stayed at Parc 55 this past weekend for the 3rd and 4th of July 09. This was our 4th wedding anniversary. Deciding to stay at Parc55 was decided after a few calls late night calls to the hotel with questions, and each time we were transferred to the front desk staff and based on the helpfulness of this staff I booked two nights. The questions I asked were not just hotel matters but, on items such as getting around and things to see and do. They made recommendations for Breakfast, Lunch even Dinner, none of which disappointed us. Although they will not grant early check-ins, I was told that I could check bags with the Bell desk for keeping if we were going sightseeing until we checked-in. We arrived back later that afternoon (Friday July, 3) at the front desk and to my surprise the hotel had upgraded us to a premier view suite with a balcony on the 30th floor due to it being our wedding anniversary. The room was five stars all the way with everything down to the Turkish bath robes to the King bed with feather pillows with chocolates. The front desk person was one of the most pleasant people I met during our entire stay in San Francisco. The people at the front desk really took the time to provide the care that is not often found with a large hotel especially when they cater to a large volume of business from airlines and conventions; CISCO was having a convention at the time. Although I was extremely satisfied with the staff of the front desk and bell desk and quality of the room... I cannot say the same about the hostess and host in the Cityhouse restaurant / bar, our waitress was wonderful. I typically wear Jeans and Polo shirts with jogging shoes and can afford to dress however I like and have no need to impress anyone, the Hostess especially, made us feel like I she was advising us that I may not have enough money to eat or drink in their restaurant and could I afford it? The Host just ignored us than looked the other way and walked away almost offended? Go figure, Iâ€™ll spend more on lunch than he makes in a week. We chose to have a couple of glasses of good red wine and eat at one of the upscale restaurants in town. I am giving this hotel a 5 star because the view from our room was wonderful, the staff, excluding the hostess / host in the restaurant, were first class and the beds were amazingly comfortable. Also, the location the location could not be better. The F-Line electric buss go to Fishermanâ€™s Warf and the Powell- Hyde cable car line is across the road which gives access straight to Union Square (only a quick walk away anyway) right down to the piers on the waterfront for $5 a ride (if you are in San Francisco more than a day buy a mutli-pass 3day ticket itâ€™s $18.00 it is not sold on the cars only at a ticket window). Tourist Information office is just adjacent to it too, as is the giant five floor shopping mall with many upscale stores in it. Going to and from the Airport is a fun ride on the BART for a round trip cost of $16.00 and takes about 60 minutes. The BART Station is a block away from the hotel. This will be my hotel of choice whenever we are in San Francisco. Had a great time and wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, will stay here again if in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend to San Francisco which is where I was born and lived till 1997 (i had not been back to the city since 1998). I think this was the Renaissance Park Hotel when i was young, or something to that effect. But its a great hotel. Perfect location, right next to the Powell St. BART station which is super easy from SFO or Oakland airport, right next to Cable Car and F Market streetcar line, it is easy to get anywhere from here -- i recommend getting one of those City Passes for $59 that gets you free admission to the Muni and to attractions around the city, you'll use it for sure. The check in when i was there was still on the 2nd level, my understanding was they were weeks from moving it back down to the main floor. Looked like they were close to completing the renovation. The rep at check in was kind enough to give us a view room - we got a tremendous deal on Priceline, 3 nights over Memorial Day holiday at $69 plus tax per night! Incredible! She gave us a corner room that had windows all around it. The view was gorgeous, and really showed my girlfriend the city. The bathroom is nicely appointed and super super clean. I noticed what attention to detail the housekeeping has here. This was in every bit a 4-star plus hotel and it provided me with a great trip. I will hope to return to Parc 55 Hotel next time I stay in downtown SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nephy
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Priceline for under $100 - what a bargin! Its right across from the BART - which made it easy to get to and from the airport. Located right in the middle of Union Square, you're close to all the shopping. The hotel was recently redone and the rooms and common areas are very nice. They gym is small, but has the necessary equipment. I just wish it had a hottub!

Reviews.Title: “Tried and Tried again...”
Reviews.Author: Business_TravelMan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed after getting comped a room because previously the hotel was overbooked and didn't have my room. After finding another hotel the previous trip, I called and complained and they were very good at remedying the situation and giving me a free stay while back in town. The wait times at the front desk are long. The hotel key maker wasn't working so after several trips up and down to try and get it fixed we just waited it out. The door staff etc. were friendly. There is no pool so this hotel isn't very good for young kids, but the location is great for shopping and seeing downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location, Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: K82Travel
Reviews.Content: A friend and myself checked into the Parc for a 5 night stay while in San Francisco for leisure travel. The hotel itself was gorgeous, when we walked in we were impressed at how nice and contempory it looked. I had stayed there before and noticed how nice the upgrades looked. A friend who lived in SF came to visit our hotel and noted how 'swanky' it looked. We checked in with no problem. The room was gorgeous, plenty of towels, large, clean bathroom. I used the gym and was impressed how nice it was. Very modern equipment, lots of free-weights, machines, and workout balls, ect. Our only issue was with customer service. We called the contiegre and left a message and they never got back to us. We wanted a shuttle to take us to the airport, but we were leaving very early. We then asked the belldesk and they told us no shuttles ran that early. Little did we know that plenty of shuttles ran 24 hours and would pick you up wherever. And cost less than the one recommended by the hotel. It would have been nice to be told than instead of given attitude. We also asked for directions to Golden Gate park and the bellhop was very confusing. Instead we went down to the service area and they were able to tell us how to get their quickly and even gave us a map! We also ate at the restaurant. It was very overpriced, mediocre, and we were seated by an overly romantic, PDA couple. Watching them made me want to vomit up my entire dinner. In conclusion, great place to stay if appearences are what matter and you don't want to talk to the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skelly3055
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 just completed thier $30 mil renovation and it really shows how well the rooms and lobby area really is. Wonderful staff with easy check-in check-out, we did leave the housekeeping a nice tip for the quick turn down service each day. The high floor rooms need time to cool off, but if you close your curtains and remember the sun does shine during check-in at 2pm it all cools off by the time you arrive back from dinner in the evening. The hotel location is great and I would return again for the great rates and wonderful rooms at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: rainier98
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly and adequate. Nothing spectacular but nothing to detract from the experience. The room was nice but the giant treadmill in the corner was a big eye sore and waste of space. We had the corner "view room" and the views were spectacular. Very comfortable beds. The bar and restaurant are very nice. We did not have an issue with the walls being thin and they did not charge a $100/day deposit to my card as other reviews have mentioned. The noise from the street on the 29th level was very loud. I could not imagine being on the lower levels. We spent most of our time at Fisherman's Wharf so the travel back and forth was a hassle. The F-Line can be difficult to get on to return to the hotel due to high passenger volume. If you intend to spend most of your time at the Wharf, I'd suggest getting a hotel closer. A cab ride from the Wharf to the Parc 55 is only $9-10 (not including tip).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielchu
Reviews.Content: Internet is not working, and walls are thin -- if you are looking for a place to rest and sleep after a long day walking around SFO, this is NOT it! I have to admit that the location is amazing. It's 2 minutes from Powell BART station; hence, I can see a lot of businessmen and airline crews here. The room was clean, but the walls are way too thin. In a downtown area, you need pretty thick walls to block the noise out there. This decreases your willingness to stay especially after a long day walking around SFO. Therefore, I don't recommend any travelers who are not here for business to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ciara99
Reviews.Content: We satyed here as part of our honeymoon whilst travelling in the US booked last minute - and where really happy with the hotel. Two large beds in all rooms with a modern twist - a lot of business people seem to use it - great shops restaurants and bars right on your doorstep. Staff can't do enough to help you - I would give this hotel 100% concierge booked all our trips to alcatraz at discount prices. Rooms great and spacious air con also great not that you need it in san francisco!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully updated hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: redtentgal
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at this Union Square gem for a combination business & pleasure trip. I had a three-block walk to the Moscone Center for my conference - perfect. Cable cars, BART, and MUNI bus are one-block away - perfect. Chinatown is less than a mile away with few of the hills SF is famous for - perfect. Shopping, shopping, shopping surrounds you - perfect. Great restaurants (try New Dehli across the street FOR SURE) abound - perfect. We actually walked to Fisherman's Wharf, but for less adventurous, it is a quick cable car ride. The hotel has been renovated beautifully. The public spaces are gorgeous. Rooms are pretty spacious and the bed was absolutely comfy. With all the great food around, we did not enjoy Cityspace (the restaurant/bar), but it looked very chic and like a great place to have a drink. The fitness center leaves a bit to be desired, but with all the walking around we did, not an issue. No pool... The concierge desk was terrific. They always had great suggestions and good directions. We arrived early and the room wasn't ready. The bell desk downstairs checked our luggage for free and we enjoyed the day in the city before returning to our room. Rates were good in comparison to other hotels in area. STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but walls are thin”
Reviews.Author: eveysiy
Reviews.Content: the location is great as others have said, but the walls are so thin. we could hear every word our neighbors were saying and they weren't even being loud. sounded like they were just having a normal conversation. hallway noise is particularly loud too. we had to ask to move to another room because we couldn't sleep. that room was much better, but we could still hear the hallway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NL1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most perfect location - just across the street from the Powell BART station which brings you from the airport to downtown and at the cable cars and buses. Some people have complained about the hotel being too close to a "bad" neighbourhood (Tenderloin). We've spoken to some locals and though they don't encourage us to wander through the area at night it really isn't that bad. Just to give you the complete picture: the hotel is located directly opposite Nordstrom, Bloomingdales and lots of really fancy shops. The exterior of the hotel looks a bit outdated, but inside it's really nice. They have recently renovated the rooms and reception area (which probably also explains the noise other reviewers were complaining about) and everything looks fresh, modern and tidy. We stayed in room 1311 and the airconditioning did need some TLC to get started. The bathroom and room itself were great. Super comfy bed, huge tv and a clean and large bathroom. There are complimentary ear plugs which I had to use (light sleeper) but they did the trick. The only thing that disappointed me was the 13 dollar fee for 24 hours use of internet! We tried getting an unsecured WIFI connection but ended up in Starbucks one block up the street.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks! NOISY! A/C does not work! Don't GO THERE!”
Reviews.Author: lovintraveling3
Reviews.Content: I was referred to this hotel by a friend and therefore had pretty high hopes. Positive: This hotel is within walking distance of the mall Lobby is beautiful and contemporary, the restaurant is as well. The hotel room looks nice online, however once entering the room it looked like it once was an older hotel with newer furniture. Location: This hotel is on the outer edge of union square across from the Westfield Mall and backed up against a shady neighborhood. Even when checking in the reservation employee circled our current location & then drew an arrow directly behind the hotel stating that it is an area of high crime. We did not wander that way during our stay but on the day of check out we did drive that way and all we saw were crack addict looking people. So she was right! Room: New Furniture, no mini bar, drinks at the vending machine outside is $2.50 so you are better off going to Walgreens before going back to your hotel. AC does not work we had to turn it to 62 degrees to get cold air and even then it took several hours to finally get cool. You are even better off a the Marriott. Internet; There were several cheaper places that offers free wifi around the area, I was disturbed to find out that this hotel charged $13/day. Parking: $44/day! Room Service: Food arrived cold We stayed very high up on the 19th floor however it was extremely noisy. We had a king suite next to apparently noisy people who stayed up until 4am talking loudly and drunkenly probably. Banging of the doors etc...I can deal with outside noise which is expected of a busy city like this and New York. However the class of the people staying in this hotel is ridiculous. There must have been 10 girls in 1 room partying. Its not the RED ROOF INN! My boyfriend and I are a young couple, we drink go out and have fun but even the noise was just ridiculous. When reporting the complaint to the desk they did not resolve the matter after continuing to hear the noise and disruption for another 20 mins, I called again, finally speaking to a security personnel who resolved the matter. I've learned my lesson and will gladly pay an extra $100 for class. This place is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “$100/day incidental fee they don't tell you about!”
Reviews.Author: psylensse
Reviews.Content: Typically hotels hold a credit card in case charges are made. Parc 55 charges you $100 / day on your card IN ADVANCE before you even make any charges. I am staying 10 days and was supposed to be charged $1000, but for some reason they decided to only charge me $100. I have yet to see if I'll be getting this money back. Worse, nowhere on the website can I find information regarding this incidental charge. Several people at the front desk I spoke to said they had no idea if the information was on the website or not. I've traveled numerous times for both business and pleasure and this is the first time I've had this happen to me or heard of it happening. Stay tuned folks...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding- much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: california_trip09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights before heading down to LA and received an upgrade to a suite from a superior room(without asking, still not sure why but obviously didnt complain!) . It was amazing, much bigger than our own flat in London! We were on the top floor with amazing views across San Fran. The hotel itself was lovely, modern, and clean, with polite desk staff. We didnt eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that, but the cafe beside the entrance had great value for breakfast/lunch. The area was perfect for us as we were there to do sightseeing and the odd bit of shopping - it was across the road from a big shopping centre and right beside the tourist info centre, the BART stop (which goes to and from the airport so is really handy) and its really near the start of the cable cars/trams that take you down to fishermans wharf. We got the three day passport for the carts which was good value. The reason I gave a 4/5 for service was only because they didnt replace the coffee and milk in the room on 2 occasions, but otherwise it was good, with 2 services/day to the room. The bed was really comfortable and the decor was modern. I would really recommend this hotel for anyone visiting san fran for the first time and who is interested in shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: lovessanfran
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good, location was convientent and view was amazing but the customer service was dreadfull!! We had plenty of money to spend but walked in wearing jeans and t-shirts, a lady at check in, named Cristina, was extremly snoody not one that should work with the public. I will never stay there again due to her attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, great location, would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: gkinny
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on travelocity.com for half price. I stayed with 6 friends in connecting rooms. One was a king room one was a 2 double bed room. I called a couple of weeks before our stay to request connecting rooms, non smoking rooms and I also requested a room on an upper floor(because of the street noise). All of my requests were met. One room was ready when we arived so we checked into that room early. The other room was ready just a couple hours later. We had a great time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: kueric09
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a better location when staying in SF. Throw in wonderful views (assuming a high enough floor), friendly service (although check-in was a touch long, the bartender was great), it was a great hotel. 4-stars, through and through and I can't ocmplain about the price. Very pleased with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: GingelaOK
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on going to Union Square for shopping, etc., then this is wonderful. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The room was clean and well-appointed, and when we had a problem with the shower head, it was fixed immediately and courteously. If you want to complain about parking rates, you haven't traveled to big cities often enough to know to check on that before you rent a car and go downtown. Locating reasonable parking garages was easy in that area because we knew to do that. Parc 55 was easy to get to, and it was close enough to Powell to be handy, but far enough away to keep the noise level down. The bar served a great drink. We were very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unexpected costs”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraJohn
Reviews.Content: Not a good hotel and not a bad hotel. It goes to what is important when you are on a business trip. Parking is $55.00 per night. Drive one block up from the hotel and there is the parking garage that the hotel uses. Self park there for $20 per night. Internet is $17 per day. Three doors down at Starbucks it's free. Noisy. Requested a room on one of the upper floors. Got the 18th floor and we could hear music and revelers from the bar across the street and streetsweepers woke us up at 4am. The inconvenience for business travelors doesn't make this place competitive with the customer service oriented, comparably priced boutique hotels that surround it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: txn
Reviews.Content: My son (college student) and I did a quick trip to San Francisco this week. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. after a very short walk from the BART station ($5.35 one way from SFO) and were very happy that they had a room available for us despite checking in hours before the official check in time. Our room didn't have much of a view (was on the 13th floor) but we didn't expect a view room with the price we got on the hotel's web site (109/night). The beds were very comfortable and the room was very stylish. We had a flat screen tv which had a nice variety of channels, including HBO. The bathroom was large and even had a phone in it. The only complaint I really would have with the bathroom would be that there is no vent fan and the bathroom is a bit dark. But everything else was good with a generous amount of towels and even a magnifying mirror. The location, as I said before, is really good if you don't plan on bringing a car, since it is very close to the BART Station, a cable car turnaround, and a very nice mall. There are several Walgreens not too far away if you forgot something and on the other end of the spectrum, at the Mall there is a Nordstroms. There is a charge for the internet but we didn't use our computer there at the hotel. They have a fitness center and a business center, again neither one was used by us. I would stay at the Parc 55 again if I go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Best location if you're without a car”
Reviews.Author: funnymoney
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Parc 55 is location location location. If you are coming to SF without a car, this is probably one of the best places to stay. It is next to the Powell Street Station so you can catch the MUNI or the BART without a problem. I was on this trip without a car, but parking each day is probably around $45, which seems outrageously expensive, but in all honestly, this is average for a SF hotel, especially in the Union Square area. There are parking lots within walking distance that are cheaper, but since I did not use any, I cannot recommend a specific one. If you're taking the BART in from SFO, it will cost you less than $6 to get to the hotel. Since it is close to this hub of public transportation (including the famous cable cars), and surrounded by the major shopping area of the city, you should be aware that there is a lot of city street noise through the night. If you are a light sleeper, you will need the highest floor possible to get away from the hustle & bustle. If you are used to it, or can sleep through anything, you probably wouldn't even notice the noises. However, the hotel does provide ear plugs if you need them. Some people seem confused by the lobby being on the second floor, which is understandable, but don't forget this is SF and buildings are built into the hills. There are signs all over the place to direct you to the correct place to check in and elevators to get you to the second floor. There's also a great staff to assist you if you come in on the ground level, which is still under renovations. Or if you're feeling spry, you can always walk up the hill to another entrance and take a short flight of steps to the second level directly. Also, if you are on a lower level, do not expect a great view of the bay from your room like they feature on their website. You are, after all, surrounded by other tall buildings, block after block. If you really like the views, I would ask the front desk for the highest level possible upon checking in. The room we had was one of the recently renovated from floor to ceiling so everything looks great. For me, the bed was too firm, but I am used to sleeping on foam so all traditional beds are less than comfortable to me. The room featured flat screen tv's & a safe, but no fridges, unless you're willing to pay for it, and also no free Wi-fi. There is a business center and a 24 hour fitness center, both of which I did not frequent. The hotel features the cityhouse restaurant & bar, located on the 2nd floor lobby, which I recommend, especially if you have a late arrival like I did and do not feel like finding a place to get a quick bite (fast food restaurants aside).

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel”
Reviews.Author: Leslie K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 May 13-15 at the end of a trip to the Wine Country. Got the hotel for $86/night on Priceline and we were very happy with the accommodations for the price. The hotel went through a remodel that was finished about 6 weeks ago and it's very sleek and modern looking right now. Definitely a nice surprise, especially for the price we paid. Location is great; walking distance to several restaurants, Union Square and the cable car/BART stop. The only negative was that the bathroom was a little small. Other than that, great hotel, we'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Besos111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Francisco for the first time and stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel for five days. The hotel rooms are very clean and the service was great. I had called ahead and requested a room on a higher floor and my request was granted with no problems. Our room was a bay view with exceptional views! Everything was just steps outside of the hotel...BART....cable cars...downtown. We were very pleased with the location and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure to Stay at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: nycgeorgian
Reviews.Content: I can't say the negative reviewers are wrong, but I've stayed at this hotel 6 or 7 times, maybe more. My traveling attire is always casual, running pants and baggy shirt, light jacket, gators. So, I know they don't give you a bad room because of your dress. With each visit if a room on a high floor with a view was available, I was given such a room. Service has always been professional and friendly. Rooms are lovely and beds are comfortable. Rooms are business friendly too. Good lights, good chair. Sorry for the trouble the other reviewers had, but I've always had a good experience with this hotel -- and I've always booked through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “*Horrible* experience”
Reviews.Author: Lefcourt
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice. Convenient location, nice rooms, comfortable and clean. However, the stay was a nightmare. I arrived at about 9 PM to check in, and they told me that they didn't have my room ready and that it would be 30 minutes or so. They gave me a $10 coupon for the bar. Okay, not too terrible... 10 PM rolls around and they still don't have a room. Come 11:30 PM, I'm getting pretty annoyed. They wouldn't put me up at another hotel (and I had pre-paid through Expedia) or accommodate me in any way. I didn't get a room until 1:30 AM. They didn't offer any kind of compensation. They wouldn't even refund the cost of the room for that night! Outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer (Credit card) Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: EBSIrl
Reviews.Content: I and my three friends had the pleasure of visiting San Francisco in May this year (wonderful city). We chose to stay in Parc 55 and the hotel did meet our expectations. The rooms and location were ideal for our trip. HOWEVER!!! I came home to find an extra charge on my credit card for a 3rd room apparently attached to my booking. This is despite the fact that I (as directed) printed my booking and produced it upon check-in. I have a copy of my reservation confirmation stating that 2 rooms were booked and listing all four guests. There is no mention of a 3rd room. When I realised there was an extra charge and a charming lady informed me that the hotel would not have chosen my name or credit card out of the millions of people in the world to charge and couldn't have been less helpful. She did eventually suggest that she could pass the "case" to a manager. I await his call...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but be aware of . . .”
Reviews.Author: afishinSC
Reviews.Content: I would not rate this hotel as a 4 star, but it is a 3+. The rooms have been upgraded with new furniture and linens, but they left the old carpet (really, just change it), and the rather old wallpaper. However, they are clean and neat. At first, they gladly informed me that there were only two rooms available, a suite that they would gladly give me for my quoted price, and a room on a lower floor, that was just the deluxe I reserved. Well of course I opted for the suite, BUT when I got there, it was a bit nasty - stained carpet, horrible view - not so great bathroom, so I went back downstairs and asked if I could see the Deluxe I reserved. They said sure, and when I went to that room, it was much cleaner, nice view, just better overall - I kept that room and told them no thanks to the upgraded suite. During check in, after they took my id and credit card, they informed me that they just charged my credit card and extra $100. per day - surprise! Apparently it is their policy to charge this for any incidentials that you might rack up during your stay. For me it was an extra $500 seeing I was staying for 5 nights. I protested a bit letting the clerk know that she really should not charge one's credit card without their knowledge. It is unacceptable to inform me AFTER the fact. With that she said she would reverse that charge, and just have me pre-pay for the room. I still don't know what that was all about. But I did not feel too comfortable with all the charging and reversing she did on my credit card, so when I got settled in my room, I called my credit card company to see what just went on. Well I am glad I did because she charged me twice for the room and twice for the incidentials and only reversed one of the incidentials charges. I call the front desk and explained what I just learned and at first they were a bit pompus and said they will explain how a credit card works. When I told them I was clearly aware how a credit card works and didn't need their lesson, they did indeed correct the charges (as I verified the next day with my credit card company). There are plenty of amenities at this hotel, but NOTHING is free. The bottled water left in your room - $4.50 each, a fridge $25., internet access $12.50/day, etc. Just know whatever great price you landed on the internet for this hotel, is for the room, and the room only. The location couldn't be better. Every type of transportation available in SF is available to you right across the street, and you never have to wait more than 5-10 minutes for any of them. We bought the City-Pass, and it was the best thing we did. We could get on and off of any type of transportation, (trolley, cable car, bus anything except taxi's) without paying extra, and it included coupons for many attractions. This also can be purchased right across the street at the Visitors Center. Take Lorries Shuttle from the airport to the hotel for about $16 pp, and they will give you a coupon for your return trip for $12 pp The bellman services were exceptional. The restaurant is over-priced. There are too many great, reasonable restaurants around. I say yes, go there, but understand that nothing is free!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience at Parc 55- brilliant location and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Manny08
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful stay at The Parc 55. recommended by my sister as amazing value for money and excellent location in the heart of all the shops and things to do. Catch the trolley to the Quay or just shop until you drop. It is all there. Ericka at Reception checked me in and Hanif is an encyclopedia about where to go and how to get there. he is calm and so professional. Thanks to Ericka and Hanif for an amazing stay. see you soon! Manny , Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: katemc9035
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to San Francisco for our wedding anniversary. We stayed at Parc 55 for four nights. We found an excellent price online ($89.00 per night) . This hotel exceded our expectations. When we checked in a little early, our room hadn't been cleaned yet so we were upgraded to a room with a fabulous view of the city and the bay. The room was very nice, very comfortable bed and lux linens. The location is great, right by shopping and public transportation. Like many downtown San Francisco hotels, parking here is quite expensive. We found a garage a few blocks away that charged $25 a night and walked to the hotel. The only (small) downsides to this hotel...VERY hot water in the shower and bathroom sink, we nearly burnt ourselves; the shower curtain seemed very ineffective, water kept spilling out onto the bathroom floor no matter how careful we were; and no fridge in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dominik_r
Reviews.Content: I wasnâ€™t really sure where to stay in San Francisco and found the Parc 55 @ a very good price and expected not much. As I do like to use public transport wherever it is offered I took the bart train from the airport to powell station, which is next to the hotel. This is already a plus for the hotel. Check in was hassle free and I took the advantage to use their Club Lounge as well. Room was on a high floor with nice view over the city and comes with to small double beds, flat screen TV and a bathroom with bathtub. Layout and style was pretty nice- I would rate it 4 Star. In room Internet access for 24h is 12.95USD. The Club Lounge is typical American fair- you need to use your Key Card to enter- so no real concierge service. The view is nice and the complimentary continental breakfast contains bagels,toast, cold cuts, fresh fruits and pastries of a good quality. During the evening they do offer small snacks like cheese and crackers and some sweets. Soft drinks are free of charge but for the booze you will have to pay. If you are not fancy about a Club Lounge- there is even a grab and go breakfast buffet in the lobby. This is indeed not a world- class hotel but overall I was quiet surprised with the service received.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience for 2 picky travelers”
Reviews.Author: RockChalk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights, after booking for a very reasonable price on Priceline. Given the low rates, we were prepared for (and honestly would have been fine with) anything. We are both somewhat light sleepers and our biggest concern at any hotel is noise. Obviously, staying so close to Union Square and the cable car turntable, we expected to hear some street noise. Thus, we asked for a room on the highest available floor (without paying for an upgrade). The check-in representative was very willing to accommodate us, and she even went out of her way to make sure we weren't stuck in a room adjacent to the elevators. Ultimately, we had a room on the 23rd floor, and noise--from the street, from other rooms, etc.--was never a problem. We were quite pleased. The room, in all other respects, was fantastic, too. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the room and bathroom were very spacious. We had a great view, and the location was unbeatable (steps from the BART, cable cars, and other public transit). We did not explore much of the hotel outside our room. We didn't pay for wireless internet access (a fairly high rate). Likewise, we didn't have a car, so the steep parking rates didn't affect us. Given the rates and the hotel's great location, I would strongly discourage bringing a car. Overall, we were very pleased with our two nights at Parc 55, and we will be happy to stay there again on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Would return again”
Reviews.Author: mswesleyforever
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time being in the middle of union square...the room was nice the bed was excellent. The view was not what i wanted, but they were going under construction so i couldnt get it....our check in time was suppose to be at 3pm, but they let us check in early.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL FOR THE PRICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: OS24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days, me , my spouse and my 2 yrs old daugter. We booked our rooms through Priceline, paid 89$ per night. We checked in our room close to 3pm. Sarah checked us in. There was no wait time when we arrived, pretty much the lobby was empty. Their looby is on the 2nd floor. Entrance is a bit awkard, you actually have to go to 2nd floor to get checked in.
