As per our request we were upgraded to 20th floor (don't know for sure that she did upgraded us or we were actually going to get the room on 20th floor initally, but she did give a bit bigger room then the traditional king size room. It was the conner room, had 3 big windows with spectacular view of the city. Amenities included flat screen tv, coffe maker, sham/conditioner, lotion, ear plugs, shower cap, shoe polish, cable connection wire, (this is all I can rememder at this time). Internet was almost 13 $/day. Fridge is free if you have medicine to keep in it else it is $25/day. We didn't rent car so never inquired about parking. Concierge was very helpful everytime we went there. Great location - close to B.A.R.T, muni subway, trolley car station, multpile bus stations close, visitor information center (9am - 5pm), shopping center and restuarants. Street noise : honestly by the end of the day we were so tired that we slept pretty much through out the night - didnot have to use ear plugs at all. Tenderlion area: Is only few blocks away from the hotel.even after reading the reviews --- did we go...? Yes we did., but during the day time. We knew where we had to go so we did not stop, kept on walking till we reached our destination. Few said somethings we never paid attention or made eye contact. We made sure that before sunset we were back to the hotel. HouseKepping - no problems there, either. Didnot eat at the hotel or used gym - so can't comment on that. I will not give it a 4star because the interior decoration did not measure up to the standard. Also I didnot find mattress to be as comfortable as most people said. Overall good place for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for its superb location and value”
Reviews.Author: TheHOs
Reviews.Content: Had booked two rooms for my family and sisters after attending our daughter's wedding in Los Angeles. The extended trip was equally momentuous where we had great time shopping, sightseeing and including drinking in the comfort of our rooms. Was glad to have booked the Park 55 club . Must say that the staff, Robert, and Sergio in the platinium lounge (30th floor) were superb in their service making us feel very "at home". The hotel was very conveniently located to the shopping areas and near to the tram station and bus stops along market street. One recommendation is for better signage and location to the business center which was rather deserted on the 4th floor making it quite frightening for your guest to be alone using the internet , if at all. Also, Your chambermaid enthusiasm to do their job woke us up at 8.30am when they knocked at our doors to check if we want our rooms to be made. Overall , Park 55 is a highly recommended hotel for anyone going to San Francisco notwithstanding an uncalled unpleasant and snide remarks by your bellboy ,Oscar over his tips when handling our luggage.! Room 2853_57

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: sarahjoshua
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. we found the staff and concierge in particular to be extremely helpful. for the price we paid we couldn't believe what we got. Theres a cheap coffee shop just down stairs so no need to use the hotel breakfasts...

Reviews.Title: “Only positive feature is the location.”
Reviews.Author: JJ_NYC2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a few blocks from Union Square. That's it-- that's its only selling point. Otherwise it is oddly configured, cheap, and NOT a four star hotel. Also, the elevators were not functioning well and a constant source of irritation. As we attempted to check in, we entered through the streel level and had to wait for an elevator to reach the second floor for the registration desk (which is odd). We had to wait behind 30 people who were also using the hotel for its event space -- the whole process was dispiriting and annoying. In short everything about this hotel feels wrong, mostly because it is aspiring to be a 4-star but only putting in half the budget. It just doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Move to a better neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Goatspeed
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is a wanabee 4 star hotel but needs to move to a better neighborhood. It's close to shopping and the cable cars, but also to the Tenderloin district and a grubby and noisy street scene. Earplugs are provided in room to dampen the noise from parting in the street, traffic, sirens and people who talk while walking down the hall. Lots of plywood on the street level (maybe for improvements) but not impressive as an entry or making guests feel comfortable they are entering a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “totally unexpected”
Reviews.Author: kenaus1
Reviews.Content: Paid 89.00 got upgraded to king view. We were so happy. This is a very nice hotel.Shopping all around, Bart across the street. Bed very comfortable.What else can I say???

Reviews.Title: “Go for the executive rooms”
Reviews.Author: pean
Reviews.Content: Booked an executive room directly on hotel website. Rebooked 3 times beacause the price got lower. Ended up with a 124$ + tax for an executive (double)room on 29th floor including lounge acces with free breakfast and afternoon hors d'euvres. Location: Perfect for tourist purpose, absolutely Check-in: No problem when we arrived around 4 pm Room: room 2920 which was a very large corner room with fantastic wiew from 3 windows. Walk-in closet, large flatscreen and even a a fitnessmachine. Coffe and tea maker as well. Icebucket so you could get icecubes at the icemachines. No fridge ;o(. Wireless internet was 12.99 for 24 hours, but we had a 50% discount. Cleaning: No problem Conclusion: A very big hotel, but we did not feel it that way. The upper floors have not so many rooms. The price was very attractive, don't know if we just were lucky. Tip: Go to biscuits and blues a short walk from the hotel, ok food and good blues/jazz Lounge: Nice breakfast and ok hors d'euvres. Softdrinks was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: as530
Reviews.Content: this is one of the cheaper 4* places in such a prime location. Rooms great, but the reception is on floor 2, which is a little strange. No free wifi. TV OK. I requested view, got 18th floor, giving great view over city.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get promised room”
Reviews.Author: californiatravel_9
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip using hotels dot com website, i booked a non smoking king deluxe special offer for the parc 55, i was driving and was running a little late and so i called up the hotel in late afternoon saying i might check in late night, they said it should be fine, i arrive around midnight that night, the hotel lobby has only one elevator working and there was a line of around 30 guests waiting to go upto the second floor for reception/checkin, well that was fine, once i start to check in i am informed that only rooms availabe for me are a smoking queen or a non smoking two double beds, i was very dissapointed and i called hotels dot com number and they said that even though i paid for a king deluxe, they are third party and Cannot guarantee any room Ever and that i should have read the fine print terms and conditions, so i was not eligible for any refund or change of hotel, the room that is available is the only one i can get. I was exhausted and sleepy and so there was no point arguing here, accepted a smoking queen bed on a lower floor, requested the hotel ppl to see if i could get a nonsmoking king deluxe room the next day if possible. Was very dissapointed but was powerless here. Next day called hotels dot com again and they were sorry for the inconvinience and gave me a fifty dollar voucher for future use with them. The hotel gave me a great room on the 20th floor with superb bay views, king non smoking at around 2pm the next day, so was happy for the next two nights. Asides from this experience, the hotel has a superb location right next to the cable car and the powell station / union square with easy access to all public transport, i had a car and did not use the hotel valet parking which is 44dollars a night and used a nearby garage at 20 dollars a night with in and out privileges, the housekeeping was very efficient, bathrooms and rooms were very clean, bed was very comfortable, did not have a microwave or fridge in the room. It is more like a business hotel, but good for tourists too. They charge for everything including bottled water, health club and internet access and even local calls! So beware while using any of those services. So my conclusion is when you book with hotels dot com dont have any expectations of the room you have booked, they will Try to give you the room you have booked, but it is not guaranteed. Reach early, right around check in time so that you can increase your chances of getting the desired room.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient Location & Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bliss920
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 was a great place to stay - especially since it was our first trip to SF. The location is extremely convenient - it is around the corner (less than a block) from the Powell St BART station and the beginning of the cable car route (also Powell St)! Taking the BART to and from SFO was SO EASY and definitely recommended at $5.35/person each way (much less than taking a shuttle or taxi). Union Square is only a few blocks away and Market Street is a half block (not even) to the south. The hotel staff was very polite and accomodating. They were very helpful in booking a rental car for us for the one day we left the city. We had a GREAT room on the 31st floor (2nd from the top) - with an amazing view of the city and the bay! The room was clean, plenty big enough and the (king) bed was very comfy! The only complaint is the lack of drawer space, but we made it work! The bathroom was also a good size and very clean! Also since we were so high up, we heard barely any street noise, with the exception of the occasional sirens. They also provide travel books/magazines in the rooms with GREAT suggestions for places to eat -- we found some of our best restaurants in them! The lobby is still under construction, however aside from having to head to the 2nd floor to check-in (which is very easy to do), you wouldn't know it! I never heard any noise or encountered any issues! The 2nd floor lobby area is very nice and looks as though it is supposed to be there! The restaurant was nice, but we didn't eat there - just stopped in for a drink one night before heading up to our room. Drinks were about average price for the area. There is a great bar/pub a block up from the hotel - Foley's Irish House - we frequented this place the 2nd half of the week - great beer and they ususally had live music! Overall, this was a great, convenient place to stay and we would recommend it to anyone! Insider tips: 1) Buy the Muni Passport (I believe they come in 1, 3, 5 or 7 Day passes) - it pays for itself very quickly (Cable Car ride = $5 each way)!! We used the cable cars, trolleys and buses every day - which is a very convenient way to get around! 2) Although the lines get pretty long at the cable car turn-arounds -- they usually move pretty quickly - or you can head up a block or two and jump on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hjmover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 4/10/09-4/12/09 over Easter weekend. I landed the hotel on Priceline for a rate of $72 plus taxes and fees. Parc 55 webrates were in the mid 80's so I saved just a few bucks. The hotel was very busy when I arrived and the hotel front desk said the property was full. There was alot of activity but I am always surprised when my Priceline bid is accepeted at a hotel that says they are full. The hotel entrance is located right near the Powell Street BART so its very convenient to take the subway from the airport to the hotel. It costs $5.35 each way for about a 30 minute ride. It is is very easy to use. I got off the part and walked across the the street onto Cyril Magnin. The hotel entrance is right on the corner and one has to take an elevator up from the Cyril Magnin Street entrance to the registration desk on the second floor. I had to wait a few minutes for an elevator since their was a line. Their was a small line as well waiting to check-in but I only had to wait a few minutes. The clerk was very gracious and greeted me kindly. She made no mention on Priceline and honored my verbal request for a room on a high floor. I knew from reading tripadvisor.com that a room on a high floor would be less noisey with a nicer view. I was assigned room 2957. I was a bit disappointed when I got off the elevator to see my room was very close to the elevator and right across from the ice and soda machine. Yet, I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door to see a sleek, well appointed room. The room had a large king bed with nice sheets and a quality duvet. There was a flat screen tv, a small couch, a desk, three telephones, coffee maker, and a large window that had a partially blocked view of the bay and civic center area. I could see what I thought was Alcatrez. I was even more satisfied when I laid down on the bed. It was very very very comfortable. Since I am diabetic and did not see a minibar to place my insulin, I called down for a refrigerator. Housekeeping brought one to the room very quickly for no charge. I quickly umpacked my clothes for the weekend and noticed there was not to much drawere space for clothes. There were a few hangers in the closet along with two robes, but storage would be a problem for a longer stay. I checked out the bathroom which had all the stardard amenitites, a free bottle of water, a nice tub and three large, fluffy bath towels. Some of the bath amentities included ear plugs for noise and mouthwash. After checking out the room and the view I hooked up my computer via a wireless connection for $12.95 per 24 hours. The connection was strong. After checking emails, I went to the gym, which is free of charge, to work out.. The fitness center was great, It has lots of aerobic equipment, free weights, and weight machines. The room was relatively empty and I had a great work out. After the work out, I headed via BART to the Mission District for some burritos. The tacqueria's in the Mission make great, really large burrio's. I grabbing a carne asada burrito at El Farolito near the 24th and Mission BART stop for under five bucks. The burrito tasted amazing. Although there was a chill in the air I took the long walk back to the Parc 55. It took about 35-40 minutes. I walked along Mission to Gough to Market whcih is a very colorful neighborhood. Maybe there is shorter way but it was great to exercise after the filling carne asado burrito. I got up at 9 AM the next day and planned for a free City Guide walking tour of the Yerba Buena area. The tour started at 11 AM in front of St. Particks church by the Contempary Jewish Museum. I drank some fo the in-room coffee, took a long bath, and planned for a fun day exploring San Francisco. Yerba Buena Gardens is a short five minute walk from the Parc 55 so after getting dressed I headed outside. It was a bright sunny day and Union Square was packed with people. I made my way over to the St. Patricks church and there were a few people waiting for the free walking tour. The tour started at right on time and the guide was a local resident of the area. She had a real love for Yerba Buena and it showed it her presentation. She explained the history of the area and how it went from an inpoverished but nuturing community with many single occupancy hotels to a thriving area with large hotels, museums, shops, and a dynmic public garden. The tour lasted about one and one half hours and was terrific. I decided to go to another City Guide tour of the Embacadero area. It was such a nice day so I walked down to the Embarcadero. The walking tour started at 2 PM so it gave me time to grab some lunch. The pier has lots of places to eat and is very touristy. There is a fresh farmers market in front of the pier building and I would have been wiser grabbing some fresh fruit from a local merchant. Instead I went to the San Francisco Sea Food Company stall and had some fish chowder and fried oyster loaf. It costs abit over $16 and was less than enjoyable. After finishing up lunch I headed under the clock to meet the tour. There was a lot more people waiting for this tour and the area was pretty crowded with people. The guide was not as vibrant about the area but did his best to describe theis salty,sea port area of SF. This neighborhood has a colorful history and has gone through significant redevelopment. We walked in and around some of the buildings near the Embarcadero but I did not find the guide very engaging. I left the tour after about one hour and headed back to Union Square. I wanted to check out the easter flowers at Macy's which were really spectacular. Then, I headed back to the hotel to prepare for a facial appointment I made a LeBelle Day Spas which is located at 233 Grant Avenue. I had a facial at LaBelle three years prior and it was fantastic. The facialist Stella has great charisma and it was the cleanest my face has ever felt. I thought about that facial for years and could not wait to go back. I was excited for a similar experience. The spa has three levels and is not quite as male friendly as I would like. The male changing room is small but once you are ready, well, LaBelle is very pampering. After changing, I went to the waiting area where my feet were placed in a bowl on hot water. I ate some sweet honeydew melon as I waited for Stella Relaxation started to overtake me. My facial was fantastic. I am not sure how Stella does it, but my skin felt clean, fresh, and hydrated. Although, this was a bit expensive at $150+, well, it was worth every penny. It truly was two hours of bliss that ended with a clean skin and a relaxed mind. I walked back to the Parc 55 as releaxed and comfortable as I have ever felt. Later, I grabbed a quick dinner at King of Thai Noodle Shop. The duck and rice plate which was under ten bucks was fantastic. I headed back to the hotel for another quick work out and then to read before bed. It was a truly great day between the walking tours, facial, and inexpensive, delicious dinner. I slept soundly again. I woke up at 9 AM and drank some in room coffee and watched morning TV. Slowly I got up and began packing for my weekend getaway was soon heading to an end. I did have one more place I wanted to visit, so after packing most of my clothes I headed out to Chinatown to grab some dim sum at a small take out place I read about called Delicious Dim Sum. Its located at 752 Jackson Street. It was a long walk up a steep hill via Powell but I made it to Jackson. You really need to have stong legs to make it up that hill. I found Delicous Dim Sum which truly was a small little hole in the wall. I order shu mai, har gaw, and some sticky rice. It cost $5.40 which I thought was a bargain. The woman put the dim sum in a container and gave me a fork as I walked outside. I walked across the street and sat on the curb by a small alleyway. It was really interesting to sit on the street corner. watching people walk through China town as I ate this really delicious dim sum. The har gow and sticky rice were very good and the shui mai was some of the best I ever tasted. I was smiling brightly as I walked back to the Parc 55. I got back to my room and finshed packing. I looked out at the beautiful view and tried to breathe in the last parts of my nice weekend as I left my room. It took a while to finally get from the 29th floor to the ground floor with all the stops but the sun was shining as I headed across the street to grab the BART to SFO. It was a nice weekend and the Parc 55 really helped in making for a very pleasant, affordable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for BART and MUNI”
Reviews.Author: egyptdragon
Reviews.Content: I was trying to do a bargain trip for Spring Break, but did not want to get stuck in a one star hotel in the Tenderloin. So, I booked on Priceline and got an amazing rate. I'd never even heard of the hotel before and am really glad I took that gamble. Their list price is about $200-250 a night, and I paid less than that total for 2. Their website did have some specials very near to the rate I got on priceline, so poke around to find the links to the coupons and special rates. I liked it enough I might intentionally book through their own site. The desk clerk let me check in early! I was very happy about that since I had read other reviews indicating that they would be unhelpful in that regard. I also did not look like their normal clientele, but did not seem to get treated differently at all. Most of the people checking in and out were wearing suits and fine designer dresses, and I showed up with a backpacking backpack and REI fleece. This was my third trip to SF, but the first time staying in a hotel-- I used to stay at a friend's place. Some of the reviews here complain about the noise level, but, the noise level is about the same if you are staying in a residential area. San Francisco is just noisy at night. I came primarily to see Wicked again and to see the Bhutan exhibit at the Asian Art Museum. Both of those are one stop on the Muni. I also took the bus system to the Legion of Honor and once again, this hotel was a really good central starting place. It also helps that the websites for all these locations have muni directions on them from multiple places in the city. The only complaint I could make is that if I paid the full price for the hotel, the room seemed rather small. But once again, in San Francisco, there are so many people crammed into such a small area, this might be pretty standard. The Westfield Mall is right across the street, so you have plenty of restaurants. I went to the Bristol Farms grocery store at the bottom level and stocked up on fresh fruit and tea. The coffee/tea maker is in the dresser under the TV, so don't forget to look for it before you give up and order room service!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time back, still great”
Reviews.Author: CGibson
Reviews.Content: Was a tad worried since not under Marriott and some reviews were questionable but the place is fine and still a good value. Here are some highlights: 1) Booked a CLUB level room. The room was not huge but had nice views and more windows. Best part was access to lounge, so we had a continental breakfast and also hor deuvres/honor bar in the afternoon (except Saturdays, be noted). Only suggestion with that is to remember your room key (that is your access) and to get there fairly early since they don't restock often. 2) The location is fine, and is one of the best hotels to use if taking BART into the City. It is right across the street from the Powell Street stop near the Cable Car turnaround. While it is true that if you walk the other direction from the hotel, it may get shady but it is very obvious that all the good stuff is toward Union Square. 3) The on site restaurant was being renovated, we had lunch there and it was fine, although it did kind of look like a cafeteria. There are plenty of places to eat outside the hotel anyways. 4) The one negative was the terrible elevator service (sometimes a stop on every floor down) and the check in (nearly an hour). Perhaps we caught a bad time, I know the place is popular with tours and airlines. The place is well recommended and the prices are good too, with many package plans available. It should work out for any type of visit to the City, business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “wow, just wow”
Reviews.Author: norcalchevy99
Reviews.Content: WOW, so i had originaly reserved a club room with a view, a nice room and i had got a very good price. However, when we arived they told me they had to upgrade us to the "PRESIDENTIAL SUITE", yes, no joke. the 700+ sq ft room with bay and city views on the 32nd floor was absolutely the most amazing room i had ever stepped foot in. Parc 55 made this night one to remember. Location is A+, staff was friendly, I couldnt have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS TIME - DON'T TAKE OTHERS REVIEWS SO SERIOUSLY”
Reviews.Author: plyonsden
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky person staying only at the best hotels when we travel. I'm 49 and took my 17 yr old daughter. I have stayed in San Fran many times, at some little boutique hotel & yes noise was always a factor. Wasn't sure booking with Parc 55 but turns out this is a wonderful hotel, no matter where you are in the city you will get noise from the street. The Gaming convention was in SF so the hotel was full. Staff are fantastic with all your needs and help (directions, restaurant suggestions, taking transit, etc). The front desk offered to confirm and pre check us in on our flight, which saved a lot of time at the airport. ALL HOTELS HAVE PROBLEMS. Yes flight staff book in here, but they are gracious & wait for everyone to arrive & all book in at one time rather than taking up every staff member at the counter. Remember San Fran airport is one of the largest in the US. Airline staff stay at many hotels there. This is a city of many cultures and colors. If you are bothered by this then don't go to SF.. People, regarless of who they are were friendly and helpful...WOULD DEFINATELY STAY HERE AGAIN. If you get a chance go to Cafe Du Nurod to take in a concert....GREAT TIME. I'd be more than happy to offer further feedback.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Cities”
Reviews.Author: FGCESQ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate her 50th birthday. The good: great room, very helpful concierge, courteous staff. The bad: weird entrance, location too close to tenderloin district. First, I'll discuss the good aspects of the hotel. Upon check-in, I requested a room as high as possible, to minimize the street noise and maximize the view, and the reservation desk gratiously offered me a room on the 18th floor, provided I didn't mind waiting until it was ready at 3:00, and I accepted. ( I should explain that when you book a deluxe king room through Priceline, you can get a room only up to the 18th floor. The rooms above that are more expensive "view" rooms.) It was only 12:30 p.m at that point, so we went to lunch at Lori's Diner down the street and enjoyed a lunch at a 50's theme diner, very fun. Lori's is a great spot for breakfast too, $11.25 for a huge breakfast with eggs, potatoes, pancakes,sausage, bacon. When we returned to check in at 3:30 p.m., the room still wasn't ready, so they upgraded us to a view room on the 22nd floor. Wow! Really nice, big room with big bay window overlooking city. The bed was oh so comfortable, the bathroom fantastic. Even a couch,and a flat screen tv with HBO. We loved the room. During the course of our stay, the concierge gave us helpful tips on visiting places, and they even printed out our boarding passes when it came time to leave. Very helpful and courteous, as was the rest of the staff. The maid kept the room sparkling clean, absolutely no complaints at all. Now, for the bad. The main entrance to the hotel seems to be where the garage is. You enter where the bell man is located, then have to go up 2 floors to reach the main lobby. Very weird, and it takes away from the impression you get upon entering the hotel. If you visit the Westin St.Francis, you'll notice what an amazing impression the entrance area can make. Now, there is a side entrance, which seems to me ought to be the main entrance, but people just stay outside those doors to smoke, and the doors don't even have real handles to pull the doors open, just strange knobs. Fine, this may be an unimportant criticism, but the location of the hotel is a legitimate beef. I know that there are tons of hotels right next door to the Parc 55, including the Hilton, the Abri, the Bijou, and many others, but because of the ridiculous number of homeless in the area, and the proximity of these hotels to the Tenderloin area, I would not choose to stay in any of these hotels for a leisure vacation. The homeless problem is terrible in this area. If you just move east a couple of blocks, the area becomes substantially less seedy. Hence, the title of my review. Don't get me wrong, the area is close to everything, restaurants, shopping, cable cars. Very convenient location. In fact, having looked around San Francisco, I am very glad I didn't book a hotel in the Financial District (too sterile and business-like) or Nob Hill (the hotels like the Fairmont or Stanford or Mark Hopkings are amazing, but I could not face the hills each morning) or the Wharf (too touristy). I like Union Square, however, I just would like to be a few blocks east of where I was. Now, would I stay here again? For business, definitely. The rooms and service are fantastic. And, the hotel seems to cater to quite a few airline crews and business meetings. But, for a vacation with the family, I think I would pick something further away from the edge of the Tenderloin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not cheap!”
Reviews.Author: ff7099
Reviews.Content: The location is great as it is right by Union Square. The rooms were ok but not anything special, all very clean and comfortable. We booked in advance as were told that they are likley to be busy and we wanted a nice place to stay for a few days at the end of our round the world trip. As a result we paid alot for the room, infact about three times the amount than if we had booked the day before we stayed!! In the end this is a nice clean hotel in a good location, but its room rate are very high so if you do want ot stay there it might be best to leave booking until just before you arrive the difference when we were there was massive. (We paid over Â£100 per night in advance and a couple we met who booked online the day before arriving paid about Â£30) Is it worth Â£30 per night? of course! is it worth over Â£100 per night? Im not sure there are plenty of other hotels in San Francisco! I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but only as a book on arrival option.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and close to all the tourist locations, very close to shopping area. The rooms are large and very comfortable with coffee and tea facilities. Nice little cafe next door for breakfast, toasted sandwiches and pastries, very good value. The noise.... between 11pm and 5am all you can hear is the bin collectors. Every nght the same. If you can sleep with ear plugs you will be fine. I would probably use the hotel again, but ask for a much higher floor. Must be above 15th floor. Hotel would benefit from double glazing..........

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great downtown location close to all the Union Square action”
Reviews.Author: cjwCalgary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 5 night holiday break and overall had a mixed experience. The initial check-in was smooth and courteous and our room on the 21st floor with a Bay view was high enough to escape the constant city noise. However, our second night there was wrecked by very noisy and uncouth guests next door. (The bad language was unbelievable!!) Next morning, we checked with the front desk who confirmed that those guests had checked out. Whew!! Next evening, the same mayhem, so we checked again with front desk only to be told that they had checked back in!! Insisting on a move, we were given a larger corner room on the 25th floor, with a City view, which was considerably less scenic than our previous Bay view. Overall, the standard of the rooms was very good, but in the second room, we had a shower which leaked all over the floor and also an air extraction vent which never switched off and in fact blew cold air out 24/7. There were also 2 occasions when our magnetic room keys barred us from entering our room. The front desk never really explained why that was happening to us, but merely gave us replacements and on the second occasion, the same lady who initially checked us in actually asked us for proof of ID before handing over our new keys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cancellation policy is 72 hours in advanced. Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: 4ever88
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about cancellation fees of 72 hours in advanced -this hotel is for you!!!! If you do care about it since there is always a chance that something can happen at the very last minute of your trip, DO NOT stay at this hotel! Even if you talk to the manager of the hotel with more than two days and a half in advance, the manager will not wave you the cancellation penalty....YOU'LL HAVE TO PAY THE FEE... You need to call by 4:00pm 72 in advance!!! In addition, although I've never been in San Francisco I've seeing many more hotels in the internet that looks much nicer, with better prices and without that 72 hours cancellation fee. So why staying on this hotel?...My advice is AVOID Parc 55!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jdljr
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights here, March 8-11, 2009. Had been in the Harbor Court for one night before this, and was nice to get to this hotel and the larger room! We got there early and were not able to check in, so we left our luggage with the bellhop while we got something to eat and did a little sightseeing. Upon our return at 1:30pm we were able to check in. We were assigned a room on the 26th floor with a view of City Hall and the residential hills in the distance. Room was spacious, bed was soft but comfortable. Bathroom was functional with all the usual amenities. We had a problem with the TV one night but someone came to fix it within 30 minutes. All public areas were kept very clean. Location was one block from the Powell Street cable car turnaround and the Powell Street Bart/Muni Station which was very convenient. Plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. We even walked from the Hotel to Chinatown two days, and from the Hotel to Coit Tower via Chinatown and on to Embarcadero Street to take the F-Line to Pier 39. Great exercise! The Parc 55 Hotel was a great value through Priceline and I was happy with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby under renovation, $13 net, nasty ID policy, fee for late checkout”
Reviews.Author: zippy47
Reviews.Content: The Parc55 not only wants to see photo ID, they record the number of that ID, which I find disturbing (SF isn't a police state, folks!). Down duvets, good pillows, fluffy 100% cotton towels. Both wired and wireless net, each $13/day. Had some trouble getting connected, but tech support was fast and helpful. Adjustable desk chairs that lock upright. Four power outlets right next to the desk, but none near the beds. Flat panel TV. No coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, or minibar. The lobby escalators are undergoing renovation, which leaves getting in and out of the hotel to be a bit of a maze. They wouldn't offer a checkout later than than 12:30pm without a surcharge. Reasonably competent desk staff and fast response to maintenance issues, but the housekeepers spoke too little English to understand simple questions. All-in-all, a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, delightful city but beware noise from traffic!”
Reviews.Author: valethatch
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a quick four days from UK! Location was excellent as very convenient from Bart(Powell) less than 200metres away making easy access and cheap access from the airport. Rooms tidy and clean and well appointed. reception little slow but in fairness whole area in renovation. Housekeeping staff friendly and exceedingly helpful, in fact in many years travelling some of the best. Advice though if English take a supply of decent tea bags! For leisure travellers convenient for all public transport with cable car right next door(to Fisherman's Wharf). The Wharf warrants one day but no more as very tacky( enjoy meal at Wines of California at end of pier)! The Golden Gate Bridge worth seeing(take bus to bridge 5 then 28) and walk across .... remarkably few people do ... on to the peaceful town of Sausalito returning by ferry to the Ferry Terminal via Alcatraz .... with lunch at Socama's(super halibut and Dungeness Crab). from Ferry Terminal take cable car from Market Street up to Powell then join at intersection car from the Wharf, Area near Parc 55 very pleasant with Union Square 5 minutes away. Enjoy a coffee and croissant in the square. Plenty of good eating houses around, try Italian across from the hotel(great value Happy Hour 4-6). Beware price of wine if from UK. A bottle from a liquor store of local wine $20 upwards, buy at Heathrow(3 bottles $26!). for shopping Parc 55 just opposite Westfield, ultra modern cathedral to consumerism. Go to top level above Bloomingdale's to see what I mean. Good value Internet cafe at rear of hotel($3.50 for 30 minutes) Parc excellent value if seek Internet prices. Only real downside is the traffic noise particularly on lower floors(we were on 11th) however sirens and rubbish collections noises will be encountered where ever you stay in this super city. Trip capped by two excellent flights by BA! on time, excellent service and very comfortable seats.

Reviews.Title: “Service not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: jessicalacie
Reviews.Content: Staff was unhelpful and unfriendly, yet waited expectantly for tipping. (fat chance!) No help offered by bellmen when struggling with luggage-not a good first impression. Front desk was quick to promote hotel restaurant, but when asked what they served/offered they had very little information. Room was very similar to a Holiday Inn Express-minimal decor, plain walls. The walls were very thin and we could hear everything (EVERYthing) going on next door as well as in the hallways. The view of Market Street was redeeming, unless you were trying to sleep-then the noise from outside could be unbearable. If staying for a short business trip, being in the heart of downtown would be convenient, however if on vacation or looking for good customer service, this is not the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “service similar to a boutique kimpton property”
Reviews.Author: Klara21
Reviews.Content: I just returned with my 15 year old daughter, her 16 year old friend, as well as her mother from a pleasant stay at Parc 55. We were celebrating our girls 16th birthdays. Our late flight put us at the hotel at 12:20 a.m., no problem for the front desk, we were checked in and unpacking our bags within 20 minutes of arrival. We stayed on the 32nd floor, with a sweeping view of the city, I could see the TransAmerica building, the water and a bit of the golden gate bridge. I am a light sleeper, but the room I was in was quiet & I never heard my neighbors. No clanging dumpster noise at 5:00 a.m., something I've experienced at other properties in San Francisco. The room is tastfully remodelled with light duvet covers, and very comfortable beds that felt like new mattresses. The beds are doubles, so for 2 adult women with teen-age daughters it was a bit on the cozy side, but I expected this. I am a substitute teacher on a budget, so I will trade close quarters for a great price. Our room included a hospitality room on the 31st floor, staff was friendly, efficient, and promptly restocked fresh fruit, strawberries and the chocolate croissants that my daughter and I became addicted to. Staff helped me plan my sight-seeing, and I want to personally offer a shout out thank-you to Robert for suggestions on restaurants and the seam-less service he provided during our stay. We did not have a car, but I've never understood why you would want one in a major city. Cars are a liablity in a major city in my opinion, so I would suggest you dump the rental car after the Napa wine tasting. You always pay through the nose for parking, no matter what the city. So maybe if you need cheap parking and that is a priority, you might want to shop around. The Bart system is right around the corner, cable-cars and muni all conveniently located. Muni drivers should be commended for their polite answers about transferring etc. since there are no bus schedules and they have to constantly put up with tourists asking how to get around. Mr. Newsom might want to look into resources here, since tourism is the 2nd biggest industry for San Francisco next to Financial. And it looks like financial is in for a bit of a dry spell. This hotel is in a terrific location, heart of shopping, 10 minute walk to Chinatown. cable-cars on the next street. Which leads me to safety. I was travelling with my 16 year old daughter, we are suburban people and I never felt frightened around this property. Are there homeless people in San Francisco and occasionally in front of our hotel? Yes. And the doorman and attendants do a fine job of keeping an eye on things. I am also not going out for a stroll at 2:00 a.m. along Geary street. We did however, stay out until around 11:00 p.m, walking back from a financial district restaurant. The lobby remodel was completed on our last day, there are large groovy white light fixtures to admire. Front desk held our bags for 4 hours while we did some last minute sight-seeing before our flight. I have stayed at many of the Kimpton properties in this city and typically prefer a smaller boutique type hotel. I honestly found service to be similar in attention to detail and friendliness of staff. I would highly reccommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: momoney1687
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our babymoon. The location is good, but the neighborhood gets a little sketchy only a couple of blocks west. The rooms were very nice, only complaint was a little too much street noise. Very close to the BART, trolley cars and public transportation. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price ... and Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: rstark223
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel! It is right at the Powell Street Bart Bart stop, so I can get to and from the airport in under Â½ an hour (usually much faster than driving). The workout facilities are great, and the proximity to shopping, baseball, Union Square, is perfect. The great internet deals make it my â€œmust stayâ€� choice in San Francisco. I checked in after a day of Travel Hell (snowed out of my ski vacation, then flights delayed for hours, pouring rain in the city). The manager, Deanna, was incredibly sympathetic to all that Iâ€™d been through, and sent wine up to my room, which was exactly what I needed at the time. This is the kind of gesture I expect from an expensive boutique hotel, but for $100 a night? Too awesome!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS GREAT!! Read on and find out why...”
Reviews.Author: Martinimom
Reviews.Content: So for about $100 give or take depending on the when you stay, you can't go wrong. It is clean, updated, well located (right across from Bart station, Nordies, etc...) Service is wonderful too. It's a no nonsense business or pleasure hotel. I know my friends stay here too and always return. Unless you are looking for super posh and luxurious...or quaint and small...BOOK IT!! You won't go wrong. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot to like, really”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromtheIsland
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 2 nights after some winetasting in Napa. We asked for a high floor but got 13... not bad, I guess.. but you could still hear road noise from here. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. It passed the shower hot water test that I'm fussy about. The reception staff were nice and courteous, as were the valets. The parking rate was outrageous - $44 a night plus taxes. Two nights of parking cost us over $105... compare that to 5 days of car rental at $185 and you can see why I was annoyed. The only saving grace was the in/out privileges for that price. On top of that they made a mistake on our bill and charged us for 3 nights of parking - duplicate billing the first night. The bar on the second floor is a must-miss. It looks like part of a Denny's... maybe not even that good. The hotel is located in a pretty seedy part of town so be warned that you're going to want to watch where you go in the evenings. All-in-all it was a so-so experience. I can't say it was bad but I can't say it was great either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice corner rooms with great views”
Reviews.Author: Socalsailracer
Reviews.Content: Well to start with I saw a lot of poor reviews on this place but they were contrary to my experience. I arrived around 1:30pm on a Friday I had no trouble checking in, they set me up with a corner room with a king bed, which is the way to go, 2 big panorama bay windows on separate walls with spectacular views. Furnishings were nice with dark cabinets and desk, (see hotel photos) nice color schemes, well designed. Nice big flat screen TV, nice bathroom a little smallish but well laid out and not at all cramped feeling. On a side note I booked through a â€œname your own priceâ€� type website and got a weekend rate of $78.00 per night, so at that price Iâ€™d be hard pressed to complain about this joint. The beds were very comfortable with nice soft white sheets and comfy pillows. Also the â€œbedspreadsâ€� were nice fluffy duvets with white removable covers, you may read this as clean as opposed to bedspreads with who knows what on them, big plus if you ask me. I had very little interaction with the hotel staff aside from check-in, bell desk and the valet parking attendants who were a constant as they happily whisked my car in and out of their lot over and over again. By the way parking here is on the spendy side at $44.00 plus taxes and fees per night, ($50.00 total, and donâ€™t forget tips) but considering my use it seemed alright to me. I think the parking staff got the drift and kept my car close by as after a few trips my car always seemed to be there moments after I hit the lobby doors, proper tipping doesnâ€™t hurt in situations like that which may have explained why I seemed to fly by others waiting for cars to be brought up. All in all I liked the hotel, stylish and clean room, desk with a view, nice couch, convenient location, little need to interact with front desk staff. I think a corner room with a king is the difference between my experience and the poor reviews Iâ€™ve read. Have a look at the hotel photos and you can see from the exterior shots the 2 windows on the corner rooms, and if you look through the photos you will see an interior shot of the corner rooms with 2 windows. remember some people only review hotels they donâ€™t likeâ€¦ â€œgrrrrr Iâ€™ll show themâ€�, I take really nasty reviews with a grain of salt but hey thatâ€™s just me. Donâ€™t know the regular rate but Iâ€™m a brave soul and book on the bid system often, most times it works out for me, this time it did. So go, have fun, enjoy San Francisco and if you are very particular then just book a Starwood Hotel and be done with it, the â€œWâ€� hotel in SF is a very nice joint, so is the St Francis, even the Palace is alright, Iâ€™m fine at all of those as well as the Parc55, heck I have no problem with Parc55 at all, I would go back. Oh and as far as noise goes, this is the city good luck no matter where you go.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaysabz
Reviews.Content: I love to travel and usually stay at 3 to 5 stars hotels. My expectations are very fair. I don't really have high standards or by any means high maintness. As long as these hotels and rooms are somewhat similar to the pictures I see in their websites and providing decent level of service then I'm satisfied. But this hotel is far from any of it! Rooms are nothing like what they show you in their site, they are very small with small windows. Beds are very uncomfortable and bathrooms are small but ok. Hotel itself is ok from outside looks good but inside looks like old burned down hospital. Worst thing about this place was their service. I was at the front desk at least 4 times a day to solve one problem after another. from my hotel bill to not being able to get to my room to being charged 4 internet charge all in less then an hour. on the first day my frinds and I checked in at the same time they gave both of us wrong keys to our room! Club level was terrible as well.... I hope think twice before staying at this hotel and don't make the same mistake we made. This is San Francisco and you have alot of hotels to choose from so choose wisely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location, Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: robo44
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in the City and chose the Parc 55 for its convenience and location to Union Square. We received an excellent rate from their website and like another reviewer as time drew closer to the reservation, I realized that good rate had gotten even better, and yes it was easily changed. We arrived well ahead of check-in and had no problems with gaining access to our room We have a club level room on the 27th floor with a wonderful view. The room was a nice size and the bed was very comfortable. Staff was good, continental breakfast was good and the bell staff was very friendly. The only draw back is the huge fee of $44 to park your car overnight. Room was a corner room on 27th floor with panoramic windows. Despite the fee I see no reason not to give the Parc 55 a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Bad Customer service”
Reviews.Author: annabelle2424
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 this past weekend for Valentine's day. After reading reviews I arrived knowing that they will not grant early check-ins but I tried anyway. I was told that the rooms were not available until 3pm and to check back in. At 2:50 I got back in life (the line was always very long) and by the time I got to the front desk again it was after 3pm. Surprise surprise my room of course was still not ready. All they have available was standard double bed rooms and I had requested a King room with a view. I was told they they would rush house keeping to get my room ready since I explained that we needed to go to our rooms to change asap.. I returned again 30 minutes later and was told it would be another hour to hour and a half because they were "behind". At this point I was extremely upset and asked whether I would be allowed to check out late since they are making me check in hours past check in time. The rude front desk person said absolutely not and there was nothing they can do. We had to leave for an appointment and we were finally able to check in when we returned at 6:45pm. It seems like the people at the front desk don't have any customer service skills and they don't really care about our business because they already have alot of business from airlines and conventions. Although I was extremely unsatisfied with the service I am giving this hotel a 3 because the view from our room was wonderful and the beds were super comfy. Also, the location was perfect and they have a very good thai restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: kitkataf
Reviews.Content: The 2 rating is for my previous stays. The view rooms are clean, comfy, and modern. Didnâ€™t have trouble with noise issues on the upper floors. Great central location and price is affordable with their specials. However, after my stay this past weekend, I will never patronize them again. I booked a view king 2 months prior in anticipation of Valentineâ€™s Day. Upon arrival at 5:30, the receptionist insisted I had booked a double and tried to check me into one. Uh, I donâ€™t think so. I overhear others mention that they are fully booked and view kings wouldnâ€™t be available for at least 2 hours. She tells me the same. Normally it would not be an issue, however I needed to prepare and had dinner reservations at 7:30. Long story short, I ended up with a smoking king on the 8th floor, which turned out to be two doubles when I arrived at the room. I was over it at this point. The room itself, aside from the smokey halls, was clean and furnished the same as my previous stays. If youâ€™re a light sleeper as I am, be prepared for a restless night. Thereâ€™s a reason they provide earplugs. Overall, their lack of care and concern is troublesome. They didnâ€™t even bother to refund part of my rate until I mentioned it. This hotel is large and caters to conference goers and airline crews, so I doubt they care about the occasional traveler. Donâ€™t be enticed by the low rates. All it brings about is uncertainty. They couldnâ€™t pay me to stay here again â€“ ever.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: fool4travel
Reviews.Content: We live very close to San Francisco, but when we are really going out on the town we always stay the night. Usually we do Priceline's Bid Your Own and enter "Union Square East, 4 star." We either get Westin St. Francis, Hilton on O'Farrell St or Parc 55. We always hope to get Parc 55. Hilton is nice because you can park a little cheaper right across the street in the garage, but Parc 55's rooms are so so nice. They are plush with big bay windows, sometimes two of them. Every room I have ever had here has had a really nice view. The rooms are spacious and sometimes quite spacious. If you are lucky enough to get the corner rooms, wow! All that for 90 to 130 USD depending on the time of year. My favorite hotel in the City for location and value!! Oh, and by the way, if you read really bad reviews, double click on the reviewer's name and see how many reviews they have. If they have only one or all of their reviews have been poor, then you know what you're dealing with. If you are still unsure, send them a message and see if they respond!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the city”
Reviews.Author: Shugsterhibs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our four year old daughter for four nights at the end iof January, using it as a place to stay while we checked out San Francisco. As others have said, the location could not be better. The Powell- Hyde cable car line is across the road which gives access straight to Union Square (only a couple of blocks away anyway) right down to the piers on the waterfront for $5 a ride (cheaper if you buy mutlipass tickets). Tourist Information office is just adjacent to it too, as is the giant five floor shopping mall with Bloomingdales in it. It is used by a lcouple of airlines to put their staff up in, and that's a good recommendation for me - they wouldn't place them somewhere bad! Rooms were a good size and well maintained, staff were very good. Airport is a ten minute $40 trip away. We did have a problem when checking out when we were charged for a breakfast we had never had, but this was dealt with quickly and removed from our bill no bother. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased”
Reviews.Author: oheckbeth
Reviews.Content: After reading some unfavorable reviews about this hotel, I was very skeptical about booking here. However, there were other reviews that were much better so I decided to take a chance. I was very pleasantly surprised with the whole experience! I believe the rooms have been recently updated - nice flat screen TV's and very soft and comfortable bed linens. The staff was very friendly and helpful with every question I had. The location of this hotel can't be beat - a five minute walk to Union Square and a 1 minute walk to the BART station. The Westfield mall - a 2-minute walk away has a fantastic food court in the lower level which makes it convenient and reasonable to eat - a real plus. You,re also only a 2 minute walk to the trolly turn- around. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant - (it has been temporarily moved to a different location in the hotel due to remodeling) - but the menu looked good...although the breakfast seemed a bit pricey. We stayed for five days and got what I thought was a great price on this hotel through a package deal with hotels.com I would definitley reccomend this hotel to any traveler! B.R. - Baltimore, MD

Reviews.Title: “Loved Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: pollardville
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel and what a fabulous Hotel, newly remodeled, very clean, very helpful staff. The location of the hotel is perfect. We rode BART from SFO, got off at Powell and literally walked across the street to the hotel, it couldn't have been more convienient. The Cable Car is right there as well. Nice restaurants and plenty of shopping all within walking distance. Very enjoyable stay and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Just by the underground and cable car”
Reviews.Author: Waikatosflyingkiwi
Reviews.Content: Check in and out quick and friendly. Questions answered with knowledge and a smile. No in room safe but reception has free security boxes. Room clean, comfortable and with a view. Stayed four days and it was a great base to explore the city. Yes there are vaigrants in close prox but these cup people ARE all over the city not just by this hotel. Fishermans wharf very very quiet. Feeling the pinch. A walk to the Golden Gate Bridge is for the fit but the reward is worth it, a bike can be hired from many shops but carry photo id just in case they require it. Told of a bar down Haight st just short of Filmore st called Toronado. 50 beers. Bar staff very knowledgable, so just ask for the style you like and hay presto one will appear thats just right. A walk through the San F gardens also well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: blondeegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in November, and really had no problems. Room was nice with a large bathroom. Clean, comfortable beds, pleasant people and the hotel is in a very convenient location. Will definitely consider staying here again, if they run a special. Parking charge is terrible, but that's San Francisco! One comment I will make is the bar was pretty pricey in their drink charges, so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel - Completely Overrated - STAY SOMEPLACE ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: Xistentialnyc
Reviews.Content: 100% overrated. Do not fall for the "4-star" rating as I did, the Parc 55 is basically a Super 8 Motel that added some additional features to earn 4 stars (like putting an old phone in the bathroom). The room service was basically frozen food that was microwaved and they turn down the intensity of the a/c at about 10:30am each day to save themselves money but that means that if you're in the room after that, you'll sweat a lot (as I did each day!). The hotel staff are not friendly (except for the house keepers) and when I complained I didn't even receive a call back. I complained again and asked for the manager to call me but nothing. The area is also not that safe at night as there were a lot of vagrants around starting at sundown. Oh, and parking is $50 per day... yes, $50 (with tax)!!! Across the street at a much nicer boutique hotel, they were charging only $25 per day. You may think you are getting a good price by staying here but if you are truly used to 4 or 5 star hotels, this will utterly disappoint. If you are used to 2 start hotels, then this is the hotel for you. I was fooled by all the good reviews online at most travel sites but after looking at many of them, it is obvious they are reviews posted by the hotel themselves just to pull people in. Don't be fooled by those pseudo-reviews... this hotel is awful and there are many (MANY!) better places to stay in SF. Don't suffer as we did... stay someplace else. I HIGHLY recommend you stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Its the little things that could have counted”
Reviews.Author: DragonKaty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for a few days prior to my trip to Australia. I had chosen it because of its location, and that certainly didn't disappoint. A block to the trolley cars and to Market Street, a couple blocks to Union Square - it was all so close. This is clearly a hotel made for meetings, conventions and airline staff. Us other folks were pretty much ignored or stared at by the staff - somewhat disconcerting. I went looking for the hotel restaurant one morning, taking the escalator right next to the bell station and the four or five bellmen there just stared at me as I went up, and then again as I came down a few minutes later. Here is a thought: instead of staring why not mention that you can't get to the restaurant that way? Why not move the big sign for the restaurant from next to the escalators and put it next to the elevators, as that is the only way to get there? I also got the stare when I tried to find a way into the hotel from Ellis Street. In fact, despite seeing lots of people struggling with their bags, the only thing I ever saw the bell men do was stare blankly at people... If you are going to stay, try and get a high level floor. I was on one of the lower floors, which provided a lot of traffic noise and no view. I am used to that so I wasn't too upset by the former, but the view provided gave me a direct look into the apartments of the people across the street. Another problem with low floors is that it is impossible to get on an elevator on your checkout date. I waited for almost half an hour, watching full elevator car after car go by, unable to get me and my heavy international suitcases in. I finally ended up taking a car up and then coming down again. All of those things are sort of expected in a hotel, so I could put up with them. The one thing I did wish was fixable was the thickness of walls. On my last night there was a large Christmas party being held at the hotel, with many folks staying over. The people in the room next door returned to their room VERY noisily around 3 a.m. and were quite active for a while after (he likes to the called "the King" if you get my drift). Still, the room itself was very large, water pressure int he shower was great and the bed was WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Never never again”
Reviews.Author: rttfons26
Reviews.Content: DONT GO THERE!!!! They are stealing me money!! I stayed there 3 nights for a conference, then when I wanned to check out they wanned to charge me two breakfast that I never had. I complained and they said they were no going to charge it, but now I have just come home and saw that they did it!! They are just stealing me money!! Now I am in Europe and I have to spend I don't know how much money calling them for cancelling that if they want!! The place is ok, but as good as any other 4 stars hotel, you don't get a penny more than what you pay. I honestly don't recommend it at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelTX
Reviews.Content: After seeing this hotel during a tour on the cable car, we walked in to see if they had any rooms available for that night. They told us they were completely booked and if they had any rooms, they were $229 per night. We then went outside and used my husband's phone to call Hotels.com. They immediately booked us a room in this same hotel for only $119.00. It was a very nice hotel and a beautiful view of downtown San Francisco. It's not something I would do all the time but nice for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Hey - were you born in a barn???”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park55 for NYE. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable. BUT, what the heck is up with people slamming doors all night long??? I have stayed at some really nice hotels in my day, and Park55 is what I consider a nice hotel. Great location, large clean room, attentive staff, nice views, etc. . . but one thing they have not conquered is how to design a hotel room door that does not slam to the point of rattling the walls all the way down the hall. I think I lost a molar at one point. We were located at one end of the building, in a little alcove, so I thought we were pretty secluded. BUT NOOOOOO. . . . all night long. . . BAM BAM BAM. . . And, to save the hotel 100% responsibility for this, have the people that STAY at the hotel not figured out that if THEY shut the door easily, it won't slam ??? Think about it the next time you travel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay but not my last at the Parc 55. I arrived in the late afternoon on New Year's Eve. The streets around downtown SF were packed with visitors as was the hotel lobby. I'd estimate there were at least 50 people checking in ahead of me. However, the professional desk staff greeted each person with a smile and never lost their cool. I asked for an upper floor room and they gave me a choice of three. I selected a room on the 19th floor facing Market Street. It was exactly as the pics. on their website. Very nicely refurbished with a goiod size bathroom, large flat screen TV and sensational views. The entire hotel, including my room, the hallways and public areas are very clean and neat. One caveat, the room would be smallish for more than two people. Great for a single person or couple, but probably a bit snug for families.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AndyT_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here around our 30th wedding anniversary. We had a Club room next to the Executive Club Lounge with complimentary cold buffet breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres. We didnâ€™t have a car, and the disabled entrance is in the parking bay which I thought a tad odd, though a reasonable compromise. Quite often, I would tell my wife to go into the main entrance, while I dashed around. As a disabled person, the whole infrastructure at San Francisco was the best I have ever encountered anywhere in the world. The room was huge and exceptionally clean comprising of a kitchenette (with two types of fully stocked coffee makers), dining and living area, and two bathrooms. The views were excellent and we didnâ€™t really notice any noise either from traffic or from other guests meaning that the walls were well insulated. A request for a fridge for medication was responded to within 15 mins of arrival. All the hotel staff were very amicable, especially the executive lounge hosts and the doorman who was full of information and always very helpful. The only criticism is that checkin was quick in our case, but we often noticed queues of around 5 -10 mins. Not really an issue for us as we only needed to go there on arrival and departure. I highly recommend this hotel if staying at Club Level and want to be close to Union Square. We would certainly not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucks!!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtour94
Reviews.Content: Not only does this hotel have horrible service but the noise from outside can be heard all through the night (even on the top floors).

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eilth
Reviews.Content: A good city-centre hotel. Close to the cable car, tour buses, shopping, cinema etc. Good size rooms with a huge bathroom. Hotel is used by a lot of the airline staff (BA etc) so it must be decent! Make sure you leave plenty of time for checking out as it can get very busy and there are only a few desks.

Reviews.Title: “could be better....”
Reviews.Author: kaitheguy
Reviews.Content: it was not perfect i tell you! they had great deal on parking package, and that's the reason i chose this hotel over others. when i entered the room, it was not bad, it's smaller than i thought, but we are in SF rite. i found those things are not acceptable when i stepped in the room 1. cigarette burnt towel 2. stained bath tub 3. HUMAN HAIR ON THE BED! Which is very very very disgusting i called the for housekeeping, waited for quite a long time. but the service was nice and quick. the other thing are not acceptable are: 1. really bad tones over the phone (one is jenny and one i forgot) 2. takes long time to pick up the phone 3. concierge is almost never there (and that's wat i need) the hotel is old, but not that bad, some are not nice, but the valet people are polite compare to others. the location is great tho. very close to every major shopping places, and close to union square (but seriously there are not much things to do at union square, seriously!) after all, it was not a bad trip. oh it has a sofa bed (single size) so if u wanna save money and crush with friends, u can do that

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: niklev
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous....location, excellent! It was beautiful, clean, well-staffed and felt ultra upscale without an ultra upscale price. We had the most gorgeous view with enormous picture windows on two side of our room. It felt wonderful to come home to at the end of each long sight seeing day. Will definitely stay again on our next trip to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: billybastings
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week after a cruise. Location was perfect as close to Union Square & easy access to all local transport. A few pan handlers in area as close to the Tenderloin but no concerns about safety. The hotel itself would not win any beauty contests as quite bland (apart from the bedrooms) but very comfortable and clean. Reception staff were always very friendly, allowed us to check in at 8am and also upgraded us! Busy hotel and particularly popular with airline staff. Before arrival I had concerns about excess noise as had read previous reviews. The hotel had provided ear plugs which I used on occasions because I'm a light sleeper. I didn't have any problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: water7996
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early November after touring CSUSF with our 17-year old daughter - wanted to get a little shopping in while in the City. This is a nice hotel - the rooms are spacious, nicely furnished and clean. The shower was one of the best I have found in California. The staff was friendly and the price was reasonable too, but the location is what it's all about. Directly across the street from the Westfield Mall (Nordstrom, Bloomies, and hundreds of others), the cable car turnaround is steps away and Union Square is just two blocks up. It's right in the middle of the best shopping in SF. We are returning with friends for Christmas shopping and a night on the town - rooms are $99 starting on Dec 18. We've stayed at many of the hotels around Union Square over the years, and this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Value”
Reviews.Author: kdeely
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in mid-November following a friend's recommendation. Wonderful location in the heart of downtown a stone's throw from the Cable Car terminus. Walking distance to great stores, restaurants and convenient to all of the major attractions. Rooms were clean, modern and extremely comfortable (our view from the 26th floor was magnificent!). Concierge was extremely helpful and staff very accomodating. Excellent value for the location (about $140 per night plus tax). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: Dec105
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 had a very good deal for a week's stay in November - the more nights you stayed, the lower the average rate per night. So, a week's stay worked out pretty well. The hotel itself is quite excellent (noticed a lot of airline crews staying there - always a good sign). Room quality and other creature comforts are of a high standard, as might be expected. The best feature, of course, is location - right in the middle of the downtown action. Close to Union Square for shopping and nightlife, and right beside the Powell St BART and Muni stops - ideal for airport connections as well as general public transport around the city (the wonderful F-line street car on Market St runs all the way down to Fisherman's Wharf or you can take the scenic route using the cable car). We didn't rent a car (no need) but the hotel did seem to have decent parking facilities. Bars and restauarants within the hotel were good, although we tended to eat elsewhere - given the wonderful selection of eateries and drinking emporiums all within ten minutes of the hotel (and no need for taxis either). Highly recommended if you can get a good deal on price.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Our Anniversary!! :o(”
Reviews.Author: nutbass
Reviews.Content: We would like everyone to know that this anniversary weekend was completely ruined by the hotel and it's staff. How anyone stays there is beyond me with that kind of service and complete disregard for their guests well being. There are many things that I have listed that are completely the hotels fault and responsibility - I left a comment card and information regarding the concerns we had in the comment box in the lobby. I will go to all sites of reservations and let them know exactly what the hotel has done and not done and how it completely ruined our weekend. This weekend had been planned in advance and special request for a romantic anniversary was made and not delivered. Instead we were treated with disrespect and discourtesy. Not only did we not receive one apology for the hotels mishaps but we were treated this terribly from the moment we stepped foot into the lobby to the time we checked out this morning! * 11/14/08 arrived at hotel with itenerary in hand and the woman at the front desk did not have our reservation. *we were booked in a deluxe view room with a king bed, and they had booked all those and took that room away from us and gave us a standard double queen room with a view that seemed smaller! * once she found the reservation (5 minutes) she gave us the two room keys to room # 2520 * we had been driving a while and were thirsty so we went to the hotel bar on the 2nd floor = when we asked for the check the waitress stated that our names were not in the computer and gave us someone else's name on that room number 2520. * we walked up to our floor 25 and our room 2520 and when we tried to open the room it would not allow us to. we were confused and tired and had to go back downstairs to get a new room?? a new key?? * when we came back downstairs there were several people in line which we had to wait for 15 minutes to get a key and new room. * when we were helped the woman (a different one this time) did not really apologize and just said something that the original agent must have made a mistake and gave us our new key to a new room #2570 * when we finally got the right room number and room keys we went up to our room there was absolutely nothing in the room that indicated that it was our anniversary or any special items left for us to enjoy... there was even no refridgerator!! It had been stated in the original booking that it was our anniversary and to make us a more romantic weekend - but not one "happy anniversary" or anything! *I came down around 3am to talk with a manager because I figured there would be no wait at the front desk. the night manager said that I should mention my concern to the daytime manager and also mentioned that booking with expedia you are not guaranteed your original booking... which I thought was completely absurd - shouldn't the hotel take good care of every guest - no matter who made the reservation???!?!!?!? *while staying on the 25th floor we got thirsty for a sprite - so I walked down the hall and put 2 dollar bills and one quarter ($2.25) for a sierra mist out of the vending machine and the money was stuck - so I called the front desk as referred by a hotel staff that noticed this, I called and was rudely told that I would have to come downstairs to the front desk and ask for a refund and you don't think that's sort of an inconvenience?? I would have bought a soda at the store if I had known there would have been such a problem! *for an evening of trying to make a terrible weekend turn a key - we decided to stay in and get a bottle of red wine to enjoy while we watched the view. I called to have some "Kim Crawford" pinot noir, it was listed in the menu in the room, I called room service and was told that they don't have that wine but they had "Chalone" pinot noir and that the bottle price wasn't listed but that it would be $40.00, when the bill came with the wine it was 55 dollars and was never informed what the $15.00 overcharge was for. Overall I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and would give very bad reviews to where ever we can to let people know that we were guests but were made to feel like outcasts at this Parc 55 hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenquack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 3rd-10th November whilst visiting San Francisco for a holiday and were not disappointed. We booked late- the night before so got a great deal. We arrived with not having had the best start to the holiday as my partner had lost his wallet on the plane, and the staff could not have been more helpful. They were so friendly and polite, and our room was upgraded to a king room with a view straightaway. The room itself wasn't huge, but plenty big enough- with an unbelievably comfy king-size bed. The view was just amazing- from the 24th floor we could see Union Square, the TransAmerica Pyramid, etc. The bathroom was very spacious, and the shower pressure was amazing- nearly knocked me off my feet! The only thing slightly disappointing was that internet access was charged for additionally- but that's a small point. We also had a large flatscreen TV, excellent climate control, and tea/coffee maker. Went to the hotel bar once, and the waiter was extremely friendly, and drinks were not expensive. However, DON'T eat in the hotel. The food was VERY poor quality for what you paid. I ordered the sea bass and I could swear I was given cod instead - didn't look at all like sea bass and my partner's pizza seemed to have been microwaved and he could not finish it. The restaurant itself is a tiny room at the back of the hotel- much like a disused conference room, and freezing cold. I recommend skipping this and going to one of the nearby restaurants- there are hundreds to choose from all at the same or better prices! The location of the hotel was excellent- literally seconds from the Muni Bart station, the cable car stop, the streetcar stop, and bus stops. Several resturants across the street from the hotel all reasonably priced and good food, or go to Union Sq 3 blocks away (10mins walk) for plenty more restaurants to choose from. Italian on the corner of Ellis St is very nice. You cannot go wrong with this location! Transfer from the airport on BART is $5.30 one way, and takes around 30minutes. Very convenient given the proximity of the hotel to the station, and much cheaper than a taxi. The streetcar stops less than a block away from the hotel, and goes all the way down to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and the Ferry Building etc. Shopping nearby is excellent- less than a block away from Bloomingdales at the San Francisco shopping centre, and 3 blocks away from Union Sq with Macy's, Tiffanys etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at convenient, well-priced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jw263
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two-night stay at Parc 55 Hotel in Union Square, San Francisco, CA and it was wonderful. The hotel is very conveniently located: from the SFO airport, we took the BART to Powell St. station (~45 min) for $5.35 one-way and the hotel was just across the street as we exited the station. The desk staff was very friendly and efficient--it took <5 minutes to get our room. Once upstairs, we were pleasantly surprised. Our room w/ king-size bed was nicely sized and everything from the carpet to the furniture looked clean, modern, and tasteful.
