Furnishings were nice, bedding very comfortable, nice marble bathroom with blow dryer, coffee maker, and terry robes. We had an awesome view of the city looking south and west. The hotel has a restaurant, bar, and fitness center. I guess the only thing that wasn't available was a pool, hot tub, or sauna. I was told they are going to be remodeling for some of those facilities soon. The location is the best...short walk- 1 block to the cable car and Bart Stop, Westfield Shopping Mall (really nice) and just about any store or type of restaurant you'd want to go to around Union Square.The price was great on Expedia, cheaper than some other websites and the hotel website. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience th Parc 55 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tango01071955
Reviews.Content: The extra cost for the Club style rooms is a wonderful value!!! We could not have asked for a better hotel. The Parc is centrally located, right in the middle of everything. The hotel staff was a pleasure to assist, the bath products were wonderful, the linens were top notch - just like the quality we have at home. I can not wait for our next visit. We stayed here for business, but are looking forward to a vacation there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaelinCB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a nice post-Valentines weekend at the Parc55. We got a great room rate from Hotwire.com. Our room was smallish, but comfortable. The king size bed was comfy, especially the down pillows and comforters. The bathroom had a phone in it! Good location for those who don't mind exploring the city by cable car, MUNI, BART, taxi, or on foot. We had an OK lunch in Barley & Hops Bar and Grill. Downsides: we were near the elevator, so we experienced a lot of noise from the hallways. The hotel was hopping, full of airline employees. Mold on the bathroom ceiling above the shower. After depleting the in-room coffee we went in search of lobby coffee for which they wanted $3. Fortunately, a coffee place was right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare front desk at checkin, good location, hefty parking fee”
Reviews.Author: norcaltravel
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms at the Parc 55. Arrived around 2PM (check-in 3PM) Was told no rooms were available until at least 4PM. The front desk (Erika I believe) was as unfriendly as I have ever experienced in years of travel. Probably better suited for a less visible position in the hotel. I understood 3PM, but 4 or 5 would make us late for our dinner and show. Also, parking came to a whopping $61 for a 24 hour period so keep that in mind if driving in as that raises the cost of the hotel significantly. We will take BART next time as the station is about half a block away. Finally got the rooms around 5pm but not on the same floor even though booked together. This was OK except that one of the rooms turned out to be a handicap room with no tub, a modified toilet seat, doors, etc... Called the front desk and they agreed to move us. Back downstairs and another wait in line for a room. By now it is almost 6PM and we are still not checked in and definately not able to eat dinner prior to our show. Back up to our new room and we discover that a makeup bag is missing. We speculate it was left in the handicap room when we moved in and back out so quickly. The front desk has already reassigned this room and cannot, or will not, allow housekeeping and/or security to check the room without the new occupants permission. (even though the bag is unmistakable and has been described to them in detail.) The front desk indicates they do not have a lost and found, only housekeeping keeps things left in rooms. OK, we agree to try later as it is our fault the bag is missing. When we come back from a late night out we check again with an extremely helpful night manager at the front desk who tells us she will check lost and found and with security again. (Thought there was no lost and found. Hmmmm.) No luck. We go to bed and about a half hour later gun shots in the neighborhood and lots of sirens. We had just walked two blocks from Mel's Diner. Yikes! Next morning we call the other room ourselves and low and behold the bag is there and is retrieved. Much better start to day two than day one. All in all, the location is excellent and the rooms were good. However, the front desk (Erika at least) needs a lesson in customer service. The night manager and the doorman were as friendly as you will ever find.

Reviews.Title: “great location comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: trvl4fun2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay. The room was very nice and the beds were very comfy. The city view was nice too. We were not bothered by noise as some reviews stated. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had lots of choices. All staff we met were extremely helpful and friendly. The toiletries provided were really nice. We booked Tower Tours from the Hotel and had a great tour. The guide was knowledegable and entertaining; I really learned a lot about the city. The location was terrific-----the trolley stop was just around the corner as was the Bart and lots of shopping right out the front door. A taxi to the Empress of China restaurant in Chinatown was around $7.00. The view and food was great. The restaurant was recommended by the hotel and it was a good choice. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daggar
Reviews.Content: I was just at the hotel while attending a convention at the Moscone Center. While the convention supplied transportation from the hotel, I chose to walk the short distance. Maybe 10 minutes. The hotel was great. The location was great just off of Market street, where you could catch a bus to anywhere. The turn-around for the old streetcars is just around the corner. In some directions, there are plenty of homeless, but, almost entirely, they were very passive. We didn't get approached a single time, though we passed many people with hats, boxes, or hands extended. I think that's just what you get in the big cities. If you do stay here, I highly recommend a breakfast at Dottie's True Blue Cafe around the corner. It's an old diner, but a real gem, and the breakfast was awesome. 622 Jones Street I think. Hotel services were what you would expect in a high end hotel. While I didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants, the hotel bars and pub were a great place to hang out with friends. Also, there is plenty of other nightlife within a couple of blocks, including a very interesting Irish pub. Highlights: Dependable lodging. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fitten06
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, wonderful staff, and exceptional location. Very easy to get to from the Bay Bridge (which was important since my friends were in Oakland), and a convenient walk away from the major SF attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel, it was my 3rd stay. It was the best experience of all my stays. I decided to book a room which had a better view this time and was given a room on the 19th floor that had a really nice view of the Civic Center area. Check-in and Check-out was fast. As I mentioned in my other reviews, the best thing about Parc Fifty Five is its location. My only minor gripe, and it is very minor, is to find out after I booked the reservation, that I could have got it $15 cheaper if I waited till later to book. Winter is slower, so hotels are willing to lower their rates if they have rooms available. Also, the sheets had holes in them, although the room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pglinfo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of the hotel website, the reviews, closeness to amenities and the link from the airport. All worked great. The check in was efficient and pleasant, the trip from airport was mega easy and inexpensive not to mention traffic free. The room was comfortable, roomy and for a main city location, great for the cable car etc for all you tourists like us. I would be pleased to recommend to fellow travellers. You can expect to pay a few pounds more in a city but at Â£73 quid a night, try getting this in London. This was a very pleasant stay. Bon voyage and I hope you all enjoy your stay, the food is pricy, but there are plenty of eating places around.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: figgyburn
Reviews.Content: great location right next to the bart station.but i must say the area around powell st and the cable car turnaround really is getting downmarket what with all the bums panhandling all day, everyday.they don't hassle you but you have to dodge them all the time.we went in december heavens knows what it would be like in the summer months.the hotel is great and the beds are wonderful i wish i could get one of these beds here in edinburgh i might get a good night's sleep!!.got a good price $110 which i think is great value.enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Julesbusiness
Reviews.Content: Parc55 is located about two minutes walk from Powell Street BART station so travelling from the airport to the hotel by train is so easy. Check in only took literally 30 seconds as the receptionist just swiped my credit card and gave me my room key. When booking, I opted for a room on one of the top floors as previous reviews have mentioned about traffic noise. The top few floors are named as an â€˜executiveâ€™ section, and as such this allows guests on these floors to enter the â€˜executive roomâ€™ on the top floor that has a small self service honesty bar, serves a continental breakfast in the morning and has a great view across the city. The room itself was very large, clean, fresh and in an excellent state of repair. I was fortunate enough to have a room on a corner of the hotel so had two large windows that gave me two different, but good views of San Francisco. The room had a large comfortable bed, large bathroom/shower, large wardrobe (and iron), sofa, TV and desk/chair. Daily maid service was excellent as was the turndown service. The room was quiet, and I didnâ€™t experience any noise either from in the hotel or from outside. Checkout through the TV was simple and I just dropped off the key in the box in the lobby on the way out. I have to admit that aside from my speedy check in, I didnâ€™t interact with the staff at all as everything was to my satisfaction and all of the services that I used could be self activated and were easy to understand and follow. I guess the only downside is that, as mentioned in a previous review, the amenities in the business centre are very expensive. I used the internet, which was somewhat pricey, but had no intention of using the printer which had an outrageous price per sheet. San Francisco is well known for its homeless population, and a great number congregate around the BART station area just around the corner from the hotel. Whilst they may be an annoyance, I found them to be harmless enough and not in the least bit aggressive. In fact, one of my evening forms of entertainment was going to a convenience store around the corner from Parc55 to buy some chocolate and join in with the banter from the people hanging around outside. This may not be everyoneâ€™s cup of tea for an hours entertainment in SF, but it demonstrates that these people are approachable and not out to kill us all. Parc55 is in an excellent central location. As mentioned, it is very close to the BART station, so great for the airport, and is also close to the trams that take you to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf and the cable cars for exploring the city. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the large department stores of Bloomingdales, Macys and Nordstrom as well as all of the others in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mtabakman
Reviews.Content: Pleasant welcome, clean and comfortable room, nice location next to Powell St. BART station, and just a couple blocks from Union Square. What more could you ask for? Oh yeah, got it for $99 on Priceline too. Add this to your list of downtown SF hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: lola315
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for $100, which is a pretty good deal for the city... although, the last 3 or 4 times we booked a room in the city for the same price on Priceline (Name Your Own Price) we've gotten either The Omni or The Westin St. Francis (which are both quite a bit nicer and overall a better value). The Parc 55 was nice enough though. Our room was very large for San Francisco, and had lots of huge windows which were very nice. There was a little sitting area by the windows which we liked, and the bed was really comfortable. We were in a great location walking distance to all the stores and restaurants in Union Square. We really didn't notice the hotel being in a bad area, but I guess we kind of knew which way not to walk to avoid being in the Tenderloin district (the people at the hotel are pretty good about informing people which way not to go). The things we did not like about the room: it smelled very musty and just gross when we arrived (there was some weird air cleaner machine in there which I guess was supposed to make it better, but really it just looked tacky and didn't do much for the smell); the bathroom was very dated and the floors did not appear to be very clean; lastly, it was really noisy in the morning due outside traffic, yelling, sirens, etc. (the hotel provided ear plugs for this). Overall, the negatives were very mild and for the price I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Too Small, A Little Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: cblase
Reviews.Content: So I bookedthe room through Hotwire and you could say I got what I deserved, but usually Hotwire gets me one of those cute boutique hotels in the shopping district. This time I got a big, bland building full of glass and steel. The room was disappointingly small and not high enough up to avoid the street people screaming and acting crazy. The creepiest parts were the dirty room service tray parked right outside the room and the dirty hand towel on the rack above the toilet. My suspicion is that the staff thought they only needed to do turndown service and not a full room cleaning. So who knows if the sheets were used? Beware of the $45 parking fee. I think nearby garages will charge less. If you're willing to hoof it, I'd check theSutter/Stockton or the 5th and Mission garages.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: cienpasos
Reviews.Content: January 4, 2008...the Bay Area's worst storm in several decades. The wind outside was ripping trees down, knocking over trucks, and carrying small children and dieters down the streets like runaway cable cars. The rain was coming down in horizontal torrents! Stepping-out of the hotel was risky. Obviously, the Parc 55 had no control over the weather. However, I didn't see them do a single thing to ease the burden of their challenged guests. Could they have offered free hot coffee and tea? No, Parc 55 decided to continue charging for this basic service. Could they have offered free WiFi to guests who were stranded in their rooms for two days? No, they charge $12.95 for internet. Could they have opened a couple of cheap bottles of wine and offered a social hour in their lounge (many hotels in SF do this)? No, their crews with ladders and other equipment commandeered the lounge to take down Christmas decorations forcing all to retire to their rooms. I spoke with the front desk suggesting that perhaps the WiFi charge could be waived concerning the circumstances, the answer was, â€œWe have no control over the weather.â€� Don't get me wrong...Parc 55 is a beautiful property with a splendid location. I am sure that the staff was as stressed as the guests. I am disappointed, however, with the Parc 55. This was an opportunity for them to step up and make a difficult time for their guests a little better...even memorable. Too bad, huh! The whole time I was sitting in my room looking out the window, I kept wondering what the other hotels were doing for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripsRUS
Reviews.Content: I think the location of this hotel is great if you enjoy Union Square and the Market Street area. My husband, my parents and I flew into Oakland and took BART into the city. The BART stop at Market and Powell is directly across the street from the hotel. While I think the hotel was in better shape when it was a Marriott property, I still think you can get a good price for a fairly nice room. The only complaint I have was that our rooms were not ready until after 5 p.m. This is a large conference hotel and several events were going on when we visited. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great shopping location!!”
Reviews.Author: dgibb
Reviews.Content: I stayed a Saturday night at Parc 55. It was the same weekend as the marathon. Our check in was quick and the room was nice size. The bed was very comfortable. Shopping is right outside the door as is the Powell Street Bart station. Easy to get from airport to hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: lauderdalebob
Reviews.Content: Almost let this review get away, but I decided I definitely do want to write something about this hotel. Stayed there for 5 nights from Dec. 3-8, 2007, and didn't have one complaint about the place. I booked a few months in advance over the hotel's website and got a fabulous rate of $111 per night plus tax for the Club Room Floors. Ended up upon check-in being put on the top floor (Rm. 3209) and the room and the view (in particular) were spectacular. Stayed at the Grand Hyatt last year (also club floor) and paid more than twice this price and I really feel the Parc 55 is superior. One reason being that I had a rental car for both stays and where the Grand Hyatt you have to pull up in the street in a lot of heavy traffic to hand the car over to valet parking, the Parc 55 has a circular drive off of the street and it was a cinch. Yes, parking was $40 a night plus tax plus I tipped them each time I got the car out, but it was still cheaper than staying at one of the other hotels, given the $111 Club Level room rate here The Club Level breakfast was teriffic! Bagels, cereals, croissants, etc. Even sliced meats for breakfast if you wanted them. Couldn't have been any nicer. I lived in SF for 10 years and love driving there, maybe it's just me but I love driving on all the hills. Anyway, do not hesitate about booking here. The place was immaculate and service was outstanding, from the parking valet to the housekeeper to the front desk staff. Enjoy SF!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, not worth the upgrade, poor reception staff”
Reviews.Author: vangelisd
Reviews.Content: Spend a few days at Grand hyatt , few in Monterey and back to SF for a few more at Parc 55. That was the worst experience of all. I did book quite in advance, requested a city view room, paid for an upgrade to a "View" room, mentioned that it was our honeymoon, and all I got when I arrived was a 21st floor room with a view at a construction yard at the back of the hotel! After numerous attempts to request a front city view I was turned down with typical answers such as "we're fully booked", "your room has a spectacular view, why do you want to change", "try again tomorrow morning". Apart from overlooking the construction yard and hearing all the noice in the morning the stay was quite ok. Nothing special, rooms are big but the bed was not really comfortable, carpet was/looked dirty, bathroom ok, amenities ok. Cleaning staff were superdb but the front desk were really bad and counldn't be botherd. Same for the conierge who weren't very helpful and looked quite bored just sitting there. The hotel caters for a lot of business travelers and lots of airline crews! Didn't bother with any of the bar/restaurants as the are so many at close proximity. Location was great though, oposite from the Shopping centre and the Bart/cable car stations that was very convenient. Our stay at the Grand Hyatt was so much better, great rooms and views, superb beds, nice touches such as an ipod docking station, great bath and bathroom products, a lot friendlier staff. Wish I had stayed there for all part of our SF stay. Not worth the view upgrade unless they can guarantee a city view. Other wise you get as bad view as you would get with a cheaper rate but on a higher floor!

Reviews.Title: “Tainted Experience; Risky Reservations”
Reviews.Author: seafloorscott
Reviews.Content: "Anyone can take a reservation; the trick is holding the reservation" -- Jerry Seinfeld Had reservations for two nights, Dec 13 - 14 2007 but stayed here only one night. Why? I tried to check into this hotel early on Dec 13, when I arrived in the city. I picked this hotel because it was near Moscone Ctr and BART and had a reasonable price. This hotel is a haven for foreign flight crews leaving SFO. A flight delay meant that at least myself and the two people in line with me had been bumped from the hotel so these stewardesses could cool their heels for a few more hours. Bonus - they comp'ed my stay at the Fairmont. They gave me a taxi voucher which wasn't accepted to get to the Fairmont. It took them nearly an hour to deal with the mess on their end, and another hour to deal with getting up to the Fairmont and checked in there. I came back to the Parc 55 for my second night in the city. The room was nice, pretty much unremarkable for this class of hotel in downtown SF. Even on the second go-around the desk staff was very slow. Given all of the problems that I experienced, and the I would rather stay at one of the large number of other hotels near Union Square that might actually hold my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, front desk consistently poor”
Reviews.Author: MikeGray
Reviews.Content: Firstly, for the most part, the hotel is excellent - the location is perfect for BART, for shopping in Union Square and just generally getting about the city. There is certainly some homelessness in the immediate area, but that's true throughout the city and shouldn't be counted against the Parc. The rooms themselves are big enough and have all the standard amenities you'd expect from a 4* hotel. My only problem was the front desk - surly during check in and unhelpful at other times. For instance, they have an internet connection in the lounge on the second floor which uses pre-paid cards and advertises them. Except they don't actually have any. Front desk's attitude was basically "not got any, not our problem", which stinks for a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the parc 55. perfect”
Reviews.Author: mickeytheshoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Parc 55 for 5 night from 26 nov and had an excellent stay. We arrived late at night and luckily there were no queues.Before I had arrived i had mailed the hotel looking for a high floor room as im a very light sleeper and to my surprise they had upgraded me to a Club room on the 29th floor. When i got to my room i also found out that this includes a free continental breakfast buffet every morning and hors duerves in the evening.I never had the evening spread but we made full use of the breakfast. Excellent for setting you up for the day sightseeing. The room itself was very large with massive bed. It must have been close to 7 ft across and amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was also large with excllent toiletries and an amazingly powerful shower(something very important to me) We didnt eat in any of the restaurants(why would you with so many restaurants nearby). The hotel does get busy with airline staff and is definitely business orientated but what is wrong with that. when on a city break to see the sights and shop all you want is a professional clean and cost effective hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: pabl01neum
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is an acceptable hotel. I arrived mid-day on a Sunday for a conference. The line to check in was long, about a 15-20 minute wait. I checked in and went to my room, only to find that they'd given me a smoking room in spite of the fact that I'd reserved a non-smoking room. Back downstairs for another 20 minute wait in line, when they informed me that they didn't have any non-smoking available and that I should come back in a couple of hours when more rooms had been cleaned (this was at about 1:30 PM, well after check out time). I came back at about 3:00 PM stood in line again for 20 minutes and was then finally given a room. The waiting in line was a very bad start for my 6 days at the hotel. The 10th floor room was acceptable. The room was clean and the king bed was just fine. I'm not sure why they put 8 pillows on the bed now. The swing valve from the main bath spigot to the shower head broke on my second day there. The plumber guys arrived promptly and fixed it. Internet service was fine (although pricey at $12.95 for 24 hours). Street noise was fairly audible, but that's probably true for any San Fran hotel room. I'm a city kid, so it doesn't bother me too much. The hotel maid did a nice job of keeping the room clean. She actually left me a note thanking me for my tip the day before I left. The hotel "bar" was below average. Go visit the Irish pub up around the corner for a lively spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: blackford1
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel in Union Square area. Hotel is literally just steps from the BART station and the cable car to fisherman's wharf. Great area for shopping too. The room was clean, modern, and well appointed, with a spacious bathroom. I have no complaints, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Parc 55 met the expectations described here on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Olida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel from November 25th to December 1st with my wife and 2 and a half year old son. I have to say that there isn't much more I can add to my review that hasn't been said by most reviewers that have given the location 4 stars. Great location to Union Square and major shops. Walgreens across the street opens at 6 am so if you need any emergency supplies its very handy. The hotel itself is nothing special. The interior is quite bland and forgettable... a bit too much cream colour so everything sort of blends into one another. The staff was very nice and helpful. We stayed in a Club Room which is on the higher floors. Our room was on the 29th floor but we did hear the odd siren roar by from time to time during the night. The bedding and room interior was comfortable and clean. I paid $45 for a weeks worth of wifi internet for our room which is a bit much I think since I've stayed at Holiday Inns where you get it for free. The one thing I should warn people about is to not make too many calls from your room phone. They will charge you $1.00 to make a local call and in some instances charge you $4.99 for a "long distance" call even though the number has a 415 area code which is the San Francisco area. Even if you make a call and it rings and no one answers you will still be charged. Whats the deal with that? We had a couple of charges (the $4.99 kind) where it listed the call time as "0 minutes" which I contested. The reception was reasonable enough to remove the charges but I'm sure a lot of people have paid for the charge which seems like free money for the hotel. Overall it was an alright experience but I think next time I would like to stay in a hotel with a bit more character.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in SF”
Reviews.Author: UKflightattendant
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I didn't think I'd like this hotel. I think it might have been the awful architecture - it's hardly a pretty place - which looks very dated, and I suspected this might be reflected inside. However, I was pleasantly surprised. What really sells the Parc 55 is its location, right in the heart of things. Don't go and stay out in Fisherman's Wharf - this is where you really want to be. It is unfortunate that the panhandlers congregate very close to the hotel and I can understand that this might make some uncomfortable. However, as has been said, be polite and I don't think you'll get any trouble. The hotel is very handy if you're planning on taking a cable car, especially if you want an early start and to be ahead of the crowds and that long queue/line waiting to board. Also nearby are countless shopping opportunities, and the recently extended Westfield Mall is a great addition, with many familiar names. Rooms are remeniscent of many a hotel chain of this calibre. By this, I mean they're not especially individual, but I don't expect that from a property of this size. My room had two queen beds, and was, I felt, spacious for a US city-centre hotel - there aren't many I've stayed in which also accommodate a little lounge area with two cosy chairs! The 'bay' window style gives the room greater depth. Furnishings are pretty standard but of high quality and the room has a large closet with iron and ironing board. Altogether very comfortable. The bathroom is equally spacious with plenty of ameneties. The only thing which concerned me was the provision of earplugs - that didn't bode well! My room, on the 18th floor, wasn't exactly low but there is a fair level of noise throughout the night. Nothing more than the sounds of a major city, and I was only aware of it when I awoke during the night through jet-lag, but it might disturn some. I used the wireless internet access, though wired is also available in the room. Wireless fees were US$12.95 per. 24h. This I fee is reasonable, but then again, I am used to highly inflated fees in UK hotel rooms! A good option in SF if you want to be in the heart of it all, close to dining/shopping and with easy access to tourist opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: dc240v
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very comfortable and in a great location, a wonderful place to stay while exploring San Francisco. I dropped my bags off at the concierge stand before checking in and they arrived at my room minutes after I arrived. Later the concierge was very helpful in finding restaurants and getting tour information. If you can arrange it, stay in the club level floors, I think it is 27 and above, the club lounge is a great place to relax breakfast is free in the morning and hor'orderves and available in the evenings with an honor bar also available. Our corner room had breathtaking views of downtown San Francisco from the Embarcadero to the Golden Gate. This hotel will be high on my list when I return. We stayed the week of September 24th.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 4* hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: willowy74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for Â£102 a night though priceline. arrived at 11.30am and was checked in immediately sob a great start. We were put on the 13th floor ! im not suspicious luckily. Lovely reception area ~(very gold/brass) with six lifts. Gift shop on 2nd floor - open from 7am-9pm which sells soft drinks/gifts/stamps/sweets etc. Adequate health club and a bar and grill on the 2nd floor (sports bar type). Staff friendly, especially concierge/bell staff. The hotel is at the bottom of Powell St near the start of the cable car lines. Tickets can be brought at that point. You are in shopping heaven here - the westfield shopping malls house Bloomingdales/Abercrombie/eateries plus lots more). The BART station is outside the hotel and pan handlers do frequent this corner. They may ask for change but if you say sorry and walk on they leave you be. Dont turn right as you come out of the main area as this is the tenderloin district - dont venture. head towards cable car powell street (left). Beds comfie/hotel very clean / staff courteous - i would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with OK service”
Reviews.Author: Dad0fTwins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 for conference in November. Travelled with my wife and twin 1year olds. Room was not ready until 4pm, but that was OK. After much waiting, the room they gave us was occupied by another person! After further waiting, they did accomadate us with a great room with cribs on a high floor with great view. Area is centrally located, but you do have to put up with panhandlers. Valet parking is $40/day + tax - better off in garage. Overall, it was OK for the money (I paid conference rates), but would not likely stay there again unless the rate was very low.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Mandy7162
Reviews.Content: It's a large hotel with almost 1000 rooms and 32 floors. We stayed on #23 with nice views over the city. The room was alright and clean but the water pressure is weak and it took up to 10 minutes to get hot water. Internet is not cheap either with $9.95. Unfortunately this is from noon to noon, no matter when you check in or out. Its centrally located near Market and Powell Street with BART, bus and cable car right next door and many shopping opportunities nearby. We booked relatively late and paid $229 (1st night) and $249 (2nd night). I would only go back if we could get a lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: OCruiser
Reviews.Content: I know a lot of people hate big hotels, but I really enjoy them, and this one is no exception. It's very conveniently located to shopping and transportation (BART, MUNI). I know others have said that they found the vicinity unsafe, but I felt quite comfortable walking by myself in the evenings (and I'm a female). I didn't run into any panhandlers and it's so close to a busy shopping area that there are always a ton of people around. I found the rooms to be very up-to-date, clean and comfortable. Their bar soap (from a Pasadena company called Lather) was really nice and moisturizing. I didn't interact all that much with the hotel staff, but I did notice that every time in went in and out of the hotel, the doorman said hello with a smile I also ordered room service which was delivered in a timely fashion. The person that delivered my meal was very pleasant. The food was very nicely plated and surprisingly good for hotel food. I'd definitely recommend Parc 55 and stay there next time I'm in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the rate seemed reasonable for San Francisco but we feel we would have been better off paying a bit more for a better hotel. The room is not too bad but our bathroom was in the need of some updating and the plumbing needed some work. We waited for so long for our luggage to be delivered that my husband ended up going and getting it himself. When we approached the conceirge with a question he was rude even though he had been standing doing nothing at all. Don't plan on eating breakfast at the hotel as the prices are ridiculous. The best part about the hotel was the location for day travel. It is close to all means of transportation which is really important because you should avoid coming in by car if possible. The valet rate is $40 per night! There is really good shopping nearby however I do feel that this area is not safe at night. We went for a walk but returned very quickly because there were many, many beggars and street people as well as teenagers fighting in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, as long as you don't stray off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: melglaz
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the 55 Parc for a conference in October 2007 and since I travel fairly often to SF I wanted to note that this was was one of the better hotel experiences that I've had in the city, despite the hugeness of the hotel. The hotel rooms are kept up quite nicely and the staff is very helpful. The lovely rose in my bathroom and the gourmet chocolates at turndown were a great touch. I'd definitely stay here again. Some things to note, this is a huge tour bus hotel, so don't plan on going in on a Saturday with no reservation and being accomodated - it won't happen. Second, if you're a light sleeper ask for a room not on the main street - I've been told you can hear the the cars all night long - they do leave a pair of ear plugs in every room but since I was there for work, I couldn't risk not hearing the alarm. Third, for those unfamilar with the city, ask where not to walk! A few blocks in back of the hotel the area gets a bit sketchy, but if you pay attention, you'll notice the decline in the area right off - turn around and use the Bart, trolley or cable car to get where you want to go. There are some great places in SF and 55 Parc has moved up my list which is amazing since I tend to prefer the smaller boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous, but pretty nice....”
Reviews.Author: Minivern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 in October, 2007. We found it to be a nice hotel. Its courteous staff and superb location prompt me to give it a 4 star rating. As just noted, one of the hoteIs best assets is its location, which is conveniently situated to easy access to Union Square, BART, and the nearby conference center. That being said, however, the rooms are not well sound-proofed, and as the hotel is in the 'heart' of things, it can be a very noisy place to stay. During the night, we heard not only street noise (sirens, people shouting, garbage trucks) from our 16th floor room, but we also heard other guests coming and going (one particularly loud party woke us from a sound sleep at 2:15am). If you are sensitive to noise, you may want to consider asking for a room on a higher floor or taking earplugs with you for your stay at this hotel. Our room was comfortable, especially the bed. However, the decor was somewhat dated and didn't feel at all 'fresh.' The even more dated, large hotel bathroom somehow felt a little grimy -- perhaps because of its dated fixtures and circa 1980s tiles, but it also might have felt that way as a result of the the fact that some of the floor tiles were dirty. I like things really clean when I stay in a hotel (my husband would say I'm too picky), so the dirty floor tiles bugged me. We were unable to locate the safe in the room, but otherwise found everything we needed, includind hair dryer, iron, and coffee-maker. The staff we encountered were very courteous and professional, and this included everybody from housekeeping to the concierge (Rob was especially helpful) to the bell hops. After calling the front desk and asking for a nail file, as I'd forgottent to pack mine, one was delivered to my room within 5 minutes by a nice man. This expeditious, friendly service was a nice bonus. I would stay at this hotel again for its location and friendly staff, but wouldn't recommend it to someone who is really sensitive to dated room decor, somewhat dirty bathroom floor tiles, or noise. Although it isn't the nicest place I've stayed in SF, it is comfortable and was a terrific value for the area at $130/night via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “In like Flynt”
Reviews.Author: spoon47
Reviews.Content: Booked the 55 ages in advance as the start of my coast to coast trip across the US. A great spot to explore SF and also to unwind after about 18 hours of travelling. Service was excellent and recommend any room over the 7th floor for a decent view. Front desk even brought up a nice botttle of bubbly from my famry! Beds were comfy and loads of room in the rooms , internet access downstairs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: windvalley
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel for 1 night while exploring the city for 2 days. The front desk and concierge were fantastic and helpful, check in wasn't until 3pm but they gave me a room at 11am. The room wasn't huge and our view wasn't great but it faced away from the street (8th floor) so didn't have that much street noise. The location was superb, just steps from BART, shopping and Cable Car. I can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Turn left...”
Reviews.Author: Marmont
Reviews.Content: Needed a stopver hotel on the way back to NZ so I picked Parc 55 from Tripadvisor. Good choice. Super easy to get to from the airport - just get the BART ($5.15) to Powell. Hotel is on 5th and Market. 35 floors, 1000+ Rooms, close to the cable car and Union Sq shops. No mini bar so ventured out late Sat night to find a liquor store. Turned right out of main doors. Straight into George A Romero's Land of the Dead. Welcome to the Tenderloin. I don't think I've ever felt more scared in a major city. This is wino/crackhead country, you absorb the despair. In fact, just like in the zombie movies these unfortunates seem to accost you in slow motion, so it's all very Shaun of the Dead and not truly threatning after 5 minutes, but not the place to take your Mom for an evenin' stroll. Despite this, the hotel is great; $10 superb martinis in the piano lounge, sports bar, cheapest/best Thai restauraunt in SF all on site. For Happy Hour turn left out of main doors and go to Puccini & Pinetti on Magnin and Ellis - $3 for a glass of wine, $4 for a small pizza and well classy hotel attached. The Parc 55 is a big hotel with a big heart. Great location for zombie movie directors and money concious tourists alike.

Reviews.Title: “A few problems, but never the less, a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Musclebearnz
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Parc Fifty Five last Thursday night, just after midnight. Got a great rate on Expedia for a "view room" and requested a high floor (the hotel has 32 floors). I was given a room on the 14th floor. On arriving in the room, I found the room had not been cleaned after the previous guests had checked out. Trapsed all the way back to reception to complain. Some other guests were at reception complaining of the same thing!! The reception agent wasnt too pleasant and it seemed to be my fault the room hadnt been cleaned properly.. He gave me a room on the 9th floor.. Hardly a "high floor view room" which was what was requested. Next morning, I got an early "wake up call" at 7am.. Unfortunately, I never requested a "wake up call", again, the caller wasnt that pleasant or apologetic. Those were the only negative aspects of the stay! The room and facilities were lovely. After arriving from London and staying in a minute and cramped London hotel room, this room was huge by comparison. The facilities were great, lovely bed and a coffee maker that make beautiful coffee. The cleaning staff were lovely. On checking out, the doorman was excellent and rung the airport shuttle service twice to give them a hurry up as they were late picking me up. The hotel is in the Tenderloin region, which means a few homeless people around, but I never find them a problem, some of the time, they are very colourful and humourous, Ive never felt threatened by them. The hotel is also in a great location, right at the exit to the Powell St Bart/Muno station. Would definitely stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Great first experience”
Reviews.Author: badbadsal
Reviews.Content: After reading some mixed reviews of the parc 55, we decided that we would take advantage of their great online "labour day" special and book with them via their own web site. We were very apprehensive as other reviews noted alot of beggars in the area around the hotel. We found this to be true although it did not detract from our overall experience, they seem to be a way of life in Union square and are not at all aggressive. The hotel lobby was very clean and there was no line at check in. They had our reservation easily and the lovely lady on the desk got us a great room with a fantastic view of the city and the bay (see our candid traveller pics) The concierge was accommodating and friendly infact all the staff were very smiley and helpful. Check out was easy, done via the telephone in the room. Room was clean, quiet and plenty big enough. We did not take advantage of the bars or restaurants in the hotel as there are so many other great places to eat and drink in relatively easy distance. The hotel is literally across the road from the trams and the Bart station. We got the bart from the airport straight to the union square station and it was ideal. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good base in san francisco as the location is superb, and there were no problems with service what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Place”
Reviews.Author: mahenry
Reviews.Content: We went for our 40th anniversary on Sept 5, 2007 for 4 nts. and had a wonderul time. The location is ideal for any transportation. Took the Bart right from the airport and only cost $5.15 each. It is practically out the door from the station. The Cable, trolleys,buses etc. are across the street. We were only a few blocks from the theatre and Union Square 2 blocks away with all the shopping you could want. The service at the hotel was excellent, we had a real sweetheart at the desk that could not have been nicer. Stayed on the 26th floor with a gorgeous view of the city. The room was spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. The bed was comfortable. I would recommend staying above the 19th floor because there is city noise and construction noise that may bother you. We had breakfast at the Club room each morning and it was wonderful with great service, they also had drinks etc. in the evening with a fabulous view from the 31st floor. The concierge desk is very helpful with all your needs and directions for what to see being taken care of. The only down side was $40. a day to park. We flew in so that was not a problem and after our stay we headed back to the airport rented a car and finished our trip to Napa,Reno and Tahoe. We figured we would not need a car in the city. Also if you will be there a few days or more get a pass for all the transportation for a flat rate. It was $18 for 3days, where as just a cable car ride one way was $5. so a very good deal. For safety reasons if i were a woman in the area on my own I would not be out late alone, San Francisco does have a lot of homeless so take cabs if necessary. I would definitely book again online and stay at Parc 55 and recommend anyone else to do so. You will not do better anywhere in the city for your money. Hope this helped and enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: colkiwi
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night weekend stay through Expedia. The room we reserved was a "view" room located on floors number 20-26. Our room rate for the entire stay was $350 including all taxes and fees. We arrived ten minutes prior to the 3pm check in time. The line was fairly long with about twelve people ahead of us. All reservation counter space was manned and we waited less than ten minutes to begin the check in process. The courteous clerk took our information and offered us a room on the 19th floor. I mentioned that our reservation was for a "view" designated room on floors 20-26. His response was that our room did have a view. All of us know that every hotel room with a window has a view....of something. San Francisco is one of the more picturesque cities of the world and a view of the city was important to us. Upon arrival to our 19th floor room we were astounded with the sweeping view. From Union Square to the financial district to the bay beyond, it was stunning. Our reservation also included a king size bed, not the queen sized that came with this room. We decided not to request a room change for fear of losing the view. The room was spotless and the housekeeping staff was quick and efficient. The furniture was a bit out dated but showed no signs of scratches, dents or other guest trauma. I would recommend staying on the highest floor you can manage to mitigate the traffic noise from the street. On the 19th we could still hear passing sirens and the clang of the cable cars. The location of this property is fantastic. Two blocks to Union Square and a block from Market. World class resteraunts and shopping are just steps away....however. Be mindful that the Tenderloin district is adjacent to the hotel. The street vibe there becomes a little rough after sundown. If your'e searching for the road less traveled this is definitely not it. Parc 55 is a lovely property within a unique and vibrant city. I hope that you enjoy them both!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LynnClarke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Only yards from cable car, trams and buses. Ideal for shopping centre and eating out. On the plus side the hotel rooms are big, clean and beds are comfy. We also had complimentary breakfast in the club room and soft drinks were on offer P.M. On the down side we could hear street noise and sirens at night even though we were on the 27th floor.. On our first night I found a blob of poo on the toilet floor. I guess if I had rung housekeeping they would have dealt with it, but I felt it wasn't worth making a fuss. Although it did mar my initial feelings about the place. I also have to say that this was the only thing that offended me on the cleanliness of the hotel and I guess it was just and over sight of the maid... We stayed here a week and I have to say that everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sweetka
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location Cons: Everything. Parking expensive. Food is terrible. Rooms are way outdated. Dont stay on lower floors (we stayed on 8th) and you can hear everything that is happening on the street. Sirens of all kinds all night long.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaSeattle
Reviews.Content: The loaction is gr8. You are only a block away from Bart station, MUNI stops and cable car turnaround. The visitors center is also there. From the airport, we took the BART and reached the hotel with no hassles. There is plenty of shopping and restaurants close by. There is a cafe next to the hotel where u can get small eateries, milk, juices etc. The hotel was clean and the service prompt. Our stay was pleasant and I would definately consider staying there again. The only bad experience was at a chinese restaurant right across the hotel (near the burger king). The prices were atrocious..we paid about 50 usd for one fried rice and one chicken dish. There was a 15% gratutity added to the bill for serving two items at a table for 2. Then there is still space left for you to add a tip. So if you miss the gratutity addition, you may end up paying adding tip.The portions were small and did little to fill us. (we went to burger king later and ate again). The moment you are seated, a trolley with different appetizers appear and they hard sell to make you buy it. The way it is presented, you are led to believe that it is complimentary. Thankfully, I asked !! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: UKAlex500
Reviews.Content: As I was travelling on business with a contingency from the UK I didn't really have much of a choice as to where I stayed, however I was extremely happy when I checked into my room at the Parc 55. The last couple of days of the trip were vacation so I had intended to move hotels and stay closer to Fisherman's Wharf but instead I extended my stay at the Parc 55. Being a bit of a shopaholic this was perfectly situated, 5 mins from Union Square with Macy's, Tiffany's, Nike Town & a host of designer stores and then a huge shopping mall the other side of the hotel. Also great for the cable car to Fishermans Wharf, etc. I guess the only thing I might have gained from a hotel at Fisherman's Wharf was a nice view. I understand that there is building work going on over the road from one side of the hotel so if you're intending to lie-in in the mornings ask to be the otherside. The main downside starts to appear at night when some of the streets start to fill with unsavoury types and being female I didn't feel particularly safe. Yes you get this in most cities but SFO seemed to have more than it's fair share. Staff were very helpful. The hotel lounge bar closed very early although there is a smaller bar on the lower ground floor but I didn't find it as confy as the lounge. A tip if you are sightseeing might be to contact the concierge before your stay to see if they can book tickets for some of the attractions on the days you want to go, we left it too late for Alcatraz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chuckenpen
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Parc 55 hotel for 3 nights in August/September. We booked a double deluxe room at $129pn. I have mixed feelings about this hotel as there was good and bad about it. The room was a good size, with a seating area near the window. The bathroom was small and dated, but the shower was really powerful. Our view was down on a back street which was extremely noisy at night. The safe was broken so we couldn't use it. The real thing this hotel has going for is the location, it is in the heart of some serious shops, the cable car, BART and tram is a two minute walk from the hotel. All in all if you are not too fussy about your room this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaelifeisgood
Reviews.Content: We just spent a get-away-weekend at the Parc 55. It was within walking distance of so many different attractions. Shopping was a couple of blocks away. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf (about 20 to 25 blocks), walked all over once we got there, and took a trolley car back within one block from the Parc. Took a little side trip through Chinatown. It was a wonderful hotel and GREAT service. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay. The bed was super comfortable, plenty of extra pillows. FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE. We'll definitely be back to the Parc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Poor Reservations Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler10017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night for a family gathering. We made reservations through the hotel website. A day prior to checkin, I called the hotel to confirm our reservation. I was told that I have TWO reservations under my name, for TWO nights each. I asked the person I was speaking with to fix it to be ONE reservation for ONE night, and he said that he did it. At check-in, we were told that we've got two reservations, which means that the person I spoke to on the phone did not fix the reservation to correspond to what we booked on the hotel website. So, at check-in, they fixed it to ONE reservation, but told us that a king room, non-smoking is unavailable, only king smoking and double non-smoking are available. Time being 6:30 (checkin time is published to be 3:00), I got irritated and the front desk rep IMMEDIATELY found one more non-smoking king room that we initially reserved. But he did not see in the system that our promotional rate had free breakfast vouchers included in the rate. He took another 15 minutes to verify that and we got our vouchers (needless to say that the folio under our door the next morning prior to checkout had charges for those breakfast vouchers that were supposed to come free with our promotional rate. They fixed that when we came down to complain). On to the good part -- the room was the cleanest room i've ever been to. Not a stain was anywhere -- which is great in my book, and redeems the poor front desk service. The hallways are spacious and clean; as are the common areas. The buffet breakfast is excellent, and there is a piano bar upstairs, as well a a really delicious and suprisingly cheap Thai restaurant on the second floor. All in all, I LOVED the hotel, and would recommend it to anyone who appreciates a nice, clean room and spotless linens more than a seamless check-in experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Loved the beds”
Reviews.Author: wycwand
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay at the Parc 55, the location is excellent for the shops, restaurant and cable car. The beds are very comfortable just what you need after a hard days sight seeing. Useful tip - Walk up one stop from the cable car station to save waiting in the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: phlavorful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 10-13 and had no problems. My husband booked it on priceline for 120.00 a night, but I've read of some people getting it cheaper. Check-in was quick and I was glad to find out that we had a corner room. However, the windows wrap around the corner rooms so you probably get more light in the morning, but that didn't bother us. They had two sets of curtains, but light always finds a way :) The room was clean and spacious with cool decor. It had a separate room with a closet and enough space to store your luggage. That room led into the bathroom. The bathroom was fine, nothing spectacular. I did like that the shower curtain curved out to give you more room in the shower. I didn't like the smell of the shampoo/conditioner, but they got the job done. The bed and pillows were comfortable, check the closet for the extra pillow. The TV was large and the picture was clear so my hubby was happy. We kept the do not disturb sign on the door so I can't comment on the maid service. We ordered room service one night and were satisfied. We also had an overpriced buffet breakfast with okay food on last morning. There is a shuttle service that comes every 15 minutes to take you to the airport and I think it was $16.00 per person The location was great. If you plan to explore the neighborhood on foot, DO NOT make a right when you walk out of the main lobby. I think that is the Tenderloin section, a ghetto part of town. A block over to the left of the main lobby is where you catch the cable cars. Some tips and things we enjoyed: The best was watching the sea lions at Pier 39. If you plan to cover a lot of the city in one day you can pay $11.00 for unlimited rides on the cable cars, buses, and trolleys. A one way trip on the cable car is $5.00 so we cabbed it a lot. It was cheaper to take a cab from Parc 55 to Fisherman's Wharf. We had a great meal at Sauce ( It's on Gought St. I think it's in the Pacific Heights section) Alcatraz was cool-we happened to go on their annual anniversary event so there were scheduled speakers (former inmates, guards and family members that lived on the island) Before we went I searched a calander of events for things going on and found a lot of time specific things to do. i.e. The Nihonmachi Street Fair in Japantown. I think [--] has a list too. It was worth it to take a cab over to the GG bridge. Have Fun

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous, but OK”
Reviews.Author: EarlyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 last Saturday night while we were in town for a wedding. The entrance to the hotel is not striking; as a matter of fact we spent time trying to figure out where the front door was! The lobby is elegant, although in kind of a wierd layout. In the room things were clean and the furnishings were nice and looked new. The bathroom was serviceable but somewhat small and the amenities were basic (soap, shampoo, creme rinse, no shower cap.) On a low shelf in the bathroom was a one-cup coffee maker that you apparently put on the bathroom counter and plug it in there if you want in-room coffee. The two full-sized beds that we requested and got were comfortable with lots of pillows. The TV remote did not work. As far as I could tell, none of the rooms at the Parc 55 have a breathtaking view - it's mostly rooftops and other buildings. The biggest thing that I didn't like was the inconsistency of staff coverage. When my parents drove up into the valet driveway, there was no one there to come and take their bags. So we had to commandeer a cart, pack it with the luggage and bring it inside (which we later found out was "against hotel rules", putting us in a no-win situation.) Another day, we needed a taxi. But there was no one at the valet station to call one for us. We ended up walking down the street until we found one. These are not horrible things, but they are basics that I expect from a 4-star hotel. On the upside, the hotel is in a safe location to walk to Market Street, including the cable cars, the "Union Square" Amtrak bus stop and the Powell St. BART station. From this hotel, you can ride transit and get just about anywhere in the city. Just be careful not to walk west of the hotel via Ellis St.: it will take you straight into the Tenderloin neighborhood which is not safe. Would I stay here again? If the price was right and I didn't want to bring a car into the city, I'd say yes. If I was looking to spend a lot of relaxing/pampering time in the hotel, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent all rounded hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minnx
Reviews.Content: Cool dude place we think !! Great location in city centre with all the facilities within a block of the front door, Big hotel feel, though were made very welcome by the resturant staff in particular. Nice pub in the building which also served excellent food, Excellent room with ultra quiet AC Did not have much time to use all of the excellent facilities as we were out and about all day, and tired out by night time. Very comfortable beds. Fantasic view from room across Market Street, the centre and the bay from the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: hmmmmmmmm
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms through bidding on Priceline and got a great price. I called 4 days before and requested 1 room with a king and 1 room with 2 doubles and non-smoking for both rooms. The hotel honored the request when we checked in. We got rooms on the 25th floor with great views. Rooms were beautiful, beds were very comfy. Parking is expensive, but the valet was very efficient. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CACruzin
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I just returned from an overnight excursion to San Francisco. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Being a little bit leary after reading some unfavorable reviews, I asked for a quiet room and was given 969 which I thought was a quiet room for the heart of downtown San Francisco - and we live on remote acreage in the California mountains. There was no waiting when we checked in at 6:30 p.m. The beds were comfortable with a selection of pillows. We loved the fresh air vents below the windows & left them open all the time. They have a well-equipped exercise room and we fit in a free-weight workout. All of our driving was done during the day of arrival. After checking in, we drove up the block to a 24 hour garage to save $20 on the SUV. These type garages do not have in & out privileges, but that's fine, because from the Parc's location you can walk or take the cable car almost anywhere. It is located at the Powell Street cable car turn around. We walked to the financial district for dinner and came back through Chinatown. We didn't try the restaurants or room service. All in all it was a fantastic experience for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Brossie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the end of our trip around California. I had chosen the Parc 55 for it's location as I knew we'd be doing last minute shopping. As other reviews have mentioned it is ideally placed for public transport and very handy to Union Square and Westfield shopping centre. We were upgraded to Club room (27th floor and above?) and this was a pleasant surprise. Very nicely decorated room, 2 double beds, large tv etc. The Club Lounge was a bonus for us but I definately would not pay to use it. The food was pretty meagre for the hors d'oeuvres and desserts - better for breakfast. The Lounge was closed on Saturday (take note if you are thinking of paying for this!) and no evening service on Friday so we only got 2 breakfasts and 1 evening in the end! The staff in the Lounge were very disinterested. The dressing gowns in our room were great though! Didn't try any of the restaurants but the coffee shop next door is good for breakfast. We ate at the foodcourt at Westfield in the evenings - excellent range and healthy options (for a change!). Overall, an excellent location. And definately ditch the rental car - no need for it and very expensive to park.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: lhutchins13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from San Francisco and had a wonderful time staying at the Parc 55. Check in was surprisingly --fast! We arrived early around 11 and were immediately given our room on the 5th floor. The view was great, overlooking the shops from downtown. The location was wonderful, we bought a 3 day muni pass and hopped on the trolley (which is right across the road) or bus daily to take us to the wharf or wherever we needed to go. Also took the Bart to the airport --very convenient. The room was comfortable, not the best I have stayed in, but nice compared to other places I have stayed in San Francisco. Everyone at the hotel was very nice. The sportsbar has a happy hour and cheaper drink prices. I suggest hit them up during this time to save $. Overall, we can't wait to go back. Very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “So-so experience”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I had a mixed experience at the hotel. I found the front desk staff quite helpful, although some of the rest of the service staff were found wanting. I flew in straight from Hong Kong to San Francisco. My flight arrived early and so I arrived at the hotel at 10am. I was told that check in was not until 3pm so I had to leave my bags and walk around. That was fine - the excellent location of the hotel meant I could walk to AT&T park and see a Giants game (Bonds went 0-for-5, sadly). When I returned at around 5pm, I got a room, and asked for my bags. The bellhop got me to go into the storage area with him, and then grabbed my bag, walked past me unnecessarily into the lobby, plonked my bag on the ground and looked at me expectantly. If I had wanted that service, or if he'd brought my bag up to my room, I might have tipped him, but that was a bit much. When I got to my room, I discovered that there was no remote control. I knew I'd be up in the wee hours, so I wanted to get my remote before I fell asleep, exhausted. I went down to the front desk to ask for it, and they said they'd send it up right away. After an hour, I called and asked what had happened. They said that they would bring it right away (again). I waited another 45 minutes, wondering whether the surly bellhop had blackballed me, and fighting sleep back at the same time. Finally the housekeeping staff came with my remote and I was able to drift off to dreamland. The bed was comfortable. I was able to survey the room better when I awoke at 4am. The room I had got was large. However, the bathroom was a little bit of a let-down, with 80s style bathroom tiles. Overall, the hotel is a worthy 4-star hotel in terms of its physical appearance and offerings. I just wish the service had been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location, some minor service problems”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: This feels like a good business-class hotel in a Marriott category. My overall rating mostly reflects a very comfortable room in a great location (right at the Powell Street BART station on Market Street, near Union Square.) Room 2763 is a very good size, with two double beds looking towards Union Square (visible a LITTLE bit between the buildings) and the Coit Tower in the distance. Nice-size bathroom with many toiletries -- but no hair dryer that I could find. Spotless housekeeping. The desk (chipped on the edges) could be a good work surface, and there is an internet connection (with an ethernet cord in the room) for $12 a day. We paid extra for this room with entitles the guest to the club lounge, breakfast, and evening snacks. While not bad, I'm not sure I'd upgrade again. The lounge itself is nice enough with an excellent view (same as our room, but on the 31st floor), tables and lounge chairs, nice continental-plus buffet breakfast of pastries, cereals, fruit, juices, etc. The evening has cocktails ($6 for wine) and hors d'oeuvres, which were not that impressive -- small assortment of hot hors d'oeuvres and really mundane cheese selection. There were a few complimentary newspapers around to be used in the lounge (I think, since there were so few.) Like any Club lounge I've seen, it can get a little crowded at some times in the morning. I could deal with these minor imperfections if not for the issues with the Club lounge management. When we first stopped in, the manager and assistant seemed more concerned with talking to each other than greeting guests. We would also find that guests often had a problem with their pass key-cards to enter, which often meant guests would knock (pound) on the locked door. Rather than assume that these were guests with key problems, the attitude seemed to be that these were Club-crashers. This could easily be verified since Club guests have a different color card. But no -- the Manager scolded anyone who might open the door, but he was VERY slow in trying to come to the door -- leaving the guest outside pounding the door, and those inside having to listen to it. Couldn't an assistant manage something? Further, I believe that the staff should be able to have their meal break, but this sometimes meant that NO ONE was minding the door -- again resulting in a guest, sooner or later, pounding the door. Also: the evening hors d'oeuvres were scheduled to go until 7:30. When we stopped in at 7:10 to grab something quickly, the food had all been cleaned up, and an evening dessert was not out yet. The slips continued. I met my sister at this hotel, where she would check in the following day. I reminded the staff about this at my check-in. Supposedly they entered her name. The following evening, I stopped by the desk to remind the desk staff to expect her later that evening. When they checked, there was no record of her name. They dutifully re-entered the information. When she checked in later, there was STILL no record of her name, which resulted in a late-night call to the room to give permission to send her up. To top it off: they gave her a room key-card that did NOT correspond to a Club level -- which resulted in problems at breakfast the next morning in the Club lounge until we got it corrected. (Also "funny:" the desk clerk mentioned, "You don't have the same last name as your sister," I think questioning her story. We are in our 50's, and I'm married. Are different names of married sisters so surprising???!!!???) The hotel has a nice, sunny second-floor public lounge, bar, and restaurant. We didn't eat here or have drinks, but it could have been a nice possibility. There are free newspapers for guests in this area -- stocked much better than on the Club lounge!!! The take-away: we'd be happy to stay here again since the room was like a good Marriott-quality place at a better price, and the location is excellent if you want to use the BART from the airport and be convenient to Union Square. I'd still check other options for price/value, but I could return here and be pretty happy if I could overlook the service slips. I understand the need for security at any hotel, but this place gets a bit undiplomatic ans slipshod in trying to manage it. Further, the Club lounge was not very impressive, and there are other good-to-much better alternatives for breakfast, drinks, etc. nearby. Do it only if you want a not bad continental breakfast without having to go far, if the additional price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel , great access..”
Reviews.Author: N&GB6
Reviews.Content: Large hotel with gym, sports bar, chinese & a la carte restaurants, which were all reasonable priced & hotel bar. We had a room at the end or a corridor and the view of the city was fantastic, the windows were large and gave a panoramic view. The bed was wonderful, duvet & pillows. Room cleanliness was also good but you could hear some traffic noise even though we were on 8th floor. Easy walking access to shopping and cable car. Coffee shop right outside. It appeared to be in an area with a high volume of homeless people but as you travel round the city, there are homeless people everywhere. Trip to Alcatraz worth doing & spending day at Fisherman's wharf

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: goRedSox1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 the week of 4th of July. We had one minor bump in our check in process - they had our last name spelled wrong (most likely an error in transferring the reservation from Expedia) so it took an extra minute to locate our reservation, otherwise this place was top notch! It couldn't be more convenient to public transportation around the city and to the airport. You are right in the heart of Union Square. We had breakfast each morning from the small coffee shop on the corner - it was cheap and easy. The only hotel restaurant we ate at was the pub - a little pricey, but what do you expect? We found the rooms to be very nice and the beds comfortable. The only thing was the bathroom didn't have a vent so it got quite steamy in there. I would definitely stay at the Parc 55 again - it is a great hotel for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but don't park at the Parc!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaDan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was reasonably clean, but the room was a bit dated and the carpet was pretty old. Staff friendly, but carry cash for frequent tipping! Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was good, but rather pricey (almost $20 per adult). I do not recommend the valet parking at the hotel- - it is also somewhat costly and you have to often wait for a long period while they retrieve your car. I recommend parking at one of the nearby garages if you don't plan on driving in and out frequently. I paid $15 for overnight parking a block or so away, versus $40 plus tax and valet tips in the hotel garage.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55, awesome views & great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ileftmyheartinsf
Reviews.Content: Check in was great and front desk was extremely helpful. Stayed for 3 nights at a summer promotion of $99/night with my fiance. I would suggest confirming reservations a day or two before you arrive to avoid complications other people say they have. The view we had on the 26th floor was awesome. The bath amenities were lovely and housekeeping was great. We were very happy with the location of this hotel. Minute walk from BART, cable car turn-around, muni buses. Highly recommend getting a passport for 3 or 7-day from visitor center a block away that lets you have unnlimited rides. Yes there are LOTS of homeless people, but there are EVERYWHERE in union square so don't act surprised tourists. Our experience was that they were not too aggressive and some were actually nice. The only thing I wish was that internet access was free (in the room (as it should be in an area like that) and a refridgerator would have been nice and convienient. Another thing was that walls were surprisingly thin, we could hear regular conversations in the next room, but it was more personal enteratinment hearing the person singing in the shower next door. Other than that LOVED Parc 55 and will stay again for the aforementioned rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: savtrav22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June for 2 nights for business, hotel is steps from the Powell St. BART and couldn't be more convenient for travel to and from the airport. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds. No WIFI, internet is available via broadband for additional charge. Breakfast at the 2nd floor restaurant is pricey, better to go to the great and inexpensive coffee shop adjacent to the hotel. The area is teeming with great shopping and restaurants. Concierge did a fantastic job of recommending places to eat, and arranged transportation for us at no cost to one of those restaurants one evening. Cable cars departed one block over. Check in and check out were very busy, the hotel seems to be home base for flight crews for both Delta Airlines and Singapore Air, so if you arrive/depart when those airlines are dumping flight crews in or out, then you are in for a wait. As many other reviewers have said, I was astounded by the homeless - I have traveled around the world in many major cities and have never seen so many homeless, and was startled by how aggressive they were (although not at all threatening, just aggressive in panhandling.) You are very near the tenderloin district so be cautious where you go when you leave the hotel. All in all great stay for the cost and location and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, Parc 55 couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: BostonVince
Reviews.Content: Check in around 1pm was quick and easy, and got a room right away. We did see long lines at the desk at times, and several large flight crews from Singapore Airlines checking in. It isn't possible to get any closer to BART or the MUNI, a godsend for travelers using public transit. As previously stated, proximity to shopping is superb. There were homeless people and some panhandlers around Powell Station, but they were totally harmless. Traveling frequently to NYC, we probably look more streetwise than some of the other reviewers not used to the city. No one ever approached us, even walking through the Tenderloin towards Civic Center. I do not recommend this area to anyone not used to being in major cities. Room on 29th floor was great. Nice and large and very clean. Good bathroom products by "Lather". Bed was extremely comfortable. Fresh air vents were great (but of course give you a little more noise). At times we turned off the AC and just opened those vents. Noise level really was minimal, even with the building going up next store. Besides, noise is intrinsic to cities. Anyone who can't stand noise should take a country vacation. Housekeeping does like to knock a lot, to check whether the room is ok. It seemed like overkill to us. Breakfast in club lounge was adequate. Fresh fruits, meats and cheeses, hot and cold cereal, bagels, breads and danish. Starbucks coffee was a real kickstart in the morning. The afternoon snack was ok, no where near what other hotels put out in their concierge lounge, but the Parc 55 also cost a fraction of what those other hotels charge. The evening dessert was a nice touch, and perfect since we usually don't have room for dessert at that evening's restaurant. Speaking of restaurants, we tried the Siam Thai Noodle both in the hotel (many restaurants were closed for the 4th of July) and across the street. Both were fantastic. Express check out could not have been easier. All in all I very highly recommend this hotel and will stay here next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Hombresg33
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4-nights in a regular room on the 19th floor for $99 a night. The location of the hotel was great, next to Union Square. A lot of little shops and major stores in the area, also plenty of homeless. Being from LA my wife and I weren't put off by them. The room was extremely well maintained and cleaned very well.
