Very comfortable bed with lots of pillows, loved the view . The bathroom was great with overhead shower...nice. The soaps were first rate (Lather) and the maid service was also great. Great location next to Bart, Powell lines, Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to SF on business and had struggled to find a hotel I would come back to on subsequent trips, but with the Parc 55 I finally found one (at least until it was no longer a Marriott property). Right away upon checking in I was recognized as a Marriott Elite member and given an upgrade to a room on the concierge level. The concierge lounge provided a decent selection of hot appetizers during dinner time and desserts later in the evening. It also had great 180 degree views of SF. The hotel itself was spotless, very classy and well maintained. The best part however was the service. I was in town for a convention and my fiancee was with me, she got very ill and we did not know what to do between check out time of 11am and 5pm (when my convention ended). The hotel arranged for her to see a local doctor and then allowed her to stay in the room until 4pm. Even though I'm a Marriott person, would consider staying here again because of the wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon098
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days at Parc 55. We had a club room on the 29th floor which was well worth the money. Large room and great bathroom, turn down service each evening .Our room had great view of the city and bay area we could also see the fireworks on the 4th July. Nice club room on the 31st floor great breakfast and tea time snacks also drinks available to club room guest. Location of hotel is excellant yes lots of homeless about but as other reviews have said not the hotels fault. Service at hotel and checkin was also hassle free. 1st vist to SF hotel and city were great.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: PBNL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location. Next to a BART station, so a direct and easy connection to the airport. The little pastry shop at the left side of the hotel has great coffee and sandwiches. Large room with a large, comfy bed. The rooms may be starting to get a bit worn down, but at least the are clean! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: mole
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a Club room at a rate of $155 per night. After our flight from Las Vegas we caught the Bart from the airport to Powell Street Station and it was quick couple of minute walk to the hotel. We were lucky when we arrived that not too many people were checking in so we were promptly allocated our room on the 21st floor. The room was extremely well maintained and cleaned to a high standard. Very comfortable bed with lots of pillows, easy chair and desk. The bathroom was quite small with a shallow bath and overhead shower. Although the hotel is no longer part of the Marriott chain the bathroom amenities (soaps,shampoos etc) were stil the same as the Marriott use and were replenished frequently. A coffee/tea maker was also in the bathroom and supplied daily with coffee/tea bags. The club lounge had nice views of the city and was a relaxing place to have a drink. Breakfast was continental but rather limited and the lounge was closed from Friday evening until Sunday evening. We got the room for a good rate so werent too worried however would not pay a significant amount to stay in the club room as the lounge facilities are not great. No internet access in the club lounge or the business centre although you can pay for internet at an area near the bar on the 2nd floor. There is a good little coffee shop located next to the hotel great for grabbing a quick coffee/hot chocolate and a donut etc and very cheap. The location of the hotel is fantastic for accessing transport including the cable cars and the Bart system and lots of shopping nearby and a quick walk to Union Square. There are a lot of homeless around the area and in San Francisco in general however we never felt threatened. We would return to this hotel but mainly for location the hotel itself is average but the location increases its appeal.

Reviews.Title: “reservations needs work”
Reviews.Author: midliferDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: Made our reservation online and took the precaution of printing out the entire reservation confirmation and taking it with me as a result of reading other travelers' experiences. Good thing I did because at check in, there was NO record of any reservation at all! When we got home, (reservations were on 28,29 June) we found that our mastercard had been charged for a "no-show" on the 22nd of June, the day I had made the reservations! Several calls on eternal hold with accounting, then a fax had to be sent, a call to my credit card company protesting the amount and just finally today we (think) resolved everything with a very nice lady in reservations. It seems a lot of hassle for something that should have been a no-brainer. That said, the hotel is in a prime location next to everything. The bedding is newer and the mattress comfortable, the bathroom clean and of adequate size.We had an upper level room (15th floor) and enjoyed the city view in the evenings For a hotel of that size, the elevators are surprisingly quick to arrive. Outside the hotel, there are an awful lot of homeless people and it is worse if you make a wrong turn and head to the Tenderloin area where the panhandling is even more aggressive. No fault of the hotel, but it can be uncomfortable when walking alone. Reservation problems aside, the hotel offers good value and a prime location--just keep a copy of your entire reservation with you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italianissima73
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Parc 55. I was in San Francisco on business and we chose this hotel because of it's conveient location to the BART station - an easy and cheap way to get from SFO to the hotel. We were very pleased with our stay. Our room on the 15th floor had a nice view and was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a bustling part of town - Union Square - close to AWESOME shopping, the cable cars, and great restaurants. My only concern, which had nothing to do with the hotel, was the large number of homeless people in the area. However I soon found that they were everywhere in San Francisco. I have lived in Washington DC and Philadelphia and have never seen so many homeless people - it really took me buy surprise. Back to the hotel. The fitness center was good - many machines to use - it was crowded in the morning but due to the size of the hotel I was not surprized. They provided towels and fruit for you to eat after your work out. Check-in and out was a breeze but again there are a lot of people at this hotel so be wary of the time of day you do these things - the potential for a line is good. We ate at the Pub in the hotel. The food was ok - moderately priced - but there are so many options outside the hotel we decided to try those other than the hotel restaurant. All in all is was a great stay and when I come back to San Francisco I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience Here But SF Needs to Clean Up Area”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdinOK
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights at the Parc 55. Check in was relatively easy. I requested a top floor but got floor 15. Room was relatively large with views out two sides since it was on the end. Room was clean and staff was acceptably friendly. Be forewarned that they are constructing a large building next door so the noise starts pretty early. I use earplugs so it didn't bother me. Lots of homeless all around but it still seems safe as they were harmless. Just don't go very far to the immediate west from the hotel because that area is not safe. Very convenient to cable car and subway (BART). Major disappointment was not the hotel but the amount of homeless begging in a major tourist area. SF leadership really needs to clean up their act. Very little police presence noticed anywhere around the city and that was very disappointing. Saw more homeless begging on the 100 yard walk from the subway to the hotel than 2 days in NYC. Not the Parc 55's fault though. I think eventually this will come back to bite tourism there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: thomasons
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at Parc 55. We were put in a handicapped room, but were moved immediatly with our request to change. Big bathrooms, and good sized rooms. There is a great little pastry-type shop located at the bottom of the hotel which was great for breakfast (donuts, muffins, etc.). There is a burger king and carl's jr. across the street and a subway and walgreens 1 block up. There is no better location for the cable cars and muni transportation. This hotel is very clean, comfortable and convenient to everything! No complaints here, would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55: nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PGdenizen
Reviews.Content: I spent last night at the Parc 55. I was watching for certain problems that have come up in some of the recent reviews--most especially the issue of rude or incompetent staff at the front desk. I was greeted by a young women in a very friendly manner, and check-in was smooth. I had reserved via Hotwire and got a rate of $99. I'm always concerned that I might not get a nice room because of booking through a discount service, but my room was nice. It was fairly large by SF standards; the bed and pillows were very comfortable; the bathroom was spacious and well-stocked and the shower was great--good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Among the toiletries were some ear plugs--not a good sign. I was on the 5th floor and I did hear street noise, but no more than at any other SF hotel I've stayed at. My only complaint is that $12.95 for the Internet connection is too much. I saved money by parking at the Ellis-O'Farrell garage nearby ($30 for overnight) instead of using the hotel's valet parking ($40 plus 14% tax and a tip or two would have been about $48). I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Great location for cable cars, shopping, dining. I had a lovely room with a great view (18th floor). Check-in very busy on the afternoon I arrived but quiet when I left at the same time two days later. Staff at reception very efficient and helpful. Had arranged a package to be waiting for me on arrival. It was waiting for me at the bell desk. Accommodation, clean, spacious and comfortable. Have stayed in many hotels in SF including the Westin St Francis, Hilton, Crowne Plaza and City Quarters. I would certainly recommend the Parc 55 above those mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, near the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: Ilia T
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms on the top floors have a nice view Receptionists and concierge were very nice and helpful. The only minus I can state is that parking for guests is pretty expensive - 40 usd per 24h.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: se2121
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights from June 5 -June 9. We booked through the hotel web site and got a great deal. It appears that the only problem here is the check-in staff. We had reserved a room the same day that our friends had reserved their room, we chose the same catagory and requested in the comments that we be placed on the same floor near each other. When we checked in we were on two different floors. This was handled quickly and changed so we could be near eachother. This is not a big deal at all however, the employee that checked me in was quite rude and either inexperienced or just didn't care. The employee that checked our friends in was quick and friendly and resolved the issue. Our check in was pretty quick, about 15 minutes, however this hotel caters to the airlines it seems and there was always a large amount of flight crews there. Numerous days we saw check-in lines at least 20 deep and only 2-4 employees working. We heard numerous people complaining about waiting over an hour to check in. So only problem seems to be the check in. We had a room on the 27th floor with amazing views of the city. There was noise in the room but what do you expect when you are in the middle of a large city. We heard police sirens all night long but once again what do you expect! The room was amazingly clean and we always had turndown service with a chocolate and the next days weather left on our bed. This was wonderful. The shower had awesome water pressure and it seems that they are still using the Marriott soaps and shampoos. Our room included free breakfast and afternoon snacks. The breakfast was simple but great. Always had free juice, water, and soda. There was always fresh bread and some pastries. There was meat to make a sandwich and lots of cereal with fresh fruits. The afternoon snacks were not bad. We only went up there twice, once was chicken wings which were ok and the next time there were little pizzas. I thought that alcohol was included in the afternoon snack but it isn't, they have an honor bar. The workout facility at the hotel is not bad. An area of barbells and a couple multi exercise machines. Several treadmills. Nice towels to stay clean and that have a steamroom. THe only thing that is missing is no pool or hot tub. The hotel location is awesome. I would say the best around. You walk out the front door and take about 100 steps to the cable car, or BART. The booth to buy the MUNI tickets is right there at the cable car so just wait and buy it there. You are within a block of all the major shopping stores and walgreens and what not. Parking is expensive, $40.00 per day plus and extra $5.60 per day tax but it is very nice to have your car safe and right there at the hotel. THe valet employees were excellent, friendly, and brought the car very quickly. IF you are debating between fishermans wharf area and union square area, do union square because there is nothing to do at fishermans wharf. This is the first time staying in the city and when I come back, I will only stay at the Parc 55 hotel. The stay was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “no problem parc 55”
Reviews.Author: RL2
Reviews.Content: From the time you leave San Francisco Airport, It was a breeze getting there . Taking the Bart made it to simple, coming out of the station walking maybe 20 feet stood the Parc 55. Expect to see the homeless as you enter or leave the station. Parc 55 is accessible to all modes of transportation, union sq, mall, etc We picked up a 3 day passport , 18 $, to be used on , muni, cable cars , trolly cars for unlimited rides..good bargin. We stayed there 3 nights , no problems what so ever, staff was friendly, instead of the concerierge , ask the BellMen for directions, info, etc.. they were very accommodating . The so call sports bar on premises , wasn't lively, low key, unless super bowl or world series was being played you may get sound on the tv's...they had 6 flat screens in a small place . go somewhere else if you're looking for a sports bar. Other wise check out the Pac 55 .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: verymerry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block from the cable cars and BART. There is also a mall across the street and a few blocks away is the Financial District and Union Square. Taking BART from Oakland Airport was a breeze - a $3 bus ride from the airport to the Coliseum train station and a $3.35 ride to Powell Street and the hotel is just a 1/2 block away. Compare this to an approx $45 taxi ride or $22/person airport shuttle! The room was a nice size with a comfy bed and crisp white linens. The view was good though there is construction opposite the hotel at the back so a crane and worksite is outside the window...but being on the 25th floor we could easily see above and could not hear any outside traffic noise. All in all, a good hotel. The only downside was no free internet which, from my past experiences, is unusual for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and location”
Reviews.Author: Wiserblond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc 55 on Memorial Day weekend. We had stayed there the previous year and enjoyed it, but were somewhat nervous considering the recent reviews since the hotel changed ownership. We arrived using BART, and learned that we wouldn't be able to check in until after 3pm. We left our baggage and returned at 6pm to learn that the hotel was booked solid, operating at full capacity, and some customers were upset that their rooms weren't ready yet. We were ready for problems and attitudes (as we read about in the reviews here) and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready, everything was in order, and check-in took only 5 minutes. We had a great view of southwest San Francisco (we were on the 17th floor), and the room was in excellent condition. No extra or hidden charges, pleasant hotel staff and the entire stay was stress free. We are staying there again next week for the Fillmore Jazz Festival and anticipate another great weekend. The convenience of the location and the quality of the hotel and the $99 rate featured on travel websites such as Hotwire, Orbitz and Expedia makes it a steal of a deal! Try it out!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with a couple quirks”
Reviews.Author: allisontebbe
Reviews.Content: When I transferred to San Francisco, my company put me in the Parc 55 Hotel for 20 days. For 20 days, you'd better like the place you're staying! And it turns out, I did! The location is perfect. Parc 55 is located right on Market Street, across from the best mall I've ever been to (Westfield). It's like Vegas for shoppers. The actual hotel is really nice. My room had an amazing view of the Grace Cathedral and the sunsets were priceless. The room was very clean and the staff was amazing. The only issue I really had was with the internet - $12.95 a day and no wireless. Not having a wireless connection was a huge inconvenience. Also, most hotels I stay at offer internet free of charge. After 20 days, this expense was pretty painful. As someone who works in the tech industry, I will definitely look for this the next time I book a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At the Heart of San Francisco Shopping”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoLarry
Reviews.Content: Tremendous hotel! The service was excellent, very accommodating and helpful. Exquisitely clean and comfortable rooms. We didnâ€™t request one but they offer hardwood floor rooms for allergy sufferers. Great location, in the heart of the shopping district. Not a long walk to Chinatown or Nob Hill. Less than a block to a cable-car turnaround that takes you to the Wharf/Ghirardelli Square without any transfers. Parking is expensive but what isnâ€™t in San Francisco?!! I recommend the 5th and Mission parking garage, $30 for overnight versus $40+tax at the Parc Fifty Five, plus, you get a nice walk! This was one of our top 3 vacations(as of June 2007)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LAStravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It is located right between Union Square and the San Francisco Shopping Center. The Metreon, Mosconi Center, Crocker Gallery and more are very close by. The walk to union square was only about two minutes. We had a great view on the 20th floor. It was a typical nice upscale hotel. No character or charm if that is what you are looking for, but the beds were great, the lobby, the view, the room, and everything else was clean and nice. The pick up for the cable car is just steps away outside, but be prepared for a long line! I tagged along on my husband's business trip so this wasn't on our dollar, so warning- the parking fee is $45 a day and it is valet only, and there is a $12.95 fee per day for using the internet. The hotel restaurants looked very nice, but they were too expensive for us. If you are looking for a good breakfast or lunch, head to Sears Fine Foods. It is a small coffee shop across from the Sir Francis Drake. It is classic old SF! And simple good food. For quick food on the go it is fun to pick something out at the food market in Bristol Farms (on the bottom level of the San Francisco Shopping Center). They have a ton of prepared foods that you can take with you to a picnic in Golden gate park or just a snack to go. This hotel is perfect for a weekend of shopping or sight seeing in the Union square area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: edhodge
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Parc 55. Easy access to BART, cable cars and easy walking to the Embarcadero. The noise at night was disconcerting even on the 20th floor, even with a sound machine going. Lots of city noise but hey, we are in the heart of the city- what else would we expect? The concierge was very helpful. The staff at reception was funny and friendly. The room was very clean and a nice size, much larger than the boutique hotels where we have stayed before. The amenities were from Lather, all natural and from a local company. The hair dryer stopped working and they replaced it quickly. We were with friends. They had only one complaint- coffee in the room. Oh there was a coffee maker but evidently, the coffee was blech. We don't drink it so I couldn't say. No honor bar, no mini fridge but very soft, dreamy linens, comforters and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: astroToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel to attend a Major Conference at the Moscone Centre. This hotel double-charged me for my stay. It is not so much the mistake itself that leaves me with a poor impression of this establishment, it is their unprofessional and incompetent handling of the problem. I have now returned home and called the hotel three days in a row, and the staff seem unable to comprehend the problem. They keep asking if they can call me back, taking my phone number and then I dont hear from them. I have been double-charged before, but high-quality hotels usually deal with problems like this quickly and with professionalism. I am very dissappointed in my experience with this hotel, and I dont feel that I could recommend a stay with them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: bebycik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 2 nights in June of 2007 (booked via priceline at $150 a night). First basics: 1. The hotel used to be a part of Renaissance chain-- expect standard decor and larger than usual rooms. 2. This is not a boutique hotel-- it's a high-rise with a large lobby and hundreds of rooms. 3. It is right by Union Square-- homeless people are a staple for that area and not a fault of the hotel. Now, to the experience-- hotel is very centrally located (right by Powell BART station-- take it right from the airport for a fraction of the taxi cost!). Restaurants, shops, museums, the cable cars, (and yes, even the homeless people)-- it's all there. The lobby is spacious and can look deserted at times. We had no problems with staff. Rooms are much larger than usual for Union Square-- we had a sitting area with a couch in ours and a king size bed. Spacious bathroom, fantastic linens and even complimentary ear plugs ( we were on the 10th floor and could not hear the street noise but appreciated the gesture anyway.) We did not use room service but stopped by at a hotel bar on the second floor-- a typical boring sports bar on a smaller side with an ambiance of a moth ball. In summary. Pros: great location, spacious, clean rooms, awesome beds for a very good price. Probably one of the best deals for your dollar in Union Square. Cons: a pretty generic experience (don't expect to be showered with attention like you get with boutique hotels), and you have to pay for your internet. The building is kinda ugly from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: leggsworth
Reviews.Content: The good: 1. Bed is quite comfortable with nice linens 2. We were on the 20th floor with a great view of the SF skyline 3. Rooms clean 4. Great deal on Expedia, including 3 last-minute round trip tickets from San Diego and 3 night's stay, for about $800. 5. Convenient locations, close to lots of good restaurants and shopping 6. Front desk service is professional and pleasant The bad: 1. Some staff need training in proper service etiquette. We had a housekeeper one morning that kept knocking on our door, trying to get into our room, even after we had asked to not be disturbed. One of the hostesses at the restaurant treated my 2 year old son like a thief when he went to take some fruit from a fruitbowl. He's only 2! 2. Rooms very small (oh well, what can you expect from San Francisco?).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but Bad enviorment!”
Reviews.Author: RACQUEENS
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Convienent location, clean, nice staff and decent service. The only problem I ran into was, no one knew anything at the helpdesk. We asked how far a restaurant was from the hotel and if it was walking distance. They told us it was a 8 to 10 minute walk. As we were walking to the restaurant, we noticed that we had been walking for a good 20 minutes. On top of that it was extremely cold outside. We were very upset with the poor judgement of the hotel's help desk. There since of direction is VERY poor, so if you don't know where you are going, find out before you stay at this hotel. The area of the hotel is REALLY shady. Homeless people on every singel corner harrassing you at any second they get. I was surprised that a women at the front desk gave directions using the back door, then told me to ignore what ever is happening outside that door. Outside that door was serval homeless people sitting on the stairs bothering bypasser's. If you want to stay in a quiet, nice area, I suggest you stay in Nobb Hills!

Reviews.Title: “Good rate”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to this hotel. The last time was when it was called the Renaissance Parc 55. Both times I was there for one night, and it wasn't obvious in seeing the difference between the two stays. I was given a low-floor again, probably the floor above the health club. The 6th floor of Parc 55 is about the 10th floor of some hotels and there was a decent view of downtown Market & 5th Streets. While I was checking out, a huge tour group was packing the elevators. I guess now that the hotel has dropped the Renaissance affiliation, it is catering to budget tourists. Still, my rate of $113 including tax, on Expedia, is a bargain given its location so close to the cable car on Powell, subway to airport and the Westfield shopping mall. But $12.95 for using the Internet for 24 hours is not, when you consider at most hotels it is free. Also, the double lock on my door was out of order, so had to rely on the chain. And after I had checked out, I wanted to use the restroom on the ground floor but it was only open to guests with keys.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: ddetravel
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why I had such a different experience from the recent reviews, but I had a fantastic experience at the Parc 55. I took the BART from Oakland Airport. It was a breeze. And just right outside the stop at Powell Street was the Parc 55. It took about 45 mins from the airport to the hotel (door to door). Who needs a car? There was a line at check in, but the man who helped me knew I had been patiently waiting for about 10 mins and easily accommodated my request to be on a higher floor (I paid for the cheapest room in the place). He put me on the 27th floor with a view of the bay and Transamerica building. I had a fabulous room. Too bad I was just staying for one night for a seminar the next day. I was just steps away from the best shopping (including H&M)! The room was a good size (especially for San Francisco) and had clearly been remodelled. The bed was extremely comfortable. I'd go back in an instant. Also, I thought the bell desk was really helpful. I needed to leave a bag (being in a class all day) after checking out. They were nice enough to let me add things to my bag after I went shopping and before I needed to go to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelABQ
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Expedia.com. They gave us a great rate for 3 nights. Our hotel was ideally located just one block from the Powell Cable Car station near Market Street. There is a great coffee/breakfast place 50 feet from the hotel with great prices on their food and drinks. Upon check in we were taken to a wonderful corner room that was very spacious. The room had lovely bed linens and two lovely windows with views. The staff were really great, and they have a rent a car service right in the hotel, which came in handy when we wanted to rent a car for one day to travel to the Muir Woods. During my 6 nights in San Francisco, I stayed in 3 different hotels (different events). However, the Parc 55 was my absolute favorite! I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the front desk service”
Reviews.Author: sheree99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 as the first hotel out of ten on a round-the-world trip in April/May. After being very tired, but excited, after a 12 hour flight from Australia, we were greeted by one of the rudest front desk staff I've ever experienced. I requested a high floor, to which the response was a huff. She also tried telling us she only had twin rooms available (despite booking a double two months prior), but after some pressure she suddenly 'found' a double room for us. It was a shame the first impression was so bad, as the room was fine - much larger than expected, with a sofa area and nice view of the city. The coffee maker in the room was a welcome touch! The bed was huge and extremely comfortable, and we found the room to be very quiet, despite being right next to the lifts and the fact we stayed on both Friday and Saturday nights. The bathroom was a fair size and had some good amenities. The one thing that the room was missing was a fridge, and the room furnishings were also quite datedâ€¦ but Iâ€™ve certainly stayed in worse 4 star places. We used the sports bar downstairs which again suffered from poor customer service â€“ except for one particular man who was extremely friendly and helpful â€“ he was the one person in the entire hotel that made it a pleasant stay for us! Also, it was in a great location near a big shopping centre and right next to the BART station, which made it so convenient from the airport. The only negative was having an 'early' flight out of San Fran (8.30am) on the Sunday, and discovering that the BART didnâ€™t start running until 8am! We were a little shocked by this, so unfortunately had to fork out almost $40 for a cab instead. Overall, it was a fine hotel for what we paid - we got a deal at $100 a night (through a last-minute hotel website) â€“ but I would probably stay somewhere else next time, mainly due to the service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 was a fine 2 night stop for me, flying in to SFO meant easy access from Powell St BART station, and the location 1 block from Union Street was a bonus. I opted for a 'view room' which from the 25th floor offered a great panorama towards the Transamerica Pyramid and the heart of the Financial District. Nice bathrooms, with good shower and large tub & toiletries. Lovely comfy bed too. I used room service twice, found the choice a bit limited and expensive, with tax & service charges added after. But the food was good and delivery quick. Also made use of the Restaurant for breakfast; 1st day had a made-to-order omelette.. which was ok, 2nd day buffet breakfast.. which was very nice and plentiful. As a single male traveller I did not find the drop-out types offensive around the area, and felt no more concerned walking around this City than I would In any other. In fact San Francisco is a great place to explore on foot - of particular note is Golden Gate Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: dwe1978
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and stayed at the Fairmont (which is absolutely wonderful). I stayed a few extra days on my own dime so needed a cheaper hotel. I got a great deal on Parc 55 from hotels.com. While it's not the greatest hotel I've ever stayed at, the pluses definitely outweigh the negatives. The best thing about it was the price. For less than $100 a night, I was able to stay in a great location. The hotel is in walking distance of restaurants and shops. It's VERY close to BART, muni subway, and cable cars. The negatives include the rooms had an older feel to them. In addition, I went to the concierge twice. The first time was to get a recommendation for lunch and he quickly gave me two names and didn't ask me what I wanted to eat or a budget. The second time the woman was a little nicer but didn't go out of her way to be friendly. But overall, if I go back to San Fran, I will likely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY THE BEST.”
Reviews.Author: TARMOM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is IT. It is reasonably priced, very very clean, great hotel staff, and the best of all in a GREAT location. It is 1 block from the cable car or F line, a really nice shopping mall, 2 blocks from union square shopping, and tour buses picked you up rightoutside the hotel. You even can book these tours with the concierge at the hotel. One of the concierge's at this hotel was AWFUL but the other 3 were SUPER D DUPER. They went above and beyond to make our trip what we wanted. They gave great directions and good suggestions on local restaurants. The hotel staff was just as great, helpful and very friendly. Our room was extremely clean and plenty of linens each of our 5 day stay. This is the hotel to stay at when going to San Francisco. We will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Horrific. Parc 55 used to be great, not anymore...”
Reviews.Author: killbondnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc55 because it *used* to be a good hotel, back when I lived in SF, and I had had good experiences there. Got a discounted rate through their web site, so I switched to there instead of at a host hotel for the convention I was attending. What a mistake! They nickel-and-dime you to DEATH, and by the time we were through paying dribs and drabs for things, it was more expensive than the other hotel anyway. Don't get me started on the $40 Valet charge -- better hotels in San Fran have $25 or 30 or so. We, also, parked at the 5th and Mission garage after check-in, which is a couple blocks away, a STEAL at $16/day maximum, and was more convenient to our convention anyhow. Complimentary breakfast for concierge-level rooms was NOT worth it. No hot food, and the lunch meats they did have, looked scary and gross. (A Hampton Inn breakfast is a Lucullan feast next to this place.) Wireless charge was ASTRONOMICAL. Again, why free at the Hampton Inns, properties that are a fraction of the cost? I *like* staying at luxury hotels, but this is senseless. The neighborhood of the hotel is dicey at best, loud, noisy, and full of bums. You have to run a large gauntlet of panhandlers, con artists and questionable vendors just to get to the BART station and cable cars on the next block. Worst of the Parc55 offenses by far however: We had returned the last night of our stay with a to-go box, but realized we didn't get utensils. We rang housekeeping and asked for knives and forks, they said fine. When they came up, they presented a BILL, for $4 for each utensil, AND tax (!!!) on the bill, AND the 18% room service delivery charge!!!! I am not kidding! Over $10 to get a knife and fork! THAT WAS IT! I had a lot to say the next morning at check out -- they removed the tax and the delivery charge, but NOT the charges for the utensils!!! CRAZY! We should have just gone to the Walgreen's down the street or even the 24-hour Carls Jr on the next block... Parc55, never again! I felt bad because I *cheated* on my mainstay Hotel Vitale, and that is a mistake which will not be repeated, I assure you!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel, Rough city”
Reviews.Author: DavyGGG
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights 4/20 to 23. Very nice hotel, Well worth the price. Very large , Very clean, Great location (steps from BART). Would stay again if not in San Francisco. Every where you go there is Homeless Begging. I did not see one uniformed policeman the whole 4 days we were there. I hope they are all undercover. At Fishermans Wharf we watched a "three card monte" game going on for hours. They took a lot of money from a lot of people. No Police in sight. BEWARE. Took a tour on a double decker bus for 2 days and also a ferry to Alactraz it was very nice and worth the price. Glad to be home ALIVE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Okie37
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised and pleased with the quality of this hotel for the price. Parking is costly, but the need for using a car is limited because of location. Very nice lobby and rooms. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: OsideMom2three
Reviews.Content: Sayed here April 9, 2007. Great location for shopping. Room was very clean, though a little worn around the edges. The parking was $47 (for an SUV) for a 24 hour period but you do have in and out privileges and that is quite reasonable for SF. Valet staff were very courteous. Overall for what we paid, it was a great deal and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: auttapol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean room, great location. The only problem with this hotel is their expensive parking $40/day. My recommedation is they shold provide free/inexpensive wireless access to customer

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TxAggieGirl
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is a great hotel for the value. We took a gamble and booked on Hotwire, but were pleasantly pleased with what we got for $110 a night. The checkin was smooth, room service was good and the valets were fast and helpful. The concierge was a bit snotty, but hey, it happens. The only bad thing was the Friday night we were there, some drunk morons were down in the street yelling and doing their best to get hit by taxis at 1 a.m. We could watch them from our room and wished we could have thrown water balloons at them or something to make it more interesting... Even though we were nine floors up, it made sleep tough for a while. No wonder they have complimentary ear plugs in the bathrooms! Overall, a nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: krissydorset
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms online, based really on position, and were delighted. Large clean rooms, helpful staff, would not hesitate to recommend. Central to all we wanted and handy for transport to airport (BART), trolley buses and trams. Aware of homeless but not intimidated by any.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not an upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbunnorita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 over the weekend and found it to be a fair hotel in a central (but not nice) part of downtown SF. I would echo some of the other reviews in saying that while the rooms were clean and the staff were professional, DO NOT come here if you are expecting a 4 star (i.e. Westin, Sheraton, Hilton) type hotel. Having stayed at multiple large-scale business hotels in downtown SF, Parc 55 is on the very bottom of that range. Definitely doesn't deserve its AAA four diamond. Come here if you want a central location and if you can get a much lower rate than from other hotels, but given the choice, I'd definitely recommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Ojaigal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for 4 nights in March, during a combination of business and weekend getaway travel. The hotel was very busy (lots of airline crews, tour groups, etc.); front desk personnel were perfunctory and distracted, but did honor our request for a view room, which was great! We booked through the hotel website, and got a good rate. Our room was spacious, but not well cleaned...poorly dusted and carpet had many "leftovers" from previous guests. Bathroom was not thoroughly cleaned. Cleaning staff were very nice, but VERY NOISY when coming and going in the early morning from their supply room, which was near our room...doors slamming, loud conversation, etc. at 7 a.m., including on the weekends. Calls to housekeeping and front desk did not change this. Concierge was marginally helpful when asked for referrals to basic things (health food store, wine shop, etc.) Room service was prompt and brought some nice little extras. Internet access is $12/day for cable. Refrigerator in the room is $25 one-time charge. Location is terrific; we took BART from the airport and were at the hotel less than an hour after our flight arrived (checked bags). We walked all over the city, and it was never a problem to get a cab right outside the hotel. All-in-all, might stay here again, but will first explore other options in the city. Prefer a cleaner room, and more personal service from concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...reservation problems galore”
Reviews.Author: SunnySanDiegoMom
Reviews.Content: We booked on the hotel website directly. Got what I thought was a decent rate. Called the hotel directly and spoke to Jenny at the front desk the day BEFORE we arrived to discuss the need for adjoining rooms. We were traveling with our children. I also advised her that we would be a late arrival as our plane landed after 10PM. I was told it would be no problem, and she was blocking our rooms as we spoke. You guessed it...when we arrived at 11:25 pm...we were told our rooms had not been blocked and there was no indication that I had told them about the late arrival. We ended up with ONE room that night as the only others rooms available were on a different floor. I was able to give a name of the person I spoke with...but nothing seemed to be happening and they did not even seemed very concerned. Other than to say that the hotel was booked that night and they could do something about it in the morning. I then asked for something to compensate the lack of follow thru and was given a few breakfast coupons. We were told when I called in the morning that if we packed up our bags, they would move us automatically to our requested rooms. This was important because we had important plans for our day. When we arrived back at the hotel at 4:30 PM, no one at the front desk seemed aware of the situation...and they could not be sure where our baggage was. After speaking to the manager Mr. Mussleman we finally got our rooms. When we went to open the doors, only one key worked. More importantly, we could not see our baggage anywhere. After checking BEHIND the CLOSED closet doors we found the luggage. The hotel is in a PERFECT location. It is clean, comfortable and other than the mess ups with our room it would have been a great stay. It is frustrating to spend most of your time dealing with the front desk and moving rooms. If the hotel could take care of that HUGE problem it would be ideal. When it came time to check out...There was a charge for an extra day and FULL charge for Breakfast. One of the front desk workers named Jenny took care of the billing problems and we were on our way. As I said, the location is PERFECT, the people are very friendly, the concierge was great, the housekeepers were lovely. They just need to get their act together at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: vonroad
Reviews.Content: We were in San Fran for a wedding and wanted to stay in the city. Thanks to Hotwire we got a good deal here. Overall it was perfectly fine; the room was nice, and the staff were friendly. My only complaint was parking. $40 a day! We had a car because we had to fly into San Jose (long story) and the wedding was just not accessible by public transportation. I saw other hotels nearby that were charging more like $25. I researched ahead and parked at the 5th and Mission garage just down the street; it saved us about 30%. Other than that, it was a nice place to stay, right in the heart of things near Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel in sfo”
Reviews.Author: ret777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc Fifiy Five hotel on Market Street. Nordstroms was directly across the street. Once I realized which BART exit to take, I was within steps of the hotel. The hotel itself was kept very clean. Maid service was excellent. Every one on the hotel staff I spoke to were friendly and informative. Not many TV channels to choose from. The restaraunt on the second floor was great for breakfast. Never used room service. Since I used BART and my feet for transportation, I didn't have to pay the daily parking fee of $40. A small extra was a package of foam ear plugs in the room. Never did need them. All in all, a very pleasant and troublefree visit. I have no reservations in recommending this hotel. Howard Larson, Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: MauritsLondon
Reviews.Content: At first sight this hotel seems blandly mainstream and you wouldn't think it would leave a lasting impression. The location of this hotel could not be better and the quality is consistent and excellent value. We booked a Club Room and were on the 28th Floor with magnificent views of the city and the Bay area. The Club Lounge is a good place to have breakfast, although it is closed during weekends. The information sheet said it would be open on Sunday evening, but it wasn't. The room is comfortable, clean and tastefully designed and much better then the image of the Lobby and the public areas. The gym is very adequate and the laundry service impeccable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CrabGuy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at the Parc 55 (March 15-18). Let me say first that I pride myself on finding travel bargains. I'd much rather spend my money on good food and wine than on a hotel room. San Francisco has always been an expensive city for travelers, and finding an above-average room at a bargain price can be a challenge. I began researching SF hotels back in December and found the Parc 55 on Trip Advisor and Expedia. I always book directly with the hotel, as the rates are often equal to or lower than the travel websites and you can always cancel the reservation if you find a better rate elsewhere. I booked a king deluxe room on a high-floor and requested an early check-in (1:00pm). When I originally booked in January, the rate was $149. In mid-February, I re-checked the hotelâ€™s website and found the same room for $95, so I rebooked and cancelled the first reservation and saved enough money to buy my wife and I a very nice dinner. I called the hotel 3 days before our arrival to confirm, and informed them that our flight had been changed and that we now expected to arrive around 10:00pm. They assured me that our room would be held. When we arrived at the hotel at about 10:10, the desk clerk informed me that they had no record of our arrival time change and that my king room was no longer available, but that they could put us in a queen deluxe on the 20th floor. She did not apologize, or offer some kind of complimentary perk. After a long day of travel from the east coast I was too tired to negotiate with the manager, so I accepted the offer. The room (Room 2001) was clean, comfortable and very spacious for a big-city hotel, with lots of windows and great views. The closet was large, with plenty of hangers, but no safe for storing valuables. The bed was great â€“ firm mattress, lots of pillows and nice linens. The bathroom was large and clean, and included a one-cup coffee maker. There was no mini-bar fridge (which I would never use anyway). Internet access was available (for a fee), but I carry a Blackberry for emails and leave my laptop home when Iâ€™m traveling for fun. I noted that some travelers complained about the city noise, even on high floors. Folks, this is a large city, and youâ€™ll hear police and fire engine sirens, as well as some street commotion. If you want silence, go camping. Otherwise, use the free earplugs provided by the hotel. The Parc 55 is primarily a business/conference hotel, but there was very little business activity because we stayed Thursday to Sunday. While some people have complained about the lobby furnishings and somewhat â€œdatedâ€� look of the public areas, I thought the hotel was more than adequate for leisure travelers. If youâ€™re looking for â€œcharm,â€� try the Serrano Hotel or The Orchard, a few blocks away. The location is ideal, with easy access to Market Street and Union Square shopping and mass transit. We resorted to taking a cab on Friday night to meet friends for dinner in the Russian Hill neighborhood, otherwise mass transit and walking worked great for getting around town. My interaction with the staff was limited to the desk clerk, bellman and housekeeper, who were all pleasant and helpful. We donâ€™t normally use room service. Overall, the Parc 55 was a winner. The value for the money was exceptional when you consider its spacious rooms, great location and accessibility. I would recommend it and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Charged for no-show when I had cancelled”
Reviews.Author: Rea27
Reviews.Content: I should say right off that I have never stayed at this hotel. I did have a rather unpleasent experience with their staff, though. I booked a Feb 2007 reservation through the Mariott's web site in late 2006. I later received a notice that the Parc was discontinuing it's relationship with Marriott, so my stay at the Parc would not count for Marriott points or nights. So I cancelled my reservation on Mariott's web site, and recieved a cancellation email and number. Then I got my February credit card bill and found a charge for one night at the hotel. I dug up the cancellation email and called. My first call was after business hours, and I was told to call back during business hours. The next day I called during business hours and explained the situation to someone in the accounting department. That person told me that the problem was my cancelling on Marriott's site rather than calling them. I never understood why that was a problem, since I cancelled well before they dropped off the Mariott's system, but in any case I expected that they would credit me immediately. Instead I was told that it would take several days to research it and I should call back if I did not receive the credit. It would seem to me that if the Parc knew they were having a problem with cancellations on Mariott's system, that THEY would take the initiative to research no-shows. Instead, I find that it is taking a considerable amount of my time to avoid being charged, when the hotel seems to be at fault for losing the cancellation - and that is in spite of the fact that they are apparently well aware of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sfbness
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 had everything we needed, easy access, spacious room and bathroom. Concierge and staff were very helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: someseesee
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I had ever stayed. It is 4 star hotel, customer services is excellent. I arrived with two kids and a lot of luggage, plus a double stroller. They helped me unload all my stuff and parked my mini van. The front desk gave my room number to the bell man, so he brought all my stuff to my room in 10 minutes. I called the valet parking and my mini van was ready in 15 minutes. Nice city view from my room (26 floors). Bed is very comfortable. Hotel is very clean. I only paid $119 for one night stay. All my friends in San Francisco thought I got good deal. Con: parking is $40 per day plus tax, but I think it is worth for the service I got.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: SFtoSD
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3-day stay at the Parc 55. The hotel is in a great location near the Powell Street cable car stop. The room was decent too. The only big problem was the noise. The walls are paper thin! I could hear every single word the people next door said. After a couple of hours, I went down to the lobby and asked to be switched to a new room. Same problem with the new room... I could hear my new neighbor's entire conversation. I switched rooms AGAIN and the third room was fine. Make sure you don't get a room with an adjoining room! The staff was nice about changing my room- they probably get this complaint often...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad management”
Reviews.Author: travelmom2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel, recently liberated from the Marriot chain, heavily promoted itself on Expedia. For something special, my husband and I treated my mom to a 60th birthday trip in San Francisco. I wanted a special hotel, but could not afford the W. The price was right for this place, the location was EXCELLENT - around the corner from the cable car, across the street from the BART station and the big, new Westfield shopping center, and a few blocks from Union square. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable - soft pillows, feather comfortors. I even had room service bring tea - a charming Chinese gentleman delivered it with new years wishes and lots of giggles. BUT - and this is the big BUT - we were not given our room until 2AM!!!!!!! We checked in at 9 PM. Fortunately, my mom and I checked in the day before, so we were able to put our 2 young sons to bed in her room. My husband and I waited 5 hours in the lobby, mostly standing in line with about 25 other very hostile guests, waiting for our room. There was a couple who had spent 25 hours traveling from Caracas, VZ, a man with Parkinson's disease who desperately needed rest, and a long list of other stories. In addition to all of this, the hotel staff repeatedly double assigned rooms. They would send a relieved guest up to a room, only to have them return to say someone was already in it!!! Can you imagine how mortifyingly embarrassing that must have been for both parties???? This happened at least 4 times by my count. When we were given our room assignment, we made the staff call the room before we went up. The other part that was so awful was that we were told 3 times that our room would be ready in 30 minutes, and to come back. It took at least 1 hour to get through the line. My question is, why didn't the staff let people know what was going on? They knew the rooms wouldn't be ready, with only the small night cleaning staff and a number of very late check-outs (Singapore Air has a regular contract, I guess). Really unconscionable! My husband refused the offer of a free breakfast (hah!) and demanded the room for free - which is what we got. If you want to stay in this hotel, you are rolling the dice with your time and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: strathj
Reviews.Content: We had a convention/meeting rate based on my wife's employment. We live in the San Francisco Bay area. We were pleasantly surprised and would choose this property for a weekend getaway. Room was contemporary generic, with queen bed, writing desk, love seat and coffee table. Large bathroom with closing door. Good thermostat. Better than properties in the area that are rehabilitated older properties. Location is not Union Square, but very close--but if you go walking at night alone, be sure you are walking in the Union Square direction. Stay on a high floor to minimize urban noise. Prices for such things as room service are high, but lots of local options VERY close by--starting with Burger King and going up and up. If you get a decent price, this is a very good "play it safe" choice. Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Loved It ”
Reviews.Author: kiwijoy
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel Feb 18 2007. Long line at checkit but it went very quickly. The front desk staff are very efficient. We book a club room and got upgraded to a king suite which was on floor 30. What a beautiful room(S) had a foyer with fridge, huge bedroom, bed was wonderful, bathroom was across the hall and was nice, living room was great, and the view.......WOW It evn has its own big deck. Tastefully furnished. Only drawback was outside our bedroom window was the hotel air con units...very noisy!!!!! 3007. I could not sleep, i called down at 1.30am to see if they could do anything about the noise, the maintence worker came up and was going to put some insulation strips on to help drown out the noise but i asked for earplugs instead...sort of helped. However it was such a fabulous room that i was happy even with an hour or two of sleep. The club room had a great view, good food and great staff. We had lunch from the Thai place in the hotel, very yummy! We took BART so didn't have to pay parking and everything is within walking distance. We had drinks at First Crush across the road, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: DrA.G.D.
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel 2/7/2006 unfortunately at midnight because our flight was delayed. I was to attend a conference the next day. A non-smoking room as reserved was not available. When we arrived at the only room available at 12:30 AM the cleaning staff were in the room spraying it down with lysol and air refreshiner. The room reaked of ciagarette smoke which worsened if you turned on the fan or heat. Although I applaud them for their efforts, the combination was noxious. At 1:30AM the fire alarm in the room went off. After over an hour of deliberation with the front desk, security, and maintenace staff we finally got a non-smoking room at 2:30 AM. After the inconvenience of a delayed flight the inconvenience at the hotel was rather unwelcome and made my trip to SanFran rather unproductive. For $242 plus tax per night I would avoid this place like the plague. I had intended to write a letter to corporate but was told the hotel is no longer under management with Marriot and is in limbo with regard to management. Things are becoming a little more clear....

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Teyla
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 day stay at the Parc 55! The location is the best because of the proximity to BART (across the street), and the cable cars (1 block away). Westfield Shopping Center is located directly across the street (Nordstroms, Bloomingdale, great food court too). The service and the rooms were excellent and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco that would like to be close to the shopping and public transportation. It is right on Market Street, and is close to Chinatown. Parking is a little pricey at $40 for overnight; however, parking is at a premium at this location. We found great rates for this hotel on Expedia; however, I would recommend that you check out their website (Parc 55) first because they have several special package rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, best location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: EdRicarti
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff was very friendly and helpful. I arrived early and they gave me a room right away. The concierge was very knowledgeable and gave us an updated map, and also suggestions of places to go. Hotel was close to everything. I toke the train from the airport to the hotel, it toke about 25 min. and costs less than U$6.00 each way. Subway and cable cars are steps away from the hotel too. Tourist information centre is across the street from the hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Your search is over!!!”
Reviews.Author: Radrat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Parc 55 and had to write about our GREAT experience! We loved the hotel and the area. First of all, as we checked in, the service at the front desk was fantastic and the staff was very friendly. They assigned us a Club View Room on the 31st floor which has spectacular views of the downtown skyline and access to their private lounge for evening drinks and continental breakfast in the morning, also located on the 31st floor. The room was very clean and the beds were wonderful with plenty of pillows to choose from. If possible, leave your car at home. This place is located within 1 block from any type of transportation you could need. BART, MUNI, Trolleys, cable cars, busses and taxis are all a stones throw away. I would highly suggest the 3 day MUNI pass for $18. It can be purchased at the cable car ticket booth on Powell and Market St. There is a large mall just across the street and Union Square 1 block away. Last but not least, I would like to comment the concierge for his great knowledge of the area and his wonderful help in setting up our itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tymothy
Reviews.Content: Well you can't beat the location, right at Market and Powell St. So if your looking for downtown shopping you can't beat this hotel. It is a little dated and could us an update. But the rooms are a good size, very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: yupric
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend who was attending a conference here. Picked the hotel based on that. The hotel is located well, not far from lots of shopping on Union Square and across the street from a main transit station. One thing I have to say is try to book on a higher floor. We where on Geary street on a lower floor and it was quite noisy most nights. If you wear earplugs it might suffice. Service was quick to the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Stroll in the Parc”
Reviews.Author: LadyRayRay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had stayed at Renaissance Parc 55 after thoroughly reading the reviews on this site as well as others. We decided to give it a shot and were absolutely impressed and satisfied. LOCATION and TRANSPORTATION: Renaissance Parc is located in Union Square and I discovered that it was close to many forms of transportation including both the BART and the MUNI. And while cabs are scarce in San Francisco, I was pleased to see that there were usually at least 2 cabs waiting outside by the street. If there aren't any cabs there, I know that there were always a line of cabs outside of the Westin Hotel a few blocks away. Literally right outside Parc hotel is a shopaholic's dream. It's blocks away from Saks, Macy's, and other department stores as well as unique boutiques and stores along the way. There's also a new Westfield Mall right by there on Market Street which has a Nordstrom and Bloomindales. I also took a walk to Chinatown from there, and while it's not that far, make sure to wear comfy shoes. Somewhat southwest of the hotel further down Market Street, the area gets a little bit shadier and seems to crawl with even more homeless people (San Francisco as a whole has a huge homeless population), but it's nothing to be wary of. As for places to eat by there - we ate at a dim sum place called Tian Sing right outside which was great! The place was clean (cleaner than the ones I saw in Chinatown) and the service was very attentive. We also ate at this trendy spot across the street from Tian Sing called First Crush. The place was okay, but not exactly worth the pricey tag. I'd just go there again for drinks or a cocktail. SERVICE and CLEANLINESS: We checked in around 11am and found out from the hotel desk that official check-in time was not until later at 3pm; however, before even asking, the woman checked to see if there were any available rooms and checked us in to a 14th floor room. The man who brought up the luggage to our room was very helpful and pointed out what was what right from our window (whichwas a breathtaking view!). The room was clean. The bed was very comfy and cushy and had a plethora of pillows! The bathroom was big and absolutely not cramped like some hotel bathrooms I've seen. The only problem I seemed to have was with their shower curtain- no matter how much I tried to close the curtain, it seemed as if water would always be seeping onto the floor. BOTTOM LINE: The place was exactly what we wanted. A clean hotel with genuine and friendly service right in the heart of the city. As for price, it was mid-range, but well worth it. I'd definitely stay here again and try to get a room on a higher floor for an even more spectacular view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JRGreen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here after Thanksgiving for four nights. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff were all very nice - from the maids to the front desk. The Veranda lounge is nice in the evenings with live piano music and a great bar. The location here is excellent - close to the public transportation, Union Square, shopping, etc. There are some panhandlers in nearby Union Square but this comes with the territory in San Francisco, which has a large number of homeless. We had a room on the 16th floor which had a nice skyline view - I understand the views are even better higher up. Will definitely stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: WappingViisitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights mid-November with my partner. We were given a great, really comfortable room on the 24th floor. The view was simply fantastic. The beds were really comfortbale and the staff throught were attentive and helpful. We would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, serious homless problem around hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms. Christina
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location in proximity to things to do in the city, beautiful lobby, average to above average rooms, with a nice view. Excellent service that I would expect from an upscale hotel. Right away we were bombarded by the homeless. We we're just pulling into the parking garage (which costs $40 a night) and a homeless man came to the window, very agressively begging, would not leave our window no matter how many times we asked him to go away. In he morning, we walked to breakfast. Immediately outside the doors, two homeless people asking for money, one making sickly disturbing comments about my six year old daughter. Not far away, we were followed and harrassed by another homless person. They were everywhere you turned, literally, and very agressive. The Parc Renassaince tried their best to shoo them from in front of the hotel, but once you step a few feet away from the property, you are a target.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, awful telecommunications”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Parc 55 for a business meeting. The hotel is conveniently situated very close to the Metro station - also very convenient to the multi-company car rental pickup/dropoff garage across from the Hilton on O'Farrell Street. While there were panhandlers in the area, as mentioned in other reviews, we didn't find them aggressive. The room was nice and well-maintained and the fitness center was well-equipped. Room service dinner was good and not overpriced. My main complaint was the telecommunications. First, there's the usual $10 per day charge for high-speed Internet access- a ridiculous nickel-and-dime charge when you know most of your guests will need it. I couldn't get connected after we arrived and spent 15 minutes on the phone with Tech Support. They said they needed to check some things and would call back- they never called back. I called again and they said the modem was bad and would be replaced. It was 8 PM Sunday. I went off to my meetings Monday morning (still no modem) and finally when my husband went to the front desk and requested a new modem they sent one up. The second problem was the phone lines. There was some kind of feedback on the line that made it hard to hear. I had to resort to my cell phone for the tech support calls. I tried participating in a teleconference on Tuesday morning on the hotel phone (800 call-in #) and the sound quality was so bad I had to disconnect and use my cell phone again. Usually a cell phone is worse than a land line. Not here. Summary- I'd recommend this hotel unless it's important for you to use their Internet/phone connections.

Reviews.Title: “Right at the Centre of Things”
Reviews.Author: PumpDesigner
Reviews.Content: This hotel, like most in this chain, is well run with attentive service and clean comfortable rooms. The location is excellent and close to the cable car stop right in down town SF. Excellent shopping is all around. I prefer this downtown location to the overly touristy Fishermans Wharf area. One word of caution, SF was full of homeless people when I visited. Although I never felt threatened or in danger they can be intimidating if you are on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Valet Parking Watch Them”
Reviews.Author: Heart10
Reviews.Content: We arrived in hotel after a flight from North Carolina. Unsure of how difficult it would be to find the hotel we were pleasantly surprised how easy it was to find and get into. Check-in was quick and efficient. The polite lady gave us the details of the hotel and directions to places that we inquired about. Our room was on the 26th floor and had a wonderful view of the city. The room was very large and clean. The bathroom was big and very clean. There were more towels than we would use in a week at home. The hotel if very close to the cable-car (about a half block to a block). There was a long line for the cable-car but well worth the wait to get to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel is also in an excellent shopping district (found a wonderful shoe store about 2-3 blocks away, that my hubby wishes didn't exist.) We went into Barley 'N' Hops Sports Bar located in the hotel for a quick bite to eat and had so much fun joking with the waiter / bartender that we stayed for 2 hours. The food was very good and not expensive (1 burger w/ fries, 1 chicken sandwich w/ fries, 1 soft drink and 1 beer) at about $20.00. The only problem we had was when we checked out we paid for the Valet parking at check-out. When we went to get the car, the people at the valet parking office tried to charge us again even though we showed them we had paid at check-out. They were rude and told us this was not the correct way to do this. They even asked us to go back inside and get the money, we refused. Because of this they were very slow in getting our car and when they did, the driver got out of the car and stood with his hand held out. We loaded our own luggage and the guy continued to stand with his hand held out. My husband shook his hand and said, "thank you." After the way we were treated we did not feel they deserved a tip. However, I must say that when we arrived the valet staff was very nice and helpful. They quickly came to the car and opened our doors and helped us get all of our belongings out of the car and carried them inside to check-in for us. Quick advice on Valet parking: Valet parking is $40 per night: On-site self parking is either $8 per hour or $40 per night. If you are not planning on driving upon arrival the Valet parking is a better deal because parking is scarce (even with the rudeness when we were leaving.) I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We used Marriot travel vouchers and had no problems using them.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad - Not Great”
Reviews.Author: traveltina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early August as a family of 4 w/ 15 & 12 year old kids on first trip to San Francisco. The hotel is a bit outdated; not rundown necessarily, just outdated. We had a gorgeous suite with wraparound views on one of the upper floors. The view was just stunning--we could see the Golden Gate Bridge out the bedroom window and the Coit Tower out the Living Room window. Service was fine; restaurant was ok. Nothing really outstanding; just average. This is probably a better business hotel than tourist place. But if you get a great rate or use points, it is just fine. The cable car was right there, there was lots of shopping. It was not the best part of town but convenient enough.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Buds46
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Parc 55 in september during a business trip. 5minutes from union square and main shopping area. hotel room was spacious clean and gave us clear views of the city. Thai restaurant in the hotel served amazing thai food that was reasonably priced. the sports bar was also a great place to eat and drink. location of the hotel is really well placed - you're in the middle of everything. planning on coming back to SF next year for a vacation and will be sure to book my room at Parc 55 again. perfect place to relax after a hard days work (or shopping ;) )

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SandyCA
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to union square, across the street from bart and cable car. Hotel very clean, nice room 1001 with 4 very large bay windows with a city view. Room large, clean, the bathroom tile is dated, shower pressure excellent. Bed comfortable. Excellent italian restaurant across the street, check out is 1pm which was great. Parking at hotel $39 a day, however if you walk 1 block down steet price $29 a day and if you park in off site garages after 5:30pm and out by 9:30 am only $15. Bid for room on priceline $75. I would stay here again and do feel it is a good deal if you can get the room for $150 or less. Staff very friendly and helpful. Street noise early in morning due to garbage trucks which is common in SF, bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance during a recent visit to San Francisco to attend a conference. The location is excellent. Right on Market, easy access to Union Square, and right next to a large BART station from which you can easily get to both San Francisco and Oakland airports. The hotel itself is not as glamorous as the web site makes it appear. It's a standard large hotel. Well maintained, but without charm. The rooms are small, but this is typical of San Francisco. For example, there were two large chairs near the window, but you really had to put your feet up on one of the beds to sit in them. The bed was very comfortable, with a nice comforter and plenty of pillows. The bathroom was OK, but didn't have much counter space. The "bay" window looked out over the roof of part of the hotel and some air conditioning units. The workout room had a pretty good selection of bikes and treadmills, but very few Nautilus style machines, and the AC wasn't working terribly well. There is quite a good Thai restaurant in the building, and easy access to many restaurants in the area. I would stay at this hotel again, but only for less than the $220 "special" conference rate.

Reviews.Title: “decent”
Reviews.Author: nola75
Reviews.Content: I booked this room after reading the reviews and getting a good rate through AAA. Two days before I was to arrive, I received an email from the hotel asking if I would need anything special for my stay; extra pillows, late check-in, etc. So I requested 2 foam pillows, which was one of the choices and a room away from the elevators. Fast Forward to check in: there was no one in line at the front desk however none of the agents even looked up. Two of them were having their own conversation. When she finally did look up she just asked us our name and for our credit card, handed us our keys and told us where the elevator was. She never once smiled or even said hello. I felt this was a bit off-putting as she was so not friendly. We get up to our floor and surpise surprise our room is 2 doors away from the elevator and no foam pillows. I didnt complain because in reality it wasnt going to hamper my stay but the fact that I asked for these things and was given the complete opposite unnerved me a bit. The positives: The room was quite large, especially for SF. The bed was super comfy. Location is great to catch any type of public transportation and right by union square. The bathroom could use some updating, specifically the floor. I did not eat at the hotel or use the fitness center. All in all, I would stay here again as the price was good and if youre visitng SF you shouldnt be in your room that much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Boringly competent”
Reviews.Author: Riffmaster
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights here in August. Very good location near Union Square, Macys etc and the Powell Street cable terminus. Appears grand on entering, but after forcing you to drag your bags down a long chandelier clad corridor to check in, thats it! Staff ok, but one chap next to me was not getting what he had booked, and although he was very polite and calm, staff member seemed pretty indifferent. Our room was of modest size, and the whole scenario (like the rest of the hotel) was bland,bland,bland. We were also just behind the lift which could be heard at night. $40.00 a night for parking? No thanks - cheaper garages abound around every corner! Very average, sure could do better for less.

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: JenSmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most disappointing hotels in San Francisco and an absolute embarassment to the Renaissance brand. I have traveled to San Francisco more than 100 times over the last five years and sampled just about every major upscale hotel in the area. I would stay anywhere but this place. The disappointment begins with the area that the hotel is located in, which, although centrally located, is the seediest part of the city and abounds in threatening looking characters. I felt at risk just stepping out of the hotel! The overall ambience within the hotel is gaudy early-eighties and an absolute assault to the eyes and senses. Rooms are small, even by San Francisco standards, and missing the nice balconies that hotels like Hilton and Meridien have. The overall feeling is of clutter and claustrophobia, exacerbated by windows that don't open adequately and leaflets touting all manner of hotel services. The beds are comfortable but nothing unique to the upgraded beds available at almost all major chains today. By the way, almost every pictures on the hotel website is highly unrepresentative of reality. Hotel infrastructure is in need of serious upgrading. Heating and air-conditioning system is ineffective and noisy. Water pressure is weak and hot and cold water mixing is problematic leading to uncomfortable showers and shaving. To cap it all, the hotel charges a usurious rate for internet service and only offer service from noon-to-noon regardless of when you check-in and check-out. Bathrooms have a dated feel and look. And there are marks on the wall of amenities that were once attached to walls and are now gone. Hotel staff service levels are nothing special and a little below average. The concierge lounge is absolutely below standards of typical hotel properties and closed on weekends unlike most other major upscale hotels in downtown SF. Overall, the quality and feel of this hotel is a better fit for Fairfield Inn than Marriott's top-of-the-line Renaissance brand. Only worth a stay if you can get it a Fairfield prices -- i.e. , below US$60.
