Reviews.Title: “Nice, Big City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoustonFamily
Reviews.Content: Fairly typical large city hotel. Rooms were nice although a bit small (no room for a roll away in a two queen bed room). Looked new and well maintained; staff was helpful. Nice view from room towards financial district and south down the bay. Breakfast buffet expensive but good. Convenient to cable cars and Union Square. Parking not unreasonable for SF and they were very efficient with my coming and going several times during the day. If you've stayed in a nice big city hotel, you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: brv08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to attend a concert at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. It was a quick walk to the auditorium. The hotel is right across the street from the cable cars, close to all the major shopping and within walking distance to Union Square. In the times I have been to San Francisco, I have yet to find a GOOD neighborhood. The streets are overrun with homeless people begging for money. With this being said, I feared for my life on our walk to the concert. It is really bad! However, I was pleased with the hotel. The bedding was great! Very comfortable bed, and descent size room (remember you are in San Francisco). The pictures on the Marriott website are a bit misleading. the hotel lobby is a fraction of the size it appears in the pictures. I must say, everything was clean and in order. I would stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: max71
Reviews.Content: My son and I travelled to San Francisco at the end of June for a 16 night tour of the West Coast of America starting in SF. Following our arrival by the BART $5.30 each from SF airport we came out of the station and walked across the road to the Renainssance Parc 55. Checked in by Robert who was lovely, very nice room on the 10 floor good view of the city and bay in the distance. No complaints what so ever. Our only disapointment in SF was not pre-booking tickets to Alcatraz via the internet, and as our stay was only for 2 nights we missed out! It may cost a few more $ but not as much as another trip from the UK!!!! We would travel back to SF but only to see Alcatraz, everything else was very nice and just like on TV but we've seen it now! Oh.....do remember a coat YES IT IS COLD IN SUMMER!!!! about 62 degrees and very windy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JasonBailey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for one night on Saturday, June 24. The lobby is beautiful and the service from the valet and front desk staff is very good. Overall, the property is very clean and appears to be well maintained. My room on the tenth floor was also clean, fairly large for a S.F. property, had a decent view and was well appointed. The bed was actually very comfortable. I did by the way ask for a complimentary upgrade at check in so its possible that my room was a little nicer than the regular rooms but you often don't know if you really are being upgraded unless you are a regular and/or are very familiar with the property. I did not dine at the hotel so I cannot comment about the quality of the food at the Parc however I had a drink in the sports bar which was quite small but like any other hotel sports bar. The Parc 55 is definitely one of the most "strategically" located hotels in S.F. in my opinion. Union Square, shopping and great restaurants are all very close and within easy walking distance. There is also an abundance of stores with wine, food, etc. all around the area if one wanted to get supplies or perhaps their own wine/beer. One disappointment however was the absence of an in room refrigerator and mini bar which made having any cold snacks or beverages on hand impossible. The Parc 55 is where the visiting baseball teams stay when they are in town to play the Giants (at least it used to be and I believe that this is still the case). All in all, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the centrally located Renaissance Parc 55 Hotel for 4 nights on business and was very pleased. Staff was attentive without being overbearing, the room was absolutely divine (spacious corner room with a wonderful view) and squeaky clean, and room service was fast and tasty and moderately priced. There are several restaurants within walking/trolley distance but my favorite during this trip was a nice Italian restaurant - Panetti's (friendly people, excellent food) â€“ located across the street from the hotel. Business or pleasure, I will definitely return to the Parc 55 my next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit”
Reviews.Author: vallecitogirl
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I made a quick decision to travel to San Francisco to do a little sight seeing and shopping. Since we were so late in making our travel plans most hotels were sold out or were asking top $$ for their rooms. We tend to stay at either Marriotts, Hiltons or Hyatts so I was a little surprised when the Marriott Renaissance Parc 55 showed availability at a decent price. What was even a bigger surprise was that I was able to use my Marriott points which left us more money for shopping! We arrived at the hotel around noon and fully expected to leave our bags with the bellman and check in later in the day. To our surprise a room was ready and we immediately checked in. The front desk could not of been more helpful. Our room was non-smoking as requested with two very comfortable beds. We were given a room with a "bay view". We were on the 17th floor and the view was of the bay but not much of it. Too many other high rise buildings in the way blocking the view. The higher you go, the better view but this was not an issue to us. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was just fine. They could use more counter space for storage. The biggest drawback was the ability to hear people in the rooms on either side of us. I wonder if the guests in those rooms knew that we could hear their early morning conversations about getting ready for their flights or their late night giggles, etc. I was surprised that we did not have evening turn down service, this would have been a nice touch. The location of the hotel was perfect. Just around the corner from Union & Powell streets you were at the beginning of the cable car system or just steps from the BART station. You are also within walking distance of all the shopping around Union Square. The front desk and bell desk was very helpful with maps, where to go and where not to go (the tenderloin district) and dining options. We never did dine in the hotel so I cannot comment on that. Too many places around the hotel to eat so why bother with hotel dining. It was suggested that we buy a 1 day pass for the cable car which we did. It use is good for the cable cars and the bus system. It was also suggested that on our return trip to the airport we use the BART system. Since we had to pay a $42 (incl. tip) cab fare to the hotel from the airport on our return we used the BART system. $5.15 one-way. It was great! Only drawback to this is the ticket machines don't really have instructions on them and most people are either too busy to help you or are in the same boat as you. We did find a nice lady that was getting her own ticket to help us out only to have a very rude lady come up from behind and start yelling at us because we were holding up the line! Nobody else seemed to have a problem with us and there are many machines. I think she was just an unhappy person. Would we stay here again - yes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingfromTX
Reviews.Content: We stay at many Marriotts. The Renaissance Parc 55 was what I would classify as fine. The lobby was pretty, however the hallways and the rooms were just average size and were a little worn. The service was very good, however we had a major problem with the doorman and a limo company, which has yet to be resolved. The location was wonderful. You could walk virtually everywhere, or take the Powell Street Cable car 1.5 blocks away, the BART across the way, or an inexpensive taxi to most sights! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Renaissance standards”
Reviews.Author: horns1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for 5 days in April and had three rooms for a family trip. I have stayed at Marriotts and Renaissance hotels often and am familiar with what standards to expect. I aslo have traveled to San Fran often and have stayed at other hotels in the Union Square area. Although the Renaissance line of hotels can be inconsistant about what to expect, this hotel is more like a Holiday Inn in their standards. It definately ranks far below comparable hotels in the area that I have stayed in, including the St. Francis, Hyatt and far below the Fairmont. The rooms are stripped of most upgrades that were once there and the overall appearance is not very memoriable. The restaurants do not operate fully at dinner and it seems that everything is done to save money. The lounge was closed on weekends and other services were reduced. For the same price as The Palace and Omni it is very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 - still a leading contender”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 has remained an excellent hotel, well-run, definitely meets or exceeds expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out very well”
Reviews.Author: psu0904
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights (4/7 - 4/9) at this hotel while in San Francisco for a conference. The hotel is very attractive, with clean rooms and beds to die for. I mean, this must be what laying on a cloud feels like. However, despite the wonderful bed, I was unable to sleep the first night because I had a room on the sixth floor overlooking the alley and the dumpsters that I became very well aquainted with. I was compensated by the hotel for this lack of sleep resulting from the dumster noise in the form of a new room on the thirteenth floor and a comped room (first night). I thought this was very stand-up and customer-oriented by the hotel - hence my high rating. I felt that I was treated very well and always with the utmost courtesy. The one final point is that the housekeeping staff need to ensure that the creamer in the little coffee packets are not stale. I had this experience but they quickly brought fresh replacements.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SeminarTrekker
Reviews.Content: I do like to stay at Marriott's and stayed at this Marriott Parc 55 Renaissance Hotel because it was convenient to a S.F. Amtrak Rail Pick Up Bus Stop,across from the San Francisco Shopping Center on Market. I had taken the train into the East Bay. I was in town for a Film Festival. The check in process was smooth and the front desk reception person was friendly and efficient. My room had a nice city view, and was clean and looked modern. Moderate size. This hotel is convenient to many San Francisco attractions, restaurants, trendy stores, as well as transportation lines (B.A.R.T., Muni buses, Trolley Cars, Cable Cars). There is only one enterance into the Hotel but multiple exists. This Marriott is part of their Renaissance line (typically older restored buildings). I stayed at one other Marriott Renaissance, The Chancery Court in London, which is one of the finest place's I stayed at. My only complaint, is one of the days, they messed up on cleaning my room, but later on in the day, someone checked about it. Other than that, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yc999
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at this property for 6 days over new year of 2006. This is a great property in SF, best location of all, we think. We were warned that parking in SF is very expensive($40/day), we don't want to waste money on parking at all. So without a rental, this property is the one. You can take the bart train from Airport to the Bart station at Pawell st, which is located just accross the street from the hotel. And if you do want to get out of town to check out other sites, you can easily rent a car for the day, which is very convinient. In town, the powell st cable cart is just around the corner. We got a room on the higher flr, so the noise level could be lower, and plus you get nice city view.... they do have in-room high speed internet, but cost extral, I ordered it for a week, around $40, I think, which is worth it, since it is very good for finding out the stuff you want to do, restrauants you want to eat at, e.t.c.... Over all, we are very happy with it. This will be our spot for SF from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: radiacabeza
Reviews.Content: BF and I stayed at the Parc 55 this past weekend and we had a great time. The hotel is just across the street from the Powell Street Bart station - super convenient. It is about a 2-3 min walk to Powell Street and the great shops & restaurants. Had a great corner room with a nice city view (room 2269). Be aware that you can hear city noise. Hotel staff were very friendly. Room was large and clean. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bianca79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni on December 2, 2005 for 1 night. The hotel is beautiful and service is excellent! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Holidays at the Parc”
Reviews.Author: smalltowngalReno
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for two nights, Dec 22-23, and couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. Prior to our arrival, I spoke to Donna (at the front desk) who was very helpful and made arrangements for two adjoining rooms with lovely views of the city. After reading many reviews about small rooms in the city, I found these rooms to be quite spacious with a sitting area where we could enjoy our coffee in the morning while enjoying the view. We found the beds very comfortable, the bathrooms good size, and the water pressure for showers was good. They had a great holiday room rate, $119/night, which was appreciated since parking is expensive $38/night. Everyone at the hotel, from the bellman to the room service waiter, was very courteous and friendly and we would definitely stay there again. We walked to Union Square and did some shopping and took in many San Francisco events. First, be prepared, everything in SF is EXPENSIVE. The first night we attended a concert at Davies Symphony Hall (excellent venue and fantastic musicians). Afterwards, we had dinner at the Italian restaurant across the street from the hotel(Panetti's)and it was very good. I recommend the eggplant parmesan. The second day we attended the 2pm performance of the San Francisco Ballet's Nutcracker at the War Memorial Opera House. This is an experience you don't want to miss. Beautiful scenery and dancing, it was truly breathtaking. I think we should have stopped with those two events, because the last one (Holiday Lights Tour) on the motorized cable car was a bummer. First, the only holiday lights you see are at Union Square (which is where we boarded). It's the standard (canned) tour of the city, nothing more, which we may have enjoyed more during the day, but at night, you miss a lot. Not recommended. After the tour, we couldn't find a place to eat that wasn't packed to the gills with shoppers, and it was 9pm. We finally got a table at Johnny's, where it was cramped and hot and the server had an attitude. Expensive and not very good, I wouldn't recommend Johnny's either. I think we would try and make dinner reservations next time we visit. All in all, we had a wondeful time in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: Doll3001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 on December 30th with my fiance, at a discounted rate we got using priceline. It was my first time using priceline, and I think I should have started with an even lower rate, but at $100 a night we were very satisfied. We were accomidated in our request for a room on a high floor; the nice lady at the check in desk gave us a bay view room on the 26th floor. The hotel is very big, and a little corporate looking, the lobby decor is maybe a little less than cutting edge, but the rooms are very clean, with nice, expensive looking furniture, good quality amenities in the bathroom, and a comfortable bed with a lovely looking bedspread. It did have one of those weird foamy blankets under the bedspread, and I am afraid of actualy touching hotel bedspreads, but we were comfortable nonetheless. Everything looked extremely clean, I am just paranoid. The windows do not open, but you have your own thermostat. We were able to hear people walking above us and people in the hall occasionaly, but never in a ongoing way and not at night. We were in town just for the night to go to a concert, and to do a little shopping. The location was great for shopping at Union Square, we got everything done quickly and easily. We were so happy in our room that we ended up ordering room service, which was prompt and extremely good! We had a very nice stay, and if you get a good rate, I would say don't hesitate to stay at the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of location, room type and service”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/2-4,2005. Had a regular room on the 23 floor. Hotel was almost full but didn't feel that way. You are 1/2 a block from the BART/MUNI staion on Powell which is fantastic. Room was typical Marriott type - the room was adequate and my bathroom was great, although I had a corner room. The room was spotless and the shower items were replaced daily. Windows had a door at the bottom to open and close for fresh air which was appreciated. It's a noisy part of town, but the windows blocked out all but the loudest sirens. Service was great, I was given late check out and the concierge took care of my simple request with a smile. Elevators were quick and there are plenty of places close by to get coffee, snacks etc. There are pay-internet stations that were not horribly expensive near the main restaurant. - $4.00 for 20 minutes - much better than using the TV internet or paying $12 for 24 hours just to check your email real quick. I got a very good rate but would pay a bit more for the combination of services available and location. The building is starting to look a bit dated, but everything works and is clean.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok - not topnotch Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: jessicak
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel room but small. Not much room to navigate around the bed, although there was a nice small sitting area by the window. Bathroom was not particularly large either (an issue for my traveling companion.) With all the hotels in SF, I didn't see anything about this one to entice me to stay there again, necessarily. I expect top-level accommodations at a Renaissance. I did appreciate that Parc 55 had a parking package rate because we drove to SF, where parking is notoriously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - but stay on a higher floor”
Reviews.Author: Jct_9_M3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and really had no complaints with the hotel. Great location, very close to Union Square, shopping, convention centre, SFMOMA, etc. Room was fine; good service particularly from housekeeping. Breakfast in the restaurant is pricey, although the bar area immediately outside serves complimentary coffee and inexpensive pastries. Only downside was the noise from the surrounding streets: Thought I would be OK on the 9th floor, but it's a zoo around here late at night (it is the middle of San Francisco after all). Mostly, very loud police sirens going every half hour through the night. However, the hotel moved me up to the 22nd floor and all was well. Great view too. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It did it for me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having travelled all that distance across the Atlantic for our annual holidays in California it was a pleasure to relax in the luxurious and spacious rooms of the Renaissance Park 55. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful, in addition to there prompt response to all our requests. The hotel location is second to none for sightseeing, shopping and dining out. To sum up the hotel, the surroundings, the staff and location made that special difference to our holidays. We will be back! Joe Taylor

Reviews.Title: “Corporate But OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very competent and central hotel, two minutes walk from Union Square and really convenient for the SF mall, right opposite. Room was fine - good size and a fantastic view. Asked for an upgrade to the Club floor and was given it - the restaurant was good, and the bar serves some really good cocktails, but if there's a conference going on, the bar is way too small. Overall, nothing special, but competent, very clean and on the higher floors, great views.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Trev01
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel near all the action. Particularly good for Union Square, shopping and the cable car terminus. A medium quality hotel which does everthing correctly and efficiently. High level rooms are better than lower level which, as previous reviewers noted, are tired and in need of a makeover. The Club Lounge on 31st floor is unusually open 7 days a week and provides a good continental breakfast buffet, all day coffee and a small evening finger buffet and a limited selection of deserts. Good views from the lounge due it being several floors higher than neighbouring buildings. The only problem with the club lounge is the lack of tables for breakfast, as it is laid out as a lounge with sofas and low level glass topped coffee tables. It gets busy in the mornings as it caters for 3 executive floors as well as overspill from lower level rooms when the exec floors are overbooked. Check-in was a bit slow due to lack of staff at the front desk, (only one check-in attendant) but checking out was fast using the express checkout facility. 6 express lifts, ground to 31st floor in about 30 seconds and very little waiting in lobbies after calling for a lift. If you have booked a high level room with club access make sure you get it, don't be fobbed off with a lower level room with card access to the lounge as they try to get away with if you let them. The lower level rooms are not in very good condition and don't have the superb views that the high level rooms have.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: Dallastraveler74
Reviews.Content: I agree with the poster before me, this hotel is looking a little worn and is not all it's cracked up to be. I too stay at Marriot properties all year long and the staff here is by far the least helpful of any I've experienced with Marriot. The location is in a convenient area with access to shopping and restaurants, if you go in the right direction. Make a wrong turn and you will be surrounded by druggies and prostitutes, don't make a left out of the front entrance! The final day of my stay here there was a fire alarm that went off at 5:30 AM. Being on the 26th floor it wasn't a pleasant surprise to wake to. Can you say earthquake?!?! Anyhow, we stayed here for 3 days and it will be the last 3 we ever spend there. Do yourself a favor and go to Hotel Monaco right down the block, better restaurants, better bar & MUCH better service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views From The 24th Floor”
Reviews.Author: maisany
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Labor Day Saturday and was quite pleased. This is a downtown/Union Square area hotel, so the caveats re the nearby Market Street/Tenderloin areas do apply, but if you can deal with that, the hotel is quite lovely. We got there late in the afternoon and they had no single king bed non-smoking rooms available immediately, but when I persisted, the receptionist told me that there were a couple that were being made up as we spoke and that they would be ready in a short while. When I told them that I would wait, I think they did everything they could to get me the nicest room possible, and I wound up with a very high (24th fl) corner room, very close to the elevators (but not noisy at all), with a really terrific view of the city. The room was a good size, although the only shortcoming was the entry hall is extremely narrow so that you have to stand clear of the door as you open it on the way out. Not a big deal. The bed was wonderful and the sheets and pillows were quite good as well. The bathroom was huge and well laid out. I had limited interaction with the staff but starting with the accomodating receptionist, everyone was very polite, professional and knowledgeable. I asked the concierge to find me an address of a nearby shop and he wrote it down on a map, making it very easy to find. The only down side to this hotel is the immediate neighborhood, which can be a little off-putting and limits your dining options somewhat, but otherwise, this is a very nice place to stay downtown and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “She's looking a bit worn.....”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a great location. This hotel is looking a lot like its external surroundings---tired and worn. Its time for a massive overhaul. The front desk staff offer only blah, blah, blah when asked about securing a better room location. Why don't they just say yes or no? The blah, blah, blah is worse than a no. BTW--calling the hotel manager gets action. This was my hotel of choice in SF--not anymore. YAWN. I stay more than 200 nights a year--almost all at Marriott properties. The front desk staff at this hotel doesn't care about that.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: eric_pruitt
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55, as all have said, is in a great location. Very convenient to all modes of transportation. The rooms were good, not great. The service was solid, not outstanding. It was just an all-around good hotel. Which was fine for me and my wife for the price we paid. There are a lot nicer hotels in the area. But for the money and location this one is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, loved the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel808
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Parc 55 in San Francisco was the second hotel we stayed at while on our 16 day vacation. We arrived at the Parc 55, tired after driving 14 hours in from Seattle. Being so tired, it really helped that the service was superb! The valet and front desk employees were extremely courteous and friendly. We booked a standard room with the government discount and was pleasantly surprised to have been upgraded to a huge, beautiful corner room with windows all around. We had an amazing view fronting Union Square! The room was well appointed and clean. Perhaps the only flaw in this room was that we booked a room with a King sized bed and instead got a room with a full size bed. This of course was overlooked once we saw the size of the room and the view! The bathroom was clean and had a few nice touches like a heater which came in handy since it was cold at night, a phone and a movable vanity mirror. Directly outside of the bathroom in front of the closet was a seperate changing area, which I thought was a nice touch. For those of you who love to stay fit, this hotel offers a 24-hour fitness center free of charge. Also, there are restaurants on the property which offer a variety of genres. My favorite meal there was breakfast in the hotel restaurant, prices were reasonable for San Francisco and tasty and of course service was superb. Location wise, you couldn't find a better place. It is so centralized! It is right across the street from shopping and in walking distance from Union Square. If you go out late at night, past midnight or so, don't go to the left of the hotel towards Larkin st. Not exactly the safest feeling in the world with the number of homeless people and prostitutes but what else can you expect from any big city. Valet parking was $38.00 plus tax...pretty high, but the going rate for San Francisco. If you don't mind public transportation, don't get a car. You can see most things on foot patrol or via cable cars. It was pretty rough having to pay almost the same amount for parking after our three nights there as it was for one night's stay. Needless to say, our stay was very enjoyable and we will definitely stay at the Parc 55 the next time we visit San Francisco! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good hotel right in the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: World-roamer
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal through Priceline, and so we thought this hotel was good value. But if we'd been paying full price I'm not so sure. It's a large hotel and our non-smoking room was a reasonable size. But there is no fridge and not even any tea or coffee making facilities. The daily maid service keeps the room very clean. The checkout time is 12 noon, so I suppose I can't complain that our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 2pm, and had to wait an hour and a half. It's well located next to all the big stores, cinemas, restaurants, public transport and car rental locations. The cable car terminus to Fisherman's Wharf is nearby, but always crowded. You could wait up to an hour at busy times. Here's a tip - they don't always fill the car up at the terminus, so go to the next stop up the line and you'll probably get on the first car to come along. After you've done the calble car thing once, you'll probably find the Market Street tram or the #30 trolley bus the best way to get to Fishermans Wharf and the Ferries to Alcatraz. You definitely need to book the Alcatraz trip in advance (via internet), but another great day out is to hire a bike from Blazing Saddles and bike the bridge to Sausalito. If you start out at 10am or so you can have a nice lunch in this charming sea front town before getting the ferry back to Pier 39. We had a great time in San Francisco, and the Renaissance Parc was an OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: Upscaleduds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend vacation in early Augsut 2005. Very nice location - we did the "tourist thing" and used entirely public transportation. We foudn the conceirge to be quite helpful in giving us suggestions about what to do and how to use public transportation to get there. Be warned: Alcotraz sells out at least a week in advance this time of year, so buy tickets online before you go. We LOVED the Ferry Bldg and highly recommend a "picnic" trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: JuicyCouture
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Fleet Week in October of 2004 and we've booked another stay for October 2005. The hotel room was extremely large for San Francisco and very clean. The bathroom was huge and had tons of space for my beauty products. The staff was friendly and they were always willing to help with any request we had. While we were there, there were protesters on the street below at one of the neighboring hotels. We were on a high floor but we could still hear them --regardless, it didn't bother us. Im originally from The City and Im used to some noise. You should know though, that if you stay at any downtown hotel, you should expect at least, a little bit of noise from outside. However, the hotel was quiet and we never even heard our neighbors. The hotel is located between the Union Square/Powell St. cable car line area and the Tenderloin Dist --stay on the Powell St. side! As far as getting to the cable car line, you can easily walk --it's about half a block away. However, if you walk down Market St, although the easiest, be prepared for the strong smell of urine and B.O. as the homeless sleep right in the area at night. I recommend going up to Ellis and walking down. It takes a few more minutes, but you don't have to deal with the horrid odor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller84
Reviews.Content: Polite, helpful staff, 24 hour gym facilities, clean room which was well maintained by housekeeping. The best aspect of this hotel is the location which is right in the centre of all the shops with tram stations, taxis, busses and a large shopping centre etc right outside the hotel. There is also a huge cinema within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The central location meant there were always people around, which meant no problems when walking back to the hotel late at night. Would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, but would still recommend”
Reviews.Author: stefiharr
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Hotels usually do a great job - but this hotel could use a little work. The location is GREAT! We were first-time S.F. visitors, so being so close to so much was a big plus. But, we had two problems when we checked in: (1) When we got to our room, ummm, it wasn't ready...thank goodness no one was actually IN the room. So, we went back downstairs to change rooms. (2) In our new room, we turned on the tv, and within 2 minutes, the tv shut off and started smoking. We had to then wait for a new tv to be put in. The hotel's asst. manager called to do the standard (but nice) apology. She asked if she could send something to us like a bottle of wine. She did (it was nothing too special and nothing accompanied it, like some fruit or cheese or something). We were paying only $142/night for our room, so you would have thought they would have comped a night, given a free breakfast or even moved us to a nicer room for the not 1, but 2, inconveniences. Oh well - the only reason it wasn't too big of a deal is b/c we didn't plan to be in the room much and we DID get such a great rate. So, the hotel is ok for a Renaissance (I've seen and stayed in much nicer, though). Would recommend it only b/c of the location and price...but the small, older rooms made us feel like we were in a NY hotel (which isn't a bad thing...just don't come expecting luxury or space). Also, for such a huge hotel, they only have one concierge on duty at a time...taking calls AND helping people in person. I felt rushed every time I had a question. I would highly recommend that they hire 2 at all times....but until they do...if you need help with restaurant or activity ideas, ask a friend who's been there.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: chiachiang
Reviews.Content: The room is clean, nice beds but no fridge. Indeed, the hotel is a stone throw away from BART Powell station, so forget about taking expensive taxi from the airport. The cable car turnaround point and the F-line are also closeby for access to Fisherman wharf and Chinatown. Will definitely stay in here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SactownTraveler
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels to stay in for business or pleasure in San Francisco. The location is good, the rooms are extremely nice and well maintained (comparable to Omni International rooms), the rooms are surprisingly quiet - I expected to be bothered by the nearby cable cars, but it was not a problem - and the shower is powerful. Even when nearly full, the atmosphere is quiet and adult. Oh, yes, the beds are nice and comfortable with both small and large pillows to choose from. The rate was extremely reasonable for the quality. I could only find two things to quibble about. First, my room was humid and warm on a cold day - due to all of the sound deadening insulation and the solid windows - but that was fixed by using the air conditioner. Second, there is no coffee maker in the room, but on check-in I was told about the free morning brew on the second floor. There were muffins and fruit rolls for sale for only $2.00, much less than you would pay at a nearby Starbucks. Finally, with big hotels like this, using the valet parking is often a problem. It tends to take a lot of time and it can be difficult dealing with the parking staff. That was not the case here, the staff were very professional and swift. All in all, this hotel reminded me of what large-city Hyatts and Hiltons were like in the 1960s and 1970s. Congratulations to Marriott for getting it right!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, and oh-so-convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Temporary
Reviews.Content: I had a short-notice business trip last we9ek and the conferen]ce hotel was full. I wanted a hotel within walking distance of the conference hotel, but expense was an issue as well. Luckily, Southwest Airlines (on which I traveled) allows one to book hotels on their web site as well, and this hotel came up with a reasonable price. It was a very nice room, everything in good shape. I was especially impressed with the temperature controls in the room, providing trouble-free adjustment from crisp cool to balmy heat within minutes. The city view out of one of my windows was very nice (although it would probably have been better if I were on a higher floor--I was on the eleventh) I had a couple of meals in the hotel bar, which has a good selection of beers as well as tasty, if a bit pricey, entrees (most start around $8-9). One night though they seemed a bit understaffed... The hotel is practically right on Market St and the Hallidie Plaza, steps away from just about any kind of transportation (taxis, BART, cable car, surface trolley, Muni Metro and buses) that one might want. Loads of shopping too, both on Market and a few blocks north to Union Square for the real high-end designer stuff. It does get a bit downmarket as you walk along Market toward 7th-8th Sts, though. Street life is the usual mix of suits, tourists, street merchants, panhandlers, performers and proselytizers, but its perfectly safe during the day, and just requires the usual big-city awareness after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Parc 55 during the 4th of July weekend, celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary. We were very pleasantly surprised at the class of hotel and its great location, for the relatively low price I was able to secure online. For all of you that have girlfriends or wifes that love to shop, this hotel is very very centrally located in Union Square, near all the shopping that San Francisco offers. Just as a tip, ask for a high floor. Our room was on the 23rd floor and we had an awesome view of the city from our room. The hotel is also located right next to one of the BART stations (BART is the public train system in San Francisco). This made it extremely convenient traveling from the airport (we landed in Oakland). This option was significantly cheaper than hiring a taxi. We paid $3.15 per person for a BART ticket vs. $55 taxi fare. The rooms at the Renaissance were very clean and modern. The standard room was also well sized, especially for San Francisco. The bathroom was also very clean and good sized. If I had any complaints at all, it would only be the length of time it took them to respond to our request for more towels. Also, we had breakfast included in our rate, however, the order form was never brought to us after the first night. We had to call the front desk and have them deliver it to our room each night. Other than that, it was a great stay in centrally located area. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants all the hustle and bustle and shopping that San Francisco has to offer. Oh yea, we discovered on our last night that the restuarant, directly across the street from our hotel, was a great italian restaurant. Its called Puccini and Panetti. Very delicious food (you might want to make reservations- it was very packed when we went late at night).

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time to San Francisco didn't know where to stay, but with help of trip advisor it worked out great. The Parc 55 was very nice, our room was of average size, clean (no bugs) and the location was great. However one to two blocks away from the hotel and the changes begin, bums, drunks, and ect. We really never felt that unsafe, I just never seen so much poverty. So be prepared to be sad and Realize how lucky you are. I'm so glad we rented a car and glad we paid the $38.00 to park at the hotel because the trolley was impossible to get on when you have 9 people in a group. So $38.00 a day all the in and out you want hey not to bad. The hotel was accomadating to our needs considering we had booked several rooms and wanted to stay close together it was no problem considering it was a holiday weekend and they were booked. For $120.00 a night it was a great place to stay in fact better than some of our $350.00 rooms we stay at. Alcatraz is a must to see, it was one of our favorite accractions. Though that could be the fact there was no Fog.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet 16th Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travel to San Francisco once or twice a year and want the best of everything. . We just came back from a five nighter and experienced another great stay. The nicely furnished room was clean, very bright and airy with plenty of room, and the king bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was furnished with extra large, fluffy thick towels that were very soft, not old and scratchy, a hair dryer, and Bath and Body products. This was a pleasant surprise and not the usual generic bathroom products. The hotel again provides a safe environment, decor, and the ambiance as well as the service were all perfect. If you are looking for a hotel which is conveniently located to Union Square, San Francisco Shopping Centre, Cable Car turnaround, BART or MUNI METRO Station, and/or SF MUNI, stay here. We will never stay any where else. The front desk and elevators are so close to the entrance that you can save your energy for the streets of San Francisco. Everyone on this hotel staff that we came in contact with was caring and helpful, appeared to take great pride in their work, and thanked us for staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location & the omni”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend of mine went on a girls weekend,and stayed here. The location was great and the Hotel was beautiful and quiet. The staff was excellent and very helpful too. We can not wait to go back and we diffinitly will stay here again. I have told everybody I know about this place, and hope if they go to San Francisco, they will stay here too! Thank you For the wonderful stay Renaissance : ) Cindee

Reviews.Title: “The elegant Renaissance Park 55”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Park 55 Hotel, exudes elegance, and charm in the heart of the city by the bay. In close proximity to all the shopping and nightlife as well as the best food in the world. The cable cars are as much fun as they are practical to ride and readily available. One does not need a car to see the sites in this city everythings right at your doorstep. The service and emenities were beyond excellent and the charm of the hotel lets you escape to another place when time stood still. The food in the hotel restaurant was the best I have ever had in a hotel and I have stayed in many hotels on business. When you stay at the Park 55 everything is first class all the way and you feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, In Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night and it was very nice. Not excellent but in a great location. All the stores you want to shop at are in less than 100 feet, plus the trolley is right there and the train! Ask for a high floor! Valet Parking is a little on the high side for a hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave0365
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Parc 55 for a convention. With this in mind, the hotel was perfectly located only a short walk to the Moscone Convention Centre - 800 metres, San Francisco Shopping Centre - 200 metres, cable car turnaround - 150 metres, Union Square shopping precinct - 400 metres. We had a couple of friends staying at the Crown Plaza at Union Square and a friend, on a much tighter budget, staying at The Powell just across the street. All were in agreement that The Parc had the best rooms and location. Another TripAdvisor member commented on the number of homeless that were in this district and that made them feel uncomfortable, but really there are no more here than anywhere else in the city. Yes they'll ask you for money, but they aren't going to hurt you. Give them change if you are so inclined, or just give them a smile. I found all the staff I had contact with to be friendly and polite and they provided whatever assistance that I required. I cannot comment on the restaurant/bar facilities as we didn't use them. I recommend cocktails on the 41st floor at the Marriott - great variety and a GREAT view. I also definitely recommend dinner and drinks at the Clift Hotel on Geary St (a few blocks walk away) - a great vibe and awesome food for quantity and quality. We felt quite safe walking around the area, however we were told not to venture down 6th St after dark. We spent a lot of time riding the cable car between Fishermans Wharf and our hotel, right up until midnight with no concerns at all. Cabs were convenient for where the cable cars didn't run and were inexpensive. During our stay, the hotel was full at all times, yet we had no problems getting in and out or getting access to one of the 8 lifts. We used room service once and the delivery was prompt but they messed up the order. After making a call, they replaced the incorrect meal equally promptly. I would recommend this hotel as a quality 4 star establishment and I would definitely consider staying again when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: SugarWahine
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after reading a few reviews here, but found this hotel just fine. Staff was gracious and very helpful - we had a problem with the key card and the door and they bent over backward to try and get it addressed/resolved. I'm a local and was there for tradeshow, so no, its not the Palomar, the W or some of the other boutique hotels in the area, but it was clean, rooms large enough to share and in a good location to get to the convention center easily enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to the shopping. The rooms were nice and ready early for us to check into. Gal at the front desk was extremely friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but BAD conceirge!”
Reviews.Author: TravelindivaNYC
Reviews.Content: I loved the location, right in the heart of Union Sq. The rooms were nice and surprisingly quite for in the heart of the city. The only problem we had was the conceirge. We asked for a recommendation of a sushi restaurant was close by. She said that the one close by only had reservations for 9PM, which was too late for us. So she suggested one a little further away (a taxi ride). So she tells us to meet her in the lobby at 6:45 to get the confirmation number to the restaurant and directions. We go downstairs to meet her and she is nowhere to be found. 5 minutes later she shows up, she was on her "break" (at 6:45PM on a Saturday night?!?!). So she gives us the info and we are off to the restaurant. So, then we get to the restaurant and it is literally the most outrageously expensive sushi I have ever laid eyes on (and I am from NYC). It was about 30 for some rolls. So ridiculous. So we left and jumped in a taxi and asked for a good sushi place and he literally brings us to a place ACROSS THE STREET from the hotel (which wasn't the place with the 9PM reservation). I was so annoyed. So that left a sour taste in my mouth but, all in all it wasn't a bad hotel, just a bad conceirge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Matt F
Reviews.Content: Located a couple blocks from Union Sq and right next to great shopping the Parc 55 was perfect for us. After finding a great offer on Travelzoo my wife headed into the city for the evening. Friendly service and nice sized room made this a great find. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: mtb1234
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean rooms, comfy beds, great view - stayed on 15th floor. About a block to visitors center, cable cars, buses & trains. Taylor Street Coffee Shop is a couple of blocks away and is great for a wonderful breakfast. My only gripe about the city is the homeless.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is blah”
Reviews.Author: cubeless
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 dissappointed me. The location can be good or bad depending on what you're looking for. I personally don't like the Union Square area (too tourist and too many homeless), however it is right in the thick of things in the Union Sq area...so, personal preference on this one. Parking is $35 a day (which is normal for SF)...another posted mentioned they "take care of the $35 fee"....I must not have know the secret password to have this happen. In fact, I had a friend visit for about 4 hours one evening and they charged my room the full $35 charge. First night I arrived, I checked into my room (had requested a king/non smoking) and upon entering my room, it was a double bedded smoking room. I booked this room through my corporate travel agent (not a discount agent like Travelocity or Priceline). I called the manager on duty and explained that I had booked a non smoking, and told him I didn't care about the King bed, but I really wanted non-smoking. He explained that other guests had paid a premium to guarantee a non-smoking room and that he had nothing for me. Moving on. Went down to the lobby to get a dinner recommendation for a local restaurant a the Concierge. One problem, they were on break. Break? How does a Concierge take a break in a 1,000 room hotel at 8:00 pm? The rooms are equipped adequately. Decent beds. There is no "scene" or action in the lobby. You have to go up to the 2nd floor for a drink or for the "lobby bar". They do have a pianist that plays, which was nice. The decor is very dated though. If you can get the room for under $100, it's worth it. I wouldn't stay here again for business, and certainly not for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our overnight stay very much. Nice hotel, great view, turndown service - with chocolates :) They even take care of the $35 valet parking charge. We'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: Boopsquared
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to San Fran this last weekend. We'd go back to Parc 55 over and over. We got a special of $99 for Thanksgiving weekend and were given a corner room with three huge bay windows over looking the entire city, the bedspread was down, the room clean, and the hotel close to Macy's the Mall, and Union Square. We had the most wonderful time - better than I imagined! I'd highly recommend this hotel. If you want a great room request #1572!

Reviews.Title: “ok, but wouldn't be my first choice”
Reviews.Author: Illinois_traveler22
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for $70/night through Priceline, but if i were paying full price, i'm not sure I would pick this place. We were there during the hotel strike and it was incredibly noisy. The first night, we had a room on the 16th floor across from the Hilton and the picketers and street noise were terrible. The next night they moved us to a room on the 24th floor on the other side and it was much better. Like the windows, the walls are pretty thin. We were talking in our room one night and security came to ask us to keep our voices down. When the maid vaccuumed the room next door early the following morning, we could hear everything. It does border the tenderloin, so if you go two blocks in the wrong direction, there will be groups of homeless men hanging out on the street, although the area immediately surrounding the hotel is perfectly decent and i felt safe, as a single woman, walking alone at night. Parking in the lot on Mason across the street is only $20/day with in and out privileges. That having been said, service was good, amenities nice, lobby and breakfast areas well kept up, and free coffee and tea a nice touch

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a wonderful trip to San Francisco (Oct7-11) and enjoyed my stay at the Parc 55. The rooms are large and even the bathroom was spacious. The bed was very comfortable, with a lovely comforter and lots of fluffy pillows - especially welcome after a 7 hour flight! We didn't see any homeless people in the immediate vicinity of the hotel - saw some on Powell, but no one bothered us. We didn't eat in the hotel, but there are lots of good places to eat close by (Puccini and Pinetti are right across the street, Daily Grill just a block away, Kuleto's on Powell about 2 blocks away). We did have coffee one morning on the 2nd floor lobby and you can buy fruit cups, yogurt, cold cereal there as well. I liked the fitness centre, although its a little crowded with equipment. There were 6 treadmills, 4 cross trainers, stationary bikes, free weights and a couple of machines. Everything worked and the room was clean and bright. The front desk staff were very helpful and our room on the 20th floor had a view of the bay and the Transamerica Pyramid. We didn't hear anything from the rooms on either side, but heard some noise from the street. It was a great holiday and the Parc 55 helped make it that way.

Reviews.Title: “Servicable Hotel with Priceline deal”
Reviews.Author: cocogrove25
Reviews.Content: We were assigned this hotel via Priceline for $80. For that price we were happy with the hotel. It was basic and servicable. The room was newly redecorated and the windows did allow some fresh air which was necessary as no non-smoking rooms were available. I would not have been happy with it at rack rate but for the deal it was great.

Reviews.Title: “great location, staff, bed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was genuinely friendly and quite knowledgeable. Location is perfect for downtown shopping types. Also, I felt the bed was particularly comfortable. Nothing else really stands out about this place: location while convenient is a tad on the sketchy-part-of-town side. Food is amazingly overpriced and not very good (If you stay here and like sushi, try "Anzu" across the street at Nikko, it was awesome.) This is not a luxury hotel. Not bad though if you use Marriott points to stay here for free!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Stay !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks reviewing hotels and packages - I was very very impressed with the Renaissance Parc 55 when we stayed on Sept 24- 28 2004 - it had great location, wondeful staff and the most comfortable beds I think I have EVER slept in !!! Upon arrival I asked for a high floor with view and we had a great one assigned ... The room was very spacious and clean, and we enjoyed having the high speed internet access < which is 9.95 from 12noon - 12 noon, no matter what time you first log into it - which was a lil disappointing - however we logged in at 11:58pm and were only charged one 9.95 fee for our whole weekend - maybe becuase I complained about the rates, oor we just got lucky > The parking is a lil pricey at 35.00 a day pls 14% tax - all the hotels are like that - however there is a parking garage for 20.00 next door - we did not use our car once while there ... if you can take alternate transportation from airport to hotel .. do so .. cabs, the muni and trollys are way less expensive to get around and very easy from the hotel <right outside the door > - we didnt take the bart but spoke to others who say its way easy too !!!!! We did need to order a cup of room service coffee one morning and that was pricey at 11.00 .. there is no <a href=

Reviews.Title: “Not so good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: More like a 3 star hotel - terrible beds, old bathrooms, broken safe, and worst of all - $40 a day for parking - stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: FromGB
Reviews.Content: I spent nearly a week in this hotel in August. It's well situated for the shops and the cable car. The rooms are large, clean, the usual standardised chain room. The bathroom was a bit disappointing, small bath, integral shower. No coffee maker in the room and no safe were other downsides. No breakfast included is a shame but free coffee was on offer - but from 4am to 10am, later start and later finish would be nice! The business centre had never heard of WiFi and I couldn't get a connection in the hotel despite it advertising beforehand that this was possible. Reception staff were very helpful, concierge more abrupt. Good for a business trip, for tourism I'd try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Renaissance Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: RWlover
Reviews.Content: My two children (ages 10 & 11) and I stayed at this hotel between August 23-25, 2004. The hotel was excellent! The day conceirge, Rikky, was most helpful in giving us suggestions to explore San Francisco and it's environs. On the day we went up to Muir woods, I had rented a car (Hertz will deliver right to the hotel) and was quite nervous about the return Highway 1 trip, flush against the Pacific. She outlined an alternative route that took us deeper into Marin County, away from the cliffs and was absolutely beautiful. Every day as I chatted with her, she also spoke to my kids about the area as well. My only two travel advisories are 1) don't walk directly west of the hotel, as within a couple of blocks you are in Tenderloin (not a great neighborhood) and 2)make sure you ask for a room on a higher floor to escape the immediate street traffic. In many ways the hotel is well positioned, right across from the cabel car turn-around and from a BART station that will take you to the airport ($4.95, have exact amount). Overall I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: PaHunter01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights, the Hotel was excellent, close to cable car,supertour lines picked up at the hotel . We also rented a car at the hotel for one day and drove down US1 to Monterery , what a beautiful drive . Get the 3 day pass to ride cable cars , street cars and buses for $ 15.00 each . The Bart system dropped us off close to the hotel for $4.95 each from the airport.Excellent securty and staff. We picked this Hotel from reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, We will return , Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mid_West_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night recently at the Renaissance Parc 55 hotel. The service was excellent. Staff was very pleasant and helpful even though this hotel is very busy and they are constantly being deluged with requests and questions. The room was very large, nicely decorated, very clean, and had great views of the city. I like smaller hotels, so I decided to change to the Stanford Court Renaissance on Nob Hill. This was a personal preference, however, and not a reflection on the hotel itself. The hotel is in a great location although some of the area is a little "urban". However, this is a great hotel and you can usually get good bargain rates through Expedia or Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Corporate off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: cruisingbug
Reviews.Content: After three days of being "pampered" at nice inns and b&bs on the road, the Parc 55 Renaissance was slightly disappointing. As with any big-city, corporate hotel, the little things were missing or cost extra. No coffee maker in the room, no robes, no free continental breakfast, no pool, no free Internet. Local calls cost $1. There was free coffee/tea in the morning on the 2nd Floor. By the by, concierge was rude to us when we asked about airport transportation. :( This hotel sits right on the line of the Tenderloin. If you go out of the hotel one way (east), you will encounter panhandlers. But on the other side are some nice restaurants and the very short walk to Union Square. Easy to get to public transportation on Market St. The view from our 24th floor window was nice, although other buildings blocked out the Bay Bridge and other SF landmarks. The Parc 55 did have a sauna (seemed like no charge - didn't get a chance to try it) and fitness center. Nice Bath and Body Works brand toiletries. This hotel has Air Conditioning, which not many in SF have. We did use it the first day - it was about 70F outside but the sun was shining in (!!!!) and made our room quite warm during the day. Of course it cooled off at night. We got an excellent deal for this room, so I really shouldn't complain. $99 a night off the Internet for Union Square area of SF. When we called to confirm, they had us at a higher rate, though - we had the printouts to prove it, but they changed it on the phone with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel. Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Christelyn
Reviews.Content: I ususally don't write reviews but I felt like this hotel was getting somewhat of a bad wrap. I stayed at at the Parc 55 for a family/business trip last week. I was a little scared when I bid through Priceline and got it, because I had read some not-so-flattering reviews here. But I was pleasantly surprised that, as soon as I walked through the door, a bellman was there to take my bags. They even changed my room when at first they stuck me on the fifth floor with a terrible view of the air conditioning. The views on the 21st floor were wonderful, and the location was great. Everyone was so attentive!

Reviews.Title: “Book it through Priceline & it's worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is the best part. It is close to Union Square and walking distance from Chinatown. I booked this hotel through Priceline for about 75.00 a night, which is a steal for this hotel. The Expedia rate was over twice as much & I would have to say at that price it wouldn't be worth it. The lobby is nice & the rooms were clean. The parking was 30.00 per night & was not included in the internet price. There are a lot of great views from the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An average Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The large 1980s marble lobby is probably the nicest part of this hotel. The 4 star rating should be 3.5. The room was large and clean with an ok bath (not luxurious by any means). We had a high floor so no city noise. Corridors are bright and newly carpeted. Our dealings with the hotel staff were minimal, so I cannot fairly comment on the service. Superb location near the Powell Street Cable Car, Nordstrom (and 2005 the new Bloomingdale's), Abercrombie, Gap, and two blocks away from Union Square with almost every luxury retailer you could want. BART within 30 yards and one block away is the Market Street trolly. However, San Francisco is loaded with beggers, panhandlers and homeless people. Interestingly, NONE of them are of Asain descent...ponder that. They seem to congregate near the subway area (big shock!) but are not aggressive. Not a plethora of restaurants near the hotel, and the doorman did advise (read: warn) us not to venture onto the streets toward the rear of the hotel. We took his advice and had a great safe trip. Fisherman's Wharf is little but T-shirt shops and mediocre tourist restaurants. Don't miss the cable car...even if there is a long line. One other item: The bus tours to the wine country are little more than sales pitches at the wineries to get you to buy their wines; highlight of that tour was 2 hours in the town of Sonoma.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Neutral About Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We knew little about the city before we went. We were concerned about some of the postings that rated hotel average---and homeless a problem. Here is what we learned: The hotel is average--not a four star---maybe a 3.5 star. Our room was good size, clean, well decorated, excellent water pressure, soaps and shampoo's. Hey the little thing's are important. The bed was average. Our room was on the 16th floor--the view was o.k.--but the street noise was bad(Cyril Magnin side). The maid's were attentive and friendly. That is more than what I can say for the front desk. When we checked in (as per other posting) we asked for room on 27th floor or above. We were told they were booked (hard to understand lady, she was curt and had bad accent) so we settled for 16th floor. When we got to room called down and asked if could be upgraded and told 50.00 extra a night. So what is the truth---are they booked or not. We rode down the elevator--couple who just checked in pushed button for 28th floor and we asked how they got that room? The told us they said they were on anniv. and they gave them upgrade. So we went down and asked again and were told best they could do was 26th floor--we said no thanks. Desk clerk's get below average rating. The hotel does not have pool, the resturants are average at best, no views or dining from the top floor, and the hotel location is average. The Homless report: The problem is mild. There are street people, it does mar the image, they do ask for money. The hotel is 1 block from market street station where they seem to hang out---not really a problem everywhere else. We were out late one night and walking around in that area they were more aggressive than in day. Reccomendations: Stay in a hotel that is on or very near Powell street (this is the cable car line). Buy a multi day Muni pass to ride buses and cable cars. Rent a car only the days you want to travel out of the city. Don't need or want a car for city. Hard to park and parking is expensive. Visit--Sausalito, take a bay cruise, visit Muir Woods and stinson beach. Take a drive down the coast to Monterray. Eat at Kuleto's ( on Powell) and Nonna Rose on Wharf. Lori's diner good for b-fast. Alot of walking--be prepared. Pick up a San Fran Bay City Guide--they are free and everywhere--they have excellent map's and map's that show hotel's. Dont buy the transit map-- a waste of money--it is impossible to read.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - For the Money”
Reviews.Author: bar01
Reviews.Content: We booked a four day/3 night package with airfare and hotel for about $980 on expedia. So maybe the room worked out to around $120 a night (pretty good!). We did not know anything about the hotels in SF. We used this site and people seemed to say some good things about Parc 55. I travel on Business and usually like to stay in Marriottâ€™s. This Hotel is owned by Marriott so that ment it would meet a minimum acceptable standard for me. Some general thoughts about the hotel. 1) Star rating - the hotel is listed as a 4 star hotel. I think it is a little shy of that - maybe a 3.75 star. Only a little better than a standard Marriot. 2) Room was good sized, clean, comfortable bed, and quiet. 3) Staff - not too bad. Cleaning ladies came by often to see if room was cleaned. Concierge messed up and was supposed to have flowers in the room BEFORE we checked in - but came up afterwards. Food was okay. 4) Views - ask for a room on the 12th floor or higher to get a decent view. They gave us a corner room on the 12th which was pretty good. 5) Bums and Panhandlers - In general, SF has a lot of homeless people. Be prepared where ever you are walking around to be asked for money. They are not mean or aggressive - but they are every where - not just around this hotel. 6) Location - right next to the Powell Street Bart station. Was able to save money and just take BART to hotel. Again - the Bart Station has alot of bums, but during the day there are plenty of regular folks too - so it was safe. Also this hotel is kind of on the edge of the "Tenderloin district". Know where you are going when you head out for a walk - talk with the bellmen. However, you are right next to an upscale mall, and the cable cars, shops and resturants. Bottom line on this hotel? Good value for the money. Clean, comfortable, above average. Looking for something more upscale and willing to pay (double/triple) for it? Look to the Mandarin. Also let me share quick thoughts on SF in general. City is a little dirty - to much trash in the streets. To many bums. Commercial Architecture is a little boring. Restaurants - If you can afford $75 per person - try Aqua and Boulevard. They were FANTASTIC. Go on a NAPA valley wine tour. Bus will pick you up at Hotel. Loved it! Go on a bus tour to Muir Woods and Sausalito. We went to the Muir woods in the morning but they were only going to let us spend 30 min in Sausalito. Get off the bus in Sausalito and spend the afternoon there- take a ferry back to the pier warf. Skip Fishermanâ€™s Warf for site seeing. Sausalito is MUCH better. One last thing - If you are looking for an alternative trip - instead of SF - come to Chicago ! You will LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calif-FloridaBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there while attending a convention at the nearby Moscone Center. Found it to be a great central location right off Market Street next to a BART station. Did all our sightseeing from there by foot, streetcar, and BART train. The room was attractive, done in red, gold, and dark wood--adequate in size and comfortable though not quite spacious. The bed, linens, blanket, and pillows were not of the best quality, should be upgraded. The view from our 25th-floor room through a large bay window facing east was very pleasant. Housekeeping did a superb job, keeping the room and bathroom spotless. Having no safe in the room was a hugh inconvenience especially since it usually took so long for a front desk agent to assist you at the boxes downstairs. The Renaissance Club Lounge on the 31st floor had a breathtaking view, and the complimentary breakfast was excellent. Most of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Would we stay there again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels”
Reviews.Author: Beardsh
Reviews.Content: If you're impressed by a large lobby but not a fat lot else then this is the hotel for you. I stayed here for one night only in April - thank God! The staff spoke very litte English and were frankly rude. After eventually checking in to our room, we were given a twin despite booking a double, we received numerous nuisance calls and staff were completely uninterested in dealing with these. The room was dirty, and small and not nicely decorated - litter under the bed, certainly not 4 or 5 star more like 3. We had a long list of issues which is not like me at all but too many to really go into now. It's not in the best area at all - right next to Tenderloin with numerous homeless hanging around nearby and right outside. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, not even enemies. This was my last day of a fantastic 30th birthday and if I'd stayed there for longer it would have completely spoilt my trip to the West coast - but as it was it was just laughable. Stay at the Palomar - cheaper and far nicer without all the fancy facade!

Reviews.Title: “55 Parc a Treat”
Reviews.Author: New Orleans gal
Reviews.Content: A great large scale hotel. The location is great and within easy walking distance of Union Square, China Town, Nob Hill and tons of shopping, restaurants and public transportation. We were on the 29th floor and had great views. All of the staff was attentive and very helpful. The room and bath were both lovely. Don't worry about the homeless in San Francisco, they are everywhere - the states problem - but noone bothers you and we felt safe both walking and taking public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: AdAgencyWoman
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. I was a bit concerned about the posts regarding the homeless but there are homeless throughout the city.I stayed in a suite on the 30th floor with absolutely wonderful views of the city. In addition, I had acess to the club upstairs for breakfast and desserts served after 7:30 PM. Just a wonderful experience. The staff was also very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Club Floors are Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night business trip at the Parc 55. I had read the postings on this cite and made sure to ask for a corner room. I was assigned a terrific corner room on the 29th floor with views that included part of the Golden Gate Bridge. This hotel is walking distance to both Union Square and Chinatown and has a very helpful staff. Some of the previous posts have warned about the homeless problem in the city. If you are uncomfortable around the homeless then you should not visit San Francisco!! This city has a very large homeless population and they can be found in many different areas throughout SF, not just near this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: scasci
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research for a S.F. hotel and was not disappointed. The location is 1 block from Union Square (and some of the best shopping I've ever encountered!), steps from the tourist info. office and 1 block from the cable car. Within an easy walk are numerous tiny restaurants with fantastic food. The hotel is very clean and modern with great "curb appeal" i.e. you think "wow this place looks really nice!" It is 32 stories high with great views from the upper floors. Rooms are spacious with a sitting area by the window. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of fluffy towels. I sure wish we'd been able to find the $50 deal - we paid $139.00, but I was able to get a good deal on worldweb as a $32 breakfast voucher was included for each day which was good on the buffet in the Veranda restaurant or room service. By the way, the hotel has a lovely lounge on the 2nd floor with internet access and continental breakfast available for those who want something lighter. You really can not go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this place was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Flew up to San Fran for a weekend and stayed here. It was great!! Nice room, fantastic location (right near Union Square and start of cable car), great amenities (gym with sauna, restaurant, sports bar). There was no "homeless" problem at all here. Yeah you do see homeless in the city who are in any major city but they weren't around the hotel, which I should add is always bustling with cutomers, valets, tour people and other employees. The hotel rooms have amazing views, either of the bridge, the bay or the skyline. Also, the restaurant is very good and the employees are very helpful and friendly. They even have a great tour desk to book sightseeing tours, which will pick you up and drop you off right at the hotel! I got a great package deal online for this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Parc 55 Wyndham
HotelInfo.Address: 55 Cyril Magnin Street, San Francisco, CA 94102
